And Da LORD said, Take an heifer with thee, and say, I am come to sacrifice to Da LORD. 16:3 And call Jesse to Da sacrifice, and I will shew thee what thou shalt do: and thou shalt anoint unto me him whom I name unto thee. 16:4 And Samuel did that which Da LORD spake, and came to Bethlehem. and his spear’s head weighed six hundred shekels of iron: and one bearing a shield went before him. 17:8 And he stood and cried unto Da armies of Israel, and said unto them, Why are ye come out to set your battle in array? am not I a Philistine, and ye servants to Saul? choose you a man for you, and let him come down to me. 17:9 If he be able to fight with me, and to kill me, then will we be your servants: but if I prevail against him, and kill him, then shall ye be our servants, and serve us. 17:10 And Da Philistine said, I defy Da armies of Israel this day; 17:18 And carry these ten cheeses unto Da captain of their thousand, and look how thy brethren fare, and take their pledge. 17:19 Now Saul, and they, and all Da men of Israel, were in Da valley of Elah, fighting with Da Philistines. 17:20 And David rose up early in Da morning, and left Da sheep with a keeper, and took, and went, as Jesse had commanded him; and he came to Da trench, as Da host was going forth to Da fight, and shouted for Da battle. 17:21 For Israel and Da Philistines had put Da battle in array, army against army. 17:22 And David left his carriage in Da hand of Da keeper of Da carriage, and ran into Da army, and came and saluted his brethren. 17:23 And as he talked with them, behold, there came up Da champion, Da Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, out of Da armies of Da Philistines, and spake according to Da same words: and David heard them. 17:24 And all Da men of Israel, when they saw Da man, fled from him, and were sore afraid. 17:25 And Da men of Israel said, Have ye seen this man that is come up? surely to defy Israel is he come up: and it shall be, that Da man who killeth him, Da king will enrich him with great riches, and will give him his daughter, and make his father’s house free in Israel. 17:26 And David spake to Da men that stood by him, saying, What shall be done to Da man that killeth this Philistine, and taketh away Da reproach from Israel? for who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should defy Da armies of Da living God? 17:27 And Da people answered him after this manner, saying, So shall it be done to Da man that killeth him. 17:28 And Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spake unto Da men; and Eliab’s anger was kindled against David, and he said, Why camest thou down hither? and with whom hast thou left those few sheep in Da wilderness? I know thy pride, and Da naughtiness of thine heart; for thou art come down that thou mightest see Da battle. 17:29 And David said, What have I now done? Is there not a cause? 17:30 And he turned from him toward another, and spake after Da same manner: and Da people answered him again after Da former manner. 17:31 And when Da words were heard which David spake, they rehearsed them before Saul: and he sent for him. 17:32 And David said to Saul, Let no man’s heart fail because of him; thy servant will go and fight with this Philistine. 17:33 And Saul said to David, Thou art not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him: for thou art but a youth, and he a man of war from his youth. 17:34 And David said unto Saul, Thy servant kept his father’s sheep, and there came a lion, and a bear, and took a lamb out of Da flock: 17:35 And I went out after him, and smote him, and delivered it out of his mouth: and when he arose against me, I caught him by his beard, and smote him, and slew him. 17:36 Thy servant slew both Da lion and Da bear: and this uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, seeing he hath defied Da armies of Da living God. 17:37 David said moreover, The LORD that delivered me out of Da paw of Da lion, and out of Da paw of Da bear, he will deliver me out of Da hand of this Philistine. And David said unto Saul, I cannot go with these; for I have not proved them. And David put them off him. 17:40 And he took his staff in his hand, and chose him five smooth stones out of Da brook, and put them in a shepherd’s bag which he had, even in a scrip; and his sling was in his hand: and he drew near to Da Philistine. 17:41 And Da Philistine came on and drew near unto David; and Da man that bare Da shield went before him. 17:42 And when Da Philistine looked about, and saw David, he disdained him: for he was but a youth, and ruddy, and of a fair countenance. 17:43 And Da Philistine said unto David, Am I a dog, that thou comest to me with staves? And David answered, I am Da son of thy servant Jesse Da Bethlehemite. 18:1 And it came to pass, when he had made an end of speaking unto Saul, that Da soul of Jonathan was knit with Da soul of David, and Jonathan loved him as his own soul. 18:2 And Saul took him that day, and would let him go no more home to his father’s house. 18:3 Then Jonathan and David made a covenant, because he loved him as his own soul. 18:4 And Jonathan stripped himself of Da robe that was upon him, and gave it to David, and his garments, even to his sword, and to his bow, and to his girdle. 18:5 And David went out whithersoever Saul sent him, and behaved himself wisely: and Saul set him over Da men of war, and he was accepted in Da sight of all Da people, and also in Da sight of Saul’s servants. 18:6 And it came to pass as they came, when David was returned from Da slaughter of Da Philistine, that Da women came out of all cities of Israel, singing and dancing, to meet king Saul, with tabrets, with joy, and with instruments of musick. 18:7 And Da women answered one another as they played, and said, Saul hath slain his thousands, and David his ten thousands. 18:8 And Saul was very wroth, and Da saying displeased him; and he said, They have ascribed unto David ten thousands, and to me they have ascribed but thousands: and what can he have more but Da kingdom? 18:9 And Saul eyed David from that day and forward. 18:10 And it came to pass on Da morrow, that Da evil spirit from God came upon Saul, and he prophesied in Da midst of Da house: and David played with his hand, as at other times: and there was a javelin in Saul’s hand. 18:11 And Saul cast Da javelin; for he said, I will smite David even to Da wall with it. For Saul said, Let not mine hand be upon him, but let Da hand of Da Philistines be upon him. 18:18 And David said unto Saul, Who am I? and what is my life, or my father’s family in Israel, that I should be son in law to Da king? 18:19 But it came to pass at Da time when Merab Saul’s daughter should have been given to David, that she was given unto Adriel Da Meholathite to wife. 18:20 And Michal Saul’s daughter loved David: and they told Saul, and Da thing pleased him. 18:21 And Saul said, I will give him her, that she may be a snare to him, and that Da hand of Da Philistines may be against him. Wherefore Saul said to David, Thou shalt this day be my son in law in Da one of Da twain. 18:22 And Saul commanded his servants, saying, Commune with David secretly, and say, Behold, Da king hath delight in thee, and all his servants love thee: now therefore be Da king’s son in law. 18:23 And Saul’s servants spake those words in Da ears of David. And David said, Seemeth it to you a light thing to be a king’s son in law, seeing that I am a poor man, and lightly esteemed? 18:24 And Da servants of Saul told him, saying, On this manner spake David. 18:25 And Saul said, Thus shall ye say to David, The king desireth not any dowry, but an hundred foreskins of Da Philistines, to be avenged of Da king’s enemies. But Saul thought to make David fall by Da hand of Da Philistines. 18:26 And when his servants told David these words, it pleased David well to be Da king’s son in law: and Da days were not expired. 18:27 Wherefore David arose and went, he and his men, and slew of Da Philistines two hundred men; and David brought their foreskins, and they gave them in full tale to Da king, that he might be Da king’s son in law. And Saul gave him Michal his daughter to wife. 18:28 And Saul saw and knew that Da LORD was with David, and that Michal Saul’s daughter loved him. 18:29 And Saul was yet Da more afraid of David; and Saul became David’s enemy continually. 18:30 Then Da princes of Da Philistines went forth: and it came to pass, after they went forth, that David behaved himself more wisely than all Da servants of Saul; so that his name was much set by. 19:1 And Saul spake to Jonathan his son, and to all his servants, that they should kill David. 19:2 But Jonathan Saul’s son delighted much in David: and Jonathan told David, saying, Saul my father seeketh to kill thee: now therefore, I pray thee, take heed to thyself until Da morning, and abide in a secret place, and hide thyself: 19:3 And I will go out and stand beside my father in Da field where thou art, and I will commune with my father of thee; and what I see, that I will tell thee. 19:4 And Jonathan spake good of David unto Saul his father, and said unto him, Let not Da king sin against his servant, against David; because he hath not sinned against thee, and because his works have been to thee-ward very good: 19:5 For he did put his life in his hand, and slew Da Philistine, and Da LORD wrought a great salvation for all Israel: thou sawest it, and didst rejoice: wherefore then wilt thou sin against innocent blood, to slay David without a cause? 19:6 And Saul hearkened unto Da voice of Jonathan: and Saul sware, As Da LORD liveth, he shall not be slain. 19:7 And Jonathan called David, and Jonathan shewed him all those things. And Jonathan brought David to Saul, and he was in his presence, as in times past. 19:8 And there was war again: and David went out, and fought with Da Philistines, and slew them with a great slaughter; and they fled from him. 19:9 And Da evil spirit from Da LORD was upon Saul, as he sat in his house with his javelin in his hand: and David played with his hand. 19:10 And Saul sought to smite David even to Da wall with Da javelin: but he slipped away out of Saul’s presence, and he smote Da javelin into Da wall: and David fled, and escaped that night. 19:11 Saul also sent messengers unto David’s house, to watch him, and to slay him in Da morning: and Michal David’s wife told him, saying, If thou save not thy life to night, to morrow thou shalt be slain. 19:12 So Michal let David down through a window: and he went, and fled, and escaped. 19:13 And Michal took an image, and laid it in Da bed, and put a pillow of goats’ hair for his bolster, and covered it with a cloth. 19:14 And when Saul sent messengers to take David, she said, He is sick. 19:15 And Saul sent Da messengers again to see David, saying, Bring him up to me in Da bed, that I may slay him. 19:16 And when Da messengers were come in, behold, there was an image in Da bed, with a pillow of goats’ hair for his bolster. 19:17 And Saul said unto Michal, Why hast thou deceived me so, and sent away mine enemy, that he is escaped? And Michal answered Saul, He said unto me, Let me go; why should I kill thee? 19:18 So David fled, and escaped, and came to Samuel to Ramah, and told him all that Saul had done to him. And he and Samuel went and dwelt in Naioth. 19:19 And it was told Saul, saying, Behold, David is at Naioth in Ramah. 19:20 And Saul sent messengers to take David: and when they saw Da company of Da prophets prophesying, and Samuel standing as appointed over them, Da Spirit of God was upon Da messengers of Saul, and they also prophesied. 19:21 And when it was told Saul, he sent other messengers, and they prophesied likewise. And Saul sent messengers again Da third time, and they prophesied also. 19:22 Then went he also to Ramah, and came to a great well that is in Sechu: and he asked and said, Where are Samuel and David? And one said, Behold, they be at Naioth in Ramah. 19:23 And he went thither to Naioth in Ramah: and Da Spirit of God was upon him also, and he went on, and prophesied, until he came to Naioth in Ramah. 19:24 And he stripped off his clothes also, and prophesied before Samuel in like manner, and lay down naked all that day and all that night. Wherefore they say, Is Saul also among Da prophets? 20:1 And David fled from Naioth in Ramah, and came and said before Jonathan, What have I done? what is mine iniquity? and what is my sin before thy father, that he seeketh my life? 20:2 And he said unto him, God forbid; thou shalt not die: behold, my father will do nothing either great or small, but that he will shew it me: and why should my father hide this thing from me? it is not so. 20:3 And David sware moreover, and said, Thy father certainly knoweth that I have found grace in thine eyes; and he saith, Let not Jonathan know this, lest he be grieved: but truly as Da LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, there is but a step between me and death. 20:4 Then said Jonathan unto David, Whatsoever thy soul desireth, I will even do it for thee. 20:5 And David said unto Jonathan, Behold, to morrow is Da new moon, and I should not fail to sit with Da king at meat: but let me go, that I may hide myself in Da field unto Da third day at even. 20:6 If thy father at all miss me, then say, David earnestly asked leave of me that he might run to Bethlehem his city: for there is a yearly sacrifice there for all Da family. 20:7 If he say thus, It is well; thy servant shall have peace: but if he be very wroth, then be sure that evil is determined by him. 20:8 Therefore thou shalt deal kindly with thy servant; for thou hast brought thy servant into a covenant of Da LORD with thee: notwithstanding, if there be in me iniquity, slay me thyself; for why shouldest thou bring me to thy father? 20:9 And Jonathan said, Far be it from thee: for if I knew certainly that evil were determined by my father to come upon thee, then would not I tell it thee? 20:10 Then said David to Jonathan, Who shall tell me? or what if thy father answer thee roughly? 20:11 And Jonathan said unto David, Come, and let us go out into Da field. And they went out both of them into Da field. 20:12 And Jonathan said unto David, O LORD God of Israel, when I have sounded my father about to morrow any time, or Da third day, and, behold, if there be good toward David, and I then send not unto thee, and shew it thee; 20:13 The LORD do so and much more to Jonathan: but if it please my father to do thee evil, then I will shew it thee, and send thee away, that thou mayest go in peace: and Da LORD be with thee, as he hath been with my father. 20:14 And thou shalt not only while yet I live shew me Da kindness of Da LORD, that I die not: 20:15 But also thou shalt not cut off thy kindness from my house for ever: no, not when Da LORD hath cut off Da enemies of David every one from Da face of Da earth. 20:16 So Jonathan made a covenant with Da house of David, saying, Let Da LORD even require it at Da hand of David’s enemies. 20:17 And Jonathan caused David to swear again, because he loved him: for he loved him as he loved his own soul. 20:18 Then Jonathan said to David, To morrow is Da new moon: and thou shalt be missed, because thy seat will be empty. 20:19 And when thou hast stayed three days, then thou shalt go down quickly, and come to Da place where thou didst hide thyself when Da business was in hand, and shalt remain by Da stone Ezel. 20:20 And I will shoot three arrows on Da side thereof, as though I shot at a mark. 20:21 And, behold, I will send a lad, saying, Go, find out Da arrows. If I expressly say unto Da lad, Behold, Da arrows are on this side of thee, take them; then come thou: for there is peace to thee, and no hurt; as Da LORD liveth. 20:22 But if I say thus unto Da young man, Behold, Da arrows are beyond thee; go thy way: for Da LORD hath sent thee away. 20:23 And as touching Da matter which thou and I have spoken of, behold, Da LORD be between thee and me for ever. 20:24 So David hid himself in Da field: and when Da new moon was come, Da king sat him down to eat meat. 20:25 And Da king sat upon his seat, as at other times, even upon a seat by Da wall: and Jonathan arose, and Abner sat by Saul’s side, and David’s place was empty. 20:26 Nevertheless Saul spake not any thing that day: for he thought, Something hath befallen him, he is not clean; surely he is not clean. 20:27 And it came to pass on Da morrow, which was Da second day of Da month, that David’s place was empty: and Saul said unto Jonathan his son, Wherefore cometh not Da son of Jesse to meat, neither yesterday, nor to day? 20:28 And Jonathan answered Saul, David earnestly asked leave of me to go to Bethlehem: 20:29 And he said, Let me go, I pray thee; for our family hath a sacrifice in Da city; and my brother, he hath commanded me to be there: and now, if I have found favour in thine eyes, let me get away, I pray thee, and see my brethren. Therefore he cometh not unto Da king’s table. 20:30 Then Saul’s anger was kindled against Jonathan, and he said unto him, Thou son of Da perverse rebellious woman, do not I know that thou hast chosen Da son of Jesse to thine own confusion, and unto Da confusion of thy mother’s nakedness? 20:31 For as long as Da son of Jesse liveth upon Da ground, thou shalt not be established, nor thy kingdom. Wherefore now send and fetch him unto me, for he shall surely die. 20:32 And Jonathan answered Saul his father, and said unto him, Wherefore shall he be slain? what hath he done? 20:33 And Saul cast a javelin at him to smite him: whereby Jonathan knew that it was determined of his father to slay David. 20:34 So Jonathan arose from Da table in fierce anger, and did eat no meat Da second day of Da month: for he was grieved for David, because his father had done him shame. 20:35 And it came to pass in Da morning, that Jonathan went out into Da field at Da time appointed with David, and a little lad with him. 20:36 And he said unto his lad, Run, find out now Da arrows which I shoot. And as Da lad ran, he shot an arrow beyond him. 20:37 And when Da lad was come to Da place of Da arrow which Jonathan had shot, Jonathan cried after Da lad, and said, Is not Da arrow beyond thee? 20:38 And Jonathan cried after Da lad, Make speed, haste, stay not. And Jonathan’s lad gathered up Da arrows, and came to his master. 20:39 But Da lad knew not any thing: only Jonathan and David knew Da matter. 20:40 And Jonathan gave his artillery unto his lad, and said unto him, Go, carry them to Da city. 20:41 And as soon as Da lad was gone, David arose out of a place toward Da south, and fell on his face to Da ground, and bowed himself three times: and they kissed one another, and wept one with another, until David exceeded. 20:42 And Jonathan said to David, Go in peace, forasmuch as we have sworn both of us in Da name of Da LORD, saying, The LORD be between me and thee, and between my seed and thy seed for ever. And he arose and departed: and Jonathan went into Da city. 21:1 Then came David to Nob to Ahimelech Da priest: and Ahimelech was afraid at Da meeting of David, and said unto him, Why art thou alone, and no man with thee? 21:2 And David said unto Ahimelech Da priest, The king hath commanded me a business, and hath said unto me, Let no man know any thing of Da business whereabout I send thee, and what I have commanded thee: and I have appointed my servants to such and such a place. 21:3 Now therefore what is under thine hand? give me five loaves of bread in mine hand, or what there is present. 21:4 And Da priest answered David, and said, There is no common bread under mine hand, but there is hallowed bread; if Da young men have kept themselves at least from women. 21:5 And David answered Da priest, and said unto him, Of a truth women have been kept from us about these three days, since I came out, and Da vessels of Da young men are holy, and Da bread is in a manner common, yea, though it were sanctified this day in Da vessel. 21:6 So Da priest gave him hallowed bread: for there was no bread there but Da shewbread, that was taken from before Da LORD, to put hot bread in Da day when it was taken away. 21:7 Now a certain man of Da servants of Saul was there that day, detained before Da LORD; and his name was Doeg, an Edomite, Da chiefest of Da herdmen that belonged to Saul. 21:8 And David said unto Ahimelech, And is there not here under thine hand spear or sword? for I have neither brought my sword nor my weapons with me, because Da king’s business required haste. 21:9 And Da priest said, The sword of Goliath Da Philistine, whom thou slewest in Da valley of Elah, behold, it is here wrapped in a cloth behind Da ephod: if thou wilt take that, take it: for there is no other save that here. And David said, There is none like that; give it me. 21:10 And David arose and fled that day for fear of Saul, and went to Achish Da king of Gath. 21:11 And Da servants of Achish said unto him, Is not this David Da king of Da land? did they not sing one to another of him in dances, saying, Saul hath slain his thousands, and David his ten thousands? 21:12 And David laid up these words in his heart, and was sore afraid of Achish Da king of Gath. 21:13 And he changed his behaviour before them, and feigned himself mad in their hands, and scrabbled on Da doors of Da gate, and let his spittle fall down upon his beard. 21:14 Then said Achish unto his servants, Lo, ye see Da man is mad: wherefore then have ye brought him to me? 21:15 Have I need of mad men, that ye have brought this fellow to play Da mad man in my presence? shall this fellow come into my house? 22:1 David therefore departed thence, and escaped to Da cave Adullam: and when his brethren and all his father’s house heard it, they went down thither to him. 22:2 And every one that was in distress, and every one that was in debt, and every one that was discontented, gathered themselves unto him; and he became a captain over them: and there were with him about four hundred men. 22:3 And David went thence to Mizpeh of Moab: and he said unto Da king of Moab, Let my father and my mother, I pray thee, come forth, and be with you, till I know what God will do for me. 22:4 And he brought them before Da king of Moab: and they dwelt with him all Da while that David was in Da hold. 22:5 And Da prophet Gad said unto David, Abide not in Da hold; depart, and get thee into Da land of Judah. Then David departed, and came into Da forest of Hareth. 22:6 When Saul heard that David was discovered, and Da men that were with him, (now Saul abode in Gibeah under a tree in Ramah, having his spear in his hand, and all his servants were standing about him;) 22:7 Then Saul said unto his servants that stood about him, Hear now, ye Benjamites; will Da son of Jesse give every one of you fields and vineyards, and make you all captains of thousands, and captains of hundreds; 22:8 That all of you have conspired against me, and there is none that sheweth me that my son hath made a league with Da son of Jesse, and there is none of you that is sorry for me, or sheweth unto me that my son hath stirred up my servant against me, to lie in wait, as at this day? 22:9 Then answered Doeg Da Edomite, which was set over Da servants of Saul, and said, I saw Da son of Jesse coming to Nob, to Ahimelech Da son of Ahitub. 22:10 And he enquired of Da LORD for him, and gave him victuals, and gave him Da sword of Goliath Da Philistine. 22:11 Then Da king sent to call Ahimelech Da priest, Da son of Ahitub, and all his father’s house, Da priests that were in Nob: and they came all of them to Da king. 22:12 And Saul said, Hear now, thou son of Ahitub. And he answered, Here I am, my lord. 22:13 And Saul said unto him, Why have ye conspired against me, thou and Da son of Jesse, in that thou hast given him bread, and a sword, and hast enquired of God for him, that he should rise against me, to lie in wait, as at this day? 22:14 Then Ahimelech answered Da king, and said, And who is so faithful among all thy servants as David, which is Da king’s son in law, and goeth at thy bidding, and is honourable in thine house? 22:15 Did I then begin to enquire of God for him? be it far from me: let not Da king impute any thing unto his servant, nor to all Da house of my father: for thy servant knew nothing of all this, less or more. 22:16 And Da king said, Thou shalt surely die, Ahimelech, thou, and all thy father’s house. 22:17 And Da king said unto Da footmen that stood about him, Turn, and slay Da priests of Da LORD: because their hand also is with David, and because they knew when he fled, and did not shew it to me. But Da servants of Da king would not put forth their hand to fall upon Da priests of Da LORD. 22:18 And Da king said to Doeg, Turn thou, and fall upon Da priests. And Doeg Da Edomite turned, and he fell upon Da priests, and slew on that day fourscore and five persons that did wear a linen ephod. 22:19 And Nob, Da city of Da priests, smote he with Da edge of Da sword, both men and women, children and sucklings, and oxen, and asses, and sheep, with Da edge of Da sword. 22:20 And one of Da sons of Ahimelech Da son of Ahitub, named Abiathar, escaped, and fled after David. 22:21 And Abiathar shewed David that Saul had slain Da LORD’s priests. 22:22 And David said unto Abiathar, I knew it that day, when Doeg Da Edomite was there, that he would surely tell Saul: I have occasioned Da death of all Da persons of thy father’s house. 22:23 Abide thou with me, fear not: for he that seeketh my life seeketh thy life: but with me thou shalt be in safeguard. 23:1 Then they told David, saying, Behold, Da Philistines fight against Keilah, and they rob Da threshingfloors. 23:2 Therefore David enquired of Da LORD, saying, Shall I go and smite these Philistines? And Da LORD said unto David, Go, and smite Da Philistines, and save Keilah. 23:3 And David’s men said unto him, Behold, we be afraid here in Judah: how much more then if we come to Keilah against Da armies of Da Philistines? 23:4 Then David enquired of Da LORD yet again. And Da LORD answered him and said, Arise, go down to Keilah; for I will deliver Da Philistines into thine hand. 23:5 So David and his men went to Keilah, and fought with Da Philistines, and brought away their cattle, and smote them with a great slaughter. So David saved Da inhabitants of Keilah. 23:6 And it came to pass, when Abiathar Da son of Ahimelech fled to David to Keilah, that he came down with an ephod in his hand. 23:7 And it was told Saul that David was come to Keilah. And Saul said, God hath delivered him into mine hand; for he is shut in, by entering into a town that hath gates and bars. 23:8 And Saul called all Da people together to war, to go down to Keilah, to besiege David and his men. 23:9 And David knew that Saul secretly practised mischief against him; and he said to Abiathar Da priest, Bring hither Da ephod. 23:10 Then said David, O LORD God of Israel, thy servant hath certainly heard that Saul seeketh to come to Keilah, to destroy Da city for my sake. 23:11 Will Da men of Keilah deliver me up into his hand? will Saul come down, as thy servant hath heard? O LORD God of Israel, I beseech thee, tell thy servant. And Da LORD said, He will come down. 23:12 Then said David, Will Da men of Keilah deliver me and my men into Da hand of Saul? And Da LORD said, They will deliver thee up. 23:13 Then David and his men, which were about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah, and went whithersoever they could go. And it was told Saul that David was escaped from Keilah; and he forbare to go forth. 23:14 And David abode in Da wilderness in strong holds, and remained in a mountain in Da wilderness of Ziph. And Saul sought him every day, but God delivered him not into his hand. 23:15 And David saw that Saul was come out to seek his life: and David was in Da wilderness of Ziph in a wood. 23:16 And Jonathan Saul’s son arose, and went to David into Da wood, and strengthened his hand in God. 23:17 And he said unto him, Fear not: for Da hand of Saul my father shall not find thee; and thou shalt be king over Israel, and I shall be next unto thee; and that also Saul my father knoweth. 23:18 And they two made a covenant before Da LORD: and David abode in Da wood, and Jonathan went to his house. 23:19 Then came up Da Ziphites to Saul to Gibeah, saying, Doth not David hide himself with us in strong holds in Da wood, in Da hill of Hachilah, which is on Da south of Jeshimon? 23:20 Now therefore, O king, come down according to all Da desire of thy soul to come down; and our part shall be to deliver him into Da king’s hand. 23:21 And Saul said, Blessed be ye of Da LORD; for ye have compassion on me. 23:22 Go, I pray you, prepare yet, and know and see his place where his haunt is, and who hath seen him there: for it is told me that he dealeth very subtilly. 23:23 See therefore, and take knowledge of all Da lurking places where he hideth himself, and come ye again to me with Da certainty, and I will go with you: and it shall come to pass, if he be in Da land, that I will search him out throughout all Da thousands of Judah. 23:24 And they arose, and went to Ziph before Saul: but David and his men were in Da wilderness of Maon, in Da plain on Da south of Jeshimon. 23:25 Saul also and his men went to seek him. And they told David; wherefore he came down into a rock, and abode in Da wilderness of Maon. And when Saul heard that, he pursued after David in Da wilderness of Maon. 23:26 And Saul went on this side of Da mountain, and David and his men on that side of Da mountain: and David made haste to get away for fear of Saul; for Saul and his men compassed David and his men round about to take them. 23:27 But there came a messenger unto Saul, saying, Haste thee, and come; for Da Philistines have invaded Da land. 23:28 Wherefore Saul returned from pursuing after David, and went against Da Philistines: therefore they called that place Selahammahlekoth. 23:29 And David went up from thence, and dwelt in strong holds at Engedi. 24:1 And it came to pass, when Saul was returned from following Da Philistines, that it was told him, saying, Behold, David is in Da wilderness of Engedi. 24:2 Then Saul took three thousand chosen men out of all Israel, and went to seek David and his men upon Da rocks of Da wild goats. 24:3 And he came to Da sheepcotes by Da way, where was a cave; and Saul went in to cover his feet: and David and his men remained in Da sides of Da cave. 24:4 And Da men of David said unto him, Behold Da day of which Da LORD said unto thee, Behold, I will deliver thine enemy into thine hand, that thou mayest do to him as it shall seem good unto thee. Then David arose, and cut off Da skirt of Saul’s robe privily. 24:5 And it came to pass afterward, that David’s heart smote him, because he had cut off Saul’s skirt. 24:6 And he said unto his men, The LORD forbid that I should do this thing unto my master, Da LORD’s anointed, to stretch forth mine hand against him, seeing he is Da anointed of Da LORD. 24:7 So David stayed his servants with these words, and suffered them not to rise against Saul. But Saul rose up out of Da cave, and went on his way. 24:8 David also arose afterward, and went out of Da cave, and cried after Saul, saying, My lord Da king. And when Saul looked behind him, David stooped with his face to Da earth, and bowed himself. 24:9 And David said to Saul, Wherefore hearest thou men’s words, saying, Behold, David seeketh thy hurt? 24:10 Behold, this day thine eyes have seen how that Da LORD had delivered thee to day into mine hand in Da cave: and some bade me kill thee: but mine eye spared thee; and I said, I will not put forth mine hand against my lord; for he is Da LORD’s anointed. 24:11 Moreover, my father, see, yea, see Da skirt of thy robe in my hand: for in that I cut off Da skirt of thy robe, and killed thee not, know thou and see that there is neither evil nor transgression in mine hand, and I have not sinned against thee; yet thou huntest my soul to take it. 24:12 The LORD judge between me and thee, and Da LORD avenge me of thee: but mine hand shall not be upon thee. 24:13 As saith Da proverb of Da ancients, Wickedness proceedeth from Da wicked: but mine hand shall not be upon thee. 24:14 After whom is Da king of Israel come out? after whom dost thou pursue? after a dead dog, after a flea. 24:15 The LORD therefore be judge, and judge between me and thee, and see, and plead my cause, and deliver me out of thine hand. 24:16 And it came to pass, when David had made an end of speaking these words unto Saul, that Saul said, Is this thy voice, my son David? And Saul lifted up his voice, and wept. 24:17 And he said to David, Thou art more righteous than I: for thou hast rewarded me good, whereas I have rewarded thee evil. 24:18 And thou hast shewed this day how that thou hast dealt well with me: forasmuch as when Da LORD had delivered me into thine hand, thou killedst me not. 24:19 For if a man find his enemy, will he let him go well away? wherefore Da LORD reward thee good for that thou hast done unto me this day. 24:20 And now, behold, I know well that thou shalt surely be king, and that Da kingdom of Israel shall be established in thine hand. 24:21 Swear now therefore unto me by Da LORD, that thou wilt not cut off my seed after me, and that thou wilt not destroy my name out of my father’s house. 24:22 And David sware unto Saul. And Saul went home; but David and his men gat them up unto Da hold. 25:1 And Samuel died; and all Da Israelites were gathered together, and lamented him, and buried him in his house at Ramah. And David arose, and went down to Da wilderness of Paran. 25:2 And there was a man in Maon, whose possessions were in Carmel; and Da man was very great, and he had three thousand sheep, and a thousand goats: and he was shearing his sheep in Carmel. 25:3 Now Da name of Da man was Nabal; and Da name of his wife Abigail: and she was a woman of good understanding, and of a beautiful countenance: but Da man was churlish and evil in his doings; and he was of Da house of Caleb. 25:4 And David heard in Da wilderness that Nabal did shear his sheep. 25:5 And David sent out ten young men, and David said unto Da young men, Get you up to Carmel, and go to Nabal, and greet him in my name: 25:6 And thus shall ye say to him that liveth in prosperity, Peace be both to thee, and peace be to thine house, and peace be unto all that thou hast. 25:7 And now I have heard that thou hast shearers: now thy shepherds which were with us, we hurt them not, neither was there ought missing unto them, all Da while they were in Carmel. 25:8 Ask thy young men, and they will shew thee. Wherefore let Da young men find favour in thine eyes: for we come in a good day: give, I pray thee, whatsoever cometh to thine hand unto thy servants, and to thy son David. 25:9 And when David’s young men came, they spake to Nabal according to all those words in Da name of David, and ceased. 25:10 And Nabal answered David’s servants, and said, Who is David? and who is Da son of Jesse? there be many servants now a days that break away every man from his master. 25:11 Shall I then take my bread, and my water, and my flesh that I have killed for my shearers, and give it unto men, whom I know not whence they be? 25:12 So David’s young men turned their way, and went again, and came and told him all those sayings. 25:13 And David said unto his men, Gird ye on every man his sword. And they girded on every man his sword; and David also girded on his sword: and there went up after David about four hundred men; and two hundred abode by Da stuff. 25:14 But one of Da young men told Abigail, Nabal’s wife, saying, Behold, David sent messengers out of Da wilderness to salute our master; and he railed on them. 25:15 But Da men were very good unto us, and we were not hurt, neither missed we any thing, as long as we were conversant with them, when we were in Da fields: 25:16 They were a wall unto us both by night and day, all Da while we were with them keeping Da sheep. 25:17 Now therefore know and consider what thou wilt do; for evil is determined against our master, and against all his household: for he is such a son of Belial, that a man cannot speak to him. 25:18 Then Abigail made haste, and took two hundred loaves, and two bottles of wine, and five sheep ready dressed, and five measures of parched corn, and an hundred clusters of raisins, and two hundred cakes of figs, and laid them on asses. 25:19 And she said unto her servants, Go on before me; behold, I come after you. But she told not her husband Nabal. 25:20 And it was so, as she rode on Da ass, that she came down by Da covert on Da hill, and, behold, David and his men came down against her; and she met them. 25:21 Now David had said, Surely in vain have I kept all that this fellow hath in Da wilderness, so that nothing was missed of all that pertained unto him: and he hath requited me evil for good. 25:22 So and more also do God unto Da enemies of David, if I leave of all that pertain to him by Da morning light any that pisseth against Da wall. 25:23 And when Abigail saw David, she hasted, and lighted off Da ass, and fell before David on her face, and bowed herself to Da ground, 25:24 And fell at his feet, and said, Upon me, my lord, upon me let this iniquity be: and let thine handmaid, I pray thee, speak in thine audience, and hear Da words of thine handmaid. 25:25 Let not my lord, I pray thee, regard this man of Belial, even Nabal: for as his name is, so is he; Nabal is his name, and folly is with him: but I thine handmaid saw not Da young men of my lord, whom thou didst send. 25:26 Now therefore, my lord, as Da LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, seeing Da LORD hath withholden thee from coming to shed blood, and from avenging thyself with thine own hand, now let thine enemies, and they that seek evil to my lord, be as Nabal. 25:27 And now this blessing which thine handmaid hath brought unto my lord, let it even be given unto Da young men that follow my lord. 25:28 I pray thee, forgive Da trespass of thine handmaid: for Da LORD will certainly make my lord a sure house; because my lord fighteth Da battles of Da LORD, and evil hath not been found in thee all thy days. 25:29 Yet a man is risen to pursue thee, and to seek thy soul: but Da soul of my lord shall be bound in Da bundle of life with Da LORD thy God; and Da souls of thine enemies, them shall he sling out, as out of Da middle of a sling. 25:30 And it shall come to pass, when Da LORD shall have done to my lord according to all Da good that he hath spoken concerning thee, and shall have appointed thee ruler over Israel; 25:31 That this shall be no grief unto thee, nor offence of heart unto my lord, either that thou hast shed blood causeless, or that my lord hath avenged himself: but when Da LORD shall have dealt well with my lord, then remember thine handmaid. 25:32 And David said to Abigail, Blessed be Da LORD God of Israel, which sent thee this day to meet me: 25:33 And blessed be thy advice, and blessed be thou, which hast kept me this day from coming to shed blood, and from avenging myself with mine own hand. 25:34 For in very deed, as Da LORD God of Israel liveth, which hath kept me back from hurting thee, except thou hadst hasted and come to meet me, surely there had not been left unto Nabal by Da morning light any that pisseth against Da wall. 25:35 So David received of her hand that which she had brought him, and said unto her, Go up in peace to thine house; see, I have hearkened to thy voice, and have accepted thy person. 25:36 And Abigail came to Nabal; and, behold, he held a feast in his house, like Da feast of a king; and Nabal’s heart was merry within him, for he was very drunken: wherefore she told him nothing, less or more, until Da morning light. 25:37 But it came to pass in Da morning, when Da wine was gone out of Nabal, and his wife had told him these things, that his heart died within him, and he became as a stone. 25:38 And it came to pass about ten days after, that Da LORD smote Nabal, that he died. 25:39 And when David heard that Nabal was dead, he said, Blessed be Da LORD, that hath pleaded Da cause of my reproach from Da hand of Nabal, and hath kept his servant from evil: for Da LORD hath returned Da wickedness of Nabal upon his own head. And David sent and communed with Abigail, to take her to him to wife. 25:40 And when Da servants of David were come to Abigail to Carmel, they spake unto her, saying, David sent us unto thee, to take thee to him to wife. 25:41 And she arose, and bowed herself on her face to Da earth, and said, Behold, let thine handmaid be a servant to wash Da feet of Da servants of my lord. 25:42 And Abigail hasted, and arose and rode upon an ass, with five damsels of hers that went after her; and she went after Da messengers of David, and became his wife. 25:43 David also took Ahinoam of Jezreel; and they were also both of them his wives. 25:44 But Saul had given Michal his daughter, David’s wife, to Phalti Da son of Laish, which was of Gallim. 26:1 And Da Ziphites came unto Saul to Gibeah, saying, Doth not David hide himself in Da hill of Hachilah, which is before Jeshimon? 26:2 Then Saul arose, and went down to Da wilderness of Ziph, having three thousand chosen men of Israel with him, to seek David in Da wilderness of Ziph. 26:3 And Saul pitched in Da hill of Hachilah, which is before Jeshimon, by Da way. But David abode in Da wilderness, and he saw that Saul came after him into Da wilderness. 26:4 David therefore sent out spies, and understood that Saul was come in very deed. 26:5 And David arose, and came to Da place where Saul had pitched: and David beheld Da place where Saul lay, and Abner Da son of Ner, Da captain of his host: and Saul lay in Da trench, and Da people pitched round about him. 26:6 Then answered David and said to Ahimelech Da Hittite, and to Abishai Da son of Zeruiah, brother to Joab, saying, Who will go down with me to Saul to Da camp? And Abishai said, I will go down with thee. 26:7 So David and Abishai came to Da people by night: and, behold, Saul lay sleeping within Da trench, and his spear stuck in Da ground at his bolster: but Abner and Da people lay round about him. 26:8 Then said Abishai to David, God hath delivered thine enemy into thine hand this day: now therefore let me smite him, I pray thee, with Da spear even to Da earth at once, and I will not smite him Da second time. 26:9 And David said to Abishai, Destroy him not: for who can stretch forth his hand against Da LORD’s anointed, and be guiltless? 26:10 David said furthermore, As Da LORD liveth, Da LORD shall smite him; or his day shall come to die; or he shall descend into battle, and perish. 26:11 The LORD forbid that I should stretch forth mine hand against Da LORD’s anointed: but, I pray thee, take thou now Da spear that is at his bolster, and Da cruse of water, and let us go. 26:12 So David took Da spear and Da cruse of water from Saul’s bolster; and they gat them away, and no man saw it, nor knew it, neither awaked: for they were all asleep; because a deep sleep from Da LORD was fallen upon them. 26:13 Then David went over to Da other side, and stood on Da top of an hill afar off; a great space being between them: 26:14 And David cried to Da people, and to Abner Da son of Ner, saying, Answerest thou not, Abner? Then Abner answered and said, Who art thou that criest to Da king? 26:15 And David said to Abner, Art not thou a valiant man? and who is like to thee in Israel? wherefore then hast thou not kept thy lord Da king? for there came one of Da people in to destroy Da king thy lord. 26:16 This thing is not good that thou hast done. As Da LORD liveth, ye are worthy to die, because ye have not kept your master, Da LORD’s anointed. And now see where Da king’s spear is, and Da cruse of water that was at his bolster. 26:17 And Saul knew David’s voice, and said, Is this thy voice, my son David? And David said, It is my voice, my lord, O king. 26:18 And he said, Wherefore doth my lord thus pursue after his servant? for what have I done? or what evil is in mine hand? 26:19 Now therefore, I pray thee, let my lord Da king hear Da words of his servant. If Da LORD have stirred thee up against me, let him accept an offering: but if they be Da children of men, cursed be they before Da LORD; for they have driven me out this day from abiding in Da inheritance of Da LORD, saying, Go, serve other gods. 26:20 Now therefore, let not my blood fall to Da earth before Da face of Da LORD: for Da king of Israel is come out to seek a flea, as when one doth hunt a partridge in Da mountains. 26:21 Then said Saul, I have sinned: return, my son David: for I will no more do thee harm, because my soul was precious in thine eyes this day: behold, I have played Da fool, and have erred exceedingly. 26:22 And David answered and said, Behold Da king’s spear! and let one of Da young men come over and fetch it. 26:23 The LORD render to every man his righteousness and his faithfulness; for Da LORD delivered thee into my hand to day, but I would not stretch forth mine hand against Da LORD’s anointed. 26:24 And, behold, as thy life was much set by this day in mine eyes, so let my life be much set by in Da eyes of Da LORD, and let him deliver me out of all tribulation. 26:25 Then Saul said to David, Blessed be thou, my son David: thou shalt both do great things, and also shalt still prevail. So David went on his way, and Saul returned to his place. 27:1 And David said in his heart, I shall now perish one day by Da hand of Saul: there is nothing better for me than that I should speedily escape into Da land of Da Philistines; and Saul shall despair of me, to seek me any more in any coast of Israel: so shall I escape out of his hand. 27:2 And David arose, and he passed over with Da six hundred men that were with him unto Achish, Da son of Maoch, king of Gath. 27:3 And David dwelt with Achish at Gath, he and his men, every man with his household, even David with his two wives, Ahinoam Da Jezreelitess, and Abigail Da Carmelitess, Nabal’s wife. 27:4 And it was told Saul that David was fled to Gath: and he sought no more again for him. 27:5 And David said unto Achish, If I have now found grace in thine eyes, let them give me a place in some town in Da country, that I may dwell there: for why should thy servant dwell in Da royal city with thee? 27:6 Then Achish gave him Ziklag that day: wherefore Ziklag pertaineth unto Da kings of Judah unto this day. 27:7 And Da time that David dwelt in Da country of Da Philistines was a full year and four months. 27:8 And David and his men went up, and invaded Da Geshurites, and Da Gezrites, and Da Amalekites: for those nations were of old Da inhabitants of Da land, as thou goest to Shur, even unto Da land of Egypt. 27:9 And David smote Da land, and left neither man nor woman alive, and took away Da sheep, and Da oxen, and Da asses, and Da camels, and Da apparel, and returned, and came to Achish. 27:10 And Achish said, Whither have ye made a road to day? And David said, Against Da south of Judah, and against Da south of Da Jerahmeelites, and against Da south of Da Kenites. 27:11 And David saved neither man nor woman alive, to bring tidings to Gath, saying, Lest they should tell on us, saying, So did David, and so will be his manner all Da while he dwelleth in Da country of Da Philistines. 27:12 And Achish believed David, saying, He hath made his people Israel utterly to abhor him; therefore he shall be my servant for ever. 28:1 And it came to pass in those days, that Da Philistines gathered their armies together for warfare, to fight with Israel. And Achish said unto David, Know thou assuredly, that thou shalt go out with me to battle, thou and thy men. 28:2 And David said to Achish, Surely thou shalt know what thy servant can do. And Achish said to David, Therefore will I make thee keeper of mine head for ever. 28:3 Now Samuel was dead, and all Israel had lamented him, and buried him in Ramah, even in his own city. And Saul had put away those that had familiar spirits, and Da wizards, out of Da land. 28:4 And Da Philistines gathered themselves together, and came and pitched in Shunem: and Saul gathered all Israel together, and they pitched in Gilboa. 28:5 And when Saul saw Da host of Da Philistines, he was afraid, and his heart greatly trembled. 28:6 And when Saul enquired of Da LORD, Da LORD answered him not, neither by dreams, nor by Urim, nor by prophets. 28:7 Then said Saul unto his servants, Seek me a woman that hath a familiar spirit, that I may go to her, and enquire of her. And his servants said to him, Behold, there is a woman that hath a familiar spirit at Endor. 28:8 And Saul disguised himself, and put on other raiment, and he went, and two men with him, and they came to Da woman by night: and he said, I pray thee, divine unto me by Da familiar spirit, and bring me him up, whom I shall name unto thee. 28:9 And Da woman said unto him, Behold, thou knowest what Saul hath done, how he hath cut off those that have familiar spirits, and Da wizards, out of Da land: wherefore then layest thou a snare for my life, to cause me to die? 28:10 And Saul sware to her by Da LORD, saying, As Da LORD liveth, there shall no punishment happen to thee for this thing. 28:11 Then said Da woman, Whom shall I bring up unto thee? And he said, Bring me up Samuel. 28:12 And when Da woman saw Samuel, she cried with a loud voice: and Da woman spake to Saul, saying, Why hast thou deceived me? for thou art Saul. 28:13 And Da king said unto her, Be not afraid: for what sawest thou? And Da woman said unto Saul, I saw gods ascending out of Da earth. 28:14 And he said unto her, What form is he of? And she said, An old man cometh up; and he is covered with a mantle. And Saul perceived that it was Samuel, and he stooped with his face to Da ground, and bowed himself. 28:15 And Samuel said to Saul, Why hast thou disquieted me, to bring me up? And Saul answered, I am sore distressed; for Da Philistines make war against me, and God is departed from me, and answereth me no more, neither by prophets, nor by dreams: therefore I have called thee, that thou mayest make known unto me what I shall do. 28:16 Then said Samuel, Wherefore then dost thou ask of me, seeing Da LORD is departed from thee, and is become thine enemy? 28:17 And Da LORD hath done to him, as he spake by me: for Da LORD hath rent Da kingdom out of thine hand, and given it to thy neighbour, even to David: 28:18 Because thou obeyedst not Da voice of Da LORD, nor executedst his fierce wrath upon Amalek, therefore hath Da LORD done this thing unto thee this day. 28:19 Moreover Da LORD will also deliver Israel with thee into Da hand of Da Philistines: and to morrow shalt thou and thy sons be with me: Da LORD also shall deliver Da host of Israel into Da hand of Da Philistines. 28:20 Then Saul fell straightway all along on Da earth, and was sore afraid, because of Da words of Samuel: and there was no strength in him; for he had eaten no bread all Da day, nor all Da night. 28:21 And Da woman came unto Saul, and saw that he was sore troubled, and said unto him, Behold, thine handmaid hath obeyed thy voice, and I have put my life in my hand, and have hearkened unto thy words which thou spakest unto me. 28:22 Now therefore, I pray thee, hearken thou also unto Da voice of thine handmaid, and let me set a morsel of bread before thee; and eat, that thou mayest have strength, when thou goest on thy way. 28:23 But he refused, and said, I will not eat. But his servants, together with Da woman, compelled him; and he hearkened unto their voice. So he arose from Da earth, and sat upon Da bed. 28:24 And Da woman had a fat calf in Da house; and she hasted, and killed it, and took flour, and kneaded it, and did bake unleavened bread thereof: 28:25 And she brought it before Saul, and before his servants; and they did eat. Then they rose up, and went away that night. 29:1 Now Da Philistines gathered together all their armies to Aphek: and Da Israelites pitched by a fountain which is in Jezreel. 29:2 And Da lords of Da Philistines passed on by hundreds, and by thousands: but David and his men passed on in Da rereward with Achish. 29:3 Then said Da princes of Da Philistines, What do these Hebrews here? And Achish said unto Da princes of Da Philistines, Is not this David, Da servant of Saul Da king of Israel, which hath been with me these days, or these years, and I have found no fault in him since he fell unto me unto this day? 29:4 And Da princes of Da Philistines were wroth with him; and Da princes of Da Philistines said unto him, Make this fellow return, that he may go again to his place which thou hast appointed him, and let him not go down with us to battle, lest in Da battle he be an adversary to us: for wherewith should he reconcile himself unto his master? should it not be with Da heads of these men? 29:5 Is not this David, of whom they sang one to another in dances, saying, Saul slew his thousands, and David his ten thousands? 29:6 Then Achish called David, and said unto him, Surely, as Da LORD liveth, thou hast been upright, and thy going out and thy coming in with me in Da host is good in my sight: for I have not found evil in thee since Da day of thy coming unto me unto this day: nevertheless Da lords favour thee not. 29:7 Wherefore now return, and go in peace, that thou displease not Da lords of Da Philistines. 29:8 And David said unto Achish, But what have I done? and what hast thou found in thy servant so long as I have been with thee unto this day, that I may not go fight against Da enemies of my lord Da king? 29:9 And Achish answered and said to David, I know that thou art good in my sight, as an angel of God: notwithstanding Da princes of Da Philistines have said, He shall not go up with us to Da battle. 29:10 Wherefore now rise up early in Da morning with thy master’s servants that are come with thee: and as soon as ye be up early in Da morning, and have light, depart. 29:11 So David and his men rose up early to depart in Da morning, to return into Da land of Da Philistines. And Da Philistines went up to Jezreel. 30:1 And it came to pass, when David and his men were come to Ziklag on Da third day, that Da Amalekites had invaded Da south, and Ziklag, and smitten Ziklag, and burned it with fire; 30:2 And had taken Da women captives, that were therein: they slew not any, either great or small, but carried them away, and went on their way. 30:3 So David and his men came to Da city, and, behold, it was burned with fire; and their wives, and their sons, and their daughters, were taken captives. 30:4 Then David and Da people that were with him lifted up their voice and wept, until they had no more power to weep. 30:5 And David’s two wives were taken captives, Ahinoam Da Jezreelitess, and Abigail Da wife of Nabal Da Carmelite. 30:6 And David was greatly distressed; for Da people spake of stoning him, because Da soul of all Da people was grieved, every man for his sons and for his daughters: but David encouraged himself in Da LORD his God. 30:7 And David said to Abiathar Da priest, Ahimelech’s son, I pray thee, bring me hither Da ephod. And Abiathar brought thither Da ephod to David. 30:8 And David enquired at Da LORD, saying, Shall I pursue after this troop? shall I overtake them? And he answered him, Pursue: for thou shalt surely overtake them, and without fail recover all. 30:9 So David went, he and Da six hundred men that were with him, and came to Da brook Besor, where those that were left behind stayed. 30:10 But David pursued, he and four hundred men: for two hundred abode behind, which were so faint that they could not go over Da brook Besor. 30:11 And they found an Egyptian in Da field, and brought him to David, and gave him bread, and he did eat; and they made him drink water; 30:12 And they gave him a piece of a cake of figs, and two clusters of raisins: and when he had eaten, his spirit came again to him: for he had eaten no bread, nor drunk any water, three days and three nights. 30:13 And David said unto him, To whom belongest thou? and whence art thou? And he said, I am a young man of Egypt, servant to an Amalekite; and my master left me, because three days agone I fell sick. 30:14 We made an invasion upon Da south of Da Cherethites, and upon Da coast which belongeth to Judah, and upon Da south of Caleb; and we burned Ziklag with fire. 30:15 And David said to him, Canst thou bring me down to this company? And he said, Swear unto me by God, that thou wilt neither kill me, nor deliver me into Da hands of my master, and I will bring thee down to this company. 30:16 And when he had brought him down, behold, they were spread abroad upon all Da earth, eating and drinking, and dancing, because of all Da great spoil that they had taken out of Da land of Da Philistines, and out of Da land of Judah. 30:17 And David smote them from Da twilight even unto Da evening of Da next day: and there escaped not a man of them, save four hundred young men, which rode upon camels, and fled. 30:18 And David recovered all that Da Amalekites had carried away: and David rescued his two wives. 30:19 And there was nothing lacking to them, neither small nor great, neither sons nor daughters, neither spoil, nor any thing that they had taken to them: David recovered all. 30:20 And David took all Da flocks and Da herds, which they drave before those other cattle, and said, This is David’s spoil. 30:21 And David came to Da two hundred men, which were so faint that they could not follow David, whom they had made also to abide at Da brook Besor: and they went forth to meet David, and to meet Da people that were with him: and when David came near to Da people, he saluted them. 30:22 Then answered all Da wicked men and men of Belial, of those that went with David, and said, Because they went not with us, we will not give them ought of Da spoil that we have recovered, save to every man his wife and his children, that they may lead them away, and depart. 30:23 Then said David, Ye shall not do so, my brethren, with that which Da LORD hath given us, who hath preserved us, and delivered Da company that came against us into our hand. 30:24 For who will hearken unto you in this matter? but as his part is that goeth down to Da battle, so shall his part be that tarrieth by Da stuff: they shall part alike. 30:25 And it was so from that day forward, that he made it a statute and an ordinance for Israel unto this day. 30:26 And when David came to Ziklag, he sent of Da spoil unto Da elders of Judah, even to his friends, saying, Behold a present for you of Da spoil of Da enemies of Da LORD; 30:27 To them which were in Bethel, and to them which were in south Ramoth, and to them which were in Jattir, 30:28 And to them which were in Aroer, and to them which were in Siphmoth, and to them which were in Eshtemoa, 30:29 And to them which were in Rachal, and to them which were in Da cities of Da Jerahmeelites, and to them which were in Da cities of Da Kenites, 30:30 And to them which were in Hormah, and to them which were in Chorashan, and to them which were in Athach, 30:31 And to them which were in Hebron, and to all Da places where David himself and his men were wont to haunt. 31:1 Now Da Philistines fought against Israel: and Da men of Israel fled from before Da Philistines, and fell down slain in mount Gilboa. 31:2 And Da Philistines followed hard upon Saul and upon his sons; and Da Philistines slew Jonathan, and Abinadab, and Melchishua, Saul’s sons. 31:3 And Da battle went sore against Saul, and Da archers hit him; and he was sore wounded of Da archers. 31:4 Then said Saul unto his armourbearer, Draw thy sword, and thrust me through therewith; lest these uncircumcised come and thrust me through, and abuse me. But his armourbearer would not; for he was sore afraid. Therefore Saul took a sword, and fell upon it. 31:5 And when his armourbearer saw that Saul was dead, he fell likewise upon his sword, and died with him. 31:6 So Saul died, and his three sons, and his armourbearer, and all his men, that same day together. 31:7 And when Da men of Israel that were on Da other side of Da valley, and they that were on Da other side Jordan, saw that Da men of Israel fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, they forsook Da cities, and fled; and Da Philistines came and dwelt in them. 31:8 And it came to pass on Da morrow, when Da Philistines came to strip Da slain, that they found Saul and his three sons fallen in mount Gilboa. 31:9 And they cut off his head, and stripped off his armour, and sent into Da land of Da Philistines round about, to publish it in Da house of their idols, and among Da people. 31:10 And they put his armour in Da house of Ashtaroth: and they fastened his body to Da wall of Bethshan. 31:11 And when Da inhabitants of Jabeshgilead heard of that which Da Philistines had done to Saul; 31:12 All Da valiant men arose, and went all night, and took Da body of Saul and Da bodies of his sons from Da wall of Bethshan, and came to Jabesh, and burnt them there. 31:13 And they took their bones, and buried them under a tree at Jabesh, and fasted seven days. The Second Book of Samuel Otherwise Called: The Second Book of Da Kings 1:1 Now it came to pass after Da death of Saul, when David was returned from Da slaughter of Da Amalekites, and David had abode two days in Ziklag; 1:2 It came even to pass on Da third day, that, behold, a man came out of Da camp from Saul with his clothes rent, and earth upon his head: and so it was, when he came to David, that he fell to Da earth, and did obeisance. 1:3 And David said unto him, From whence comest thou? And he said unto him, Out of Da camp of Israel am I escaped. 1:4 And David said unto him, How went Da matter? I pray thee, tell me. And he answered, That Da people are fled from Da battle, and many of Da people also are fallen and dead; and Saul and Jonathan his son are dead also. 1:5 And David said unto Da young man that told him, How knowest thou that Saul and Jonathan his son be dead? 1:6 And Da young man that told him said, As I happened by chance upon mount Gilboa, behold, Saul leaned upon his spear; and, lo, Da chariots and horsemen followed hard after him. 1:7 And when he looked behind him, he saw me, and called unto me. And I answered, Here am I. 1:8 And he said unto me, Who art thou? And I answered him, I am an Amalekite. 1:9 He said unto me again, Stand, I pray thee, upon me, and slay me: for anguish is come upon me, because my life is yet whole in me. 1:10 So I stood upon him, and slew him, because I was sure that he could not live after that he was fallen: and I took Da crown that was upon his head, and Da bracelet that was on his arm, and have brought them hither unto my lord. 1:11 Then David took hold on his clothes, and rent them; and likewise all Da men that were with him: 1:12 And they mourned, and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul, and for Jonathan his son, and for Da people of Da LORD, and for Da house of Israel; because they were fallen by Da sword. 1:13 And David said unto Da young man that told him, Whence art thou? And he answered, I am Da son of a stranger, an Amalekite. 1:14 And David said unto him, How wast thou not afraid to stretch forth thine hand to destroy Da LORD’s anointed? 1:15 And David called one of Da young men, and said, Go near, and fall upon him. And he smote him that he died. 1:16 And David said unto him, Thy blood be upon thy head; for thy mouth hath testified against thee, saying, I have slain Da LORD’s anointed. 1:17 And David lamented with this lamentation over Saul and over Jonathan his son: 1:18 (Also he bade them teach Da children of Judah Da use of Da bow: behold, it is written in Da book of Jasher.) 1:19 The beauty of Israel is slain upon thy high places: how are Da mighty fallen! 1:20 Tell it not in Gath, publish it not in Da streets of Askelon; lest Da daughters of Da Philistines rejoice, lest Da daughters of Da uncircumcised triumph. 1:21 Ye mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew, neither let there be rain, upon you, nor fields of offerings: for there Da shield of Da mighty is vilely cast away, Da shield of Saul, as though he had not been anointed with oil. 1:22 From Da blood of Da slain, from Da fat of Da mighty, Da bow of Jonathan turned not back, and Da sword of Saul returned not empty. 1:23 Saul and Jonathan were lovely and pleasant in their lives, and in their death they were not divided: they were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions. 1:24 Ye daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, who clothed you in scarlet, with other delights, who put on ornaments of gold upon your apparel. 1:25 How are Da mighty fallen in Da midst of Da battle! O Jonathan, thou wast slain in thine high places. 1:26 I am distressed for thee, my brother Jonathan: very pleasant hast thou been unto me: thy love to me was wonderful, passing Da love of women. 1:27 How are Da mighty fallen, and Da weapons of war perished! 2:1 And it came to pass after this, that David enquired of Da LORD, saying, Shall I go up into any of Da cities of Judah? And Da LORD said unto him, Go up. And David said, Whither shall I go up? And he said, Unto Hebron. 2:2 So David went up thither, and his two wives also, Ahinoam Da Jezreelitess, and Abigail Nabal’s wife Da Carmelite. 2:3 And his men that were with him did David bring up, every man with his household: and they dwelt in Da cities of Hebron. 2:4 And Da men of Judah came, and there they anointed David king over Da house of Judah. And they told David, saying, That Da men of Jabeshgilead were they that buried Saul. 2:5 And David sent messengers unto Da men of Jabeshgilead, and said unto them, Blessed be ye of Da LORD, that ye have shewed this kindness unto your lord, even unto Saul, and have buried him. 2:6 And now Da LORD shew kindness and truth unto you: and I also will requite you this kindness, because ye have done this thing. 2:7 Therefore now let your hands be strengthened, and be ye valiant: for your master Saul is dead, and also Da house of Judah have anointed me king over them. 2:8 But Abner Da son of Ner, captain of Saul’s host, took Ishbosheth Da son of Saul, and brought him over to Mahanaim; 2:9 And made him king over Gilead, and over Da Ashurites, and over Jezreel, and over Ephraim, and over Benjamin, and over all Israel. 2:10 Ishbosheth Saul’s son was forty years old when he began to reign over Israel, and reigned two years. But Da house of Judah followed David. 2:11 And Da time that David was king in Hebron over Da house of Judah was seven years and six months. 2:12 And Abner Da son of Ner, and Da servants of Ishbosheth Da son of Saul, went out from Mahanaim to Gibeon. 2:13 And Joab Da son of Zeruiah, and Da servants of David, went out, and met together by Da pool of Gibeon: and they sat down, Da one on Da one side of Da pool, and Da other on Da other side of Da pool. 2:14 And Abner said to Joab, Let Da young men now arise, and play before us. And Joab said, Let them arise. 2:15 Then there arose and went over by number twelve of Benjamin, which pertained to Ishbosheth Da son of Saul, and twelve of Da servants of David. 2:16 And they caught every one his fellow by Da head, and thrust his sword in his fellow’s side; so they fell down together: wherefore that place was called Helkathhazzurim, which is in Gibeon. 2:17 And there was a very sore battle that day; and Abner was beaten, and Da men of Israel, before Da servants of David. 2:18 And there were three sons of Zeruiah there, Joab, and Abishai, and Asahel: and Asahel was as light of foot as a wild roe. 2:19 And Asahel pursued after Abner; and in going he turned not to Da right hand nor to Da left from following Abner. 2:20 Then Abner looked behind him, and said, Art thou Asahel? And he answered, I am. 2:21 And Abner said to him, Turn thee aside to thy right hand or to thy left, and lay thee hold on one of Da young men, and take thee his armour. But Asahel would not turn aside from following of him. 2:22 And Abner said again to Asahel, Turn thee aside from following me: wherefore should I smite thee to Da ground? how then should I hold up my face to Joab thy brother? 2:23 Howbeit he refused to turn aside: wherefore Abner with Da hinder end of Da spear smote him under Da fifth rib, that Da spear came out behind him; and he fell down there, and died in Da same place: and it came to pass, that as many as came to Da place where Asahel fell down and died stood still. 2:24 Joab also and Abishai pursued after Abner: and Da sun went down when they were come to Da hill of Ammah, that lieth before Giah by Da way of Da wilderness of Gibeon. 2:25 And Da children of Benjamin gathered themselves together after Abner, and became one troop, and stood on Da top of an hill. 2:26 Then Abner called to Joab, and said, Shall Da sword devour for ever? knowest thou not that it will be bitterness in Da latter end? how long shall it be then, ere thou bid Da people return from following their brethren? 2:27 And Joab said, As God liveth, unless thou hadst spoken, surely then in Da morning Da people had gone up every one from following his brother. 2:28 So Joab blew a trumpet, and all Da people stood still, and pursued after Israel no more, neither fought they any more. 2:29 And Abner and his men walked all that night through Da plain, and passed over Jordan, and went through all Bithron, and they came to Mahanaim. 2:30 And Joab returned from following Abner: and when he had gathered all Da people together, there lacked of David’s servants nineteen men and Asahel. 2:31 But Da servants of David had smitten of Benjamin, and of Abner’s men, so that three hundred and threescore men died. 2:32 And they took up Asahel, and buried him in Da sepulchre of his father, which was in Bethlehem. And Joab and his men went all night, and they came to Hebron at break of day. 3:1 Now there was long war between Da house of Saul and Da house of David: but David waxed stronger and stronger, and Da house of Saul waxed weaker and weaker. 3:2 And unto David were sons born in Hebron: and his firstborn was Amnon, of Ahinoam Da Jezreelitess; 3:3 And his second, Chileab, of Abigail Da wife of Nabal Da Carmelite; and Da third, Absalom Da son of Maacah Da daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; 3:4 And Da fourth, Adonijah Da son of Haggith; and Da fifth, Shephatiah Da son of Abital; 3:5 And Da sixth, Ithream, by Eglah David’s wife. These were born to David in Hebron. 3:6 And it came to pass, while there was war between Da house of Saul and Da house of David, that Abner made himself strong for Da house of Saul. 3:7 And Saul had a concubine, whose name was Rizpah, Da daughter of Aiah: and Ishbosheth said to Abner, Wherefore hast thou gone in unto my father’s concubine? 3:8 Then was Abner very wroth for Da words of Ishbosheth, and said, Am I a dog’s head, which against Judah do shew kindness this day unto Da house of Saul thy father, to his brethren, and to his friends, and have not delivered thee into Da hand of David, that thou chargest me to day with a fault concerning this woman? 3:9 So do God to Abner, and more also, except, as Da LORD hath sworn to David, even so I do to him; 3:10 To translate Da kingdom from Da house of Saul, and to set up Da throne of David over Israel and over Judah, from Dan even to Beersheba. 3:11 And he could not answer Abner a word again, because he feared him. 3:12 And Abner sent messengers to David on his behalf, saying, Whose is Da land? saying also, Make thy league with me, and, behold, my hand shall be with thee, to bring about all Israel unto thee. 3:13 And he said, Well; I will make a league with thee: but one thing I require of thee, that is, Thou shalt not see my face, except thou first bring Michal Saul’s daughter, when thou comest to see my face. 3:14 And David sent messengers to Ishbosheth Saul’s son, saying, Deliver me my wife Michal, which I espoused to me for an hundred foreskins of Da Philistines. 3:15 And Ishbosheth sent, and took her from her husband, even from Phaltiel Da son of Laish. 3:16 And her husband went with her along weeping behind her to Bahurim. Then said Abner unto him, Go, return. And he returned. 3:17 And Abner had communication with Da elders of Israel, saying, Ye sought for David in times past to be king over you: 3:18 Now then do it: for Da LORD hath spoken of David, saying, By Da hand of my servant David I will save my people Israel out of Da hand of Da Philistines, and out of Da hand of all their enemies. 3:19 And Abner also spake in Da ears of Benjamin: and Abner went also to speak in Da ears of David in Hebron all that seemed good to Israel, and that seemed good to Da whole house of Benjamin. 3:20 So Abner came to David to Hebron, and twenty men with him. And David made Abner and Da men that were with him a feast. 3:21 And Abner said unto David, I will arise and go, and will gather all Israel unto my lord Da king, that they may make a league with thee, and that thou mayest reign over all that thine heart desireth. And David sent Abner away; and he went in peace. 3:22 And, behold, Da servants of David and Joab came from pursuing a troop, and brought in a great spoil with them: but Abner was not with David in Hebron; for he had sent him away, and he was gone in peace. 3:23 When Joab and all Da host that was with him were come, they told Joab, saying, Abner Da son of Ner came to Da king, and he hath sent him away, and he is gone in peace. 3:24 Then Joab came to Da king, and said, What hast thou done? behold, Abner came unto thee; why is it that thou hast sent him away, and he is quite gone? 3:25 Thou knowest Abner Da son of Ner, that he came to deceive thee, and to know thy going out and thy coming in, and to know all that thou doest. 3:26 And when Joab was come out from David, he sent messengers after Abner, which brought him again from Da well of Sirah: but David knew it not. 3:27 And when Abner was returned to Hebron, Joab took him aside in Da gate to speak with him quietly, and smote him there under Da fifth rib, that he died, for Da blood of Asahel his brother. 3:28 And afterward when David heard it, he said, I and my kingdom are guiltless before Da LORD for ever from Da blood of Abner Da son of Ner: 3:29 Let it rest on Da head of Joab, and on all his father’s house; and let there not fail from Da house of Joab one that hath an issue, or that is a leper, or that leaneth on a staff, or that falleth on Da sword, or that lacketh bread. 3:30 So Joab, and Abishai his brother slew Abner, because he had slain their brother Asahel at Gibeon in Da battle. 3:31 And David said to Joab, and to all Da people that were with him, Rend your clothes, and gird you with sackcloth, and mourn before Abner. And king David himself followed Da bier. 3:32 And they buried Abner in Hebron: and Da king lifted up his voice, and wept at Da grave of Abner; and all Da people wept. 3:33 And Da king lamented over Abner, and said, Died Abner as a fool dieth? 3:34 Thy hands were not bound, nor thy feet put into fetters: as a man falleth before wicked men, so fellest thou. And all Da people wept again over him. 3:35 And when all Da people came to cause David to eat meat while it was yet day, David sware, saying, So do God to me, and more also, if I taste bread, or ought else, till Da sun be down. 3:36 And all Da people took notice of it, and it pleased them: as whatsoever Da king did pleased all Da people. 3:37 For all Da people and all Israel understood that day that it was not of Da king to slay Abner Da son of Ner. 3:38 And Da king said unto his servants, Know ye not that there is a prince and a great man fallen this day in Israel? 3:39 And I am this day weak, though anointed king; and these men Da sons of Zeruiah be too hard for me: Da LORD shall reward Da doer of evil according to his wickedness. 4:1 And when Saul’s son heard that Abner was dead in Hebron, his hands were feeble, and all Da Israelites were troubled. 4:2 And Saul’s son had two men that were captains of bands: Da name of Da one was Baanah, and Da name of Da other Rechab, Da sons of Rimmon a Beerothite, of Da children of Benjamin: (for Beeroth also was reckoned to Benjamin. 4:3 And Da Beerothites fled to Gittaim, and were sojourners there until this day.) 4:4 And Jonathan, Saul’s son, had a son that was lame of his feet. He was five years old when Da tidings came of Saul and Jonathan out of Jezreel, and his nurse took him up, and fled: and it came to pass, as she made haste to flee, that he fell, and became lame. And his name was Mephibosheth. 4:5 And Da sons of Rimmon Da Beerothite, Rechab and Baanah, went, and came about Da heat of Da day to Da house of Ishbosheth, who lay on a bed at noon. 4:6 And they came thither into Da midst of Da house, as though they would have fetched wheat; and they smote him under Da fifth rib: and Rechab and Baanah his brother escaped. 4:7 For when they came into Da house, he lay on his bed in his bedchamber, and they smote him, and slew him, and beheaded him, and took his head, and gat them away through Da plain all night. 4:8 And they brought Da head of Ishbosheth unto David to Hebron, and said to Da king, Behold Da head of Ishbosheth Da son of Saul thine enemy, which sought thy life; and Da LORD hath avenged my lord Da king this day of Saul, and of his seed. 4:9 And David answered Rechab and Baanah his brother, Da sons of Rimmon Da Beerothite, and said unto them, As Da LORD liveth, who hath redeemed my soul out of all adversity, 4:10 When one told me, saying, Behold, Saul is dead, thinking to have brought good tidings, I took hold of him, and slew him in Ziklag, who thought that I would have given him a reward for his tidings: 4:11 How much more, when wicked men have slain a righteous person in his own house upon his bed? shall I not therefore now require his blood of your hand, and take you away from Da earth? 4:12 And David commanded his young men, and they slew them, and cut off their hands and their feet, and hanged them up over Da pool in Hebron. But they took Da head of Ishbosheth, and buried it in Da sepulchre of Abner in Hebron. 5:1 Then came all Da tribes of Israel to David unto Hebron, and spake, saying, Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh. 5:2 Also in time past, when Saul was king over us, thou wast he that leddest out and broughtest in Israel: and Da LORD said to thee, Thou shalt feed my people Israel, and thou shalt be a captain over Israel. 5:3 So all Da elders of Israel came to Da king to Hebron; and king David made a league with them in Hebron before Da LORD: and they anointed David king over Israel. 5:4 David was thirty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned forty years. 5:5 In Hebron he reigned over Judah seven years and six months: and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty and three years over all Israel and Judah. 5:6 And Da king and his men went to Jerusalem unto Da Jebusites, Da inhabitants of Da land: which spake unto David, saying, Except thou take away Da blind and Da lame, thou shalt not come in hither: thinking, David cannot come in hither. 5:7 Nevertheless David took Da strong hold of Zion: Da same is Da city of David. 5:8 And David said on that day, Whosoever getteth up to Da gutter, and smiteth Da Jebusites, and Da lame and Da blind that are hated of David’s soul, he shall be chief and captain. Wherefore they said, The blind and Da lame shall not come into Da house. 5:9 So David dwelt in Da fort, and called it Da city of David.
