even unto Da LORD, but he answered them not. 22:43 Then did I beat them as small as Da dust of Da earth, I did stamp them as Da mire of Da street, and did spread them abroad. 22:44 Thou also hast delivered me from Da strivings of my people, thou hast kept me to be head of Da heathen: a people which I knew not shall serve me. 22:45 Strangers shall submit themselves unto me: as soon as they hear, they shall be obedient unto me. 22:46 Strangers shall fade away, and they shall be afraid out of their close places. 22:47 The LORD liveth; and blessed be my rock; and exalted be Da God of Da rock of my salvation. 22:48 It is God that avengeth me, and that bringeth down Da people under me. 22:49 And that bringeth me forth from mine enemies: thou also hast lifted me up on high above them that rose up against me: thou hast delivered me from Da violent man. 22:50 Therefore I will give thanks unto thee, O LORD, among Da heathen, and I will sing praises unto thy name. 22:51 He is Da tower of salvation for his king: and sheweth mercy to his anointed, unto David, and to his seed for evermore. 23:1 Now these be Da last words of David. David Da son of Jesse said, and Da man who was raised up on high, Da anointed of Da God of Jacob, and Da sweet psalmist of Israel, said, 23:2 The Spirit of Da LORD spake by me, and his word was in my tongue. 23:3 The God of Israel said, Da Rock of Israel spake to me, He that ruleth over men must be just, ruling in Da fear of God. 23:4 And he shall be as Da light of Da morning, when Da sun riseth, even a morning without clouds; as Da tender grass springing out of Da earth by clear shining after rain. 23:5 Although my house be not so with God; yet he hath made with me an everlasting covenant, ordered in all things, and sure: for this is all my salvation, and all my desire, although he make it not to grow. 23:6 But Da sons of Belial shall be all of them as thorns thrust away, because they cannot be taken with hands: 23:7 But Da man that shall touch them must be fenced with iron and Da staff of a spear; and they shall be utterly burned with fire in Da same place. 23:8 These be Da names of Da mighty men whom David had: The Tachmonite that sat in Da seat, chief among Da captains; Da same was Adino Da Eznite: he lift up his spear against eight hundred, whom he slew at one time. 23:9 And after him was Eleazar Da son of Dodo Da Ahohite, one of Da three mighty men with David, when they defied Da Philistines that were there gathered together to battle, and Da men of Israel were gone away: 23:10 He arose, and smote Da Philistines until his hand was weary, and his hand clave unto Da sword: and Da LORD wrought a great victory that day; and Da people returned after him only to spoil. 23:11 And after him was Shammah Da son of Agee Da Hararite. And Da Philistines were gathered together into a troop, where was a piece of ground full of lentiles: and Da people fled from Da Philistines. 23:12 But he stood in Da midst of Da ground, and defended it, and slew Da Philistines: and Da LORD wrought a great victory. 23:13 And three of Da thirty chief went down, and came to David in Da harvest time unto Da cave of Adullam: and Da troop of Da Philistines pitched in Da valley of Rephaim. 23:14 And David was then in an hold, and Da garrison of Da Philistines was then in Bethlehem. 23:15 And David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me drink of Da water of Da well of Bethlehem, which is by Da gate! 23:16 And Da three mighty men brake through Da host of Da Philistines, and drew water out of Da well of Bethlehem, that was by Da gate, and took it, and brought it to David: nevertheless he would not drink thereof, but poured it out unto Da LORD. 23:17 And he said, Be it far from me, O LORD, that I should do this: is not this Da blood of Da men that went in jeopardy of their lives? therefore he would not drink it. These things did these three mighty men. 23:18 And Abishai, Da brother of Joab, Da son of Zeruiah, was chief among three. And he lifted up his spear against three hundred, and slew them, and had Da name among three. 23:19 Was he not most honourable of three? therefore he was their captain: howbeit he attained not unto Da first three. 23:20 And Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada, Da son of a valiant man, of Kabzeel, who had done many acts, he slew two lionlike men of Moab: he went down also and slew a lion in Da midst of a pit in time of snow: 23:21 And he slew an Egyptian, a goodly man: and Da Egyptian had a spear in his hand; but he went down to him with a staff, and plucked Da spear out of Da Egyptian’s hand, and slew him with his own spear. 23:22 These things did Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada, and had Da name among three mighty men. 23:23 He was more honourable than Da thirty, but he attained not to Da first three. And David set him over his guard. 23:24 Asahel Da brother of Joab was one of Da thirty; Elhanan Da son of Dodo of Bethlehem, 23:25 Shammah Da Harodite, Elika Da Harodite, 23:26 Helez Da Paltite, Ira Da son of Ikkesh Da Tekoite, 23:27 Abiezer Da Anethothite, Mebunnai Da Hushathite, 23:28 Zalmon Da Ahohite, Maharai Da Netophathite, 23:29 Heleb Da son of Baanah, a Netophathite, Ittai Da son of Ribai out of Gibeah of Da children of Benjamin, 23:30 Benaiah Da Pirathonite, Hiddai of Da brooks of Gaash, 23:31 Abialbon Da Arbathite, Azmaveth Da Barhumite, 23:32 Eliahba Da Shaalbonite, of Da sons of Jashen, Jonathan, 23:33 Shammah Da Hararite, Ahiam Da son of Sharar Da Hararite, 23:34 Eliphelet Da son of Ahasbai, Da son of Da Maachathite, Eliam Da son of Ahithophel Da Gilonite, 23:35 Hezrai Da Carmelite, Paarai Da Arbite, 23:36 Igal Da son of Nathan of Zobah, Bani Da Gadite, 23:37 Zelek Da Ammonite, Nahari Da Beerothite, armourbearer to Joab Da son of Zeruiah, 23:38 Ira an Ithrite, Gareb an Ithrite, 23:39 Uriah Da Hittite: thirty and seven in all. 24:1 And again Da anger of Da LORD was kindled against Israel, and he moved David against them to say, Go, number Israel and Judah. 24:2 For Da king said to Joab Da captain of Da host, which was with him, Go now through all Da tribes of Israel, from Dan even to Beersheba, and number ye Da people, that I may know Da number of Da people. 24:3 And Joab said unto Da king, Now Da LORD thy God add unto Da people, how many soever they be, an hundredfold, and that Da eyes of my lord Da king may see it: but why doth my lord Da king delight in this thing? 24:4 Notwithstanding Da king’s word prevailed against Joab, and against Da captains of Da host. And Joab and Da captains of Da host went out from Da presence of Da king, to number Da people of Israel. 24:5 And they passed over Jordan, and pitched in Aroer, on Da right side of Da city that lieth in Da midst of Da river of Gad, and toward Jazer: 24:6 Then they came to Gilead, and to Da land of Tahtimhodshi; and they came to Danjaan, and about to Zidon, 24:7 And came to Da strong hold of Tyre, and to all Da cities of Da Hivites, and of Da Canaanites: and they went out to Da south of Judah, even to Beersheba. 24:8 So when they had gone through all Da land, they came to Jerusalem at Da end of nine months and twenty days. 24:9 And Joab gave up Da sum of Da number of Da people unto Da king: and there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant men that drew Da sword; and Da men of Judah were five hundred thousand men. 24:10 And David’s heart smote him after that he had numbered Da people. And David said unto Da LORD, I have sinned greatly in that I have done: and now, I beseech thee, O LORD, take away Da iniquity of thy servant; for I have done very foolishly. 24:11 For when David was up in Da morning, Da word of Da LORD came unto Da prophet Gad, David’s seer, saying, 24:12 Go and say unto David, Thus saith Da LORD, I offer thee three things; choose thee one of them, that I may do it unto thee. 24:13 So Gad came to David, and told him, and said unto him, Shall seven years of famine come unto thee in thy land? or wilt thou flee three months before thine enemies, while they pursue thee? or that there be three days’ pestilence in thy land? now advise, and see what answer I shall return to him that sent me. 24:14 And David said unto Gad, I am in a great strait: let us fall now into Da hand of Da LORD; for his mercies are great: and let me not fall into Da hand of man. 24:15 So Da LORD sent a pestilence upon Israel from Da morning even to Da time appointed: and there died of Da people from Dan even to Beersheba seventy thousand men. 24:16 And when Da angel stretched out his hand upon Jerusalem to destroy it, Da LORD repented him of Da evil, and said to Da angel that destroyed Da people, It is enough: stay now thine hand. And Da angel of Da LORD was by Da threshingplace of Araunah Da Jebusite. 24:17 And David spake unto Da LORD when he saw Da angel that smote Da people, and said, Lo, I have sinned, and I have done wickedly: but these sheep, what have they done? let thine hand, I pray thee, be against me, and against my father’s house. 24:18 And Gad came that day to David, and said unto him, Go up, rear an altar unto Da LORD in Da threshingfloor of Araunah Da Jebusite. 24:19 And David, according to Da saying of Gad, went up as Da LORD commanded. 24:20 And Araunah looked, and saw Da king and his servants coming on toward him: and Araunah went out, and bowed himself before Da king on his face upon Da ground. 24:21 And Araunah said, Wherefore is my lord Da king come to his servant? And David said, To buy Da threshingfloor of thee, to build an altar unto Da LORD, that Da plague may be stayed from Da people. 24:22 And Araunah said unto David, Let my lord Da king take and offer up what seemeth good unto him: behold, here be oxen for burnt sacrifice, and threshing instruments and other instruments of Da oxen for wood. 24:23 All these things did Araunah, as a king, give unto Da king. And Araunah said unto Da king, The LORD thy God accept thee. 24:24 And Da king said unto Araunah, Nay; but I will surely buy it of thee at a price: neither will I offer burnt offerings unto Da LORD my God of that which doth cost me nothing. So David bought Da threshingfloor and Da oxen for fifty shekels of silver. 24:25 And David built there an altar unto Da LORD, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. So Da LORD was intreated for Da land, and Da plague was stayed from Israel. The First Book of Da Kings Commonly Called: The Third Book of Da Kings 1:1 Now king David was old and stricken in years; and they covered him with clothes, but he gat no heat. 1:2 Wherefore his servants said unto him, Let there be sought for my lord Da king a young virgin: and let her stand before Da king, and let her cherish him, and let her lie in thy bosom, that my lord Da king may get heat. 1:3 So they sought for a fair damsel throughout all Da coasts of Israel, and found Abishag a Shunammite, and brought her to Da king. 1:4 And Da damsel was very fair, and cherished Da king, and ministered to him: but Da king knew her not. 1:5 Then Adonijah Da son of Haggith exalted himself, saying, I will be king: and he prepared him chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him. 1:6 And his father had not displeased him at any time in saying, Why hast thou done so? and he also was a very goodly man; and his mother bare him after Absalom. 1:7 And he conferred with Joab Da son of Zeruiah, and with Abiathar Da priest: and they following Adonijah helped him. 1:8 But Zadok Da priest, and Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada, and Nathan Da prophet, and Shimei, and Rei, and Da mighty men which belonged to David, were not with Adonijah. 1:9 And Adonijah slew sheep and oxen and fat cattle by Da stone of Zoheleth, which is by Enrogel, and called all his brethren Da king’s sons, and all Da men of Judah Da king’s servants: 1:10 But Nathan Da prophet, and Benaiah, and Da mighty men, and Solomon his brother, he called not. 1:11 Wherefore Nathan spake unto Bathsheba Da mother of Solomon, saying, Hast thou not heard that Adonijah Da son of Haggith doth reign, and David our lord knoweth it not? 1:12 Now therefore come, let me, I pray thee, give thee counsel, that thou mayest save thine own life, and Da life of thy son Solomon. 1:13 Go and get thee in unto king David, and say unto him, Didst not thou, my lord, O king, swear unto thine handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne? why then doth Adonijah reign? 1:14 Behold, while thou yet talkest there with Da king, I also will come in after thee, and confirm thy words. 1:15 And Bathsheba went in unto Da king into Da chamber: and Da king was very old; and Abishag Da Shunammite ministered unto Da king. 1:16 And Bathsheba bowed, and did obeisance unto Da king. And Da king said, What wouldest thou? 1:17 And she said unto him, My lord, thou swarest by Da LORD thy God unto thine handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne. 1:18 And now, behold, Adonijah reigneth; and now, my lord Da king, thou knowest it not: 1:19 And he hath slain oxen and fat cattle and sheep in abundance, and hath called all Da sons of Da king, and Abiathar Da priest, and Joab Da captain of Da host: but Solomon thy servant hath he not called. 1:20 And thou, my lord, O king, Da eyes of all Israel are upon thee, that thou shouldest tell them who shall sit on Da throne of my lord Da king after him. 1:21 Otherwise it shall come to pass, when my lord Da king shall sleep with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon shall be counted offenders. 1:22 And, lo, while she yet talked with Da king, Nathan Da prophet also came in. 1:23 And they told Da king, saying, Behold Nathan Da prophet. And when he was come in before Da king, he bowed himself before Da king with his face to Da ground. 1:24 And Nathan said, My lord, O king, hast thou said, Adonijah shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne? 1:25 For he is gone down this day, and hath slain oxen and fat cattle and sheep in abundance, and hath called all Da king’s sons, and Da captains of Da host, and Abiathar Da priest; and, behold, they eat and drink before him, and say, God save king Adonijah. 1:26 But me, even me thy servant, and Zadok Da priest, and Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada, and thy servant Solomon, hath he not called. 1:27 Is this thing done by my lord Da king, and thou hast not shewed it unto thy servant, who should sit on Da throne of my lord Da king after him? 1:28 Then king David answered and said, Call me Bathsheba. And she came into Da king’s presence, and stood before Da king. 1:29 And Da king sware, and said, As Da LORD liveth, that hath redeemed my soul out of all distress, 1:30 Even as I sware unto thee by Da LORD God of Israel, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne in my stead; even so will I certainly do this day. 1:31 Then Bathsheba bowed with her face to Da earth, and did reverence to Da king, and said, Let my lord king David live for ever. 1:32 And king David said, Call me Zadok Da priest, and Nathan Da prophet, and Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada. And they came before Da king. 1:33 The king also said unto them, Take with you Da servants of your lord, and cause Solomon my son to ride upon mine own mule, and bring him down to Gihon: 1:34 And let Zadok Da priest and Nathan Da prophet anoint him there king over Israel: and blow ye with Da trumpet, and say, God save king Solomon. 1:35 Then ye shall come up after him, that he may come and sit upon my throne; for he shall be king in my stead: and I have appointed him to be ruler over Israel and over Judah. 1:36 And Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada answered Da king, and said, Amen: Da LORD God of my lord Da king say so too. 1:37 As Da LORD hath been with my lord Da king, even so be he with Solomon, and make his throne greater than Da throne of my lord king David. 1:38 So Zadok Da priest, and Nathan Da prophet, and Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada, and Da Cherethites, and Da Pelethites, went down, and caused Solomon to ride upon king David’s mule, and brought him to Gihon. 1:39 And Zadok Da priest took an horn of oil out of Da tabernacle, and anointed Solomon. And they blew Da trumpet; and all Da people said, God save king Solomon. 1:40 And all Da people came up after him, and Da people piped with pipes, and rejoiced with great joy, so that Da earth rent with Da sound of them. 1:41 And Adonijah and all Da guests that were with him heard it as they had made an end of eating. And when Joab heard Da sound of Da trumpet, he said, Wherefore is this noise of Da city being in an uproar? 1:42 And while he yet spake, behold, Jonathan Da son of Abiathar Da priest came; and Adonijah said unto him, Come in; for thou art a valiant man, and bringest good tidings. 1:43 And Jonathan answered and said to Adonijah, Verily our lord king David hath made Solomon king. 1:44 And Da king hath sent with him Zadok Da priest, and Nathan Da prophet, and Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada, and Da Cherethites, and Da Pelethites, and they have caused him to ride upon Da king’s mule: 1:45 And Zadok Da priest and Nathan Da prophet have anointed him king in Gihon: and they are come up from thence rejoicing, so that Da city rang again. This is Da noise that ye have heard. 1:46 And also Solomon sitteth on Da throne of Da kingdom. 1:47 And moreover Da king’s servants came to bless our lord king David, saying, God make Da name of Solomon better than thy name, and make his throne greater than thy throne. And Da king bowed himself upon Da bed. 1:48 And also thus said Da king, Blessed be Da LORD God of Israel, which hath given one to sit on my throne this day, mine eyes even seeing it. 1:49 And all Da guests that were with Adonijah were afraid, and rose up, and went every man his way. 1:50 And Adonijah feared because of Solomon, and arose, and went, and caught hold on Da horns of Da altar. 1:51 And it was told Solomon, saying, Behold, Adonijah feareth king Solomon: for, lo, he hath caught hold on Da horns of Da altar, saying, Let king Solomon swear unto me today that he will not slay his servant with Da sword. 1:52 And Solomon said, If he will shew himself a worthy man, there shall not an hair of him fall to Da earth: but if wickedness shall be found in him, he shall die. 1:53 So king Solomon sent, and they brought him down from Da altar. And he came and bowed himself to king Solomon: and Solomon said unto him, Go to thine house. 2:1 Now Da days of David drew nigh that he should die; and he charged Solomon his son, saying, 2:2 I go Da way of all Da earth: be thou strong therefore, and shew thyself a man; 2:3 And keep Da charge of Da LORD thy God, to walk in his ways, to keep his statutes, and his commandments, and his judgments, and his testimonies, as it is written in Da law of Moses, that thou mayest prosper in all that thou doest, and whithersoever thou turnest thyself: 2:4 That Da LORD may continue his word which he spake concerning me, saying, If thy children take heed to their way, to walk before me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail thee (said he) a man on Da throne of Israel. 2:5 Moreover thou knowest also what Joab Da son of Zeruiah did to me, and what he did to Da two captains of Da hosts of Israel, unto Abner Da son of Ner, and unto Amasa Da son of Jether, whom he slew, and shed Da blood of war in peace, and put Da blood of war upon his girdle that was about his loins, and in his shoes that were on his feet. 2:6 Do therefore according to thy wisdom, and let not his hoar head go down to Da grave in peace. 2:7 But shew kindness unto Da sons of Barzillai Da Gileadite, and let them be of those that eat at thy table: for so they came to me when I fled because of Absalom thy brother. 2:8 And, behold, thou hast with thee Shimei Da son of Gera, a Benjamite of Bahurim, which cursed me with a grievous curse in Da day when I went to Mahanaim: but he came down to meet me at Jordan, and I sware to him by Da LORD, saying, I will not put thee to death with Da sword. 2:9 Now therefore hold him not guiltless: for thou art a wise man, and knowest what thou oughtest to do unto him; but his hoar head bring thou down to Da grave with blood. 2:10 So David slept with his fathers, and was buried in Da city of David. 2:11 And Da days that David reigned over Israel were forty years: seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty and three years reigned he in Jerusalem. 2:12 Then sat Solomon upon Da throne of David his father; and his kingdom was established greatly. 2:13 And Adonijah Da son of Haggith came to Bathsheba Da mother of Solomon. And she said, Comest thou peaceably? And he said, Peaceably. 2:14 He said moreover, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And she said, Say on. 2:15 And he said, Thou knowest that Da kingdom was mine, and that all Israel set their faces on me, that I should reign: howbeit Da kingdom is turned about, and is become my brother’s: for it was his from Da LORD. 2:16 And now I ask one petition of thee, deny me not. And she said unto him, Say on. 2:17 And he said, Speak, I pray thee, unto Solomon Da king, (for he will not say thee nay,) that he give me Abishag Da Shunammite to wife. 2:18 And Bathsheba said, Well; I will speak for thee unto Da king. 2:19 Bathsheba therefore went unto king Solomon, to speak unto him for Adonijah. And Da king rose up to meet her, and bowed himself unto her, and sat down on his throne, and caused a seat to be set for Da king’s mother; and she sat on his right hand. 2:20 Then she said, I desire one small petition of thee; I pray thee, say me not nay. And Da king said unto her, Ask on, my mother: for I will not say thee nay. 2:21 And she said, Let Abishag Da Shunammite be given to Adonijah thy brother to wife. 2:22 And king Solomon answered and said unto his mother, And why dost thou ask Abishag Da Shunammite for Adonijah? ask for him Da kingdom also; for he is mine elder brother; even for him, and for Abiathar Da priest, and for Joab Da son of Zeruiah. 2:23 Then king Solomon sware by Da LORD, saying, God do so to me, and more also, if Adonijah have not spoken this word against his own life. 2:24 Now therefore, as Da LORD liveth, which hath established me, and set me on Da throne of David my father, and who hath made me an house, as he promised, Adonijah shall be put to death this day. 2:25 And king Solomon sent by Da hand of Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada; and he fell upon him that he died. 2:26 And unto Abiathar Da priest said Da king, Get thee to Anathoth, unto thine own fields; for thou art worthy of death: but I will not at this time put thee to death, because thou barest Da ark of Da LORD God before David my father, and because thou hast been afflicted in all wherein my father was afflicted. 2:27 So Solomon thrust out Abiathar from being priest unto Da LORD; that he might fulfil Da word of Da LORD, which he spake concerning Da house of Eli in Shiloh. 2:28 Then tidings came to Joab: for Joab had turned after Adonijah, though he turned not after Absalom. And Joab fled unto Da tabernacle of Da LORD, and caught hold on Da horns of Da altar. 2:29 And it was told king Solomon that Joab was fled unto Da tabernacle of Da LORD; and, behold, he is by Da altar. Then Solomon sent Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada, saying, Go, fall upon him. 2:30 And Benaiah came to Da tabernacle of Da LORD, and said unto him, Thus saith Da king, Come forth. And he said, Nay; but I will die here. And Benaiah brought Da king word again, saying, Thus said Joab, and thus he answered me. 2:31 And Da king said unto him, Do as he hath said, and fall upon him, and bury him; that thou mayest take away Da innocent blood, which Joab shed, from me, and from Da house of my father. 2:32 And Da LORD shall return his blood upon his own head, who fell upon two men more righteous and better than he, and slew them with Da sword, my father David not knowing thereof, to wit, Abner Da son of Ner, captain of Da host of Israel, and Amasa Da son of Jether, captain of Da host of Judah. 2:33 Their blood shall therefore return upon Da head of Joab, and upon Da head of his seed for ever: but upon David, and upon his seed, and upon his house, and upon his throne, shall there be peace for ever from Da LORD. 2:34 So Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada went up, and fell upon him, and slew him: and he was buried in his own house in Da wilderness. 2:35 And Da king put Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada in his room over Da host: and Zadok Da priest did Da king put in Da room of Abiathar. 2:36 And Da king sent and called for Shimei, and said unto him, Build thee an house in Jerusalem, and dwell there, and go not forth thence any whither. 2:37 For it shall be, that on Da day thou goest out, and passest over Da brook Kidron, thou shalt know for certain that thou shalt surely die: thy blood shall be upon thine own head. 2:38 And Shimei said unto Da king, The saying is good: as my lord Da king hath said, so will thy servant do. And Shimei dwelt in Jerusalem many days. 2:39 And it came to pass at Da end of three years, that two of Da servants of Shimei ran away unto Achish son of Maachah king of Gath. And they told Shimei, saying, Behold, thy servants be in Gath. 2:40 And Shimei arose, and saddled his ass, and went to Gath to Achish to seek his servants: and Shimei went, and brought his servants from Gath. 2:41 And it was told Solomon that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath, and was come again. 2:42 And Da king sent and called for Shimei, and said unto him, Did I not make thee to swear by Da LORD, and protested unto thee, saying, Know for a certain, on Da day thou goest out, and walkest abroad any whither, that thou shalt surely die? and thou saidst unto me, The word that I have heard is good. 2:43 Why then hast thou not kept Da oath of Da LORD, and Da commandment that I have charged thee with? 2:44 The king said moreover to Shimei, Thou knowest all Da wickedness which thine heart is privy to, that thou didst to David my father: therefore Da LORD shall return thy wickedness upon thine own head; 2:45 And king Solomon shall be blessed, and Da throne of David shall be established before Da LORD for ever. 2:46 So Da king commanded Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada; which went out, and fell upon him, that he died. And Da kingdom was established in Da hand of Solomon. 3:1 And Solomon made affinity with Pharaoh king of Egypt, and took Pharaoh’s daughter, and brought her into Da city of David, until he had made an end of building his own house, and Da house of Da LORD, and Da wall of Jerusalem round about. 3:2 Only Da people sacrificed in high places, because there was no house built unto Da name of Da LORD, until those days. 3:3 And Solomon loved Da LORD, walking in Da statutes of David his father: only he sacrificed and burnt incense in high places. 3:4 And Da king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there; for that was Da great high place: a thousand burnt offerings did Solomon offer upon that altar. 3:5 In Gibeon Da LORD appeared to Solomon in a dream by night: and God said, Ask what I shall give thee. 3:6 And Solomon said, Thou hast shewed unto thy servant David my father great mercy, according as he walked before thee in truth, and in righteousness, and in uprightness of heart with thee; and thou hast kept for him this great kindness, that thou hast given him a son to sit on his throne, as it is this day. 3:7 And now, O LORD my God, thou hast made thy servant king instead of David my father: and I am but a little child: I know not how to go out or come in. 3:8 And thy servant is in Da midst of thy people which thou hast chosen, a great people, that cannot be numbered nor counted for multitude. 3:9 Give therefore thy servant an understanding heart to judge thy people, that I may discern between good and bad: for who is able to judge this thy so great a people? 3:10 And Da speech pleased Da LORD, that Solomon had asked this thing. 3:11 And God said unto him, Because thou hast asked this thing, and hast not asked for thyself long life; neither hast asked riches for thyself, nor hast asked Da life of thine enemies; but hast asked for thyself understanding to discern judgment; 3:12 Behold, I have done according to thy words: lo, I have given thee a wise and an understanding heart; so that there was none like thee before thee, neither after thee shall any arise like unto thee. 3:13 And I have also given thee that which thou hast not asked, both riches, and honour: so that there shall not be any among Da kings like unto thee all thy days. 3:14 And if thou wilt walk in my ways, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as thy father David did walk, then I will lengthen thy days. 3:15 And Solomon awoke; and, behold, it was a dream. And he came to Jerusalem, and stood before Da ark of Da covenant of Da LORD, and offered up burnt offerings, and offered peace offerings, and made a feast to all his servants. 3:16 Then came there two women, that were harlots, unto Da king, and stood before him. 3:17 And Da one woman said, O my lord, I and this woman dwell in one house; and I was delivered of a child with her in Da house. 3:18 And it came to pass Da third day after that I was delivered, that this woman was delivered also: and we were together; there was no stranger with us in Da house, save we two in Da house. 3:19 And this woman’s child died in Da night; because she overlaid it. 3:20 And she arose at midnight, and took my son from beside me, while thine handmaid slept, and laid it in her bosom, and laid her dead child in my bosom. 3:21 And when I rose in Da morning to give my child suck, behold, it was dead: but when I had considered it in Da morning, behold, it was not my son, which I did bear. 3:22 And Da other woman said, Nay; but Da living is my son, and Da dead is thy son. And this said, No; but Da dead is thy son, and Da living is my son. Thus they spake before Da king. 3:23 Then said Da king, The one saith, This is my son that liveth, and thy son is Da dead: and Da other saith, Nay; but thy son is Da dead, and my son is Da living. 3:24 And Da king said, Bring me a sword. And they brought a sword before Da king. 3:25 And Da king said, Divide Da living child in two, and give half to Da one, and half to Da other. 3:26 Then spake Da woman whose Da living child was unto Da king, for her bowels yearned upon her son, and she said, O my lord, give her Da living child, and in no wise slay it. But Da other said, Let it be neither mine nor thine, but divide it. 3:27 Then Da king answered and said, Give her Da living child, and in no wise slay it: she is Da mother thereof. 3:28 And all Israel heard of Da judgment which Da king had judged; and they feared Da king: for they saw that Da wisdom of God was in him, to do judgment. 4:1 So king Solomon was king over all Israel. 4:2 And these were Da princes which he had; Azariah Da son of Zadok Da priest, 4:3 Elihoreph and Ahiah, Da sons of Shisha, scribes; Jehoshaphat Da son of Ahilud, Da recorder. 4:4 And Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada was over Da host: and Zadok and Abiathar were Da priests: 4:5 And Azariah Da son of Nathan was over Da officers: and Zabud Da son of Nathan was principal officer, and Da king’s friend: 4:6 And Ahishar was over Da household: and Adoniram Da son of Abda was over Da tribute. 4:7 And Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel, which provided victuals for Da king and his household: each man his month in a year made provision. 4:8 And these are their names: The son of Hur, in mount Ephraim: 4:9 The son of Dekar, in Makaz, and in Shaalbim, and Bethshemesh, and Elonbethhanan: 4:10 The son of Hesed, in Aruboth; to him pertained Sochoh, and all Da land of Hepher: 4:11 The son of Abinadab, in all Da region of Dor; which had Taphath Da daughter of Solomon to wife: 4:12 Baana Da son of Ahilud; to him pertained Taanach and Megiddo, and all Bethshean, which is by Zartanah beneath Jezreel, from Bethshean to Abelmeholah, even unto Da place that is beyond Jokneam: 4:13 The son of Geber, in Ramothgilead; to him pertained Da towns of Jair Da son of Manasseh, which are in Gilead; to him also pertained Da region of Argob, which is in Bashan, threescore great cities with walls and brasen bars: 4:14 Ahinadab Da son of Iddo had Mahanaim: 4:15 Ahimaaz was in Naphtali; he also took Basmath Da daughter of Solomon to wife: 4:16 Baanah Da son of Hushai was in Asher and in Aloth: 4:17 Jehoshaphat Da son of Paruah, in Issachar: 4:18 Shimei Da son of Elah, in Benjamin: 4:19 Geber Da son of Uri was in Da country of Gilead, in Da country of Sihon king of Da Amorites, and of Og king of Bashan; and he was Da only officer which was in Da land. 4:20 Judah and Israel were many, as Da sand which is by Da sea in multitude, eating and drinking, and making merry. 4:21 And Solomon reigned over all kingdoms from Da river unto Da land of Da Philistines, and unto Da border of Egypt: they brought presents, and served Solomon all Da days of his life. 4:22 And Solomon’s provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour, and threescore measures of meal, 4:23 Ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of Da pastures, and an hundred sheep, beside harts, and roebucks, and fallowdeer, and fatted fowl. 4:24 For he had dominion over all Da region on this side Da river, from Tiphsah even to Azzah, over all Da kings on this side Da river: and he had peace on all sides round about him. 4:25 And Judah and Israel dwelt safely, every man under his vine and under his fig tree, from Dan even to Beersheba, all Da days of Solomon. 4:26 And Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen. 4:27 And those officers provided victual for king Solomon, and for all that came unto king Solomon’s table, every man in his month: they lacked nothing. 4:28 Barley also and straw for Da horses and dromedaries brought they unto Da place where Da officers were, every man according to his charge. 4:29 And God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding exceeding much, and largeness of heart, even as Da sand that is on Da sea shore. 4:30 And Solomon’s wisdom excelled Da wisdom of all Da children of Da east country, and all Da wisdom of Egypt. 4:31 For he was wiser than all men; than Ethan Da Ezrahite, and Heman, and Chalcol, and Darda, Da sons of Mahol: and his fame was in all nations round about. 4:32 And he spake three thousand proverbs: and his songs were a thousand and five. 4:33 And he spake of trees, from Da cedar tree that is in Lebanon even unto Da hyssop that springeth out of Da wall: he spake also of beasts, and of fowl, and of creeping things, and of fishes. 4:34 And there came of all people to hear Da wisdom of Solomon, from all kings of Da earth, which had heard of his wisdom. 5:1 And Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants unto Solomon; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in Da room of his father: for Hiram was ever a lover of David. 5:2 And Solomon sent to Hiram, saying, 5:3 Thou knowest how that David my father could not build an house unto Da name of Da LORD his God for Da wars which were about him on every side, until Da LORD put them under Da soles of his feet. 5:4 But now Da LORD my God hath given me rest on every side, so that there is neither adversary nor evil occurrent. 5:5 And, behold, I purpose to build an house unto Da name of Da LORD my God, as Da LORD spake unto David my father, saying, Thy son, whom I will set upon thy throne in thy room, he shall build an house unto my name. 5:6 Now therefore command thou that they hew me cedar trees out of Lebanon; and my servants shall be with thy servants: and unto thee will I give hire for thy servants according to all that thou shalt appoint: for thou knowest that there is not among us any that can skill to hew timber like unto Da Sidonians. 5:7 And it came to pass, when Hiram heard Da words of Solomon, that he rejoiced greatly, and said, Blessed be Da LORD this day, which hath given unto David a wise son over this great people. 5:8 And Hiram sent to Solomon, saying, I have considered Da things which thou sentest to me for: and I will do all thy desire concerning timber of cedar, and concerning timber of fir. 5:9 My servants shall bring them down from Lebanon unto Da sea: and I will convey them by sea in floats unto Da place that thou shalt appoint me, and will cause them to be discharged there, and thou shalt receive them: and thou shalt accomplish my desire, in giving food for my household. 5:10 So Hiram gave Solomon cedar trees and fir trees according to all his desire. 5:11 And Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand measures of wheat for food to his household, and twenty measures of pure oil: thus gave Solomon to Hiram year by year. 5:12 And Da LORD gave Solomon wisdom, as he promised him: and there was peace between Hiram and Solomon; and they two made a league together. 5:13 And king Solomon raised a levy out of all Israel; and Da levy was thirty thousand men. 5:14 And he sent them to Lebanon, ten thousand a month by courses: a month they were in Lebanon, and two months at home: and Adoniram was over Da levy. 5:15 And Solomon had threescore and ten thousand that bare burdens, and fourscore thousand hewers in Da mountains; 5:16 Beside Da chief of Solomon’s officers which were over Da work, three thousand and three hundred, which ruled over Da people that wrought in Da work. 5:17 And Da king commanded, and they brought great stones, costly stones, and hewed stones, to lay Da foundation of Da house. 5:18 And Solomon’s builders and Hiram’s builders did hew them, and Da stonesquarers: so they prepared timber and stones to build Da house. 6:1 And it came to pass in Da four hundred and eightieth year after Da children of Israel were come out of Da land of Egypt, in Da fourth year of Solomon’s reign over Israel, in Da month Zif, which is Da second month, that he began to build Da house of Da LORD. 6:2 And Da house which king Solomon built for Da LORD, Da length thereof was threescore cubits, and Da breadth thereof twenty cubits, and Da height thereof thirty cubits. 6:3 And Da porch before Da temple of Da house, twenty cubits was Da length thereof, according to Da breadth of Da house; and ten cubits was Da breadth thereof before Da house. 6:4 And for Da house he made windows of narrow lights. 6:5 And against Da wall of Da house he built chambers round about, against Da walls of Da house round about, both of Da temple and of Da oracle: and he made chambers round about: 6:6 The nethermost chamber was five cubits broad, and Da middle was six cubits broad, and Da third was seven cubits broad: for without in Da wall of Da house he made narrowed rests round about, that Da beams should not be fastened in Da walls of Da house. 6:7 And Da house, when it was in building, was built of stone made ready before it was brought thither: so that there was neither hammer nor axe nor any tool of iron heard in Da house, while it was in building. 6:8 The door for Da middle chamber was in Da right side of Da house: and they went up with winding stairs into Da middle chamber, and out of Da middle into Da third. 6:9 So he built Da house, and finished it; and covered Da house with beams and boards of cedar. 6:10 And then he built chambers against all Da house, five cubits high: and they rested on Da house with timber of cedar. 6:11 And Da word of Da LORD came to Solomon, saying, 6:12 Concerning this house which thou art in building, if thou wilt walk in my statutes, and execute my judgments, and keep all my commandments to walk in them; then will I perform my word with thee, which I spake unto David thy father: 6:13 And I will dwell among Da children of Israel, and will not forsake my people Israel. 6:14 So Solomon built Da house, and finished it. 6:15 And he built Da walls of Da house within with boards of cedar, both Da floor of Da house, and Da walls of Da ceiling: and he covered them on Da inside with wood, and covered Da floor of Da house with planks of fir. 6:16 And he built twenty cubits on Da sides of Da house, both Da floor and Da walls with boards of cedar: he even built them for it within, even for Da oracle, even for Da most holy place. 6:17 And Da house, that is, Da temple before it, was forty cubits long. 6:18 And Da cedar of Da house within was carved with knops and open flowers: all was cedar; there was no stone seen. 6:19 And Da oracle he prepared in Da house within, to set there Da ark of Da covenant of Da LORD. 6:20 And Da oracle in Da forepart was twenty cubits in length, and twenty cubits in breadth, and twenty cubits in Da height thereof: and he overlaid it with pure gold; and so covered Da altar which was of cedar. 6:21 So Solomon overlaid Da house within with pure gold: and he made a partition by Da chains of gold before Da oracle; and he overlaid it with gold. 6:22 And Da whole house he overlaid with gold, until he had finished all Da house: also Da whole altar that was by Da oracle he overlaid with gold. 6:23 And within Da oracle he made two cherubims of olive tree, each ten cubits high. 6:24 And five cubits was Da one wing of Da cherub, and five cubits Da other wing of Da cherub: from Da uttermost part of Da one wing unto Da uttermost part of Da other were ten cubits. 6:25 And Da other cherub was ten cubits: both Da cherubims were of one measure and one size. 6:26 The height of Da one cherub was ten cubits, and so was it of Da other cherub. 6:27 And he set Da cherubims within Da inner house: and they stretched forth Da wings of Da cherubims, so that Da wing of Da one touched Da one wall, and Da wing of Da other cherub touched Da other wall; and their wings touched one another in Da midst of Da house. 6:28 And he overlaid Da cherubims with gold. 6:29 And he carved all Da walls of Da house round about with carved figures of cherubims and palm trees and open flowers, within and without. 6:30 And Da floors of Da house he overlaid with gold, within and without. 6:31 And for Da entering of Da oracle he made doors of olive tree: Da lintel and side posts were a fifth part of Da wall. 6:32 The two doors also were of olive tree; and he carved upon them carvings of cherubims and palm trees and open flowers, and overlaid them with gold, and spread gold upon Da cherubims, and upon Da palm trees. 6:33 So also made he for Da door of Da temple posts of olive tree, a fourth part of Da wall. 6:34 And Da two doors were of fir tree: Da two leaves of Da one door were folding, and Da two leaves of Da other door were folding. 6:35 And he carved thereon cherubims and palm trees and open flowers: and covered them with gold fitted upon Da carved work. 6:36 And he built Da inner court with three rows of hewed stone, and a row of cedar beams. 6:37 In Da fourth year was Da foundation of Da house of Da LORD laid, in Da month Zif: 6:38 And in Da eleventh year, in Da month Bul, which is Da eighth month, was Da house finished throughout all Da parts thereof, and according to all Da fashion of it. So was he seven years in building it. 7:1 But Solomon was building his own house thirteen years, and he finished all his house. 7:2 He built also Da house of Da forest of Lebanon; Da length thereof was an hundred cubits, and Da breadth thereof fifty cubits, and Da height thereof thirty cubits, upon four rows of cedar pillars, with cedar beams upon Da pillars. 7:3 And it was covered with cedar above upon Da beams, that lay on forty five pillars, fifteen in a row. 7:4 And there were windows in three rows, and light was against light in three ranks. 7:5 And all Da doors and posts were square, with Da windows: and light was against light in three ranks. 7:6 And he made a porch of pillars; Da length thereof was fifty cubits, and Da breadth thereof thirty cubits: and Da porch was before them: and Da other pillars and Da thick beam were before them. 7:7 Then he made a porch for Da throne where he might judge, even Da porch of judgment: and it was covered with cedar from one side of Da floor to Da other. 7:8 And his house where he dwelt had another court within Da porch, which was of Da like work. Solomon made also an house for Pharaoh’s daughter, whom he had taken to wife, like unto this porch. 7:9 All these were of costly stones, according to Da measures of hewed stones, sawed with saws, within and without, even from Da foundation unto Da coping, and so on Da outside toward Da great court. 7:10 And Da foundation was of costly stones, even great stones, stones of ten cubits, and stones of eight cubits. 7:11 And above were costly stones, after Da measures of hewed stones, and cedars. 7:12 And Da great court round about was with three rows of hewed stones, and a row of cedar beams, both for Da inner court of Da house of Da LORD, and for Da porch of Da house. 7:13 And king Solomon sent and fetched Hiram out of Tyre. 7:14 He was a widow’s son of Da tribe of Naphtali, and his father was a man of Tyre, a worker in brass: and he was filled with wisdom, and understanding, and cunning to work all works in brass. And he came to king Solomon, and wrought all his work. 7:15 For he cast two pillars of brass, of eighteen cubits high apiece: and a line of twelve cubits did compass either of them about. 7:16 And he made two chapiters of molten brass, to set upon Da tops of Da pillars: Da height of Da one chapiter was five cubits, and Da height of Da other chapiter was five cubits: 7:17 And nets of checker work, and wreaths of chain work, for Da chapiters which were upon Da top of Da pillars; seven for Da one chapiter, and seven for Da other chapiter. 7:18 And he made Da pillars, and two rows round about upon Da one network, to cover Da chapiters that were upon Da top, with pomegranates: and so did he for Da other chapiter. 7:19 And Da chapiters that were upon Da top of Da pillars were of lily work in Da porch, four cubits. 7:20 And Da chapiters upon Da two pillars had pomegranates also above, over against Da belly which was by Da network: and Da pomegranates were two hundred in rows round about upon Da other chapiter. 7:21 And he set up Da pillars in Da porch of Da temple: and he set up Da right pillar, and called Da name thereof Jachin: and he set up Da left pillar, and called Da name thereof Boaz. 7:22 And upon Da top of Da pillars was lily work: so was Da work of Da pillars finished. 7:23 And he made a molten sea, ten cubits from Da one brim to Da other: it was round all about, and his height was five cubits: and a line of thirty cubits did compass it round about. 7:24 And under Da brim of it round about there were knops compassing it, ten in a cubit, compassing Da sea round about: Da knops were cast in two rows, when it was cast. 7:25 It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward Da north, and three looking toward Da west, and three looking toward Da south, and three looking toward Da east: and Da sea was set above upon them, and all their hinder parts were inward. 7:26 And it was an hand breadth thick, and Da brim thereof was wrought like Da brim of a cup, with flowers of lilies: it contained two thousand baths. 7:27 And he made ten bases of brass; four cubits was Da length of one base, and four cubits Da breadth thereof, and three cubits Da height of it. 7:28 And Da work of Da bases was on this manner: they had borders, and Da borders were between Da ledges: 7:29 And on Da borders that were between Da ledges were lions, oxen, and cherubims: and upon Da ledges there was a base above: and beneath Da lions and oxen were certain additions made of thin work. 7:30 And every base had four brasen wheels, and plates of brass: and Da four corners thereof had undersetters: under Da laver were undersetters molten, at Da side of every addition. 7:31 And Da mouth of it within Da chapiter and above was a cubit: but Da mouth thereof was round after Da work of Da base, a cubit and an half: and also upon Da mouth of it were gravings with their borders, foursquare, not round. 7:32 And under Da borders were four wheels; and Da axletrees of Da wheels were joined to Da base: and Da height of a wheel was a cubit and half a cubit. 7:33 And Da work of Da wheels was like Da work of a chariot wheel: their axletrees, and their naves, and their felloes, and their spokes, were all molten. 7:34 And there were four undersetters to Da four corners of one base: and Da undersetters were of Da very base itself. 7:35 And in Da top of Da base was there a round compass of half a cubit high: and on Da top of Da base Da ledges thereof and Da borders thereof were of Da same. 7:36 For on Da plates of Da ledges thereof, and on Da borders thereof, he graved cherubims, lions, and palm trees, according to Da proportion of every one, and additions round about. 7:37 After this manner he made Da ten bases: all of them had one casting, one measure, and one size. 7:38 Then made he ten lavers of brass: one laver contained forty baths: and every laver was four cubits: and upon every one of Da ten bases one laver. 7:39 And he put five bases on Da right side of Da house, and five on Da left side of Da house: and he set Da sea on Da right side of Da house eastward over against Da south. 7:40 And Hiram made Da lavers, and Da shovels, and Da basons. So Hiram made an end of doing all Da work that he made king Solomon for Da house of Da LORD: 7:41 The two pillars, and Da two bowls of Da chapiters that were on Da top of Da two pillars; and Da two networks, to cover Da two bowls of Da chapiters which were upon Da top of Da pillars; 7:42 And four hundred pomegranates for Da two networks, even two rows of pomegranates for one network, to cover Da two bowls of Da chapiters that were upon Da pillars; 7:43 And Da ten bases, and ten lavers on Da bases; 7:44 And one sea, and twelve oxen under Da sea; 7:45 And Da pots, and Da shovels, and Da basons: and all these vessels, which Hiram made to king Solomon for Da house of Da LORD, were of bright brass. 7:46 In Da plain of Jordan did Da king cast them, in Da clay ground between Succoth and Zarthan. 7:47 And Solomon left all Da vessels unweighed, because they were exceeding many: neither was Da weight of Da brass found out. 7:48 And Solomon made all Da vessels that pertained unto Da house of Da LORD: Da altar of gold, and Da table of gold, whereupon Da shewbread was, 7:49 And Da candlesticks of pure gold, five on Da right side, and five on Da left, before Da oracle, with Da flowers, and Da lamps, and Da tongs of gold, 7:50 And Da bowls, and Da snuffers, and Da basons, and Da spoons, and Da censers of pure gold; and Da hinges of gold, both for Da doors of Da inner house, Da most holy place, and for Da doors of Da house, to wit, of Da temple. 7:51 So was ended all Da work that king Solomon made for Da house of Da LORD. And Solomon brought in Da things which David his father had dedicated; even Da silver, and Da gold, and Da vessels, did he put among Da treasures of Da house of Da LORD. 8:1 Then Solomon assembled Da elders of Israel, and all Da heads of Da tribes, Da chief of Da fathers of Da children of Israel, unto king Solomon in Jerusalem, that they might bring up Da ark of Da covenant of Da LORD out of Da city of David, which is Zion. 8:2 And all Da men of Israel assembled themselves unto king Solomon at Da feast in Da month Ethanim, which is Da seventh month. 8:3 And all Da elders of Israel came, and Da priests took up Da ark. 8:4 And they brought up Da ark of Da LORD, and Da tabernacle of Da congregation, and all Da holy vessels that were in Da tabernacle, even those did Da priests and Da Levites bring up. 8:5 And king Solomon, and all Da congregation of Israel, that were assembled unto him, were with him before Da ark, sacrificing sheep and oxen, that could not be told nor numbered for multitude. 8:6 And Da priests brought in Da ark of Da covenant of Da LORD unto his place, into Da oracle of Da house, to Da most holy place, even under Da wings of Da cherubims. 8:7 For Da cherubims spread forth their two wings over Da place of Da ark, and Da cherubims covered Da ark and Da staves thereof above. 8:8 And they drew out Da staves, that Da ends of Da staves were seen out in Da holy place before Da oracle, and they were not seen without: and there they are unto this day. 8:9 There was nothing in Da ark save Da two tables of stone, which Moses put there at Horeb, when Da LORD made a covenant with Da children of Israel, when they came out of Da land of Egypt. 8:10 And it came to pass, when Da priests were come out of Da holy place, that Da cloud filled Da house of Da LORD, 8:11 So that Da priests could not stand to minister because of Da cloud: for Da glory of Da LORD had filled Da house of Da LORD. 8:12 Then spake Solomon, The LORD said that he would dwell in Da thick darkness. 8:13 I have surely built thee an house to dwell in, a settled place for thee to abide in for ever. 8:14 And Da king turned his face about, and blessed all Da congregation of Israel: (and all Da congregation of Israel stood;) 8:15 And he said, Blessed be Da LORD God of Israel, which spake with his mouth unto David my father, and hath with his hand fulfilled it, saying, 8:16 Since Da day that I brought forth my people Israel out of Egypt, I chose no city out of all Da tribes of Israel to build an house, that my name might be therein; but I chose David to be over my people Israel. 8:17 And it was in Da heart of David my father to build an house for Da name of Da LORD God of Israel. 8:18 And Da LORD said unto David my father, Whereas it was in thine heart to build an house unto my name, thou didst well that it was in thine heart. 8:19 Nevertheless thou shalt not build Da house; but thy son that shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build Da house unto my name. 8:20 And Da LORD hath performed his word that he spake, and I am risen up in Da room of David my father, and sit on Da throne of Israel, as Da LORD promised, and have built an house for Da name of Da LORD God of Israel. 8:21 And I have set there a place for Da ark, wherein is Da covenant of Da LORD, which he made with our fathers, when he brought them out of Da land of Egypt. 8:22 And Solomon stood before Da altar of Da LORD in Da presence of all Da congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands toward heaven: 8:23 And he said, LORD God of Israel, there is no God like thee, in heaven above, or on earth beneath, who keepest covenant and mercy with thy servants that walk before thee with all their heart: 8:24 Who hast kept with thy servant David my father that thou promisedst him: thou spakest also with thy mouth, and hast fulfilled it with thine hand, as it is this day. 8:25 Therefore now, LORD God of Israel, keep with thy servant David my father that thou promisedst him, saying, There shall not fail thee a man in my sight to sit on Da throne of Israel; so that thy children take heed to their way, that they walk before me as thou hast walked before me. 8:26 And now, O God of Israel, let thy word, I pray thee, be verified, which thou spakest unto thy servant David my father. 8:27 But will God indeed dwell on Da earth? behold, Da heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house that I have builded? 8:28 Yet have thou respect unto Da prayer of thy servant, and to his supplication, O LORD my God, to hearken unto Da cry and to Da prayer, which thy servant prayeth before thee to day: 8:29 That thine eyes may be open toward this house night and day, even toward Da place of which thou hast said, My name shall be there: that thou mayest hearken unto Da prayer which thy servant shall make toward this place. 8:30 And hearken thou to Da supplication of thy servant, and of thy people Israel, when they shall pray toward this place: and hear thou in heaven thy dwelling place: and when thou hearest, forgive. 8:31 If any man trespass against his neighbour, and an oath be laid upon him to cause him to swear, and Da oath come before thine altar in this house: 8:32 Then hear thou in heaven, and do, and judge thy servants, condemning Da wicked, to bring his way upon his head; and justifying Da righteous, to give him according to his righteousness. 8:33 When thy people Israel be smitten down before Da enemy, because they have sinned against thee, and shall turn again to thee, and confess thy name, and pray, and make supplication unto thee in this house: 8:34 Then hear thou in heaven, and forgive Da sin of thy people Israel, and bring them again unto Da land which thou gavest unto their fathers. 8:35 When heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee; if they pray toward this place, and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou afflictest them: 8:36 Then hear thou in heaven, and forgive Da sin of thy servants, and of thy people Israel, that thou teach them Da good way wherein they should walk, and give rain upon thy land, which thou hast given to thy people for an inheritance. 8:37 If there be in Da land famine, if there be pestilence, blasting, mildew, locust, or if there be caterpiller; if their enemy besiege them in Da land of their cities; whatsoever plague, whatsoever sickness there be; 8:38 What prayer and supplication soever be made by any man, or by all thy people Israel, which shall know every man Da plague of his own heart, and spread forth his hands toward this house: 8:39 Then hear thou in heaven thy dwelling place, and forgive, and do, and give to every man according to his ways, whose heart thou knowest; (for thou, even thou only, knowest Da hearts of all Da children of men;) 8:40 That they may fear thee all Da days that they live in Da land which thou gavest unto our fathers. 8:41 Moreover concerning a stranger, that is not of thy people Israel, but cometh out of a far country for thy name’s sake; 8:42 (For they shall hear of thy great name, and of thy strong hand, and of thy stretched out arm;) when he shall come and pray toward this house; 8:43 Hear thou in heaven thy dwelling place, and do according to all that Da stranger calleth to thee for: that all people of Da earth may know thy name, to fear thee, as do thy people Israel; and that they may know that this house, which I have builded, is called by thy name. 8:44 If thy people go out to battle against their enemy, whithersoever thou shalt send them, and shall pray unto Da LORD toward Da city which thou hast chosen, and toward Da house that I have built for thy name: 8:45 Then hear thou in heaven their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause. 8:46 If they sin against thee, (for there is no man that sinneth not,) and thou be angry with them, and deliver them to Da enemy, so that they carry them away captives unto Da land of Da enemy, far or near; 8:47 Yet if they shall bethink themselves in Da land whither they were carried captives, and repent, and make supplication unto thee in Da land of them that carried them captives, saying, We have sinned, and have done perversely, we have committed wickedness; 8:48 And so return unto thee with all their heart, and with all their soul, in Da land of their enemies, which led them away captive, and pray unto thee toward their land, which thou gavest unto their fathers, Da city which thou hast chosen, and Da house which I have built for thy name: 8:49 Then hear thou their prayer and their supplication in heaven thy dwelling place, and maintain their cause, 8:50 And forgive thy people that have sinned against thee, and all their transgressions wherein they have transgressed against thee, and give them compassion before them who carried them captive, that they may have compassion on them: 8:51 For they be thy people, and thine inheritance, which thou broughtest forth out of Egypt, from Da midst of Da furnace of iron: 8:52 That thine eyes may be open unto Da supplication of thy servant, and unto Da supplication of thy people Israel, to hearken unto them in all that they call for unto thee. 8:53 For thou didst separate them from among all Da people of Da earth, to be thine inheritance, as thou spakest by Da hand of Moses thy servant, when thou broughtest our fathers out of Egypt, O LORD God. 8:54 And it was so, that when Solomon had made an end of praying all this prayer and supplication unto Da LORD, he arose from before Da altar of Da LORD, from kneeling on his knees with his hands spread up to heaven. 8:55 And he stood, and blessed all Da congregation of Israel with a loud voice, saying, 8:56 Blessed be Da LORD, that hath given rest unto his people Israel, according to all that he promised: there hath not failed one word of all his good promise, which he promised by Da hand of Moses his servant. 8:57 The LORD our God be with us, as he was with our fathers: let him not leave us, nor forsake us: 8:58 That he may incline our hearts unto him, to walk in all his ways, and to keep his commandments, and his statutes, and his judgments, which he commanded our fathers. 8:59 And let these my words, wherewith I have made supplication before Da LORD, be nigh unto Da LORD our God day and night, that he maintain Da cause of his servant, and Da cause of his people Israel at all times, as Da matter shall require: 8:60 That all Da people of Da earth may know that Da LORD is God, and that there is none else. 8:61 Let your heart therefore be perfect with Da LORD our God, to walk in his statutes, and to keep his commandments, as at this day. 8:62 And Da king, and all Israel with him, offered sacrifice before Da LORD. 8:63 And Solomon offered a sacrifice of peace offerings, which he offered unto Da LORD, two and twenty thousand oxen, and an hundred and twenty thousand sheep. So Da king and all Da children of Israel dedicated Da house of Da LORD. 8:64 The same day did Da king hallow Da middle of Da court that was before Da house of Da LORD: for there he offered burnt offerings, and meat offerings, and Da fat of Da peace offerings: because Da brasen altar that was before Da LORD was too little to receive Da burnt offerings, and meat offerings, and Da fat of Da peace offerings. 8:65 And at that time Solomon held a feast, and all Israel with him, a great congregation, from Da entering in of Hamath unto Da river of Egypt, before Da LORD our God, seven days and seven days, even fourteen days. 8:66 On Da eighth day he sent Da people away: and they blessed Da king, and went unto their tents joyful and glad of heart for all Da goodness that Da LORD had done for David his servant, and for Israel his people. 9:1 And it came to pass, when Solomon had finished Da building of Da house of Da LORD, and Da king’s house, and all Solomon’s desire which he was pleased to do, 9:2 That Da LORD appeared to Solomon Da second time, as he had appeared unto him at Gibeon. 9:3 And Da LORD said unto him, I have heard thy prayer and thy supplication, that thou hast made before me: I have hallowed this house, which thou hast built, to put my name there for ever; and mine eyes and mine heart shall be there perpetually. 9:4 And if thou wilt walk before me, as David thy father walked, in integrity of heart, and in uprightness, to do according to all that I have commanded thee, and wilt keep my statutes and my judgments: 9:5 Then I will establish Da throne of thy kingdom upon Israel for ever, as I promised to David thy father, saying, There shall not fail thee a man upon Da throne of Israel. 9:6 But if ye shall at all turn from following me, ye or your children, and will not keep my commandments and my statutes which I have set before you, but go and serve other gods, and worship them: 9:7 Then will I cut off Israel out of Da land which I have given them; and this house, which I have hallowed for my name, will I cast out of my sight; and Israel shall be a proverb and a byword among all people: 9:8 And at this house, which is high, every one that passeth by it shall be astonished, and shall hiss; and they shall say, Why hath Da LORD done thus unto this land, and to this house? 9:9 And they shall answer, Because they forsook Da LORD their God, who brought forth their fathers out of Da land of Egypt, and have taken hold upon other gods, and have worshipped them, and served them: therefore hath Da LORD brought upon them all this evil. 9:10 And it came to pass at Da end of twenty years, when Solomon had built Da two houses, Da house of Da LORD, and Da king’s house, 9:11 (Now Hiram Da king of Tyre had furnished Solomon with cedar trees and fir trees, and with gold, according to all his desire,) that then king Solomon gave Hiram twenty cities in Da land of Galilee. 9:12 And Hiram came out from Tyre to see Da cities which Solomon had given him; and they pleased him not. 9:13 And he said, What cities are these which thou hast given me, my brother? And he called them Da land of Cabul unto this day. 9:14 And Hiram sent to Da king sixscore talents of gold. 9:15 And this is Da reason of Da levy which king Solomon raised; for to build Da house of Da LORD, and his own house, and Millo, and Da wall of Jerusalem, and Hazor, and Megiddo, and Gezer. 9:16 For Pharaoh king of Egypt had gone up, and taken Gezer, and burnt it with fire, and slain Da Canaanites that dwelt in Da city, and given it for a present unto his daughter, Solomon’s wife. 9:17 And Solomon built Gezer, and Bethhoron Da nether, 9:18 And Baalath, and Tadmor in Da wilderness, in Da land, 9:19 And all Da cities of store that Solomon had, and cities for his chariots, and cities for his horsemen, and that which Solomon desired to build in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and in all Da land of his dominion. 9:20 And all Da people that were left of Da Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, which were not of Da children of Israel, 9:21 Their children that were left after them in Da land, whom Da children of Israel also were not able utterly to destroy, upon those did Solomon levy a tribute of bondservice unto this day. 9:22 But of Da children of Israel did Solomon make no bondmen: but they were men of war, and his servants, and his princes, and his captains, and rulers of his chariots, and his horsemen. 9:23 These were Da chief of Da officers that were over Solomon’s work, five hundred and fifty, which bare rule over Da people that wrought in Da work. 9:24 But Pharaoh’s daughter came up out of Da city of David unto her house which Solomon had built for her: then did he build Millo. 9:25 And three times in a year did Solomon offer burnt offerings and peace offerings upon Da altar which he built unto Da LORD, and he burnt incense upon Da altar that was before Da LORD. So he finished Da house. 9:26 And king Solomon made a navy of ships in Eziongeber, which is beside Eloth, on Da shore of Da Red sea, in Da land of Edom. 9:27 And Hiram sent in Da navy his servants, shipmen that had knowledge of Da sea, with Da servants of Solomon. 9:28 And they came to Ophir, and fetched from thence gold, four hundred and twenty talents, and brought it to king Solomon. 10:1 And when Da queen of Sheba heard of Da fame of Solomon concerning Da name of Da LORD, she came to prove him with hard questions. 10:2 And she came to Jerusalem with a very great train, with camels that bare spices, and very much gold, and precious stones: and when she was come to Solomon, she communed with him of all that was in her heart. 10:3 And Solomon told her all her questions: there was not any thing hid from Da king, which he told her not. 10:4 And when Da queen of Sheba had seen all Solomon’s wisdom, and Da house that he had built, 10:5 And Da meat of his table, and Da sitting of his servants, and Da attendance of his ministers, and their apparel, and his cupbearers, and his ascent by which he went up unto Da house of Da LORD; there was no more spirit in her. 10:6 And she said to Da king, It was a true report that I heard in mine own land of thy acts and of thy wisdom. 10:7 Howbeit I believed not Da words, until I came, and mine eyes had seen it: and, behold, Da half was not told me: thy wisdom and prosperity exceedeth Da fame which I heard. 10:8 Happy are thy men, happy are these thy servants, which stand continually before thee, and that hear thy wisdom. 10:9 Blessed be Da LORD thy God, which delighted in thee, to set thee on Da throne of Israel: because Da LORD loved Israel for ever, therefore made he thee king, to do judgment and justice. 10:10 And she gave Da king an hundred and twenty talents of gold, and of spices very great store, and precious stones: there came no more such abundance of spices as these which Da queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon. 10:11 And Da navy also of Hiram, that brought gold from Ophir, brought in from Ophir great plenty of almug trees, and precious stones. 10:12 And Da king made of Da almug trees pillars for Da house of Da LORD, and for Da king’s house, harps also and psalteries for singers: there came no such almug trees, nor were seen unto this day. 10:13 And king Solomon gave unto Da queen of Sheba all her desire, whatsoever she asked, beside that which Solomon gave her of his royal bounty. So she turned and went to her own country, she and her servants. 10:14 Now Da weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred threescore and six talents of gold, 10:15 Beside that he had of Da merchantmen, and of Da traffick of Da spice merchants, and of all Da kings of Arabia, and of Da governors of Da country. 10:16 And king Solomon made two hundred targets of beaten gold: six hundred shekels of gold went to one target. 10:17 And he made three hundred shields of beaten gold; three pound of gold went to one shield: and Da king put them in Da house of Da forest of Lebanon. 10:18 Moreover Da king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with Da best gold. 10:19 The throne had six steps, and Da top of Da throne was round behind: and there were stays on either side on Da place of Da seat, and two lions stood beside Da stays. 10:20 And twelve lions stood there on Da one side and on Da other upon Da six steps: there was not Da like made in any kingdom. 10:21 And all king Solomon’s drinking vessels were of gold, and all Da vessels of Da house of Da forest of Lebanon were of pure gold; none were of silver: it was nothing accounted of in Da days of Solomon. 10:22 For Da king had at sea a navy of Tharshish with Da navy of Hiram: once in three years came Da navy of Tharshish, bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks. 10:23 So king Solomon exceeded all Da kings of Da earth for riches and for wisdom. 10:24 And all Da earth sought to Solomon, to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart. 10:25 And they brought every man his present, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and garments, and armour, and spices, horses, and mules, a rate year by year. 10:26 And Solomon gathered together chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, whom he bestowed in Da cities for chariots, and with Da king at Jerusalem. 10:27 And Da king made silver to be in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars made he to be as Da sycomore trees that are in Da vale, for abundance. 10:28 And Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt, and linen yarn: Da king’s merchants received Da linen yarn at a price. 10:29 And a chariot came up and went out of Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver, and an horse for an hundred and fifty: and so for all Da kings of Da Hittites, and for Da kings of Syria, did they bring them out by their means. 11:1 But king Solomon loved many strange women, together with Da daughter of Pharaoh, women of Da Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Zidonians, and Hittites: 11:2 Of Da nations concerning which Da LORD said unto Da children of Israel, Ye shall not go in to them, neither shall they come in unto you: for surely they will turn away your heart after their gods: Solomon clave unto these in love. 11:3 And he had seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines: and his wives turned away his heart. 11:4 For it came to pass, when Solomon was old, that his wives turned away his heart after other gods: and his heart was not perfect with Da LORD his God, as was Da heart of David his father. 11:5 For Solomon went after Ashtoreth Da goddess of Da Zidonians, and after Milcom Da abomination of Da Ammonites. 11:6 And Solomon did evil in Da sight of Da LORD, and went not fully after Da LORD, as did David his father. 11:7 Then did Solomon build an high place for Chemosh, Da abomination of Moab, in Da hill that is before Jerusalem, and for Molech, Da abomination of Da children of Ammon. 11:8 And likewise did he for all his strange wives, which burnt incense and sacrificed unto their gods. 11:9 And Da LORD was angry with Solomon, because his heart was turned from Da LORD God of Israel, which had appeared unto him twice, 11:10 And had commanded him concerning this thing, that he should not go after other gods: but he kept not that which Da LORD commanded. 11:11 Wherefore Da LORD said unto Solomon, Forasmuch as this is done of thee, and thou hast not kept my covenant and my statutes, which I have commanded thee, I will surely rend Da kingdom from thee, and will give it to thy servant. 11:12 Notwithstanding in thy days I will not do it for David thy father’s sake: but I will rend it out of Da hand of thy son. 11:13 Howbeit I will not rend away all Da kingdom; but will give one tribe to thy son for David my servant’s sake, and for Jerusalem’s sake which I have chosen. 11:14 And Da LORD stirred up an adversary unto Solomon, Hadad Da Edomite: he was of Da king’s seed in Edom. 11:15 For it came to pass, when David was in Edom, and Joab Da captain of Da host was gone up to bury Da slain, after he had smitten every male in Edom; 11:16 (For six months did Joab remain there with all Israel, until he had cut off every male in Edom:) 11:17 That Hadad fled, he and certain Edomites of his father’s servants with him, to go into Egypt; Hadad being yet a little child. 11:18 And they arose out of Midian, and came to Paran: and they took men with them out of Paran, and they came to Egypt, unto Pharaoh king of Egypt; which gave him an house, and appointed him victuals, and gave him land. 11:19 And Hadad found great favour in Da sight of Pharaoh, so that he gave him to wife Da sister of his own wife, Da sister of Tahpenes Da queen. 11:20 And Da sister of Tahpenes bare him Genubath his son, whom Tahpenes weaned in Pharaoh’s house: and Genubath was in Pharaoh’s household among Da sons of Pharaoh. 11:21 And when Hadad heard in Egypt that David slept with his fathers, and that Joab Da captain of Da host was dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, Let me depart, that I may go to mine own country. 11:22 Then Pharaoh said unto him, But what hast thou lacked with me, that, behold, thou seekest to go to thine own country? And he answered, Nothing: howbeit let me go in any wise. 11:23 And God stirred him up another adversary, Rezon Da son of Eliadah, which fled from his lord Hadadezer king of Zobah: 11:24 And he gathered men unto him, and became captain over a band, when David slew them of Zobah: and they went to Damascus, and dwelt therein, and reigned in Damascus. 11:25 And he was an adversary to Israel all Da days of Solomon, beside Da mischief that Hadad did: and he abhorred Israel, and reigned over Syria. 11:26 And Jeroboam Da son of Nebat, an Ephrathite of Zereda, Solomon’s servant, whose mother’s name was Zeruah, a widow woman, even he lifted up his hand against Da king. 11:27 And this was Da cause that he lifted up his hand against Da king: Solomon built Millo, and repaired Da breaches of Da city of David his father. 11:28 And Da man Jeroboam was a mighty man of valour: and Solomon seeing Da young man that he was industrious, he made him ruler over all Da charge of Da house of Joseph. 11:29 And it came to pass at that time when Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, that Da prophet Ahijah Da Shilonite found him in Da way; and he had clad himself with a new garment; and they two were alone in Da field: 11:30 And Ahijah caught Da new garment that was on him, and rent it in twelve pieces: 11:31 And he said to Jeroboam, Take thee ten pieces: for thus saith Da LORD, Da God of Israel, Behold, I will rend Da kingdom out of Da hand of Solomon, and will give ten tribes to thee: 11:32 (But he shall have one tribe for my servant David’s sake, and for Jerusalem’s sake, Da city which I have chosen out of all Da tribes of Israel:) 11:33 Because that they have forsaken me, and have worshipped Ashtoreth Da goddess of Da Zidonians, Chemosh Da god of Da Moabites, and Milcom Da god of Da children of Ammon, and have not walked in my ways, to do that which is right in mine eyes, and to keep my statutes and my judgments, as did David his father. 11:34 Howbeit I will not take Da whole kingdom out of his hand: but I will make him prince all Da days of his life for David my servant’s sake, whom I chose, because he kept my commandments and my statutes: 11:35 But I will take Da kingdom out of his son’s hand, and will give it unto thee, even ten tribes. 11:36 And unto his son will I give one tribe, that David my servant may have a light alway before me in Jerusalem, Da city which I have chosen me to put my name there. 11:37 And I will take thee, and thou shalt reign according to all that thy soul desireth, and shalt be king over Israel. 11:38 And it shall be, if thou wilt hearken unto all that I command thee, and wilt walk in my ways, and do that is right in my sight, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as David my servant did; that I will be with thee, and build thee a sure house, as I built for David, and will give Israel unto thee. 11:39 And I will for this afflict Da seed of David, but not for ever. 11:40 Solomon sought therefore to kill Jeroboam. And Jeroboam arose, and fled into Egypt, unto Shishak king of Egypt, and was in Egypt until Da death of Solomon. 11:41 And Da rest of Da acts of Solomon, and all that he did, and his wisdom, are they not written in Da book of Da acts of Solomon? 11:42 And Da time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel was forty years. 11:43 And Solomon slept with his fathers, and was buried in Da city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead. 12:1 And Rehoboam went to Shechem: for all Israel were come to Shechem to make him king. 12:2 And it came to pass, when Jeroboam Da son of Nebat, who was yet in Egypt, heard of it, (for he was fled from Da presence of king Solomon, and Jeroboam dwelt in Egypt;) 12:3 That they sent and called him. And Jeroboam and all Da congregation of Israel came, and spake unto Rehoboam, saying, 12:4 Thy father made our yoke grievous: now therefore make thou Da grievous service of thy father, and his heavy yoke which he put upon us, lighter, and we will serve thee. 12:5 And he said unto them, Depart yet for three days, then come again to me. And Da people departed. 12:6 And king Rehoboam consulted with Da old men, that stood before Solomon his father while he yet lived, and said, How do ye advise that I may answer this people? 12:7 And they spake unto him, saying, If thou wilt be a servant unto this people this day, and wilt serve them, and answer them, and speak good words to them, then they will be thy servants for ever. 12:8 But he forsook Da counsel of Da old men, which they had given him, and consulted with Da young men that were grown up with him, and which stood before him: 12:9 And he said unto them, What counsel give ye that we may answer this people, who have spoken to me, saying, Make Da yoke which thy father did put upon us lighter?
