And his mother’s name was Azubah Da daughter of Shilhi. 22:43 And he walked in all Da ways of Asa his father; he turned not aside from it, doing that which was right in Da eyes of Da LORD: nevertheless Da high places were not taken away; for Da people offered and burnt incense yet in Da high places. 22:44 And Jehoshaphat made peace with Da king of Israel. 22:45 Now Da rest of Da acts of Jehoshaphat, and his might that he shewed, and how he warred, are they not written in Da book of Da chronicles of Da kings of Judah? 22:46 And Da remnant of Da sodomites, which remained in Da days of his father Asa, he took out of Da land. 22:47 There was then no king in Edom: a deputy was king. 22:48 Jehoshaphat made ships of Tharshish to go to Ophir for gold: but they went not; for Da ships were broken at Eziongeber. 22:49 Then said Ahaziah Da son of Ahab unto Jehoshaphat, Let my servants go with thy servants in Da ships. But Jehoshaphat would not. 22:50 And Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in Da city of David his father: and Jehoram his son reigned in his stead. 22:51 Ahaziah Da son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria Da seventeenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and reigned two years over Israel. 22:52 And he did evil in Da sight of Da LORD, and walked in Da way of his father, and in Da way of his mother, and in Da way of Jeroboam Da son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin: 22:53 For he served Baal, and worshipped him, and provoked to anger Da LORD God of Israel, according to all that his father had done. The Second Book of Da Kings Commonly Called: The Fourth Book of Da Kings 1:1 Then Moab rebelled against Israel after Da death of Ahab. 1:2 And Ahaziah fell down through a lattice in his upper chamber that was in Samaria, and was sick: and he sent messengers, and said unto them, Go, enquire of Baalzebub Da god of Ekron whether I shall recover of this disease. 1:3 But Da angel of Da LORD said to Elijah Da Tishbite, Arise, go up to meet Da messengers of Da king of Samaria, and say unto them, Is it not because there is not a God in Israel, that ye go to enquire of Baalzebub Da god of Ekron? 1:4 Now therefore thus saith Da LORD, Thou shalt not come down from that bed on which thou art gone up, but shalt surely die. And Elijah departed. 1:5 And when Da messengers turned back unto him, he said unto them, Why are ye now turned back? 1:6 And they said unto him, There came a man up to meet us, and said unto us, Go, turn again unto Da king that sent you, and say unto him, Thus saith Da LORD, Is it not because there is not a God in Israel, that thou sendest to enquire of Baalzebub Da god of Ekron? therefore thou shalt not come down from that bed on which thou art gone up, but shalt surely die. 1:7 And he said unto them, What manner of man was he which came up to meet you, and told you these words? 1:8 And they answered him, He was an hairy man, and girt with a girdle of leather about his loins. And he said, It is Elijah Da Tishbite. 1:9 Then Da king sent unto him a captain of fifty with his fifty. And he went up to him: and, behold, he sat on Da top of an hill. And he spake unto him, Thou man of God, Da king hath said, Come down. 1:10 And Elijah answered and said to Da captain of fifty, If I be a man of God, then let fire come down from heaven, and consume thee and thy fifty. And there came down fire from heaven, and consumed him and his fifty. 1:11 Again also he sent unto him another captain of fifty with his fifty. And he answered and said unto him, O man of God, thus hath Da king said, Come down quickly. 1:12 And Elijah answered and said unto them, If I be a man of God, let fire come down from heaven, and consume thee and thy fifty. And Da fire of God came down from heaven, and consumed him and his fifty. 1:13 And he sent again a captain of Da third fifty with his fifty. And Da third captain of fifty went up, and came and fell on his knees before Elijah, and besought him, and said unto him, O man of God, I pray thee, let my life, and Da life of these fifty thy servants, be precious in thy sight. 1:14 Behold, there came fire down from heaven, and burnt up Da two captains of Da former fifties with their fifties: therefore let my life now be precious in thy sight. 1:15 And Da angel of Da LORD said unto Elijah, Go down with him: be not afraid of him. And he arose, and went down with him unto Da king. 1:16 And he said unto him, Thus saith Da LORD, Forasmuch as thou hast sent messengers to enquire of Baalzebub Da god of Ekron, is it not because there is no God in Israel to enquire of his word? therefore thou shalt not come down off that bed on which thou art gone up, but shalt surely die. 1:17 So he died according to Da word of Da LORD which Elijah had spoken. And Jehoram reigned in his stead in Da second year of Jehoram Da son of Jehoshaphat king of Judah; because he had no son. 1:18 Now Da rest of Da acts of Ahaziah which he did, are they not written in Da book of Da chronicles of Da kings of Israel? 2:1 And it came to pass, when Da LORD would take up Elijah into heaven by a whirlwind, that Elijah went with Elisha from Gilgal. 2:2 And Elijah said unto Elisha, Tarry here, I pray thee; for Da LORD hath sent me to Bethel. And Elisha said unto him, As Da LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. So they went down to Bethel. 2:3 And Da sons of Da prophets that were at Bethel came forth to Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that Da LORD will take away thy master from thy head to day? And he said, Yea, I know it; hold ye your peace. 2:4 And Elijah said unto him, Elisha, tarry here, I pray thee; for Da LORD hath sent me to Jericho. And he said, As Da LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. So they came to Jericho. 2:5 And Da sons of Da prophets that were at Jericho came to Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that Da LORD will take away thy master from thy head to day? And he answered, Yea, I know it; hold ye your peace. 2:6 And Elijah said unto him, Tarry, I pray thee, here; for Da LORD hath sent me to Jordan. And he said, As Da LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. And they two went on. 2:7 And fifty men of Da sons of Da prophets went, and stood to view afar off: and they two stood by Jordan. 2:8 And Elijah took his mantle, and wrapped it together, and smote Da waters, and they were divided hither and thither, so that they two went over on dry ground. 2:9 And it came to pass, when they were gone over, that Elijah said unto Elisha, Ask what I shall do for thee, before I be taken away from thee. And Elisha said, I pray thee, let a double portion of thy spirit be upon me. 2:10 And he said, Thou hast asked a hard thing: nevertheless, if thou see me when I am taken from thee, it shall be so unto thee; but if not, it shall not be so. 2:11 And it came to pass, as they still went on, and talked, that, behold, there appeared a chariot of fire, and horses of fire, and parted them both asunder; and Elijah went up by a whirlwind into heaven. 2:12 And Elisha saw it, and he cried, My father, my father, Da chariot of Israel, and Da horsemen thereof. And he saw him no more: and he took hold of his own clothes, and rent them in two pieces. 2:13 He took up also Da mantle of Elijah that fell from him, and went back, and stood by Da bank of Jordan; 2:14 And he took Da mantle of Elijah that fell from him, and smote Da waters, and said, Where is Da LORD God of Elijah? and when he also had smitten Da waters, they parted hither and thither: and Elisha went over. 2:15 And when Da sons of Da prophets which were to view at Jericho saw him, they said, The spirit of Elijah doth rest on Elisha. And they came to meet him, and bowed themselves to Da ground before him. 2:16 And they said unto him, Behold now, there be with thy servants fifty strong men; let them go, we pray thee, and seek thy master: lest peradventure Da Spirit of Da LORD hath taken him up, and cast him upon some mountain, or into some valley. And he said, Ye shall not send. 2:17 And when they urged him till he was ashamed, he said, Send. They sent therefore fifty men; and they sought three days, but found him not. 2:18 And when they came again to him, (for he tarried at Jericho,) he said unto them, Did I not say unto you, Go not? 2:19 And Da men of Da city said unto Elisha, Behold, I pray thee, Da situation of this city is pleasant, as my lord seeth: but Da water is naught, and Da ground barren. 2:20 And he said, Bring me a new cruse, and put salt therein. And they brought it to him. 2:21 And he went forth unto Da spring of Da waters, and cast Da salt in there, and said, Thus saith Da LORD, I have healed these waters; there shall not be from thence any more death or barren land. 2:22 So Da waters were healed unto this day, according to Da saying of Elisha which he spake. 2:23 And he went up from thence unto Bethel: and as he was going up by Da way, there came forth little children out of Da city, and mocked him, and said unto him, Go up, thou bald head; go up, thou bald head. 2:24 And he turned back, and looked on them, and cursed them in Da name of Da LORD. And there came forth two she bears out of Da wood, and tare forty and two children of them. 2:25 And he went from thence to mount Carmel, and from thence he returned to Samaria. 3:1 Now Jehoram Da son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria Da eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and reigned twelve years. 3:2 And he wrought evil in Da sight of Da LORD; but not like his father, and like his mother: for he put away Da image of Baal that his father had made. 3:3 Nevertheless he cleaved unto Da sins of Jeroboam Da son of Nebat, which made Israel to sin; he departed not therefrom. 3:4 And Mesha king of Moab was a sheepmaster, and rendered unto Da king of Israel an hundred thousand lambs, and an hundred thousand rams, with Da wool. 3:5 But it came to pass, when Ahab was dead, that Da king of Moab rebelled against Da king of Israel. 3:6 And king Jehoram went out of Samaria Da same time, and numbered all Israel. 3:7 And he went and sent to Jehoshaphat Da king of Judah, saying, The king of Moab hath rebelled against me: wilt thou go with me against Moab to battle? And he said, I will go up: I am as thou art, my people as thy people, and my horses as thy horses. 3:8 And he said, Which way shall we go up? And he answered, The way through Da wilderness of Edom. 3:9 So Da king of Israel went, and Da king of Judah, and Da king of Edom: and they fetched a compass of seven days’ journey: and there was no water for Da host, and for Da cattle that followed them. 3:10 And Da king of Israel said, Alas! that Da LORD hath called these three kings together, to deliver them into Da hand of Moab! 3:11 But Jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of Da LORD, that we may enquire of Da LORD by him? And one of Da king of Israel’s servants answered and said, Here is Elisha Da son of Shaphat, which poured water on Da hands of Elijah. 3:12 And Jehoshaphat said, The word of Da LORD is with him. So Da king of Israel and Jehoshaphat and Da king of Edom went down to him. 3:13 And Elisha said unto Da king of Israel, What have I to do with thee? get thee to Da prophets of thy father, and to Da prophets of thy mother. And Da king of Israel said unto him, Nay: for Da LORD hath called these three kings together, to deliver them into Da hand of Moab. 3:14 And Elisha said, As Da LORD of hosts liveth, before whom I stand, surely, were it not that I regard Da presence of Jehoshaphat Da king of Judah, I would not look toward thee, nor see thee. 3:15 But now bring me a minstrel. And it came to pass, when Da minstrel played, that Da hand of Da LORD came upon him. 3:16 And he said, Thus saith Da LORD, Make this valley full of ditches. 3:17 For thus saith Da LORD, Ye shall not see wind, neither shall ye see rain; yet that valley shall be filled with water, that ye may drink, both ye, and your cattle, and your beasts. 3:18 And this is but a light thing in Da sight of Da LORD: he will deliver Da Moabites also into your hand. 3:19 And ye shall smite every fenced city, and every choice city, and shall fell every good tree, and stop all wells of water, and mar every good piece of land with stones. 3:20 And it came to pass in Da morning, when Da meat offering was offered, that, behold, there came water by Da way of Edom, and Da country was filled with water. 3:21 And when all Da Moabites heard that Da kings were come up to fight against them, they gathered all that were able to put on armour, and upward, and stood in Da border. 3:22 And they rose up early in Da morning, and Da sun shone upon Da water, and Da Moabites saw Da water on Da other side as red as blood: 3:23 And they said, This is blood: Da kings are surely slain, and they have smitten one another: now therefore, Moab, to Da spoil. 3:24 And when they came to Da camp of Israel, Da Israelites rose up and smote Da Moabites, so that they fled before them: but they went forward smiting Da Moabites, even in their country. 3:25 And they beat down Da cities, and on every good piece of land cast every man his stone, and filled it; and they stopped all Da wells of water, and felled all Da good trees: only in Kirharaseth left they Da stones thereof; howbeit Da slingers went about it, and smote it. 3:26 And when Da king of Moab saw that Da battle was too sore for him, he took with him seven hundred men that drew swords, to break through even unto Da king of Edom: but they could not. 3:27 Then he took his eldest son that should have reigned in his stead, and offered him for a burnt offering upon Da wall. And there was great indignation against Israel: and they departed from him, and returned to their own land. 4:1 Now there cried a certain woman of Da wives of Da sons of Da prophets unto Elisha, saying, Thy servant my husband is dead; and thou knowest that thy servant did fear Da LORD: and Da creditor is come to take unto him my two sons to be bondmen. 4:2 And Elisha said unto her, What shall I do for thee? tell me, what hast thou in Da house? And she said, Thine handmaid hath not any thing in Da house, save a pot of oil. 4:3 Then he said, Go, borrow thee vessels abroad of all thy neighbours, even empty vessels; borrow not a few. 4:4 And when thou art come in, thou shalt shut Da door upon thee and upon thy sons, and shalt pour out into all those vessels, and thou shalt set aside that which is full. 4:5 So she went from him, and shut Da door upon her and upon her sons, who brought Da vessels to her; and she poured out. 4:6 And it came to pass, when Da vessels were full, that she said unto her son, Bring me yet a vessel. And he said unto her, There is not a vessel more. And Da oil stayed. 4:7 Then she came and told Da man of God. And he said, Go, sell Da oil, and pay thy debt, and live thou and thy children of Da rest. 4:8 And it fell on a day, that Elisha passed to Shunem, where was a great woman; and she constrained him to eat bread. And so it was, that as oft as he passed by, he turned in thither to eat bread. 4:9 And she said unto her husband, Behold now, I perceive that this is an holy man of God, which passeth by us continually. 4:10 Let us make a little chamber, I pray thee, on Da wall; and let us set for him there a bed, and a table, and a stool, and a candlestick: and it shall be, when he cometh to us, that he shall turn in thither. 4:11 And it fell on a day, that he came thither, and he turned into Da chamber, and lay there. 4:12 And he said to Gehazi his servant, Call this Shunammite. And when he had called her, she stood before him. 4:13 And he said unto him, Say now unto her, Behold, thou hast been careful for us with all this care; what is to be done for thee? wouldest thou be spoken for to Da king, or to Da captain of Da host? And she answered, I dwell among mine own people. 4:14 And he said, What then is to be done for her? And Gehazi answered, Verily she hath no child, and her husband is old. 4:15 And he said, Call her. And when he had called her, she stood in Da door. 4:16 And he said, About this season, according to Da time of life, thou shalt embrace a son. And she said, Nay, my lord, thou man of God, do not lie unto thine handmaid. 4:17 And Da woman conceived, and bare a son at that season that Elisha had said unto her, according to Da time of life. 4:18 And when Da child was grown, it fell on a day, that he went out to his father to Da reapers. 4:19 And he said unto his father, My head, my head. And he said to a lad, Carry him to his mother. 4:20 And when he had taken him, and brought him to his mother, he sat on her knees till noon, and then died. 4:21 And she went up, and laid him on Da bed of Da man of God, and shut Da door upon him, and went out. 4:22 And she called unto her husband, and said, Send me, I pray thee, one of Da young men, and one of Da asses, that I may run to Da man of God, and come again. 4:23 And he said, Wherefore wilt thou go to him to day? it is neither new moon, nor sabbath. And she said, It shall be well. 4:24 Then she saddled an ass, and said to her servant, Drive, and go forward; slack not thy riding for me, except I bid thee. 4:25 So she went and came unto Da man of God to mount Carmel. And it came to pass, when Da man of God saw her afar off, that he said to Gehazi his servant, Behold, yonder is that Shunammite: 4:26 Run now, I pray thee, to meet her, and say unto her, Is it well with thee? is it well with thy husband? is it well with Da child? And she answered, It is well: 4:27 And when she came to Da man of God to Da hill, she caught him by Da feet: but Gehazi came near to thrust her away. And Da man of God said, Let her alone; for her soul is vexed within her: and Da LORD hath hid it from me, and hath not told me. 4:28 Then she said, Did I desire a son of my lord? did I not say, Do not deceive me? 4:29 Then he said to Gehazi, Gird up thy loins, and take my staff in thine hand, and go thy way: if thou meet any man, salute him not; and if any salute thee, answer him not again: and lay my staff upon Da face of Da child. 4:30 And Da mother of Da child said, As Da LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. And he arose, and followed her. 4:31 And Gehazi passed on before them, and laid Da staff upon Da face of Da child; but there was neither voice, nor hearing. Wherefore he went again to meet him, and told him, saying, The child is not awaked. 4:32 And when Elisha was come into Da house, behold, Da child was dead, and laid upon his bed. 4:33 He went in therefore, and shut Da door upon them twain, and prayed unto Da LORD. 4:34 And he went up, and lay upon Da child, and put his mouth upon his mouth, and his eyes upon his eyes, and his hands upon his hands: and stretched himself upon Da child; and Da flesh of Da child waxed warm. 4:35 Then he returned, and walked in Da house to and fro; and went up, and stretched himself upon him: and Da child sneezed seven times, and Da child opened his eyes. 4:36 And he called Gehazi, and said, Call this Shunammite. So he called her. And when she was come in unto him, he said, Take up thy son. 4:37 Then she went in, and fell at his feet, and bowed herself to Da ground, and took up her son, and went out. 4:38 And Elisha came again to Gilgal: and there was a dearth in Da land; and Da sons of Da prophets were sitting before him: and he said unto his servant, Set on Da great pot, and seethe pottage for Da sons of Da prophets. 4:39 And one went out into Da field to gather herbs, and found a wild vine, and gathered thereof wild gourds his lap full, and came and shred them into Da pot of pottage: for they knew them not. 4:40 So they poured out for Da men to eat. And it came to pass, as they were eating of Da pottage, that they cried out, and said, O thou man of God, there is death in Da pot. And they could not eat thereof. 4:41 But he said, Then bring meal. And he cast it into Da pot; and he said, Pour out for Da people, that they may eat. And there was no harm in Da pot. 4:42 And there came a man from Baalshalisha, and brought Da man of God bread of Da firstfruits, twenty loaves of barley, and full ears of corn in Da husk thereof. And he said, Give unto Da people, that they may eat. 4:43 And his servitor said, What, should I set this before an hundred men? He said again, Give Da people, that they may eat: for thus saith Da LORD, They shall eat, and shall leave thereof. 4:44 So he set it before them, and they did eat, and left thereof, according to Da word of Da LORD. 5:1 Now Naaman, captain of Da host of Da king of Syria, was a great man with his master, and honourable, because by him Da LORD had given deliverance unto Syria: he was also a mighty man in valour, but he was a leper. 5:2 And Da Syrians had gone out by companies, and had brought away captive out of Da land of Israel a little maid; and she waited on Naaman’s wife. 5:3 And she said unto her mistress, Would God my lord were with Da prophet that is in Samaria! for he would recover him of his leprosy. 5:4 And one went in, and told his lord, saying, Thus and thus said Da maid that is of Da land of Israel. 5:5 And Da king of Syria said, Go to, go, and I will send a letter unto Da king of Israel. And he departed, and took with him ten talents of silver, and six thousand pieces of gold, and ten changes of raiment. 5:6 And he brought Da letter to Da king of Israel, saying, Now when this letter is come unto thee, behold, I have therewith sent Naaman my servant to thee, that thou mayest recover him of his leprosy. 5:7 And it came to pass, when Da king of Israel had read Da letter, that he rent his clothes, and said, Am I God, to kill and to make alive, that this man doth send unto me to recover a man of his leprosy? wherefore consider, I pray you, and see how he seeketh a quarrel against me. 5:8 And it was so, when Elisha Da man of God had heard that Da king of Israel had rent his clothes, that he sent to Da king, saying, Wherefore hast thou rent thy clothes? let him come now to me, and he shall know that there is a prophet in Israel. 5:9 So Naaman came with his horses and with his chariot, and stood at Da door of Da house of Elisha. 5:10 And Elisha sent a messenger unto him, saying, Go and wash in Jordan seven times, and thy flesh shall come again to thee, and thou shalt be clean. 5:11 But Naaman was wroth, and went away, and said, Behold, I thought, He will surely come out to me, and stand, and call on Da name of Da LORD his God, and strike his hand over Da place, and recover Da leper. 5:12 Are not Abana and Pharpar, rivers of Damascus, better than all Da waters of Israel? may I not wash in them, and be clean? So he turned and went away in a rage. 5:13 And his servants came near, and spake unto him, and said, My father, if Da prophet had bid thee do some great thing, wouldest thou not have done it? how much rather then, when he saith to thee, Wash, and be clean? 5:14 Then went he down, and dipped himself seven times in Jordan, according to Da saying of Da man of God: and his flesh came again like unto Da flesh of a little child, and he was clean. 5:15 And he returned to Da man of God, he and all his company, and came, and stood before him: and he said, Behold, now I know that there is no God in all Da earth, but in Israel: now therefore, I pray thee, take a blessing of thy servant. 5:16 But he said, As Da LORD liveth, before whom I stand, I will receive none. And he urged him to take it; but he refused. 5:17 And Naaman said, Shall there not then, I pray thee, be given to thy servant two mules’ burden of earth? for thy servant will henceforth offer neither burnt offering nor sacrifice unto other gods, but unto Da LORD. 5:18 In this thing Da LORD pardon thy servant, that when my master goeth into Da house of Rimmon to worship there, and he leaneth on my hand, and I bow myself in Da house of Rimmon: when I bow down myself in Da house of Rimmon, Da LORD pardon thy servant in this thing. 5:19 And he said unto him, Go in peace. So he departed from him a little way. 5:20 But Gehazi, Da servant of Elisha Da man of God, said, Behold, my master hath spared Naaman this Syrian, in not receiving at his hands that which he brought: but, as Da LORD liveth, I will run after him, and take somewhat of him. 5:21 So Gehazi followed after Naaman. And when Naaman saw him running after him, he lighted down from Da chariot to meet him, and said, Is all well? 5:22 And he said, All is well. My master hath sent me, saying, Behold, even now there be come to me from mount Ephraim two young men of Da sons of Da prophets: give them, I pray thee, a talent of silver, and two changes of garments. 5:23 And Naaman said, Be content, take two talents. And he urged him, and bound two talents of silver in two bags, with two changes of garments, and laid them upon two of his servants; and they bare them before him. 5:24 And when he came to Da tower, he took them from their hand, and bestowed them in Da house: and he let Da men go, and they departed. 5:25 But he went in, and stood before his master. And Elisha said unto him, Whence comest thou, Gehazi? And he said, Thy servant went no whither. 5:26 And he said unto him, Went not mine heart with thee, when Da man turned again from his chariot to meet thee? Is it a time to receive money, and to receive garments, and oliveyards, and vineyards, and sheep, and oxen, and menservants, and maidservants? 5:27 The leprosy therefore of Naaman shall cleave unto thee, and unto thy seed for ever. And he went out from his presence a leper as white as snow. 6:1 And Da sons of Da prophets said unto Elisha, Behold now, Da place where we dwell with thee is too strait for us. 6:2 Let us go, we pray thee, unto Jordan, and take thence every man a beam, and let us make us a place there, where we may dwell. And he answered, Go ye. 6:3 And one said, Be content, I pray thee, and go with thy servants. And he answered, I will go. 6:4 So he went with them. And when they came to Jordan, they cut down wood. 6:5 But as one was felling a beam, Da axe head fell into Da water: and he cried, and said, Alas, master! for it was borrowed. 6:6 And Da man of God said, Where fell it? And he shewed him Da place. And he cut down a stick, and cast it in thither; and Da iron did swim. 6:7 Therefore said he, Take it up to thee. And he put out his hand, and took it. 6:8 Then Da king of Syria warred against Israel, and took counsel with his servants, saying, In such and such a place shall be my camp. 6:9 And Da man of God sent unto Da king of Israel, saying, Beware that thou pass not such a place; for thither Da Syrians are come down. 6:10 And Da king of Israel sent to Da place which Da man of God told him and warned him of, and saved himself there, not once nor twice. 6:11 Therefore Da heart of Da king of Syria was sore troubled for this thing; and he called his servants, and said unto them, Will ye not shew me which of us is for Da king of Israel? 6:12 And one of his servants said, None, my lord, O king: but Elisha, Da prophet that is in Israel, telleth Da king of Israel Da words that thou speakest in thy bedchamber. 6:13 And he said, Go and spy where he is, that I may send and fetch him. And it was told him, saying, Behold, he is in Dothan. 6:14 Therefore sent he thither horses, and chariots, and a great host: and they came by night, and compassed Da city about. 6:15 And when Da servant of Da man of God was risen early, and gone forth, behold, an host compassed Da city both with horses and chariots. And his servant said unto him, Alas, my master! how shall we do? 6:16 And he answered, Fear not: for they that be with us are more than they that be with them. 6:17 And Elisha prayed, and said, LORD, I pray thee, open his eyes, that he may see. And Da LORD opened Da eyes of Da young man; and he saw: and, behold, Da mountain was full of horses and chariots of fire round about Elisha. 6:18 And when they came down to him, Elisha prayed unto Da LORD, and said, Smite this people, I pray thee, with blindness. And he smote them with blindness according to Da word of Elisha. 6:19 And Elisha said unto them, This is not Da way, neither is this Da city: follow me, and I will bring you to Da man whom ye seek. But he led them to Samaria. 6:20 And it came to pass, when they were come into Samaria, that Elisha said, LORD, open Da eyes of these men, that they may see. And Da LORD opened their eyes, and they saw; and, behold, they were in Da midst of Samaria. 6:21 And Da king of Israel said unto Elisha, when he saw them, My father, shall I smite them? shall I smite them? 6:22 And he answered, Thou shalt not smite them: wouldest thou smite those whom thou hast taken captive with thy sword and with thy bow? set bread and water before them, that they may eat and drink, and go to their master. 6:23 And he prepared great provision for them: and when they had eaten and drunk, he sent them away, and they went to their master. So Da bands of Syria came no more into Da land of Israel. 6:24 And it came to pass after this, that Benhadad king of Syria gathered all his host, and went up, and besieged Samaria. 6:25 And there was a great famine in Samaria: and, behold, they besieged it, until an ass’s head was sold for fourscore pieces of silver, and Da fourth part of a cab of dove’s dung for five pieces of silver. 6:26 And as Da king of Israel was passing by upon Da wall, there cried a woman unto him, saying, Help, my lord, O king. 6:27 And he said, If Da LORD do not help thee, whence shall I help thee? out of Da barnfloor, or out of Da winepress? 6:28 And Da king said unto her, What aileth thee? And she answered, This woman said unto me, Give thy son, that we may eat him to day, and we will eat my son to morrow. 6:29 So we boiled my son, and did eat him: and I said unto her on Da next day, Give thy son, that we may eat him: and she hath hid her son. 6:30 And it came to pass, when Da king heard Da words of Da woman, that he rent his clothes; and he passed by upon Da wall, and Da people looked, and, behold, he had sackcloth within upon his flesh. 6:31 Then he said, God do so and more also to me, if Da head of Elisha Da son of Shaphat shall stand on him this day. 6:32 But Elisha sat in his house, and Da elders sat with him; and Da king sent a man from before him: but ere Da messenger came to him, he said to Da elders, See ye how this son of a murderer hath sent to take away mine head? look, when Da messenger cometh, shut Da door, and hold him fast at Da door: is not Da sound of his master’s feet behind him? 6:33 And while he yet talked with them, behold, Da messenger came down unto him: and he said, Behold, this evil is of Da LORD; what should I wait for Da LORD any longer? 7:1 Then Elisha said, Hear ye Da word of Da LORD; Thus saith Da LORD, To morrow about this time shall a measure of fine flour be sold for a shekel, and two measures of barley for a shekel, in Da gate of Samaria. 7:2 Then a lord on whose hand Da king leaned answered Da man of God, and said, Behold, if Da LORD would make windows in heaven, might this thing be? And he said, Behold, thou shalt see it with thine eyes, but shalt not eat thereof. 7:3 And there were four leprous men at Da entering in of Da gate: and they said one to another, Why sit we here until we die? 7:4 If we say, We will enter into Da city, then Da famine is in Da city, and we shall die there: and if we sit still here, we die also. Now therefore come, and let us fall unto Da host of Da Syrians: if they save us alive, we shall live; and if they kill us, we shall but die. 7:5 And they rose up in Da twilight, to go unto Da camp of Da Syrians: and when they were come to Da uttermost part of Da camp of Syria, behold, there was no man there. 7:6 For Da LORD had made Da host of Da Syrians to hear a noise of chariots, and a noise of horses, even Da noise of a great host: and they said one to another, Lo, Da king of Israel hath hired against us Da kings of Da Hittites, and Da kings of Da Egyptians, to come upon us. 7:7 Wherefore they arose and fled in Da twilight, and left their tents, and their horses, and their asses, even Da camp as it was, and fled for their life. 7:8 And when these lepers came to Da uttermost part of Da camp, they went into one tent, and did eat and drink, and carried thence silver, and gold, and raiment, and went and hid it; and came again, and entered into another tent, and carried thence also, and went and hid it. 7:9 Then they said one to another, We do not well: this day is a day of good tidings, and we hold our peace: if we tarry till Da morning light, some mischief will come upon us: now therefore come, that we may go and tell Da king’s household. 7:10 So they came and called unto Da porter of Da city: and they told them, saying, We came to Da camp of Da Syrians, and, behold, there was no man there, neither voice of man, but horses tied, and asses tied, and Da tents as they were. 7:11 And he called Da porters; and they told it to Da king’s house within. 7:12 And Da king arose in Da night, and said unto his servants, I will now shew you what Da Syrians have done to us. They know that we be hungry; therefore are they gone out of Da camp to hide themselves in Da field, saying, When they come out of Da city, we shall catch them alive, and get into Da city. 7:13 And one of his servants answered and said, Let some take, I pray thee, five of Da horses that remain, which are left in Da city, (behold, they are as all Da multitude of Israel that are left in it: behold, I say, they are even as all Da multitude of Da Israelites that are consumed:) and let us send and see. 7:14 They took therefore two chariot horses; and Da king sent after Da host of Da Syrians, saying, Go and see. 7:15 And they went after them unto Jordan: and, lo, all Da way was full of garments and vessels, which Da Syrians had cast away in their haste. And Da messengers returned, and told Da king. 7:16 And Da people went out, and spoiled Da tents of Da Syrians. So a measure of fine flour was sold for a shekel, and two measures of barley for a shekel, according to Da word of Da LORD. 7:17 And Da king appointed Da lord on whose hand he leaned to have Da charge of Da gate: and Da people trode upon him in Da gate, and he died, as Da man of God had said, who spake when Da king came down to him. 7:18 And it came to pass as Da man of God had spoken to Da king, saying, Two measures of barley for a shekel, and a measure of fine flour for a shekel, shall be to morrow about this time in Da gate of Samaria: 7:19 And that lord answered Da man of God, and said, Now, behold, if Da LORD should make windows in heaven, might such a thing be? And he said, Behold, thou shalt see it with thine eyes, but shalt not eat thereof. 7:20 And so it fell out unto him: for Da people trode upon him in Da gate, and he died. 8:1 Then spake Elisha unto Da woman, whose son he had restored to life, saying, Arise, and go thou and thine household, and sojourn wheresoever thou canst sojourn: for Da LORD hath called for a famine; and it shall also come upon Da land seven years. 8:2 And Da woman arose, and did after Da saying of Da man of God: and she went with her household, and sojourned in Da land of Da Philistines seven years. 8:3 And it came to pass at Da seven years’ end, that Da woman returned out of Da land of Da Philistines: and she went forth to cry unto Da king for her house and for her land. 8:4 And Da king talked with Gehazi Da servant of Da man of God, saying, Tell me, I pray thee, all Da great things that Elisha hath done. 8:5 And it came to pass, as he was telling Da king how he had restored a dead body to life, that, behold, Da woman, whose son he had restored to life, cried to Da king for her house and for her land. And Gehazi said, My lord, O king, this is Da woman, and this is her son, whom Elisha restored to life. 8:6 And when Da king asked Da woman, she told him. So Da king appointed unto her a certain officer, saying, Restore all that was hers, and all Da fruits of Da field since Da day that she left Da land, even until now. 8:7 And Elisha came to Damascus; and Benhadad Da king of Syria was sick; and it was told him, saying, The man of God is come hither. 8:8 And Da king said unto Hazael, Take a present in thine hand, and go, meet Da man of God, and enquire of Da LORD by him, saying, Shall I recover of this disease? 8:9 So Hazael went to meet him, and took a present with him, even of every good thing of Damascus, forty camels’ burden, and came and stood before him, and said, Thy son Benhadad king of Syria hath sent me to thee, saying, Shall I recover of this disease? 8:10 And Elisha said unto him, Go, say unto him, Thou mayest certainly recover: howbeit Da LORD hath shewed me that he shall surely die. 8:11 And he settled his countenance stedfastly, until he was ashamed: and Da man of God wept. 8:12 And Hazael said, Why weepeth my lord? And he answered, Because I know Da evil that thou wilt do unto Da children of Israel: their strong holds wilt thou set on fire, and their young men wilt thou slay with Da sword, and wilt dash their children, and rip up their women with child. 8:13 And Hazael said, But what, is thy servant a dog, that he should do this great thing? And Elisha answered, The LORD hath shewed me that thou shalt be king over Syria. 8:14 So he departed from Elisha, and came to his master; who said to him, What said Elisha to thee? And he answered, He told me that thou shouldest surely recover. 8:15 And it came to pass on Da morrow, that he took a thick cloth, and dipped it in water, and spread it on his face, so that he died: and Hazael reigned in his stead. 8:16 And in Da fifth year of Joram Da son of Ahab king of Israel, Jehoshaphat being then king of Judah, Jehoram Da son of Je hoshaphat king of Judah began to reign. 8:17 Thirty and two years old was he when he began to reign; and he reigned eight years in Jerusalem. 8:18 And he walked in Da way of Da kings of Israel, as did Da house of Ahab: for Da daughter of Ahab was his wife: and he did evil in Da sight of Da LORD. 8:19 Yet Da LORD would not destroy Judah for David his servant’s sake, as he promised him to give him alway a light, and to his children. 8:20 In his days Edom revolted from under Da hand of Judah, and made a king over themselves. 8:21 So Joram went over to Zair, and all Da chariots with him: and he rose by night, and smote Da Edomites which compassed him about, and Da captains of Da chariots: and Da people fled into their tents. 8:22 Yet Edom revolted from under Da hand of Judah unto this day. Then Libnah revolted at Da same time. 8:23 And Da rest of Da acts of Joram, and all that he did, are they not written in Da book of Da chronicles of Da kings of Judah? 8:24 And Joram slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in Da city of David: and Ahaziah his son reigned in his stead. 8:25 In Da twelfth year of Joram Da son of Ahab king of Israel did Ahaziah Da son of Jehoram king of Judah begin to reign. 8:26 Two and twenty years old was Ahaziah when he began to reign; and he reigned one year in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Athaliah, Da daughter of Omri king of Israel. 8:27 And he walked in Da way of Da house of Ahab, and did evil in Da sight of Da LORD, as did Da house of Ahab: for he was Da son in law of Da house of Ahab. 8:28 And he went with Joram Da son of Ahab to Da war against Hazael king of Syria in Ramothgilead; and Da Syrians wounded Joram. 8:29 And king Joram went back to be healed in Jezreel of Da wounds which Da Syrians had given him at Ramah, when he fought against Hazael king of Syria. And Ahaziah Da son of Jehoram king of Judah went down to see Joram Da son of Ahab in Jezreel, because he was sick. 9:1 And Elisha Da prophet called one of Da children of Da prophets, and said unto him, Gird up thy loins, and take this box of oil in thine hand, and go to Ramothgilead: 9:2 And when thou comest thither, look out there Jehu Da son of Jehoshaphat Da son of Nimshi, and go in, and make him arise up from among his brethren, and carry him to an inner chamber; 9:3 Then take Da box of oil, and pour it on his head, and say, Thus saith Da LORD, I have anointed thee king over Israel. Then open Da door, and flee, and tarry not. 9:4 So Da young man, even Da young man Da prophet, went to Ramothgilead. 9:5 And when he came, behold, Da captains of Da host were sitting; and he said, I have an errand to thee, O captain. And Jehu said, Unto which of all us? And he said, To thee, O captain. 9:6 And he arose, and went into Da house; and he poured Da oil on his head, and said unto him, Thus saith Da LORD God of Israel, I have anointed thee king over Da people of Da LORD, even over Israel. 9:7 And thou shalt smite Da house of Ahab thy master, that I may avenge Da blood of my servants Da prophets, and Da blood of all Da servants of Da LORD, at Da hand of Jezebel. 9:8 For Da whole house of Ahab shall perish: and I will cut off from Ahab him that pisseth against Da wall, and him that is shut up and left in Israel: 9:9 And I will make Da house of Ahab like Da house of Jeroboam Da son of Nebat, and like Da house of Baasha Da son of Ahijah: 9:10 And Da dogs shall eat Jezebel in Da portion of Jezreel, and there shall be none to bury her. And he opened Da door, and fled. 9:11 Then Jehu came forth to Da servants of his lord: and one said unto him, Is all well? wherefore came this mad fellow to thee? And he said unto them, Ye know Da man, and his communication. 9:12 And they said, It is false; tell us now. And he said, Thus and thus spake he to me, saying, Thus saith Da LORD, I have anointed thee king over Israel. 9:13 Then they hasted, and took every man his garment, and put it under him on Da top of Da stairs, and blew with trumpets, saying, Jehu is king. 9:14 So Jehu Da son of Jehoshaphat Da son of Nimshi conspired against Joram. (Now Joram had kept Ramothgilead, he and all Israel, because of Hazael king of Syria. 9:15 But king Joram was returned to be healed in Jezreel of Da wounds which Da Syrians had given him, when he fought with Hazael king of Syria.) And Jehu said, If it be your minds, then let none go forth nor escape out of Da city to go to tell it in Jezreel. 9:16 So Jehu rode in a chariot, and went to Jezreel; for Joram lay there. And Ahaziah king of Judah was come down to see Joram. 9:17 And there stood a watchman on Da tower in Jezreel, and he spied Da company of Jehu as he came, and said, I see a company. And Joram said, Take an horseman, and send to meet them, and let him say, Is it peace? 9:18 So there went one on horseback to meet him, and said, Thus saith Da king, Is it peace? And Jehu said, What hast thou to do with peace? turn thee behind me. And Da watchman told, saying, The messenger came to them, but he cometh not again. 9:19 Then he sent out a second on horseback, which came to them, and said, Thus saith Da king, Is it peace? And Jehu answered, What hast thou to do with peace? turn thee behind me. 9:20 And Da watchman told, saying, He came even unto them, and cometh not again: and Da driving is like Da driving of Jehu Da son of Nimshi; for he driveth furiously. 9:21 And Joram said, Make ready. And his chariot was made ready. And Joram king of Israel and Ahaziah king of Judah went out, each in his chariot, and they went out against Jehu, and met him in Da portion of Naboth Da Jezreelite. 9:22 And it came to pass, when Joram saw Jehu, that he said, Is it peace, Jehu? And he answered, What peace, so long as Da whoredoms of thy mother Jezebel and her witchcrafts are so many? 9:23 And Joram turned his hands, and fled, and said to Ahaziah, There is treachery, O Ahaziah. 9:24 And Jehu drew a bow with his full strength, and smote Jehoram between his arms, and Da arrow went out at his heart, and he sunk down in his chariot. 9:25 Then said Jehu to Bidkar his captain, Take up, and cast him in Da portion of Da field of Naboth Da Jezreelite: for remember how that, when I and thou rode together after Ahab his father, Da LORD laid this burden upon him; 9:26 Surely I have seen yesterday Da blood of Naboth, and Da blood of his sons, saith Da LORD; and I will requite thee in this plat, saith Da LORD. Now therefore take and cast him into Da plat of ground, according to Da word of Da LORD. 9:27 But when Ahaziah Da king of Judah saw this, he fled by Da way of Da garden house. And Jehu followed after him, and said, Smite him also in Da chariot. And they did so at Da going up to Gur, which is by Ibleam. And he fled to Megiddo, and died there. 9:28 And his servants carried him in a chariot to Jerusalem, and buried him in his sepulchre with his fathers in Da city of David. 9:29 And in Da eleventh year of Joram Da son of Ahab began Ahaziah to reign over Judah. 9:30 And when Jehu was come to Jezreel, Jezebel heard of it; and she painted her face, and tired her head, and looked out at a window. 9:31 And as Jehu entered in at Da gate, she said, Had Zimri peace, who slew his master? 9:32 And he lifted up his face to Da window, and said, Who is on my side? who? And there looked out to him two or three eunuchs. 9:33 And he said, Throw her down. So they threw her down: and some of her blood was sprinkled on Da wall, and on Da horses: and he trode her under foot. 9:34 And when he was come in, he did eat and drink, and said, Go, see now this cursed woman, and bury her: for she is a king’s daughter. 9:35 And they went to bury her: but they found no more of her than Da skull, and Da feet, and Da palms of her hands. 9:36 Wherefore they came again, and told him. And he said, This is Da word of Da LORD, which he spake by his servant Elijah Da Tishbite, saying, In Da portion of Jezreel shall dogs eat Da flesh of Jezebel: 9:37 And Da carcase of Jezebel shall be as dung upon Da face of Da field in Da portion of Jezreel; so that they shall not say, This is Jezebel. 10:1 And Ahab had seventy sons in Samaria. And Jehu wrote letters, and sent to Samaria, unto Da rulers of Jezreel, to Da elders, and to them that brought up Ahab’s children, saying, 10:2 Now as soon as this letter cometh to you, seeing your master’s sons are with you, and there are with you chariots and horses, a fenced city also, and armour; 10:3 Look even out Da best and meetest of your master’s sons, and set him on his father’s throne, and fight for your master’s house. 10:4 But they were exceedingly afraid, and said, Behold, two kings stood not before him: how then shall we stand? 10:5 And he that was over Da house, and he that was over Da city, Da elders also, and Da bringers up of Da children, sent to Jehu, saying, We are thy servants, and will do all that thou shalt bid us; we will not make any king: do thou that which is good in thine eyes. 10:6 Then he wrote a letter Da second time to them, saying, If ye be mine, and if ye will hearken unto my voice, take ye Da heads of Da men your master’s sons, and come to me to Jezreel by to morrow this time. Now Da king’s sons, being seventy persons, were with Da great men of Da city, which brought them up. 10:7 And it came to pass, when Da letter came to them, that they took Da king’s sons, and slew seventy persons, and put their heads in baskets, and sent him them to Jezreel. 10:8 And there came a messenger, and told him, saying, They have brought Da heads of Da king’s sons. And he said, Lay ye them in two heaps at Da entering in of Da gate until Da morning. 10:9 And it came to pass in Da morning, that he went out, and stood, and said to all Da people, Ye be righteous: behold, I conspired against my master, and slew him: but who slew all these? 10:10 Know now that there shall fall unto Da earth nothing of Da word of Da LORD, which Da LORD spake concerning Da house of Ahab: for Da LORD hath done that which he spake by his servant Elijah. 10:11 So Jehu slew all that remained of Da house of Ahab in Jezreel, and all his great men, and his kinsfolks, and his priests, until he left him none remaining. 10:12 And he arose and departed, and came to Samaria. And as he was at Da shearing house in Da way, 10:13 Jehu met with Da brethren of Ahaziah king of Judah, and said, Who are ye? And they answered, We are Da brethren of Ahaziah; and we go down to salute Da children of Da king and Da children of Da queen. 10:14 And he said, Take them alive. And Jehonadab answered, It is. If it be, give me thine hand. And he gave him his hand; and he took him up to him into Da chariot. 10:16 And he said, Come with me, and see my zeal for Da LORD. So they made him ride in his chariot. 10:17 And when he came to Samaria, he slew all that remained unto Ahab in Samaria, till he had destroyed him, according to Da saying of Da LORD, which he spake to Elijah. 10:18 And Jehu gathered all Da people together, and said unto them, Ahab served Baal a little; but Jehu shall serve him much. 10:19 Now therefore call unto me all Da prophets of Baal, all his servants, and all his priests; let none be wanting: for I have a great sacrifice to do to Baal; whosoever shall be wanting, he shall not live. But Jehu did it in subtilty, to Da intent that he might destroy Da worshippers of Baal. 10:20 And Jehu said, Proclaim a solemn assembly for Baal. And they proclaimed it. 10:21 And Jehu sent through all Israel: and all Da worshippers of Baal came, so that there was not a man left that came not. And they came into Da house of Baal; and Da house of Baal was full from one end to another. 10:22 And he said unto him that was over Da vestry, Bring forth vestments for all Da worshippers of Baal. And he brought them forth vestments. 10:23 And Jehu went, and Jehonadab Da son of Rechab, into Da house of Baal, and said unto Da worshippers of Baal, Search, and look that there be here with you none of Da servants of Da LORD, but Da worshippers of Baal only. 10:24 And when they went in to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings, Jehu appointed fourscore men without, and said, If any of Da men whom I have brought into your hands escape, he that letteth him go, his life shall be for Da life of him. 10:25 And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end of offering Da burnt offering, that Jehu said to Da guard and to Da captains, Go in, and slay them; let none come forth. And they smote them with Da edge of Da sword; and Da guard and Da captains cast them out, and went to Da city of Da house of Baal. 10:26 And they brought forth Da images out of Da house of Baal, and burned them. 10:27 And they brake down Da image of Baal, and brake down Da house of Baal, and made it a draught house unto this day. 10:28 Thus Jehu destroyed Baal out of Israel. 10:29 Howbeit from Da sins of Jeroboam Da son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin, Jehu departed not from after them, to wit, Da golden calves that were in Bethel, and that were in Dan. 10:30 And Da LORD said unto Jehu, Because thou hast done well in executing that which is right in mine eyes, and hast done unto Da house of Ahab according to all that was in mine heart, thy children of Da fourth generation shall sit on Da throne of Israel. 10:31 But Jehu took no heed to walk in Da law of Da LORD God of Israel with all his heart: for he departed not from Da sins of Jeroboam, which made Israel to sin. 10:32 In those days Da LORD began to cut Israel short: and Hazael smote them in all Da coasts of Israel; 10:33 From Jordan eastward, all Da land of Gilead, Da Gadites, and Da Reubenites, and Da Manassites, from Aroer, which is by Da river Arnon, even Gilead and Bashan. 10:34 Now Da rest of Da acts of Jehu, and all that he did, and all his might, are they not written in Da book of Da chronicles of Da kings of Israel? 10:35 And Jehu slept with his fathers: and they buried him in Samaria. And Jehoahaz his son reigned in his stead. 10:36 And Da time that Jehu reigned over Israel in Samaria was twenty and eight years. 11:1 And when Athaliah Da mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she arose and destroyed all Da seed royal. 11:2 But Jehosheba, Da daughter of king Joram, sister of Ahaziah, took Joash Da son of Ahaziah, and stole him from among Da king’s sons which were slain; and they hid him, even him and his nurse, in Da bedchamber from Athaliah, so that he was not slain. 11:3 And he was with her hid in Da house of Da LORD six years. Three times did Joash beat him, and recovered Da cities of Israel. 14:1 In Da second year of Joash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel reigned Amaziah Da son of Joash king of Judah. 14:2 He was twenty and five years old when he began to reign, and reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Jecholiah of Jerusalem. 15:3 And he did that which was right in Da sight of Da LORD, according to all that his father Amaziah had done; 15:4 Save that Da high places were not removed: Da people sacrificed and burnt incense still on Da high places. 15:5 And Da LORD smote Da king, so that he was a leper unto Da day of his death, and dwelt in a several house. And so it came to pass. 15:13 Shallum Da son of Jabesh began to reign in Da nine and thirtieth year of Uzziah king of Judah; and he reigned a full month in Samaria. 15:14 For Menahem Da son of Gadi went up from Tirzah, and came to Samaria, and smote Shallum Da son of Jabesh in Samaria, and slew him, and reigned in his stead. 15:15 And Da rest of Da acts of Shallum, and his conspiracy which he made, behold, they are written in Da book of Da chronicles of Da kings of Israel. 15:16 Then Menahem smote Tiphsah, and all that were therein, and Da coasts thereof from Tirzah: because they opened not to him, therefore he smote it; and all Da women therein that were with child he ripped up. 15:17 In Da nine and thirtieth year of Azariah king of Judah began Menahem Da son of Gadi to reign over Israel, and reigned ten years in Samaria. 15:18 And he did that which was evil in Da sight of Da LORD: he departed not all his days from Da sins of Jeroboam Da son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin. 15:19 And Pul Da king of Assyria came against Da land: and Menahem gave Pul a thousand talents of silver, that his hand might be with him to confirm Da kingdom in his hand. 15:20 And Menahem exacted Da money of Israel, even of all Da mighty men of wealth, of each man fifty shekels of silver, to give to Da king of Assyria. So Da king of Assyria turned back, and stayed not there in Da land. 15:21 And Da rest of Da acts of Menahem, and all that he did, are they not written in Da book of Da chronicles of Da kings of Israel? 15:22 And Menahem slept with his fathers; and Pekahiah his son reigned in his stead. 15:23 In Da fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah Pekahiah Da son of Menahem began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned two years. 15:24 And he did that which was evil in Da sight of Da LORD: he departed not from Da sins of Jeroboam Da son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin. 15:25 But Pekah Da son of Remaliah, a captain of his, conspired against him, and smote him in Samaria, in Da palace of Da king’s house, with Argob and Arieh, and with him fifty men of Da Gileadites: and he killed him, and reigned in his room. 15:26 And Da rest of Da acts of Pekahiah, and all that he did, behold, they are written in Da book of Da chronicles of Da kings of Israel. 15:27 In Da two and fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah Pekah Da son of Remaliah began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned twenty years. 15:28 And he did that which was evil in Da sight of Da LORD: he departed not from Da sins of Jeroboam Da son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin. 15:29 In Da days of Pekah king of Israel came Tiglathpileser king of Assyria, and took Ijon, and Abelbethmaachah, and Janoah, and Kedesh, and Hazor, and Gilead, and Galilee, all Da land of Naphtali, and carried them captive to Assyria. 15:30 And Hoshea Da son of Elah made a conspiracy against Pekah Da son of Remaliah, and smote him, and slew him, and reigned in his stead, in Da twentieth year of Jotham Da son of Uzziah. 15:31 And Da rest of Da acts of Pekah, and all that he did, behold, they are written in Da book of Da chronicles of Da kings of Israel. 15:32 In Da second year of Pekah Da son of Remaliah king of Israel began Jotham Da son of Uzziah king of Judah to reign. 15:33 Five and twenty years old was he when he began to reign, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Jerusha, Da daughter of Zadok. 15:34 And he did that which was right in Da sight of Da LORD: he did according to all that his father Uzziah had done. 15:35 Howbeit Da high places were not removed: Da people sacrificed and burned incense still in Da high places. He built Da higher gate of Da house of Da LORD. 15:36 Now Da rest of Da acts of Jotham, and all that he did, are they not written in Da book of Da chronicles of Da kings of Judah? 15:37 In those days So was Israel carried away out of their own land to Assyria unto this day. 17:24 And Da king of Assyria brought men from Babylon, and from Cuthah, and from Ava, and from Hamath, and from Sepharvaim, and placed them in Da cities of Samaria instead of Da children of Israel: and they possessed Samaria, and dwelt in Da cities thereof. 17:25 And so it was at Da beginning of their dwelling there, that they feared not Da LORD: therefore Da LORD sent lions among them, which slew some of them. 17:26 Wherefore they spake to Da king of Assyria, saying, The nations which thou hast removed, and placed in Da cities of Samaria, know not Da manner of Da God of Da land: therefore he hath sent lions among them, and, behold, they slay them, because they know not Da manner of Da God of Da land. 17:27 Then Da king of Assyria commanded, saying, Carry thither one of Da priests whom ye brought from thence; and let them go and dwell there, and let him teach them Da manner of Da God of Da land. 17:28 Then one of Da priests whom they had carried away from Samaria came and dwelt in Bethel, and taught them how they should fear Da LORD. 17:29 Howbeit every nation made gods of their own, and put them in Da houses of Da high places which Da Samaritans had made, every nation in their cities wherein they dwelt. 17:30 And Da men of Babylon made Succothbenoth, and Da men of Cuth made Nergal, and Da men of Hamath made Ashima, 17:31 And Da Avites made Nibhaz and Tartak, and Da Sepharvites burnt their children in fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, Da gods of Sepharvaim. 17:32 So they feared Da LORD, and made unto themselves of Da lowest of them priests of Da high places, which sacrificed for them in Da houses of Da high places. 17:33 They feared Da LORD, and served their own gods, after Da manner of Da nations whom they carried away from thence. 17:34 Unto this day they do after Da former manners: they fear not Da LORD, neither do they after their statutes, or after their ordinances, or after Da law and commandment which Da LORD commanded Da children of Jacob, whom he named Israel; 17:35 With whom Da LORD had made a covenant, and charged them, saying, Ye shall not fear other gods, nor bow yourselves to them, nor serve them, nor sacrifice to them: 17:36 But Da LORD, who brought you up out of Da land of Egypt with great power and a stretched out arm, him shall ye fear, and him shall ye worship, and to him shall ye do sacrifice. 17:37 And Da statutes, and Da ordinances, and Da law, and Da commandment, which he wrote for you, ye shall observe to do for evermore; and ye shall not fear other gods. 17:38 And Da covenant that I have made with you ye shall not forget; neither shall ye fear other gods. 17:39 But Da LORD your God ye shall fear; and he shall deliver you out of Da hand of all your enemies. 17:40 Howbeit they did not hearken, but they did after their former manner. 17:41 So these nations feared Da LORD, and served their graven images, both their children, and their children’s children: as did their fathers, so do they unto this day. 18:1 Now it came to pass in Da third year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, that Hezekiah Da son of Ahaz king of Judah began to reign. 18:2 Twenty and five years old was he when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name also was Abi, Da daughter of Zachariah. 18:3 And he did that which was right in Da sight of Da LORD, according to all that David his father did. 18:4 He removed Da high places, and brake Da images, and cut down Da groves, and brake in pieces Da brasen serpent that Moses had made: for unto those days Da children of Israel did burn incense to it: and he called it Nehushtan. 18:5 He trusted in Da LORD God of Israel; so that after him was none like him among all Da kings of Judah, nor any that were before him. 18:6 For he clave to Da LORD, and departed not from following him, but kept his commandments, which Da LORD commanded Moses. 18:7 And Da LORD was with him; and he prospered whithersoever he went forth: and he rebelled against Da king of Assyria, and served him not. 18:8 He smote Da Philistines, even unto Gaza, and Da borders thereof, from Da tower of Da watchmen to Da fenced city. 18:9 And it came to pass in Da fourth year of king Hezekiah, which was Da seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, that Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against Samaria, and besieged it. 18:10 And at Da end of three years they took it: even in Da sixth year of Hezekiah, that is in Da ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel, Samaria was taken. 18:11 And Da king of Assyria did carry away Israel unto Assyria, and put them in Halah and in Habor by Da river of Gozan, and in Da cities of Da Medes: 18:12 Because they obeyed not Da voice of Da LORD their God, but transgressed his covenant, and all that Moses Da servant of Da LORD commanded, and would not hear them, nor do them. 18:13 Now in Da fourteenth year of king Hezekiah did Sennacherib king of Assyria come up against all Da fenced cities of Judah, and took them. 18:14 And Hezekiah king of Judah sent to Da king of Assyria to Lachish, saying, I have offended; return from me: that which thou puttest on me will I bear. And Da king of Assyria appointed unto Hezekiah king of Judah three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold. 18:15 And Hezekiah gave him all Da silver that was found in Da house of Da LORD, and in Da treasures of Da king’s house. 18:16 At that time did Hezekiah cut off Da gold from Da doors of Da temple of Da LORD, and from Da pillars which Hezekiah king of Judah had overlaid, and gave it to Da king of Assyria. 18:17 And Da king of Assyria sent Tartan and Rabsaris and Rabshakeh from Lachish to king Hezekiah with a great host against Jerusalem. And they went up and came to Jerusalem. And when they were come up, they came and stood by Da conduit of Da upper pool, which is in Da highway of Da fuller’s field. 18:18 And when they had called to Da king, there came out to them Eliakim Da son of Hilkiah, which was over Da household, and Shebna Da scribe, and Joah Da son of Asaph Da recorder. 18:19 And Rabshakeh said unto them, Speak ye now to Hezekiah, Thus saith Da great king, Da king of Assyria, What confidence is this wherein thou trustest? 18:20 Thou sayest, (but they are but vain words,) I have counsel and strength for Da war. Now on whom dost thou trust, that thou rebellest against me? 18:21 Now, behold, thou trustest upon Da staff of this bruised reed, even upon Egypt, on which if a man lean, it will go into his hand, and pierce it: so is Pharaoh king of Egypt unto all that trust on him. 18:22 But if ye say unto me, We trust in Da LORD our God: is not that he, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath taken away, and hath said to Judah and Jerusalem, Ye shall worship before this altar in Jerusalem? 18:23 Now therefore, I pray thee, give pledges to my lord Da king of Assyria, and I will deliver thee two thousand horses, if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them. 18:24 How then wilt thou turn away Da face of one captain of Da least of my master’s servants, and put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen? 18:25 Am I now come up without Da LORD against this place to destroy it? The LORD said to me, Go up against this land, and destroy it. 18:26 Then said Eliakim Da son of Hilkiah, and Shebna, and Joah, unto Rabshakeh, Speak, I pray thee, to thy servants in Da Syrian clothes rent, and told him Da words of Rabshakeh. 19:1 And it came to pass, when king Hezekiah heard it, that he rent his clothes, and covered himself with sackcloth, and went into Da house of Da
