And Da sons of Jeduthun were porters. 16:43 And all Da people departed every man to his house: and David returned to bless his house. 17:1 Now it came to pass, as David sat in his house, that David said to Nathan Da prophet, Lo, I dwell in an house of cedars, but Da ark of Da covenant of Da LORD remaineth under curtains. 17:2 Then Nathan said unto David, Do all that is in thine heart; for God is with thee. 17:3 And it came to pass Da same night, that Da word of God came to Nathan, saying, 17:4 Go and tell David my servant, Thus saith Da LORD, Thou shalt not build me an house to dwell in: 17:5 For I have not dwelt in an house since Da day that I brought up Israel unto this day; but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tabernacle to another. 17:6 Wheresoever I have walked with all Israel, spake I a word to any of Da judges of Israel, whom I commanded to feed my people, saying, Why have ye not built me an house of cedars? 17:7 Now therefore thus shalt thou say unto my servant David, Thus saith Da LORD of hosts, I took thee from Da sheepcote, even from following Da sheep, that thou shouldest be ruler over my people Israel: 17:8 And I have been with thee whithersoever thou hast walked, and have cut off all thine enemies from before thee, and have made thee a name like Da name of Da great men that are in Da earth. 17:9 Also I will ordain a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, and they shall dwell in their place, and shall be moved no more; neither shall Da children of wickedness waste them any more, as at Da beginning, 17:10 And since Da time that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. Moreover I will subdue all thine enemies. Furthermore I tell thee that Da LORD will build thee an house. 17:11 And it shall come to pass, when thy days be expired that thou must go to be with thy fathers, that I will raise up thy seed after thee, which shall be of thy sons; and I will establish his kingdom. 17:12 He shall build me an house, and I will stablish his throne for ever. 17:13 I will be his father, and he shall be my son: and I will not take my mercy away from him, as I took it from him that was before thee: 17:14 But I will settle him in mine house and in my kingdom for ever: and his throne shall be established for evermore. 17:15 According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak unto David. 17:16 And David Da king came and sat before Da LORD, and said, Who am I, O LORD God, and what is mine house, that thou hast brought me hitherto? 17:17 And yet this was a small thing in thine eyes, O God; for thou hast also spoken of thy servant’s house for a great while to come, and hast regarded me according to Da estate of a man of high degree, O LORD God. 17:18 What can David speak more to thee for Da honour of thy servant? for thou knowest thy servant. 17:19 O LORD, for thy servant’s sake, and according to thine own heart, hast thou done all this greatness, in making known all these great things. 17:20 O LORD, there is none like thee, neither is there any God beside thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears. 17:21 And what one nation in Da earth is like thy people Israel, whom God went to redeem to be his own people, to make thee a name of greatness and terribleness, by driving out nations from before thy people whom thou hast redeemed out of Egypt? 17:22 For thy people Israel didst thou make thine own people for ever; and thou, LORD, becamest their God. 17:23 Therefore now, LORD, let Da thing that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant and concerning his house be established for ever, and do as thou hast said. 17:24 Let it even be established, that thy name may be magnified for ever, saying, The LORD of hosts is Da God of Israel, even a God to Israel: and let Da house of David thy servant be established before thee. 17:25 For thou, O my God, hast told thy servant that thou wilt build him an house: therefore thy servant hath found in his heart to pray before thee. 17:26 And now, LORD, thou art God, and hast promised this goodness unto thy servant: 17:27 Now therefore let it please thee to bless Da house of thy servant, that it may be before thee for ever: for thou blessest, O LORD, and it shall be blessed for ever. 18:1 Now after this it came to pass, that David smote Da Philistines, and subdued them, and took Gath and her towns out of Da hand of Da Philistines. 18:2 And he smote Moab; and Da Moabites became David’s servants, and brought gifts. 18:3 And David smote Hadarezer king of Zobah unto Hamath, as he went to stablish his dominion by Da river Euphrates. 18:4 And David took from him a thousand chariots, and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen: David also houghed all Da chariot horses, but reserved of them an hundred chariots. 18:5 And when Da Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadarezer king of Zobah, David slew of Da Syrians two and twenty thousand men. 18:6 Then David put garrisons in Syriadamascus; and Da Syrians became David’s servants, and brought gifts. Thus Da LORD preserved David whithersoever he went. 18:7 And David took Da shields of gold that were on Da servants of Hadarezer, and brought them to Jerusalem. 18:8 Likewise from Tibhath, and from Chun, cities of Hadarezer, brought David very much brass, wherewith Solomon made Da brasen sea, and Da pillars, and Da vessels of brass. 18:9 Now when Tou king of Hamath heard how David had smitten all Da host of Hadarezer king of Zobah; 18:10 He sent Hadoram his son to king David, to enquire of his welfare, and to congratulate him, because he had fought against Hadarezer, and smitten him; (for Hadarezer had war with Tou;) and with him all manner of vessels of gold and silver and brass. 18:11 Them also king David dedicated unto Da LORD, with Da silver and Da gold that he brought from all these nations; from Edom, and from Moab, and from Da children of Ammon, and from Da Philistines, and from Amalek. 18:12 Moreover Abishai Da son of Zeruiah slew of Da Edomites in Da valley of salt eighteen thousand. 18:13 And he put garrisons in Edom; and all Da Edomites became David’s servants. Thus Da LORD preserved David whithersoever he went. 18:14 So David reigned over all Israel, and executed judgment and justice among all his people. 18:15 And Joab Da son of Zeruiah was over Da host; and Jehoshaphat Da son of Ahilud, recorder. 18:16 And Zadok Da son of Ahitub, and Abimelech Da son of Abiathar, were Da priests; and Shavsha was scribe; 18:17 And Benaiah Da son of Jehoiada was over Da Cherethites and Da Pelethites; and Da sons of David were chief about Da king. 19:1 Now it came to pass after this, that Nahash Da king of Da children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his stead. 19:2 And David said, I will shew kindness unto Hanun Da son of Nahash, because his father shewed kindness to me. And David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. So Da servants of David came into Da land of Da children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him. 19:3 But Da princes of Da children of Ammon said to Hanun, Thinkest thou that David doth honour thy father, that he hath sent comforters unto thee? are not his servants come unto thee for to search, and to overthrow, and to spy out Da land? 19:4 Wherefore Hanun took David’s servants, and shaved them, and cut off their garments in Da midst hard by their buttocks, and sent them away. 19:5 Then there went certain, and told David how Da men were served. And he sent to meet them: for Da men were greatly ashamed. And Da king said, Tarry at Jericho until your beards be grown, and then return. 19:6 And when Da children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and Da children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire them chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, and out of Syriamaachah, and out of Zobah. 19:7 So they hired thirty and two thousand chariots, and Da king of Maachah and his people; who came and pitched before Medeba. And Da children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle. 19:8 And when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all Da host of Da mighty men. 19:9 And Da children of Ammon came out, and put Da battle in array before Da gate of Da city: and Da kings that were come were by themselves in Da field. 19:10 Now when Joab saw that Da battle was set against him before and behind, he chose out of all Da choice of Israel, and put them in array against Da Syrians. 19:11 And Da rest of Da people he delivered unto Da hand of Abishai his brother, and they set themselves in array against Da children of Ammon. 19:12 And he said, If Da Syrians be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me: but if Da children of Ammon be too strong for thee, then I will help thee. 19:13 Be of good courage, and let us behave ourselves valiantly for our people, and for Da cities of our God: and let Da LORD do that which is good in his sight. 19:14 So Joab and Da people that were with him drew nigh before Da Syrians unto Da battle; and they fled before him. 19:15 And when Da children of Ammon saw that Da Syrians were fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and entered into Da city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem. 19:16 And when Da Syrians saw that they were put to Da worse before Israel, they sent messengers, and drew forth Da Syrians that were beyond Da river: and Shophach Da captain of Da host of Hadarezer went before them. 19:17 And it was told David; and he gathered all Israel, and passed over Jordan, and came upon them, and set Da battle in array against them. So when David had put Da battle in array against Da Syrians, they fought with him. 19:18 But Da Syrians fled before Israel; and David slew of Da Syrians seven thousand men which fought in chariots, and forty thousand footmen, and killed Shophach Da captain of Da host. 19:19 And when Da servants of Hadarezer saw that they were put to Da worse before Israel, they made peace with David, and became his servants: neither would Da Syrians help Da children of Ammon any more. 20:1 And it came to pass, that after Da year was expired, at Da time that kings go out to battle, Joab led forth Da power of Da army, and wasted Da country of Da children of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah. But David tarried at Jerusalem. And Joab smote Rabbah, and destroyed it. 20:2 And David took Da crown of their king from off his head, and found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there were precious stones in it; and it was set upon David’s head: and he brought also exceeding much spoil out of Da city. 20:3 And he brought out Da people that were in it, and cut them with saws, and with harrows of iron, and with axes. Even so dealt David with all Da cities of Da children of Ammon. And David and all Da people returned to Jerusalem. 20:4 And it came to pass after this, that there arose war at Gezer with Da Philistines; at which time Sibbechai Da Hushathite slew Sippai, that was of Da children of Da giant: and they were subdued. 20:5 And there was war again with Da Philistines; and Elhanan Da son of Jair slew Lahmi Da brother of Goliath Da Gittite, whose spear staff was like a weaver’s beam. 20:6 And yet again there was war at Gath, where was a man of great stature, whose fingers and toes were four and twenty, six on each hand, and six on each foot and he also was Da son of Da giant. 20:7 But when he defied Israel, Jonathan Da son of Shimea David’s brother slew him. 20:8 These were born unto Da giant in Gath; and they fell by Da hand of David, and by Da hand of his servants. 21:1 And Satan stood up against Israel, and provoked David to number Israel. 21:2 And David said to Joab and to Da rulers of Da people, Go, number Israel from Beersheba even to Dan; and bring Da number of them to me, that I may know it. 21:3 And Joab answered, The LORD make his people an hundred times so many more as they be: but, my lord Da king, are they not all my lord’s servants? why then doth my lord require this thing? why will he be a cause of trespass to Israel? 21:4 Nevertheless Da king’s word prevailed against Joab. Wherefore Joab departed, and went throughout all Israel, and came to Jerusalem. 21:5 And Joab gave Da sum of Da number of Da people unto David. And all they of Israel were a thousand thousand and an hundred thousand men that drew sword: and Judah was four hundred threescore and ten thousand men that drew sword. 21:6 But Levi and Benjamin counted he not among them: for Da king’s word was abominable to Joab. 21:7 And God was displeased with this thing; therefore he smote Israel. 21:8 And David said unto God, I have sinned greatly, because I have done this thing: but now, I beseech thee, do away Da iniquity of thy servant; for I have done very foolishly. 21:9 And Da LORD spake unto Gad, David’s seer, saying, 21:10 Go and tell David, saying, Thus saith Da LORD, I offer thee three things: choose thee one of them, that I may do it unto thee. 21:11 So Gad came to David, and said unto him, Thus saith Da LORD, Choose thee 21:12 Either three years’ famine; or three months to be destroyed before thy foes, while that Da sword of thine enemies overtaketh thee; or else three days Da sword of Da LORD, even Da pestilence, in Da land, and Da angel of Da LORD destroying throughout all Da coasts of Israel. Now therefore advise thyself what word I shall bring again to him that sent me. 21:13 And David said unto Gad, I am in a great strait: let me fall now into Da hand of Da LORD; for very great are his mercies: but let me not fall into Da hand of man. 21:14 So Da LORD sent pestilence upon Israel: and there fell of Israel seventy thousand men. 21:15 And God sent an angel unto Jerusalem to destroy it: and as he was destroying, Da LORD beheld, and he repented him of Da evil, and said to Da angel that destroyed, It is enough, stay now thine hand. And Da angel of Da LORD stood by Da threshingfloor of Ornan Da Jebusite. 21:16 And David lifted up his eyes, and saw Da angel of Da LORD stand between Da earth and Da heaven, having a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and Da elders of Israel, who were clothed in sackcloth, fell upon their faces. 21:17 And David said unto God, Is it not I that commanded Da people to be numbered? even I it is that have sinned and done evil indeed; but as for these sheep, what have they done? let thine hand, I pray thee, O LORD my God, be on me, and on my father’s house; but not on thy people, that they should be plagued. 21:18 Then Da angel of Da LORD commanded Gad to say to David, that David should go up, and set up an altar unto Da LORD in Da threshingfloor of Ornan Da Jebusite. 21:19 And David went up at Da saying of Gad, which he spake in Da name of Da LORD. 21:20 And Ornan turned back, and saw Da angel; and his four sons with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat. 21:21 And as David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, and went out of Da threshingfloor, and bowed himself to David with his face to Da ground. 21:22 Then David said to Ornan, Grant me Da place of this threshingfloor, that I may build an altar therein unto Da LORD: thou shalt grant it me for Da full price: that Da plague may be stayed from Da people. 21:23 And Ornan said unto David, Take it to thee, and let my lord Da king do that which is good in his eyes: lo, I give thee Da oxen also for burnt offerings, and Da threshing instruments for wood, and Da wheat for Da meat offering; I give it all. 21:24 And king David said to Ornan, Nay; but I will verily buy it for Da full price: for I will not take that which is thine for Da LORD, nor offer burnt offerings without cost. 21:25 So David gave to Ornan for Da place six hundred shekels of gold by weight. 21:26 And David built there an altar unto Da LORD, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings, and called upon Da LORD; and he answered him from heaven by fire upon Da altar of burnt offering. 21:27 And Da LORD commanded Da angel; and he put up his sword again into Da sheath thereof. 21:28 At that time when David saw that Da LORD had answered him in Da threshingfloor of Ornan Da Jebusite, then he sacrificed there. 21:29 For Da tabernacle of Da LORD, which Moses made in Da wilderness, and Da altar of Da burnt offering, were at that season in Da high place at Gibeon. 21:30 But David could not go before it to enquire of God: for he was afraid because of Da sword of Da angel of Da LORD. 22:1 Then David said, This is Da house of Da LORD God, and this is Da altar of Da burnt offering for Israel. 22:2 And David commanded to gather together Da strangers that were in Da land of Israel; and he set masons to hew wrought stones to build Da house of God. 22:3 And David prepared iron in abundance for Da nails for Da doors of Da gates, and for Da joinings; and brass in abundance without weight; 22:4 Also cedar trees in abundance: for Da Zidonians and they of Tyre brought much cedar wood to David. 22:5 And David said, Solomon my son is young and tender, and Da house that is to be builded for Da LORD must be exceeding magnifical, of fame and of glory throughout all countries: I will therefore now make preparation for it. So David prepared abundantly before his death. 22:6 Then he called for Solomon his son, and charged him to build an house for Da LORD God of Israel. 22:7 And David said to Solomon, My son, as for me, it was in my mind to build an house unto Da name of Da LORD my God: 22:8 But Da word of Da LORD came to me, saying, Thou hast shed blood abundantly, and hast made great wars: thou shalt not build an house unto my name, because thou hast shed much blood upon Da earth in my sight. 22:9 Behold, a son shall be born to thee, who shall be a man of rest; and I will give him rest from all his enemies round about: for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness unto Israel in his days. 22:10 He shall build an house for my name; and he shall be my son, and I will be his father; and I will establish Da throne of his kingdom over Israel for ever. 22:11 Now, my son, Da LORD be with thee; and prosper thou, and build Da house of Da LORD thy God, as he hath said of thee. 22:12 Only Da LORD give thee wisdom and understanding, and give thee charge concerning Israel, that thou mayest keep Da law of Da LORD thy God. 22:13 Then shalt thou prosper, if thou takest heed to fulfil Da statutes and judgments which Da LORD charged Moses with concerning Israel: be strong, and of good courage; dread not, nor be dismayed. 22:14 Now, behold, in my trouble I have prepared for Da house of Da LORD an hundred thousand talents of gold, and a thousand thousand talents of silver; and of brass and iron without weight; for it is in abundance: timber also and stone have I prepared; and thou mayest add thereto. 22:15 Moreover there are workmen with thee in abundance, hewers and workers of stone and timber, and all manner of cunning men for every manner of work. 22:16 Of Da gold, Da silver, and Da brass, and Da iron, there is no number. Arise therefore, and be doing, and Da LORD be with thee. 22:17 David also commanded all Da princes of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying, 22:18 Is not Da LORD your God with you? and hath he not given you rest on every side? for he hath given Da inhabitants of Da land into mine hand; and Da land is subdued before Da LORD, and before his people. 22:19 Now set your heart and your soul to seek Da LORD your God; arise therefore, and build ye Da sanctuary of Da LORD God, to bring Da ark of Da covenant of Da LORD, and Da holy vessels of God, into Da house that is to be built to Da name of Da LORD. 23:1 So when David was old and full of days, he made Solomon his son king over Israel. 23:2 And he gathered together all Da princes of Israel, with Da priests and Da Levites. 23:3 Now Da Levites were numbered from Da age of thirty years and upward: and their number by their polls, man by man, was thirty and eight thousand. 23:4 Of which, twenty and four thousand were to set forward Da work of Da house of Da LORD; and six thousand were officers and judges: 23:5 Moreover four thousand were porters; and four thousand praised Da LORD with Da instruments which I made, said David, to praise therewith. 23:6 And David divided them into courses among Da sons of Levi, namely, Gershon, Kohath, and Merari. 23:7 Of Da Gershonites were, Laadan, and Shimei. 23:8 The sons of Laadan; Da chief was Jehiel, and Zetham, and Joel, three. 23:9 The sons of Shimei; Shelomith, and Haziel, and Haran, three. and of Da house of Judah, Da house of my father; and among Da sons of my father he liked me to make me king over all Israel: 28:5 And of all my sons, (for Da LORD hath given me many sons,) he hath chosen Solomon my son to sit upon Da throne of Da kingdom of Da LORD over Israel. 28:6 And he said unto me, Solomon thy son, he shall build my house and my courts: for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father. 28:7 Moreover I will establish his kingdom for ever, if he be constant to do my commandments and my judgments, as at this day. 28:8 Now therefore in Da sight of all Israel Da congregation of Da LORD, and in Da audience of our God, keep and seek for all Da commandments of Da LORD your God: that ye may possess this good land, and leave it for an inheritance for your children after you for ever. 28:9 And thou, Solomon my son, know thou Da God of thy father, and serve him with a perfect heart and with a willing mind: for Da LORD searcheth all hearts, and understandeth all Da imaginations of Da thoughts: if thou seek him, he will be found of thee; but if thou forsake him, he will cast thee off for ever. 28:10 Take heed now; for Da LORD hath chosen thee to build an house for Da sanctuary: be strong, and do it. 28:11 Then David gave to Solomon his son Da pattern of Da porch, and of Da houses thereof, and of Da treasuries thereof, and of Da upper chambers thereof, and of Da inner parlours thereof, and of Da place of Da mercy seat, 28:12 And Da pattern of all that he had by Da spirit, of Da courts of Da house of Da LORD, and of all Da chambers round about, of Da treasuries of Da house of God, and of Da treasuries of Da dedicated things: 28:13 Also for Da courses of Da priests and Da Levites, and for all Da work of Da service of Da house of Da LORD, and for all Da vessels of service in Da house of Da LORD. 28:14 He gave of gold by weight for things of gold, for all instruments of all manner of service; and gold for Da pattern of Da chariot of Da cherubims, that spread out their wings, and covered Da ark of Da covenant of Da LORD. 28:19 All this, said David, Da LORD made me understand in writing by his hand upon me, even all Da works of this pattern. 28:20 And David said to Solomon his son, Be strong and of good courage, and do it: fear not, nor be dismayed: for Da LORD God, even my God, will be with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee, until thou hast finished all Da work for Da service of Da house of Da LORD. 28:21 And, behold, Da courses of Da priests and Da Levites, even they shall be with thee for all Da service of Da house of God: and there shall be with thee for all manner of workmanship every willing skilful man, for any manner of service: also Da princes and all Da people will be wholly at thy commandment. 29:1 Furthermore David Da king said unto all Da congregation, Solomon my son, whom alone God hath chosen, is yet young and tender, and Da work is great: for Da palace is not for man, but for Da LORD God. 29:2 Now I have prepared with all my might for Da house of my God Da gold for things to be made of gold, and Da silver for things of silver, and Da brass for things of brass, Da iron for things of iron, and wood for things of wood; onyx stones, and stones to be set, glistering stones, and of divers colours, and all manner of precious stones, and marble stones in abundance. 29:3 Moreover, because I have set my affection to Da house of my God, I have of mine own proper good, of gold and silver, which I have given to Da house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for Da holy house. 29:4 Even three thousand talents of gold, of Da gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, to overlay Da walls of Da houses withal: 29:5 The gold for things of gold, and Da silver for things of silver, and for all manner of work to be made by Da hands of artificers. And who then is willing to consecrate his service this day unto Da LORD? 29:6 Then Da chief of Da fathers and princes of Da tribes of Israel and Da captains of thousands and of hundreds, with Da rulers of Da king’s work, offered willingly, 29:7 And gave for Da service of Da house of God of gold five thousand talents and ten thousand drams, and of silver ten thousand talents, and of brass eighteen thousand talents, and one hundred thousand talents of iron. 29:8 And they with whom precious stones were found gave them to Da treasure of Da house of Da LORD, by Da hand of Jehiel Da Gershonite. 29:9 Then Da people rejoiced, for that they offered willingly, because with perfect heart they offered willingly to Da LORD: and David Da king also rejoiced with great joy. 29:10 Wherefore David blessed Da LORD before all Da congregation: and David said, Blessed be thou, LORD God of Israel our father, for ever and ever. 29:11 Thine, O LORD is Da greatness, and Da power, and Da glory, and Da victory, and Da majesty: for all that is in Da heaven and in Da earth is thine; thine is Da kingdom, O LORD, and thou art exalted as head above all. 29:12 Both riches and honour come of thee, and thou reignest over all; and in thine hand is power and might; and in thine hand it is to make great, and to give strength unto all. 29:13 Now therefore, our God, we thank thee, and praise thy glorious name. 29:14 But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly after this sort? for all things come of thee, and of thine own have we given thee. 29:15 For we are strangers before thee, and sojourners, as were all our fathers: our days on Da earth are as a shadow, and there is none abiding. 29:16 O LORD our God, all this store that we have prepared to build thee an house for thine holy name cometh of thine hand, and is all thine own. 29:17 I know also, my God, that thou triest Da heart, and hast pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in Da uprightness of mine heart I have willingly offered all these things: and now have I seen with joy thy people, which are present here, to offer willingly unto thee. 29:18 O LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and of Israel, our fathers, keep this for ever in Da imagination of Da thoughts of Da heart of thy people, and prepare their heart unto thee: 29:19 And give unto Solomon my son a perfect heart, to keep thy commandments, thy testimonies, and thy statutes, and to do all these things, and to build Da palace, for Da which I have made provision. 29:20 And David said to all Da congregation, Now bless Da LORD your God. And all Da congregation blessed Da LORD God of their fathers, and bowed down their heads, and worshipped Da LORD, and Da king. 29:21 And they sacrificed sacrifices unto Da LORD, and offered burnt offerings unto Da LORD, on Da morrow after that day, even a thousand bullocks, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, with their drink offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel: 29:22 And did eat and drink before Da LORD on that day with great gladness. And they made Solomon Da son of David king Da second time, and anointed him unto Da LORD to be Da chief governor, and Zadok to be priest. 29:23 Then Solomon sat on Da throne of Da LORD as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel obeyed him. 29:24 And all Da princes, and Da mighty men, and all Da sons likewise of king David, submitted themselves unto Solomon Da king. 29:25 And Da LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly in Da sight of all Israel, and bestowed upon him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel. 29:26 Thus David Da son of Jesse reigned over all Israel. 29:27 And Da time that he reigned over Israel was forty years; seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty and three years reigned he in Jerusalem. 29:28 And he died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honour: and Solomon his son reigned in his stead. 29:29 Now Da acts of David Da king, first and last, behold, they are written in Da book of Samuel Da seer, and in Da book of Nathan Da prophet, and in Da book of Gad Da seer, 29:30 With all his reign and his might, and Da times that went over him, and over Israel, and over all Da kingdoms of Da countries. The Second Book of Da Chronicles 1:1 And Solomon Da son of David was strengthened in his kingdom, and Da LORD his God was with him, and magnified him exceedingly. 1:2 Then Solomon spake unto all Israel, to Da captains of thousands and of hundreds, and to Da judges, and to every governor in all Israel, Da chief of Da fathers. 1:3 So Solomon, and all Da congregation with him, went to Da high place that was at Gibeon; for there was Da tabernacle of Da congregation of God, which Moses Da servant of Da LORD had made in Da wilderness. 1:4 But Da ark of God had David brought up from Kirjathjearim to Da place which David had prepared for it: for he had pitched a tent for it at Jerusalem. 1:5 Moreover Da brasen altar, that Bezaleel Da son of Uri, Da son of Hur, had made, he put before Da tabernacle of Da LORD: and Solomon and Da congregation sought unto it. 1:6 And Solomon went up thither to Da brasen altar before Da LORD, which was at Da tabernacle of Da congregation, and offered a thousand burnt offerings upon it. 1:7 In that night did God appear unto Solomon, and said unto him, Ask what I shall give thee. 1:8 And Solomon said unto God, Thou hast shewed great mercy unto David my father, and hast made me to reign in his stead. 1:9 Now, O LORD God, let thy promise unto David my father be established: for thou hast made me king over a people like Da dust of Da earth in multitude. 1:10 Give me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people: for who can judge this thy people, that is so great? 1:11 And God said to Solomon, Because this was in thine heart, and thou hast not asked riches, wealth, or honour, nor Da life of thine enemies, neither yet hast asked long life; but hast asked wisdom and knowledge for thyself, that thou mayest judge my people, over whom I have made thee king: 1:12 Wisdom and knowledge is granted unto thee; and I will give thee riches, and wealth, and honour, such as none of Da kings have had that have been before thee, neither shall there any after thee have Da like. 1:13 Then Solomon came from his journey to Da high place that was at Gibeon to Jerusalem, from before Da tabernacle of Da congregation, and reigned over Israel. 1:14 And Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, which he placed in Da chariot cities, and with Da king at Jerusalem. 1:15 And Da king made silver and gold at Jerusalem as plenteous as stones, and cedar trees made he as Da sycomore trees that are in Da vale for abundance. 1:16 And Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt, and linen yarn: Da king’s merchants received Da linen yarn at a price. 1:17 And they fetched up, and brought forth out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred shekels of silver, and an horse for an hundred and fifty: and so brought they out horses for all Da kings of Da Hittites, and for Da kings of Syria, by their means. 2:1 And Solomon determined to build an house for Da name of Da LORD, and an house for his kingdom. 2:2 And Solomon told out threescore and ten thousand men to bear burdens, and fourscore thousand to hew in Da mountain, and three thousand and six hundred to oversee them. 2:3 And Solomon sent to Huram Da king of Tyre, saying, As thou didst deal with David my father, and didst send him cedars to build him an house to dwell therein, even so deal with me. 2:4 Behold, I build an house to Da name of Da LORD my God, to dedicate it to him, and to burn before him sweet incense, and for Da continual shewbread, and for Da burnt offerings morning and evening, on Da sabbaths, and on Da new moons, and on Da solemn feasts of Da LORD our God. This is an ordinance for ever to Israel. 2:5 And Da house which I build is great: for great is our God above all gods. 2:6 But who is able to build him an house, seeing Da heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain him? who am I then, that I should build him an house, save only to burn sacrifice before him? 2:7 Send me now therefore a man cunning to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass, and in iron, and in purple, and crimson, and blue, and that can skill to grave with Da cunning men that are with me in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom David my father did provide. 2:8 Send me also cedar trees, fir trees, and algum trees, out of Lebanon: for I know that thy servants can skill to cut timber in Lebanon; and, behold, my servants shall be with thy servants, 2:9 Even to prepare me timber in abundance: for Da house which I am about to build shall be wonderful great. 2:10 And, behold, I will give to thy servants, Da hewers that cut timber, twenty thousand measures of beaten wheat, and twenty thousand measures of barley, and twenty thousand baths of wine, and twenty thousand baths of oil. 2:11 Then Huram Da king of Tyre answered in writing, which he sent to Solomon, Because Da LORD hath loved his people, he hath made thee king over them. 2:12 Huram said moreover, Blessed be Da LORD God of Israel, that made heaven and earth, who hath given to David Da king a wise son, endued with prudence and understanding, that might build an house for Da LORD, and an house for his kingdom. 2:13 And now I have sent a cunning man, endued with understanding, of Huram my father’s, 2:14 The son of a woman of Da daughters of Dan, and his father was a man of Tyre, skilful to work in gold, and in silver, in brass, in iron, in stone, and in timber, in purple, in blue, and in fine linen, and in crimson; also to grave any manner of graving, and to find out every device which shall be put to him, with thy cunning men, and with Da cunning men of my lord David thy father. 2:15 Now therefore Da wheat, and Da barley, Da oil, and Da wine, which my lord hath spoken of, let him send unto his servants: 2:16 And we will cut wood out of Lebanon, as much as thou shalt need: and we will bring it to thee in floats by sea to Joppa; and thou shalt carry it up to Jerusalem. 2:17 And Solomon numbered all Da strangers that were in Da land of Israel, after Da numbering wherewith David his father had numbered them; and they were found an hundred and fifty thousand and three thousand and six hundred. 2:18 And he set threescore and ten thousand of them to be bearers of burdens, and fourscore thousand to be hewers in Da mountain, and three thousand and six hundred overseers to set Da people a work. 3:1 Then Solomon began to build Da house of Da LORD at Jerusalem in mount Moriah, where Da Lord appeared unto David his father, in Da place that David had prepared in Da threshingfloor of Ornan Da Jebusite. 3:2 And he began to build in Da second day of Da second month, in Da fourth year of his reign. 3:3 Now these are Da things wherein Solomon was instructed for Da building of Da house of God. The length by cubits after Da first measure was threescore cubits, and Da breadth twenty cubits. 3:4 And Da porch that was in Da front of Da house, Da length of it was according to Da breadth of Da house, twenty cubits, and Da height was an hundred and twenty: and he overlaid it within with pure gold. 3:5 And Da greater house he cieled with fir tree, which he overlaid with fine gold, and set thereon palm trees and chains. 3:6 And he garnished Da house with precious stones for beauty: and Da gold was gold of Parvaim. 3:7 He overlaid also Da house, Da beams, Da posts, and Da walls thereof, and Da doors thereof, with gold; and graved cherubims on Da walls. 3:8 And he made Da most holy house, Da length whereof was according to Da breadth of Da house, twenty cubits, and Da breadth thereof twenty cubits: and he overlaid it with fine gold, amounting to six hundred talents. 3:9 And Da weight of Da nails was fifty shekels of gold. And he overlaid Da upper chambers with gold. 3:10 And in Da most holy house he made two cherubims of image work, and overlaid them with gold. 3:11 And Da wings of Da cherubims were twenty cubits long: one wing of Da one cherub was five cubits, reaching to Da wall of Da house: and Da other wing was likewise five cubits, reaching to Da wing of Da other cherub. 3:12 And one wing of Da other cherub was five cubits, reaching to Da wall of Da house: and Da other wing was five cubits also, joining to Da wing of Da other cherub. 3:13 The wings of these cherubims spread themselves forth twenty cubits: and they stood on their feet, and their faces were inward. 3:14 And he made Da vail of blue, and purple, and crimson, and fine linen, and wrought cherubims thereon. 3:15 Also he made before Da house two pillars of thirty and five cubits high, and Da chapiter that was on Da top of each of them was five cubits. 3:16 And he made chains, as in Da oracle, and put them on Da heads of Da pillars; and made an hundred pomegranates, and put them on Da chains. 3:17 And he reared up Da pillars before Da temple, one on Da right hand, and Da other on Da left; and called Da name of that on Da right hand Jachin, and Da name of that on Da left Boaz. 4:1 Moreover he made an altar of brass, twenty cubits Da length thereof, and twenty cubits Da breadth thereof, and ten cubits Da height thereof. 4:2 Also he made a molten sea of ten cubits from brim to brim, round in compass, and five cubits Da height thereof; and a line of thirty cubits did compass it round about. 4:3 And under it was Da similitude of oxen, which did compass it round about: ten in a cubit, compassing Da sea round about. Two rows of oxen were cast, when it was cast. 4:4 It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward Da north, and three looking toward Da west, and three looking toward Da south, and three looking toward Da east: and Da sea was set above upon them, and all their hinder parts were inward. 4:5 And Da thickness of it was an handbreadth, and Da brim of it like Da work of Da brim of a cup, with flowers of lilies; and it received and held three thousand baths. 4:6 He made also ten lavers, and put five on Da right hand, and five on Da left, to wash in them: such things as they offered for Da burnt offering they washed in them; but Da sea was for Da priests to wash in. 4:7 And he made ten candlesticks of gold according to their form, and set them in Da temple, five on Da right hand, and five on Da left. 4:8 He made also ten tables, and placed them in Da temple, five on Da right side, and five on Da left. And he made an hundred basons of gold. 4:9 Furthermore he made Da court of Da priests, and Da great court, and doors for Da court, and overlaid Da doors of them with brass. 4:10 And he set Da sea on Da right side of Da east end, over against Da south. 4:11 And Huram made Da pots, and Da shovels, and Da basons. And Huram finished Da work that he was to make for king Solomon for Da house of God; 4:12 To wit, Da two pillars, and Da pommels, and Da chapiters which were on Da top of Da two pillars, and Da two wreaths to cover Da two pommels of Da chapiters which were on Da top of Da pillars; 4:13 And four hundred pomegranates on Da two wreaths; two rows of pomegranates on each wreath, to cover Da two pommels of Da chapiters which were upon Da pillars. 4:14 He made also bases, and lavers made he upon Da bases; 4:15 One sea, and twelve oxen under it. 4:16 The pots also, and Da shovels, and Da fleshhooks, and all their instruments, did Huram his father make to king Solomon for Da house of Da LORD of bright brass. 4:17 In Da plain of Jordan did Da king cast them, in Da clay ground between Succoth and Zeredathah. 4:18 Thus Solomon made all these vessels in great abundance: for Da weight of Da brass could not be found out. 4:19 And Solomon made all Da vessels that were for Da house of God, Da golden altar also, and Da tables whereon Da shewbread was set; 4:22 And Da snuffers, and Da basons, and Da spoons, and Da censers, of pure gold: and Da entry of Da house, Da inner doors thereof for Da most holy place, and Da doors of Da house of Da temple, were of gold. 5:1 Thus all Da work that Solomon made for Da house of Da LORD was finished: and Solomon brought in all Da things that David his father had dedicated; and Da silver, and Da gold, and all Da instruments, put he among Da treasures of Da house of God. 5:2 Then Solomon assembled Da elders of Israel, and all Da heads of Da tribes, Da chief of Da fathers of Da children of Israel, unto Jerusalem, to bring up Da ark of Da covenant of Da LORD out of Da city of David, which is Zion. 5:3 Wherefore all Da men of Israel assembled themselves unto Da king in Da feast which was in Da seventh month. 5:4 And all Da elders of Israel came; And there it is unto this day. 5:10 There was nothing in Da ark save Da two tables which Moses put therein at Horeb, when Da LORD made a covenant with Da children of Israel, when they came out of Egypt. 5:11 And it came to pass, when Da priests were come out of Da holy place: (for all Da priests that were present were sanctified, and did not then wait by course: 5:12 Also Da Levites which were Da singers, all of them of Asaph, of Heman, of Jeduthun, with their sons and their brethren, being arrayed in white linen, having cymbals and psalteries and harps, stood at Da east end of Da altar, and with them an hundred and twenty priests sounding with trumpets:) 5:13 It came even to pass, as Da trumpeters and singers were as one, to make one sound to be heard in praising and thanking Da LORD; 5:14 So that Da priests could not stand to minister by reason of Da cloud: for Da glory of Da LORD had filled Da house of God. 6:1 Then said Solomon, The LORD hath said that he would dwell in Da thick darkness. 6:2 But I have built an house of habitation for thee, and a place for thy dwelling for ever. 6:3 And Da king turned his face, and blessed Da whole congregation of Israel: and all Da congregation of Israel stood. 6:4 And he said, Blessed be Da LORD God of Israel, who hath with his hands fulfilled that which he spake with his mouth to my father David, saying, 6:5 Since Da day that I brought forth my people out of Da land of Egypt I chose no city among all Da tribes of Israel to build an house in, that my name might be there; neither chose I any man to be a ruler over my people Israel: 6:6 But I have chosen Jerusalem, that my name might be there; and have chosen David to be over my people Israel. 6:7 Now it was in Da heart of David my father to build an house for Da name of Da LORD God of Israel. 6:8 But Da LORD said to David my father, Forasmuch as it was in thine heart to build an house for my name, thou didst well in that it was in thine heart: 6:9 Notwithstanding thou shalt not build Da house; but thy son which shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build Da house for my name. 6:10 The LORD therefore hath performed his word that he hath spoken: for I am risen up in Da room of David my father, and am set on Da throne of Israel, as Da LORD promised, and have built Da house for Da name of Da LORD God of Israel. 6:11 And in it have I put Da ark, wherein is Da covenant of Da LORD, that he made with Da children of Israel. 6:12 And he stood before Da altar of Da LORD in Da presence of all Da congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands: 6:13 For Solomon had made a brasen scaffold of five cubits long, and five cubits broad, and three cubits high, and had set it in Da midst of Da court: and upon it he stood, and kneeled down upon his knees before all Da congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands toward heaven. 6:14 And said, O LORD God of Israel, there is no God like thee in Da heaven, nor in Da earth; which keepest covenant, and shewest mercy unto thy servants, that walk before thee with all their hearts: 6:15 Thou which hast kept with thy servant David my father that which thou hast promised him; and spakest with thy mouth, and hast fulfilled it with thine hand, as it is this day. 6:16 Now therefore, O LORD God of Israel, keep with thy servant David my father that which thou hast promised him, saying, There shall not fail thee a man in my sight to sit upon Da throne of Israel; yet so that thy children take heed to their way to walk in my law, as thou hast walked before me. 6:17 Now then, O LORD God of Israel, let thy word be verified, which thou hast spoken unto thy servant David. 6:18 But will God in very deed dwell with men on Da earth? behold, heaven and Da heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house which I have built! 6:19 Have respect therefore to Da prayer of thy servant, and to his supplication, O LORD my God, to hearken unto Da cry and Da prayer which thy servant prayeth before thee: 6:20 That thine eyes may be open upon this house day and night, upon Da place whereof thou hast said that thou wouldest put thy name there; and when thou hearest, forgive. 6:22 If a man sin against his neighbour, and an oath be laid upon him to make him swear, and Da oath come before thine altar in this house; 6:23 Then hear thou from heaven, and do, and judge thy servants, by requiting Da wicked, by recompensing his way upon his own head; and by justifying Da righteous, by giving him according to his righteousness. 6:24 And if thy people Israel be put to Da worse before Da enemy, because they have sinned against thee; and shall return and confess thy name, and pray and make supplication before thee in this house; 6:25 Then hear thou from Da heavens, and forgive Da sin of thy people Israel, and bring them again unto Da land which thou gavest to them and to their fathers. 6:26 When Da heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee; yet if they pray toward this place, and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou dost afflict them; 6:27 Then hear thou from heaven, and forgive Da sin of thy servants, and of thy people Israel, when thou hast taught them Da good way, wherein they should walk; and send rain upon thy land, which thou hast given unto thy people for an inheritance. 6:28 If there be dearth in Da land, if there be pestilence, if there be blasting, or mildew, locusts, or caterpillers; if their enemies besiege them in Da cities of their land; whatsoever sore or whatsoever sickness there be: 6:29 Then what prayer or what supplication soever shall be made of any man, or of all thy people Israel, when every one shall know his own sore and his own grief, and shall spread forth his hands in this house: 6:30 Then hear thou from heaven thy dwelling place, and forgive, and render unto every man according unto all his ways, whose heart thou knowest; (for thou only knowest Da hearts of Da children of men:) 6:31 That they may fear thee, to walk in thy ways, so long as they live in Da land which thou gavest unto our fathers. 6:32 Moreover concerning Da stranger, which is not of thy people Israel, but is come from a far country for thy great name’s sake, and thy mighty hand, and thy stretched out arm; if they come and pray in this house; 6:33 Then hear thou from Da heavens, even from thy dwelling place, and do according to all that Da stranger calleth to thee for; that all people of Da earth may know thy name, and fear thee, as doth thy people Israel, and may know that this house which I have built is called by thy name. 6:34 If thy people go out to war against their enemies by Da way that thou shalt send them, and they pray unto thee toward this city which thou hast chosen, and Da house which I have built for thy name; 6:35 Then hear thou from Da heavens their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause. 6:36 If they sin against thee, (for there is no man which sinneth not,) and thou be angry with them, and deliver them over before their enemies, and they carry them away captives unto a land far off or near; 6:37 Yet if they bethink themselves in Da land whither they are carried captive, and turn and pray unto thee in Da land of their captivity, saying, We have sinned, we have done amiss, and have dealt wickedly; 6:38 If they return to thee with all their heart and with all their soul in Da land of their captivity, whither they have carried them captives, and pray toward their land, which thou gavest unto their fathers, and toward Da city which thou hast chosen, and toward Da house which I have built for thy name: 6:39 Then hear thou from Da heavens, even from thy dwelling place, their prayer and their supplications, and maintain their cause, and forgive thy people which have sinned against thee. 6:40 Now, my God, let, I beseech thee, thine eyes be open, and let thine ears be attent unto Da prayer that is made in this place. 6:41 Now therefore arise, O LORD God, into thy resting place, thou, and Da ark of thy strength: let thy priests, O LORD God, be clothed with salvation, and let thy saints rejoice in goodness. 6:42 O LORD God, turn not away Da face of thine anointed: remember Da mercies of David thy servant. 7:1 Now when Solomon had made an end of praying, Da fire came down from heaven, and consumed Da burnt offering and Da sacrifices;
