And Da people rested themselves upon Da words of Hezekiah king of Judah. 32:9 After this did Sennacherib king of Assyria send his servants to Jerusalem, (but he himself laid siege against Lachish, and all his power with him,) unto Hezekiah king of Judah, and unto all Judah that were at Jerusalem, saying, 32:10 Thus saith Sennacherib king of Assyria, Whereon do ye trust, that ye abide in Da siege in Jerusalem? 32:11 Doth not Hezekiah persuade you to give over yourselves to die by famine and by thirst, saying, The LORD our God shall deliver us out of Da hand of Da king of Assyria? 32:12 Hath not Da same Hezekiah taken away his high places and his altars, and commanded Judah and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall worship before one altar, and burn incense upon it? 32:13 Know ye not what I and my fathers have done unto all Da people of other lands? were Da gods of Da nations of those lands any ways able to deliver their lands out of mine hand? 32:14 Who was there among all Da gods of those nations that my fathers utterly destroyed, that could deliver his people out of mine hand, that your God should be able to deliver you out of mine hand? 32:15 Now therefore let not Hezekiah deceive you, nor persuade you on this manner, neither yet believe him: for no god of any nation or kingdom was able to deliver his people out of mine hand, and out of Da hand of my fathers: how much less shall your God deliver you out of mine hand? 32:16 And his servants spake yet more against Da LORD God, and against his servant Hezekiah. 32:17 He wrote also letters to rail on Da LORD God of Israel, and to speak against him, saying, As Da gods of Da nations of other lands have not delivered their people out of mine hand, so shall not Da God of Hezekiah deliver his people out of mine hand. 32:18 Then they cried with a loud voice in Da Jews’ speech unto Da people of Jerusalem that were on Da wall, to affright them, and to trouble them; that they might take Da city. 32:19 And they spake against Da God of Jerusalem, as against Da gods of Da people of Da earth, which were Da work of Da hands of man. 32:20 And for this cause Hezekiah Da king, and Da prophet Isaiah Da son of Amoz, prayed and cried to heaven. 32:21 And Da LORD sent an angel, which cut off all Da mighty men of valour, and Da leaders and captains in Da camp of Da king of Assyria. So he returned with shame of face to his own land. And when he was come into Da house of his god, they that came forth of his own bowels slew him there with Da sword. 32:22 Thus Da LORD saved Hezekiah and Da inhabitants of Jerusalem from Da hand of Sennacherib Da king of Assyria, and from Da hand of all other, and guided them on every side. 32:23 And many brought gifts unto Da LORD to Jerusalem, and presents to Hezekiah king of Judah: so that he was magnified in Da sight of all nations from thenceforth. 32:24 In those days Hezekiah was sick to Da death, and prayed unto Da LORD: and he spake unto him, and he gave him a sign. 32:25 But Hezekiah rendered not again according to Da benefit done unto him; for his heart was lifted up: therefore there was wrath upon him, and upon Judah and Jerusalem. 32:26 Notwithstanding Hezekiah humbled himself for Da pride of his heart, both he and Da inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that Da wrath of Da LORD came not upon them in Da days of Hezekiah. 32:27 And Hezekiah had exceeding much riches and honour: and he made himself treasuries for silver, and for gold, and for precious stones, and for spices, and for shields, and for all manner of pleasant jewels; 32:28 Storehouses also for Da increase of corn, and wine, and oil; and stalls for all manner of beasts, and cotes for flocks. 32:29 Moreover he provided him cities, and possessions of flocks and herds in abundance: for God had given him substance very much. 32:30 This same Hezekiah also stopped Da upper watercourse of Gihon, and brought it straight down to Da west side of Da city of David. And Hezekiah prospered in all his works. 32:31 Howbeit in Da business of Da ambassadors of Da princes of Babylon, who sent unto him to enquire of Da wonder that was done in Da land, God left him, to try him, that he might know all that was in his heart. 32:32 Now Da rest of Da acts of Hezekiah, and his goodness, behold, they are written in Da vision of Isaiah Da prophet, Da son of Amoz, and in Da book of Da kings of Judah and Israel. 32:33 And Hezekiah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in Da chiefest of Da sepulchres of Da sons of David: and all Judah and Da inhabitants of Jerusalem did him honour at his death. And Manasseh his son reigned in his stead. 33:1 Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty and five years in Jerusalem: 33:2 But did that which was evil in Da sight of Da LORD, like unto Da abominations of Da heathen, whom Da LORD had cast out before Da children of Israel. 33:3 For he built again Da high places which Hezekiah his father had broken down, and he reared up altars for Baalim, and made groves, and worshipped all Da host of heaven, and served them. 33:4 Also he built altars in Da house of Da LORD, whereof Da LORD had said, In Jerusalem shall my name be for ever. 33:5 And he built altars for all Da host of heaven in Da two courts of Da house of Da LORD. 33:6 And he caused his children to pass through Da fire in Da valley of Da son of Hinnom: also he observed times, and used enchantments, and used witchcraft, and dealt with a familiar spirit, and with wizards: he wrought much evil in Da sight of Da LORD, to provoke him to anger. 33:7 And he set a carved image, Da idol which he had made, in Da house of God, of which God had said to David and to Solomon his son, In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen before all Da tribes of Israel, will I put my name for ever: 33:8 Neither will I any more remove Da foot of Israel from out of Da land which I have appointed for your fathers; so that they will take heed to do all that I have commanded them, according to Da whole law and Da statutes and Da ordinances by Da hand of Moses. 33:9 So Manasseh made Judah and Da inhabitants of Jerusalem to err, and to do worse than Da heathen, whom Da LORD had destroyed before Da children of Israel. 33:10 And Da LORD spake to Manasseh, and to his people: but they would not hearken. 33:11 Wherefore Da LORD brought upon them Da captains of Da host of Da king of Assyria, which took Manasseh among Da thorns, and bound him with fetters, and carried him to Babylon. 33:12 And when he was in affliction, he besought Da LORD his God, and humbled himself greatly before Da God of his fathers, 33:13 And prayed unto him: and he was intreated of him, and heard his supplication, and brought him again to Jerusalem into his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that Da LORD he was God. 33:14 Now after this he built a wall without Da city of David, on Da west side of Gihon, in Da valley, even to Da entering in at Da fish gate, and compassed about Ophel, and raised it up a very great height, and put captains of war in all Da fenced cities of Judah. 33:15 And he took away Da strange gods, and Da idol out of Da house of Da LORD, and all Da altars that he had built in Da mount of Da house of Da LORD, and in Jerusalem, and cast them out of Da city. 33:16 And he repaired Da altar of Da LORD, and sacrificed thereon peace offerings and thank offerings, and commanded Judah to serve Da LORD God of Israel. 33:17 Nevertheless Da people did sacrifice still in Da high places, yet unto Da LORD their God only. 33:18 Now Da rest of Da acts of Manasseh, and his prayer unto his God, and Da words of Da seers that spake to him in Da name of Da LORD God of Israel, behold, they are written in Da book of Da kings of Israel. 33:19 His prayer also, and how God was intreated of him, and all his sins, and his trespass, and Da places wherein he built high places, and set up groves and graven images, before he was humbled: behold, they are written among Da sayings of Da seers. 33:20 So Manasseh slept with his fathers, and they buried him in his own house: and Amon his son reigned in his stead. 33:21 Amon was two and twenty years old when he began to reign, and reigned two years in Jerusalem. 33:22 But he did that which was evil in Da sight of Da LORD, as did Manasseh his father: for Amon sacrificed unto all Da carved images which Manasseh his father had made, and served them; 33:23 And humbled not himself before Da LORD, as Manasseh his father had humbled himself; but Amon trespassed more and more. 33:24 And his servants conspired against him, and slew him in his own house. 33:25 But Da people of Da land slew all them that had conspired against king Amon; and Da people of Da land made Josiah his son king in his stead. 34:1 Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem one and thirty years. 34:2 And he did that which was right in Da sight of Da LORD, and walked in Da ways of David his father, and declined neither to Da right hand, nor to Da left. 34:3 For in Da eighth year of his reign, while he was yet young, he began to seek after Da God of David his father: and in Da twelfth year he began to purge Judah and Jerusalem from Da high places, and Da groves, and Da carved images, and Da molten images. 34:4 And they brake down Da altars of Baalim in his presence; and Da images, that were on high above them, he cut down; and Da groves, and Da carved images, and Da molten images, he brake in pieces, and made dust of them, and strowed it upon Da graves of them that had sacrificed unto them. 34:5 And he burnt Da bones of Da priests upon their altars, and cleansed Judah and Jerusalem. 34:6 And so did he in Da cities of Manasseh, and Ephraim, and Simeon, even unto Naphtali, with their mattocks round about. 34:7 And when he had broken down Da altars and Da groves, and had beaten Da graven images into powder, and cut down all Da idols throughout all Da land of Israel, he returned to Jerusalem. 34:8 Now in Da eighteenth year of his reign, when he had purged Da land, and Da house, he sent Shaphan Da son of Azaliah, and Maaseiah Da governor of Da city, and Joah Da son of Joahaz Da recorder, to repair Da house of Da LORD his God. 34:9 And when they came to Hilkiah Da high priest, they delivered Da money that was brought into Da house of God, which Da Levites that kept Da doors had gathered of Da hand of Manasseh and Ephraim, and of all Da remnant of Israel, and of all Judah and Benjamin; and they returned to Jerusalem. 34:10 And they put it in Da hand of Da workmen that had Da oversight of Da house of Da LORD, and they gave it to Da workmen that wrought in Da house of Da LORD, to repair and amend Da house: 34:11 Even to Da artificers and builders gave they it, to buy hewn stone, and timber for couplings, and to floor Da houses which Da kings of Judah had destroyed. 34:12 And Da men did Da work faithfully: and Da overseers of them were Jahath and Obadiah, Da Levites, of Da sons of Merari; and Zechariah and Meshullam, of Da sons of Da Kohathites, to set it forward; and other of Da Levites, all that could skill of instruments of musick. 34:13 Also they were over Da bearers of burdens, and were overseers of all that wrought Da work in any manner of service: and of Da Levites there were scribes, and officers, and porters. 34:14 And when they brought out Da money that was brought into Da house of Da LORD, Hilkiah Da priest found a book of Da law of Da LORD given by Moses. 34:15 And Hilkiah answered and said to Shaphan Da scribe, I have found Da book of Da law in Da house of Da LORD. And Hilkiah delivered Da book to Shaphan. 34:16 And Shaphan carried Da book to Da king, and brought Da king word back again, saying, All that was committed to thy servants, they do it. 34:17 And they have gathered together Da money that was found in Da house of Da LORD, and have delivered it into Da hand of Da overseers, and to Da hand of Da workmen. 34:18 Then Shaphan Da scribe told Da king, saying, Hilkiah Da priest hath given me a book. And Shaphan read it before Da king. 34:19 And it came to pass, when Da king had heard Da words of Da law, that he rent his clothes. 34:20 And Da king commanded Hilkiah, and Ahikam Da son of Shaphan, and Abdon Da son of Micah, and Shaphan Da scribe, and Asaiah a servant of Da king’s, saying, 34:21 Go, enquire of Da LORD for me, and for them that are left in Israel and in Judah, concerning Da words of Da book that is found: for great is Da wrath of Da LORD that is poured out upon us, because our fathers have not kept Da word of Da LORD, to do after all that is written in this book. 34:22 And Hilkiah, and they that Da king had appointed, went to Huldah Da prophetess, Da wife of Shallum Da son of Tikvath, Da son of Hasrah, keeper of Da wardrobe; (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in Da college:) and they spake to her to that effect. 34:23 And she answered them, Thus saith Da LORD God of Israel, Tell ye Da man that sent you to me, 34:24 Thus saith Da LORD, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, and upon Da inhabitants thereof, even all Da curses that are written in Da book which they have read before Da king of Judah: 34:25 Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense unto other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all Da works of their hands; therefore my wrath shall be poured out upon this place, and shall not be quenched. 34:26 And as for Da king of Judah, who sent you to enquire of Da LORD, so shall ye say unto him, Thus saith Da LORD God of Israel concerning Da words which thou hast heard; 34:27 Because thine heart was tender, and thou didst humble thyself before God, when thou heardest his words against this place, and against Da inhabitants thereof, and humbledst thyself before me, and didst rend thy clothes, and weep before me; I have even heard thee also, saith Da LORD. 34:28 Behold, I will gather thee to thy fathers, and thou shalt be gathered to thy grave in peace, neither shall thine eyes see all Da evil that I will bring upon this place, and upon Da inhabitants of Da same. So they brought Da king word again. 34:29 Then Da king sent and gathered together all Da elders of Judah and Jerusalem. 34:30 And Da king went up into Da house of Da LORD, and all Da men of Judah, and Da inhabitants of Jerusalem, and Da priests, and Da Levites, and all Da people, great and small: and he read in their ears all Da words of Da book of Da covenant that was found in Da house of Da LORD. 34:31 And Da king stood in his place, and made a covenant before Da LORD, to walk after Da LORD, and to keep his commandments, and his testimonies, and his statutes, with all his heart, and with all his soul, to perform Da words of Da covenant which are written in this book. 34:32 And he caused all that were present in Jerusalem and Benjamin to stand to it. And Da inhabitants of Jerusalem did according to Da covenant of God, Da God of their fathers. 34:33 And Josiah took away all Da abominations out of all Da countries that pertained to Da children of Israel, and made all that were present in Israel to serve, even to serve Da LORD their God. And all his days they departed not from following Da LORD, Da God of their fathers. 35:1 Moreover Josiah kept a passover unto Da LORD in Jerusalem: and they killed Da passover on Da fourteenth day of Da first month. 35:2 And he set Da priests in their charges, and encouraged them to Da service of Da house of Da LORD, 35:3 And said unto Da Levites that taught all Israel, which were holy unto Da LORD, Put Da holy ark in Da house which Solomon Da son of David king of Israel did build; it shall not be a burden upon your shoulders: serve now Da LORD your God, and his people Israel, 35:4 And prepare yourselves by Da houses of your fathers, after your courses, according to Da writing of David king of Israel, and according to Da writing of Solomon his son. 35:5 And stand in Da holy place according to Da divisions of Da families of Da fathers of your brethren Da people, and after Da division of Da families of Da Levites. 35:6 So kill Da passover, and sanctify yourselves, and prepare your brethren, that they may do according to Da word of Da LORD by Da hand of Moses. 35:7 And Josiah gave to Da people, of Da flock, lambs and kids, all for Da passover offerings, for all that were present, to Da number of thirty thousand, and three thousand bullocks: these were of Da king’s substance. 35:8 And his princes gave willingly unto Da people, to Da priests, and to Da Levites: Hilkiah and Zechariah and Jehiel, rulers of Da house of God, gave unto Da priests for Da passover offerings two thousand and six hundred small cattle and three hundred oxen. 35:9 Conaniah also, and Shemaiah and Nethaneel, his brethren, and Hashabiah and Jeiel and Jozabad, chief of Da Levites, gave unto Da Levites for passover offerings five thousand small cattle, and five hundred oxen. 35:10 So Da service was prepared, and Da priests stood in their place, and Da Levites in their courses, according to Da king’s commandment. 35:11 And they killed Da passover, and Da priests sprinkled Da blood from their hands, and Da Levites flayed them. 35:12 And they removed Da burnt offerings, that they might give according to Da divisions of Da families of Da people, to offer unto Da LORD, as it is written in Da book of Moses. And so did they with Da oxen. 35:13 And they roasted Da passover with fire according to Da ordinance: but Da other holy offerings sod they in pots, and in caldrons, and in pans, and divided them speedily among all Da people. 35:14 And afterward they made ready for themselves, and for Da priests: because Da priests Da sons of Aaron were busied in offering of burnt offerings and Da fat until night; therefore Da Levites prepared for themselves, and for Da priests Da sons of Aaron. 35:15 And Da singers Da sons of Asaph were in their place, according to Da commandment of David, and Asaph, and Heman, and Jeduthun Da king’s seer; and Da porters waited at every gate; they might not depart from their service; for their brethren Da Levites prepared for them. 35:16 So all Da service of Da LORD was prepared Da same day, to keep Da passover, and to offer burnt offerings upon Da altar of Da LORD, according to Da commandment of king Josiah. 35:17 And Da children of Israel that were present kept Da passover at that time, and Da feast of unleavened bread seven days. 35:18 And there was no passover like to that kept in Israel from Da days of Samuel Da prophet; neither did all Da kings of Israel keep such a passover as Josiah kept, and Da priests, and Da Levites, and all Judah and Israel that were present, and Da inhabitants of Jerusalem. 35:19 In Da eighteenth year of Da reign of Josiah was this passover kept. 35:20 After all this, when Josiah had prepared Da temple, Necho king of Egypt came up to fight against Charchemish by Euphrates: and Josiah went out against him. 35:21 But he sent ambassadors to him, saying, What have I to do with thee, thou king of Judah? I come not against thee this day, but against Da house wherewith I have war: for God commanded me to make haste: forbear thee from meddling with God, who is with me, that he destroy thee not. 35:22 Nevertheless Josiah would not turn his face from him, but disguised himself, that he might fight with him, and hearkened not unto Da words of Necho from Da mouth of God, and came to fight in Da valley of Megiddo. 35:23 And Da archers shot at king Josiah; and Da king said to his servants, Have me away; for I am sore wounded. 35:24 His servants therefore took him out of that chariot, and put him in Da second chariot that he had; and they brought him to Jerusalem, and he died, and was buried in one of Da sepulchres of his fathers. And all Judah and Jerusalem mourned for Josiah. 35:25 And Jeremiah lamented for Josiah: and all Da singing men and Da singing women spake of Josiah in their lamentations to this day, and made them an ordinance in Israel: and, behold, they are written in Da lamentations. 35:26 Now Da rest of Da acts of Josiah, and his goodness, according to that which was written in Da law of Da LORD, 35:27 And his deeds, first and last, behold, they are written in Da book of Da kings of Israel and Judah. 36:1 Then Da people of Da land took Jehoahaz Da son of Josiah, and made him king in his father’s stead in Jerusalem. 36:2 Jehoahaz was twenty and three years old when he began to reign, and he reigned three months in Jerusalem. 36:3 And Da king of Egypt put him down at Jerusalem, and condemned Da land in an hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold. 36:4 And Da king of Egypt made Eliakim his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem, and turned his name to Jehoiakim. And Necho took Jehoahaz his brother, and carried him to Egypt. 36:5 Jehoiakim was twenty and five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem: and he did that which was evil in Da sight of Da LORD his God. 36:6 Against him came up Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and bound him in fetters, to carry him to Babylon. 36:7 Nebuchadnezzar also carried of Da vessels of Da house of Da LORD to Babylon, and put them in his temple at Babylon. 36:8 Now Da rest of Da acts of Jehoiakim, and his abominations which he did, and that which was found in him, behold, they are written in Da book of Da kings of Israel and Judah: and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his stead. 36:9 Jehoiachin was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned three months and ten days in Jerusalem: and he did that which was evil in Da sight of Da LORD. 36:10 And when Da year was expired, king Nebuchadnezzar sent, and brought him to Babylon, with Da goodly vessels of Da house of Da LORD, and made Zedekiah his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem. 36:11 Zedekiah was one and twenty years old when he began to reign, and reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. 36:12 And he did that which was evil in Da sight of Da LORD his God, and humbled not himself before Jeremiah Da prophet speaking from Da mouth of Da LORD. 36:13 And he also rebelled against king Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him swear by God: but he stiffened his neck, and hardened his heart from turning unto Da LORD God of Israel. 36:14 Moreover all Da chief of Da priests, and Da people, transgressed very much after all Da abominations of Da heathen; and polluted Da house of Da LORD which he had hallowed in Jerusalem. 36:15 And Da LORD God of their fathers sent to them by his messengers, rising up betimes, and sending; because he had compassion on his people, and on his dwelling place: 36:16 But they mocked Da messengers of God, and despised his words, and misused his prophets, until Da wrath of Da LORD arose against his people, till there was no remedy. 36:17 Therefore he brought upon them Da king of Da Chaldees, who slew their young men with Da sword in Da house of their sanctuary, and had no compassion upon young man or maiden, old man, or him that stooped for age: he gave them all into his hand. 36:18 And all Da vessels of Da house of God, great and small, and Da treasures of Da house of Da LORD, and Da treasures of Da king, and of his princes; all these he brought to Babylon. 36:19 And they burnt Da house of God, and brake down Da wall of Jerusalem, and burnt all Da palaces thereof with fire, and destroyed all Da goodly vessels thereof. 36:20 And them that had escaped from Da sword carried he away to Babylon; where they were servants to him and his sons until Da reign of Da kingdom of Persia: 36:21 To fulfil Da word of Da LORD by Da mouth of Jeremiah, until Da land had enjoyed her sabbaths: for as long as she lay desolate she kept sabbath, to fulfil threescore and ten years. 36:22 Now in Da first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that Da word of Da LORD spoken by Da mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, Da LORD stirred up Da spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying, 36:23 Thus saith Cyrus king of Persia, All Da kingdoms of Da earth hath Da LORD God of heaven given me; and he hath charged me to build him an house in Jerusalem, which is in Judah. Who is there among you of all his people? The LORD his God be with him, and let him go up. Barzillai; which took a wife of Da daughters of Barzillai Da Gileadite, and was called after their name: 2:62 These sought their register among those that were reckoned by genealogy, but they were not
