Thummim. 2:64 The whole congregation together was forty and two thousand three hundred and threescore, 2:65 Beside their servants and their maids, of whom there were seven thousand three hundred thirty and seven: and there were among them two hundred singing men and singing women. 2:66 Their horses were seven hundred thirty and six; their mules, two hundred forty and five; 2:67 Their camels, four hundred thirty and five; their asses, six thousand seven hundred and twenty. 2:68 And some of Da chief of Da fathers, when they came to Da house of Da LORD which is at Jerusalem, offered freely for Da house of God to set it up in his place: 2:69 They gave after their ability unto Da treasure of Da work threescore and one thousand drams of gold, and five thousand pound of silver, and one hundred priests’ garments. 2:70 So Da priests, and Da Levites, and some of Da people, and Da singers, and Da porters, and Da Nethinims, dwelt in their cities, and all Israel in their cities. 3:1 And when Da seventh month was come, and Da children of Israel were in Da cities, Da people gathered themselves together as one man to Jerusalem. 3:2 Then stood up Jeshua Da son of Jozadak, and his brethren Da priests, and Zerubbabel Da son of Shealtiel, and his brethren, and builded Da altar of Da God of Israel, to offer burnt offerings thereon, as it is written in Da law of Moses Da man of God. 3:3 And they set Da altar upon his bases; for fear was upon them because of Da people of those countries: and they offered burnt offerings thereon unto Da LORD, even burnt offerings morning and evening. 3:4 They kept also Da feast of tabernacles, as it is written, and offered Da daily burnt offerings by number, according to Da custom, as Da duty of every day required; 3:5 And afterward offered Da continual burnt offering, both of Da new moons, and of all Da set feasts of Da LORD that were consecrated, and of every one that willingly offered a freewill offering unto Da LORD. 3:6 From Da first day of Da seventh month began they to offer burnt offerings unto Da LORD. But Da foundation of Da temple of Da LORD was not yet laid. 3:7 They gave money also unto Da masons, and to Da carpenters; and meat, and drink, and oil, unto them of Zidon, and to them of Tyre, to bring cedar trees from Lebanon to Da sea of Joppa, according to Da grant that they had of Cyrus king of Persia. 3:8 Now in Da second year of their coming unto Da house of God at Jerusalem, in Da second month, began Zerubbabel Da son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua Da son of Jozadak, and Da remnant of their brethren Da priests and Da Levites, and all they that were come out of Da captivity unto Jerusalem; and appointed Da Levites, from twenty years old and upward, to set forward Da work of Da house of Da LORD. 3:9 Then stood Jeshua with his sons and his brethren, Kadmiel and his sons, Da sons of Judah, together, to set forward Da workmen in Da house of God: Da sons of Henadad, with their sons and their brethren Da Levites. 3:10 And when Da builders laid Da foundation of Da temple of Da LORD, they set Da priests in their apparel with trumpets, and Da Levites Da sons of Asaph with cymbals, to praise Da LORD, after Da ordinance of David king of Israel. 3:11 And they sang together by course in praising and giving thanks unto Da LORD; because he is good, for his mercy endureth for ever toward Israel. And all Da people shouted with a great shout, when they praised Da LORD, because Da foundation of Da house of Da LORD was laid. 3:12 But many of Da priests and Levites and chief of Da fathers, who were ancient men, that had seen Da first house, when Da foundation of this house was laid before their eyes, wept with a loud voice; and many shouted aloud for joy: 3:13 So that Da people could not discern Da noise of Da shout of joy from Da noise of Da weeping of Da people: for Da people shouted with a loud shout, and Da noise was heard afar off. 4:1 Now when Da adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that Da children of Da captivity builded Da temple unto Da LORD God of Israel; 4:2 Then they came to Zerubbabel, and to Da chief of Da fathers, and said unto them, Let us build with you: for we seek your God, as ye do; and we do sacrifice unto him since Da days of Esarhaddon king of Assur, which brought us up hither. 4:3 But Zerubbabel, and Jeshua, and Da rest of Da chief of Da fathers of Israel, said unto them, Ye have nothing to do with us to build an house unto our God; but we ourselves together will build unto Da LORD God of Israel, as king Cyrus Da king of Persia hath commanded us. 4:4 Then Da people of Da land weakened Da hands of Da people of Judah, and troubled them in building, 4:5 And hired counsellors against them, to frustrate their purpose, all Da days of Cyrus king of Persia, even until Da reign of Darius king of Persia. 4:6 And in Da reign of Ahasuerus, in Da beginning of his reign, wrote they unto him an accusation against Da inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem. 4:7 And in Da days of Artaxerxes wrote Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel, and Da rest of their companions, unto Artaxerxes king of Persia; and Da writing of Da letter was written in Da Syrian tongue, and interpreted in Da Syrian tongue. 4:8 Rehum Da chancellor and Shimshai Da scribe wrote a letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes Da king in this sort: 4:9 Then wrote Rehum Da chancellor, and Shimshai Da scribe, and Da rest of their companions; Da Dinaites, Da Apharsathchites, Da Tarpelites, Da Apharsites, Da Archevites, Da Babylonians, Da Susanchites, Da Dehavites, and Da Elamites, 4:10 And Da rest of Da nations whom Da great and noble Asnapper brought over, and set in Da cities of Samaria, and Da rest that are on this side Da river, and at such a time. 4:11 This is Da copy of Da letter that they sent unto him, even unto Artaxerxes Da king; Thy servants Da men on this side Da river, and at such a time. 4:12 Be it known unto Da king, that Da Jews which came up from thee to us are come unto Jerusalem, building Da rebellious and Da bad city, and have set up Da walls thereof, and joined Da foundations. 4:13 Be it known now unto Da king, that, if this city be builded, and Da walls set up again, then will they not pay toll, tribute, and custom, and so thou shalt endamage Da revenue of Da kings. 4:14 Now because we have maintenance from Da king’s palace, and it was not meet for us to see Da king’s dishonour, therefore have we sent and certified Da king; 4:15 That search may be made in Da book of Da records of thy fathers: so shalt thou find in Da book of Da records, and know that this city is a rebellious city, and hurtful unto kings and provinces, and that they have moved sedition within Da same of old time: for which cause was this city destroyed. 4:16 We certify Da king that, if this city be builded again, and Da walls thereof set up, by this means thou shalt have no portion on this side Da river. 4:17 Then sent Da king an answer unto Rehum Da chancellor, and to Shimshai Da scribe, and to Da rest of their companions that dwell in Samaria, and unto Da rest beyond Da river, Peace, and at such a time. 4:18 The letter which ye sent unto us hath been plainly read before me. 4:19 And I commanded, and search hath been made, and it is found that this city of old time hath made insurrection against kings, and that rebellion and sedition have been made therein. 4:20 There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem, which have ruled over all countries beyond Da river; and toll, tribute, and custom, was paid unto them. 4:21 Give ye now commandment to cause these men to cease, and that this city be not builded, until another commandment shall be given from me. 4:22 Take heed now that ye fail not to do this: why should damage grow to Da hurt of Da kings? 4:23 Now when Da copy of king Artaxerxes’ letter was read before Rehum, and Shimshai Da scribe, and their companions, they went up in haste to Jerusalem unto Da Jews, and made them to cease by force and power. 4:24 Then ceased Da work of Da house of God which is at Jerusalem. So it ceased unto Da second year of Da reign of Darius king of Persia. 5:1 Then Da prophets, Haggai Da prophet, and Zechariah Da son of Iddo, prophesied unto Da Jews that were in Judah and Jerusalem in Da name of Da God of Israel, even unto them. 5:2 Then rose up Zerubbabel Da son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua Da son of Jozadak, and began to build Da house of God which is at Jerusalem: and with them were Da prophets of God helping them. 5:3 At Da same time came to them Tatnai, governor on this side Da river, and Shetharboznai and their companions, and said thus unto them, Who hath commanded you to build this house, and to make up this wall? 5:4 Then said we unto them after this manner, What are Da names of Da men that make this building? 5:5 But Da eye of their God was upon Da elders of Da Jews, that they could not cause them to cease, till Da matter came to Darius: and then they returned answer by letter concerning this matter. 5:6 The copy of Da letter that Tatnai, governor on this side Da river, and Shetharboznai and his companions Da Apharsachites, which were on this side Da river, sent unto Darius Da king: 5:7 They sent a letter unto him, wherein was written thus; Unto Darius Da king, all peace. 5:8 Be it known unto Da king, that we went into Da province of Judea, to Da house of Da great God, which is builded with great stones, and timber is laid in Da walls, and this work goeth fast on, and prospereth in their hands. 5:9 Then asked we those elders, and said unto them thus, Who commanded you to build this house, and to make up these walls? 5:10 We asked their names also, to certify thee, that we might write Da names of Da men that were Da chief of them. 5:11 And thus they returned us answer, saying, We are Da servants of Da God of heaven and earth, and build Da house that was builded these many years ago, which a great king of Israel builded and set up. 5:12 But after that our fathers had provoked Da God of heaven unto wrath, he gave them into Da hand of Nebuchadnezzar Da king of Babylon, Da Chaldean, who destroyed this house, and carried Da people away into Babylon. 5:13 But in Da first year of Cyrus Da king of Babylon Da same king Cyrus made a decree to build this house of God. 5:14 And Da vessels also of gold and silver of Da house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took out of Da temple that was in Jerusalem, and brought them into Da temple of Babylon, those did Cyrus Da king take out of Da temple of Babylon, and they were delivered unto one, whose name was Sheshbazzar, whom he had made governor; 5:15 And said unto him, Take these vessels, go, carry them into Da temple that is in Jerusalem, and let Da house of God be builded in his place. 5:16 Then came Da same Sheshbazzar, and laid Da foundation of Da house of God which is in Jerusalem: and since that time even until now hath it been in building, and yet it is not finished. 5:17 Now therefore, if it seem good to Da king, let there be search made in Da king’s treasure house, which is there at Babylon, whether it be so, that a decree was made of Cyrus Da king to build this house of God at Jerusalem, and let Da king send his pleasure to us concerning this matter. 6:1 Then Darius Da king made a decree, and search was made in Da house of Da rolls, where Da treasures were laid up in Babylon. 6:2 And there was found at Achmetha, in Da palace that is in Da province of Da Medes, a roll, and therein was a record thus written: 6:3 In Da first year of Cyrus Da king Da same Cyrus Da king made a decree concerning Da house of God at Jerusalem, Let Da house be builded, Da place where they offered sacrifices, and let Da foundations thereof be strongly laid; Da height thereof threescore cubits, and Da breadth thereof threescore cubits; 6:4 With three rows of great stones, and a row of new timber: and let Da expenses be given out of Da king’s house: 6:5 And also let Da golden and silver vessels of Da house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of Da temple which is at Jerusalem, and brought unto Babylon, be restored, and brought again unto Da temple which is at Jerusalem, every one to his place, and place them in Da house of God. 6:6 Now therefore, Tatnai, governor beyond Da river, Shetharboznai, and your companions Da Apharsachites, which are beyond Da river, be ye far from thence: 6:7 Let Da work of this house of God alone; let Da governor of Da Jews and Da elders of Da Jews build this house of God in his place. 6:8 Moreover I make a decree what ye shall do to Da elders of these Jews for Da building of this house of God: that of Da king’s goods, even of Da tribute beyond Da river, forthwith expenses be given unto these men, that they be not hindered. 6:9 And that which they have need of, both young bullocks, and rams, and lambs, for Da burnt offerings of Da God of heaven, wheat, salt, wine, and oil, according to Da appointment of Da priests which are at Jerusalem, let it be given them day by day without fail: 6:10 That they may offer sacrifices of sweet savours unto Da God of heaven, and pray for Da life of Da king, and of his sons. 6:11 Also I have made a decree, that whosoever shall alter this word, let timber be pulled down from his house, and being set up, let him be hanged thereon; and let his house be made a dunghill for this. 6:12 And Da God that hath caused his name to dwell there destroy all kings and people, that shall put to their hand to alter and to destroy this house of God which is at Jerusalem. I Darius have made a decree; let it be done with speed. 6:13 Then Tatnai, governor on this side Da river, Shetharboznai, and their companions, according to that which Darius Da king had sent, so they did speedily. 6:14 And Da elders of Da Jews builded, and they prospered through Da prophesying of Haggai Da prophet and Zechariah Da son of Iddo. And they builded, and finished it, according to Da commandment of Da God of Israel, and according to Da commandment of Cyrus, and Darius, and Artaxerxes king of Persia. 6:15 And this house was finished on Da third day of Da month Adar, which was in Da sixth year of Da reign of Darius Da king. 6:16 And Da children of Israel, Da priests, and Da Levites, and Da rest of Da children of Da captivity, kept Da dedication of this house of God with joy. 6:17 And offered at Da dedication of this house of God an hundred bullocks, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs; and for a sin offering for all Israel, twelve he goats, according to Da number of Da tribes of Israel. 6:18 And they set Da priests in their divisions, and Da Levites in their courses, for Da service of God, which is at Jerusalem; as it is written in Da book of Moses. 6:19 And Da children of Da captivity kept Da passover upon Da fourteenth day of Da first month. 6:20 For Da priests and Da Levites were purified together, all of them were pure, and killed Da passover for all Da children of Da captivity, and for their brethren Da priests, and for themselves. 6:21 And Da children of Israel, which were come again out of captivity, and all such as had separated themselves unto them from Da filthiness of Da heathen of Da land, to seek Da LORD God of Israel, did eat, 6:22 And kept Da feast of unleavened bread seven days with joy: for Da LORD had made them joyful, and turned Da heart of Da king of Assyria unto them, to strengthen their hands in Da work of Da house of God, Da God of Israel. 7:1 Now after these things, in Da reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra Da son of Seraiah, Da son of Azariah, Da son of Hilkiah, 7:2 The son of Shallum, Da son of Zadok, Da son of Ahitub, 7:3 The son of Amariah, Da son of Azariah, Da son of Meraioth, 7:4 The son of Zerahiah, Da son of Uzzi, Da son of Bukki, 7:5 The son of Abishua, Da son of Phinehas, Da son of Eleazar, Da son of Aaron Da chief priest: 7:6 This Ezra went up from Babylon; and he was a ready scribe in Da law of Moses, which Da LORD God of Israel had given: and Da king granted him all his request, according to Da hand of Da LORD his God upon him. 7:7 And there went up some of Da children of Israel, and of Da priests, and Da Levites, and Da singers, and Da porters, and Da Nethinims, unto Jerusalem, in Da seventh year of Artaxerxes Da king. 7:8 And he came to Jerusalem in Da fifth month, which was in Da seventh year of Da king. 7:9 For upon Da first day of Da first month began he to go up from Babylon, and on Da first day of Da fifth month came he to Jerusalem, according to Da good hand of his God upon him. 7:10 For Ezra had prepared his heart to seek Da law of Da LORD, and to do it, and to teach in Israel statutes and judgments. 7:11 Now this is Da copy of Da letter that Da king Artaxerxes gave unto Ezra Da priest, Da scribe, even a scribe of Da words of Da commandments of Da LORD, and of his statutes to Israel. 7:12 Artaxerxes, king of kings, unto Ezra Da priest, a scribe of Da law of Da God of heaven, perfect peace, and at such a time. 7:13 I make a decree, that all they of Da people of Israel, and of his priests and Levites, in my realm, which are minded of their own freewill to go up to Jerusalem, go with thee. 7:14 Forasmuch as thou art sent of Da king, and of his seven counsellors, to enquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem, according to Da law of thy God which is in thine hand; 7:15 And to carry Da silver and gold, which Da king and his counsellors have freely offered unto Da God of Israel, whose habitation is in Jerusalem, 7:16 And all Da silver and gold that thou canst find in all Da province of Babylon, with Da freewill offering of Da people, and of Da priests, offering willingly for Da house of their God which is in Jerusalem: 7:17 That thou mayest buy speedily with this money bullocks, rams, lambs, with their meat offerings and their drink offerings, and offer them upon Da altar of Da house of your God which is in Jerusalem. 7:18 And whatsoever shall seem good to thee, and to thy brethren, to do with Da rest of Da silver and Da gold, that do after Da will of your God. 7:19 The vessels also that are given thee for Da service of Da house of thy God, those deliver thou before Da God of Jerusalem. 7:20 And whatsoever more shall be needful for Da house of thy God, which thou shalt have occasion to bestow, bestow it out of Da king’s treasure house. 7:21 And I, even I Artaxerxes Da king, do make a decree to all Da treasurers which are beyond Da river, that whatsoever Ezra Da priest, Da scribe of Da law of Da God of heaven, shall require of you, it be done speedily, 7:22 Unto an hundred talents of silver, and to an hundred measures of wheat, and to an hundred baths of wine, and to an hundred baths of oil, and salt without prescribing how much. 7:23 Whatsoever is commanded by Da God of heaven, let it be diligently done for Da house of Da God of heaven: for why should there be wrath against Da realm of Da king and his sons? 7:24 Also we certify you, that touching any of Da priests and Levites, singers, porters, Nethinims, or ministers of this house of God, it shall not be lawful to impose toll, tribute, or custom, upon them. 7:25 And thou, Ezra, after Da wisdom of thy God, that is in thine hand, set magistrates and judges, which may judge all Da people that are beyond Da river, all such as know Da laws of thy God; and teach ye them that know them not. 7:26 And whosoever will not do Da law of thy God, and Da law of Da king, let judgment be executed speedily upon him, whether it be unto death, or to banishment, or to confiscation of goods, or to imprisonment. 7:27 Blessed be Da LORD God of our fathers, which hath put such a thing as this in Da king’s heart, to beautify Da house of Da LORD which is in Jerusalem: 7:28 And hath extended mercy unto me before Da king, and his counsellors, and before all Da king’s mighty princes. And I was strengthened as Da hand of Da LORD my God was upon me, and I gathered together out of Israel chief men to go up with me. 8:1 These are now Da chief of their fathers, and this is Da genealogy of them that went up with me from Babylon, in Da reign of Artaxerxes Da king. 8:2 Of Da sons of Phinehas; Gershom: of Da sons of Ithamar; Daniel: of Da sons of David; Hattush. 8:3 Of Da sons of Shechaniah, of Da sons of Pharosh; Zechariah: and with him were reckoned by genealogy of Da males an hundred and fifty. 8:4 Of Da sons of Pahathmoab; Elihoenai Da son of Zerahiah, and with him two hundred males. 8:5 Of Da sons of Shechaniah; Da son of Jahaziel, and with him three hundred males. 8:6 Of Da sons also of Adin; Ebed Da son of Jonathan, and with him fifty males. 8:7 And of Da sons of Elam; Jeshaiah Da son of Athaliah, and with him seventy males. 8:8 And of Da sons of Shephatiah; Zebadiah Da son of Michael, and with him fourscore males. 8:9 Of Da sons of Joab; Obadiah Da son of Jehiel, and with him two hundred and eighteen males. 8:10 And of Da sons of Shelomith; Da son of Josiphiah, and with him an hundred and threescore males. 8:11 And of Da sons of Bebai; Zechariah Da son of Bebai, and with him twenty and eight males. 8:12 And of Da sons of Azgad; Johanan Da son of Hakkatan, and with him an hundred and ten males. 8:13 And of Da last sons of Adonikam, whose names are these, Eliphelet, Jeiel, and Shemaiah, and with them threescore males. 8:14 Of Da sons also of Bigvai; Uthai, and Zabbud, and with them seventy males. 8:15 And I gathered them together to Da river that runneth to Ahava; and there abode we in tents three days: and I viewed Da people, and Da priests, and found there none of Da sons of Levi. 8:16 Then sent I for Eliezer, for Ariel, for Shemaiah, and for Elnathan, and for Jarib, and for Elnathan, and for Nathan, and for Zechariah, and for Meshullam, chief men; also for Joiarib, and for Elnathan, men of understanding. 8:17 And I sent them with commandment unto Iddo Da chief at Da place Casiphia, and I told them what they should say unto Iddo, and to his brethren Da Nethinims, at Da place Casiphia, that they should bring unto us ministers for Da house of our God. 8:18 And by Da good hand of our God upon us they brought us a man of understanding, of Da sons of Mahli, Da son of Levi, Da son of Israel; and Sherebiah, with his sons and his brethren, eighteen; 8:19 And Hashabiah, and with him Jeshaiah of Da sons of Merari, his brethren and their sons, twenty; 8:20 Also of Da Nethinims, whom David and Da princes had appointed for Da service of Da Levites, two hundred and twenty Nethinims: all of them were expressed by name. 8:21 Then I proclaimed a fast there, at Da river of Ahava, that we might afflict ourselves before our God, to seek of him a right way for us, and for our little ones, and for all our substance. 8:22 For I was ashamed to require of Da king a band of soldiers and horsemen to help us against Da enemy in Da way: because we had spoken unto Da king, saying, The hand of our God is upon all them for good that seek him; but his power and his wrath is against all them that forsake him. 8:23 So we fasted and besought our God for this: and he was intreated of us. 8:24 Then I separated twelve of Da chief of Da priests, Sherebiah, Hashabiah, and ten of their brethren with them, 8:25 And weighed unto them Da silver, and Da gold, and Da vessels, even Da offering of Da house of our God, which Da king, and his counsellors, and his lords, and all Israel there present, had offered: 8:26 I even weighed unto their hand six hundred and fifty talents of silver, and silver vessels an hundred talents, and of gold an hundred talents; 8:27 Also twenty basons of gold, of a thousand drams; and two vessels of fine copper, precious as gold. 8:28 And I said unto them, Ye are holy unto Da LORD; Da vessels are holy also; and Da silver and Da gold are a freewill offering unto Da LORD God of your fathers. 8:29 Watch ye, and keep them, until ye weigh them before Da chief of Da priests and Da Levites, and chief of Da fathers of Israel, at Jerusalem, in Da chambers of Da house of Da LORD. 8:30 So took Da priests and Da Levites Da weight of Da silver, and Da gold, and Da vessels, to bring them to Jerusalem unto Da house of our God. 8:31 Then we departed from Da river of Ahava on Da twelfth day of Da first month, to go unto Jerusalem: and Da hand of our God was upon us, and he delivered us from Da hand of Da enemy, and of such as lay in wait by Da way. 8:32 And we came to Jerusalem, and abode there three days. 8:33 Now on Da fourth day was Da silver and Da gold and Da vessels weighed in Da house of our God by Da hand of Meremoth Da son of Uriah Da priest; and with him was Eleazar Da son of Phinehas; and with them was Jozabad Da son of Jeshua, and Noadiah Da son of Binnui, Levites; 8:34 By number and by weight of every one: and all Da weight was written at that time. 8:35 Also Da children of those that had been carried away, which were come out of Da captivity, offered burnt offerings unto Da God of Israel, twelve bullocks for all Israel, ninety and six rams, seventy and seven lambs, twelve he goats for a sin offering: all this was a burnt offering unto Da LORD. 8:36 And they delivered Da king’s commissions unto Da king’s lieutenants, and to Da governors on this side Da river: and they furthered Da people, and Da house of God. 9:1 Now when these things were done, Da princes came to me, saying, The people of Israel, and Da priests, and Da Levites, have not separated themselves from Da people of Da lands, doing according to their abominations, even of Da Canaanites, Da Hittites, Da Perizzites, Da Jebusites, Da Ammonites, Da Moabites, Da Egyptians, and Da Amorites. 9:2 For they have taken of their daughters for themselves, and for their sons: so that Da holy seed have mingled themselves with Da people of those lands: yea, Da hand of Da princes and rulers hath been chief in this trespass. 9:3 And when I heard this thing, I rent my garment and my mantle, and plucked off Da hair of my head and of my beard, and sat down astonied. 9:4 Then were assembled unto me every one that trembled at Da words of Da God of Israel, because of Da transgression of those that had been carried away; and I sat astonied until Da evening sacrifice. 9:5 And at Da evening sacrifice I arose up from my heaviness; and having rent my garment and my mantle, I fell upon my knees, and spread out my hands unto Da LORD my God, 9:6 And said, O my God, I am ashamed and blush to lift up my face to thee, my God: for our iniquities are increased over our head, and our trespass is grown up unto Da heavens. 9:7 Since Da days of our fathers have we been in a great trespass unto this day; and for our iniquities have we, our kings, and our priests, been delivered into Da hand of Da kings of Da lands, to Da sword, to captivity, and to a spoil, and to confusion of face, as it is this day. 9:8 And now for a little space grace hath been shewed from Da LORD our God, to leave us a remnant to escape, and to give us a nail in his holy place, that our God may lighten our eyes, and give us a little reviving in our bondage. 9:9 For we were bondmen; yet our God hath not forsaken us in our bondage, but hath extended mercy unto us in Da sight of Da kings of Persia, to give us a reviving, to set up Da house of our God, and to repair Da desolations thereof, and to give us a wall in Judah and in Jerusalem. 9:10 And now, O our God, what shall we say after this? for we have forsaken thy commandments, 9:11 Which thou hast commanded by thy servants Da prophets, saying, The land, unto which ye go to possess it, is an unclean land with Da filthiness of Da people of Da lands, with their abominations, which have filled it from one end to another with their uncleanness. 9:12 Now therefore give not your daughters unto their sons, neither take their daughters unto your sons, nor seek their peace or their wealth for ever: that ye may be strong, and eat Da good of Da land, and leave it for an inheritance to your children for ever. 9:13 And after all that is come upon us for our evil deeds, and for our great trespass, seeing that thou our God hast punished us less than our iniquities deserve, and hast given us such deliverance as this; 9:14 Should we again break thy commandments, and join in affinity with Da people of these abominations? wouldest not thou be angry with us till thou hadst consumed us, so that there should be no remnant nor escaping? 9:15 O LORD God of Israel, thou art righteous: for we remain yet escaped, as it is this day: behold, we are before thee in our trespasses: for we cannot stand before thee because of this. 10:1 Now when Ezra had prayed, and when he had confessed, weeping and casting himself down before Da house of God, there assembled unto him out of Israel a very great congregation of men and women and children: for Da people wept very sore. 10:2 And Shechaniah Da son of Jehiel, one of Da sons of Elam, answered and said unto Ezra, We have trespassed against our God, and have taken strange wives of Da people of Da land: yet now there is hope in Israel concerning this thing. 10:3 Now therefore let us make a covenant with our God to put away all Da wives, and such as are born of them, according to Da counsel of my lord, and of those that tremble at Da commandment of our God; and let it be done according to Da law. 10:4 Arise; for this matter belongeth unto thee: we also will be with thee: be of good courage, and do it. 10:5 Then arose Ezra, and made Da chief priests, Da Levites, and all Israel, to swear that they should do according to this word. And they sware. 10:6 Then Ezra rose up from before Da house of God, and went into Da chamber of Johanan Da son of Eliashib: and when he came thither, he did eat no bread, nor drink water: for he mourned because of Da transgression of them that had been carried away. 10:7 And they made proclamation throughout Judah and Jerusalem unto all Da children of Da captivity, that they should gather themselves together unto Jerusalem; 10:8 And that whosoever would not come within three days, according to Da counsel of Da princes and Da elders, all his substance should be forfeited, and himself separated from Da congregation of those that had been carried away. 10:9 Then all Da men of Judah and Benjamin gathered themselves together unto Jerusalem within three days. It was Da ninth month, on Da twentieth day of Da month; and all Da people sat in Da street of Da house of God, trembling because of this matter, and for Da great rain. 10:10 And Ezra Da priest stood up, and said unto them, Ye have transgressed, and have taken strange wives, to increase Da trespass of Israel. 10:11 Now therefore make confession unto Da LORD God of your fathers, and do his pleasure: and separate yourselves from Da people of Da land, and from Da strange wives. 10:12 Then all Da congregation answered and said with a loud voice, As thou hast said, so must we do. 10:13 But Da people are many, and it is a time of much rain, and we are not able to stand without, neither is this a work of one day or two: for we are many that have transgressed in this thing. 10:14 Let now our rulers of all Da congregation stand, and let all them which have taken strange wives in our cities come at appointed times, and with them Da elders of every city, and Da judges thereof, until Da fierce wrath of our God for this matter be turned from us. 10:15 Only Jonathan Da son of Asahel and Jahaziah Da son of Tikvah were employed about this matter: and Meshullam and Shabbethai Da Levite helped them. 10:16 And Da children of Da captivity did so. And Ezra Da priest, with certain chief of Da fathers, after Da house of their fathers, and all of them by their names, were separated, and sat down in Da first day of Da tenth month to examine Da matter. 10:17 And they made an end with all Da men that had taken strange wives by Da first day of Da first month. 10:18 And among Da sons of Da priests there were found that had taken strange wives: namely, of Da sons of Jeshua Da son of Jozadak, and his brethren; Maaseiah, and Eliezer, and Jarib, and Gedaliah. 10:19 And they gave their hands that they would put away their wives; and being guilty, they offered a ram of Da flock for their trespass. 10:20 And of Da sons of Immer; Hanani, and Zebadiah. 10:21 And of Da sons of Harim; Maaseiah, and Elijah, and Shemaiah, and Jehiel, and Uzziah. 10:22 And of Da sons of Pashur; Elioenai, Maaseiah, Ishmael, Nethaneel, Jozabad, and Elasah. 10:23 Also of Da Levites; Jozabad, and Shimei, and Kelaiah, (the same is Kelita,) Pethahiah, Judah, and Eliezer. 10:24 Of Da singers also; Eliashib: and of Da porters; Shallum, and Telem, and Uri. 10:25 Moreover of Israel: of Da sons of Parosh; Ramiah, and Jeziah, and Malchiah, and Miamin, and Eleazar, and Malchijah, and Benaiah. 10:26 And of Da sons of Elam; Mattaniah, Zechariah, and Jehiel, and Abdi, and Jeremoth, and Eliah. 10:27 And of Da sons of Zattu; Elioenai, Eliashib, Mattaniah, and Jeremoth, and Zabad, and Aziza. 10:28 Of Da sons also of Bebai; Jehohanan, Hananiah, Zabbai, and Athlai. 10:29 And of Da sons of Bani; Meshullam, Malluch, and Adaiah, Jashub, and Sheal, and Ramoth. 10:30 And of Da sons of Pahathmoab; Adna, and Chelal, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattaniah, Bezaleel, and Binnui, and Manasseh. 10:31 And of Da sons of Harim; Eliezer, Ishijah, Malchiah, Shemaiah, Shimeon, 10:32 Benjamin, Malluch, and Shemariah. 10:33 Of Da sons of Hashum; Mattenai, Mattathah, Zabad, Eliphelet, Jeremai, Manasseh, and Shimei. 10:34 Of Da sons of Bani; Maadai, Amram, and Uel, 10:35 Benaiah, Bedeiah, Chelluh, 10:36 Vaniah, Meremoth, Eliashib, 10:37 Mattaniah, Mattenai, and Jaasau, 10:38 And Bani, and Binnui, Shimei, 10:39 And Shelemiah, and Nathan, and Adaiah, 10:40 Machnadebai, Shashai, Sharai, 10:41 Azareel, and Shelemiah, Shemariah, 10:42 Shallum, Amariah, and Joseph. 10:43 Of Da sons of Nebo; Jeiel, Mattithiah, Zabad, Zebina, Jadau, and Joel, Benaiah. 10:44 All these had taken strange wives: and some of them had wives by whom they had children. The Book of Nehemiah 1:1 The words of Nehemiah Da son of Hachaliah. And it came to pass in Da month Chisleu, in Da twentieth year, as I was in Shushan Da palace, 1:2 That Hanani, one of my brethren, came, he and certain men of Judah; and I asked them concerning Da Jews that had escaped, which were left of Da captivity, and concerning Jerusalem. 1:3 And they said unto me, The remnant that are left of Da captivity there in Da province are in great affliction and reproach: Da wall of Jerusalem also is broken down, and Da gates thereof are burned with fire. 1:4 And it came to pass, when I heard these words, that I sat down and wept, and mourned certain days, and fasted, and prayed before Da God of heaven, 1:5 And said, I beseech thee, O LORD God of heaven, Da great and terrible God, that keepeth covenant and mercy for them that love him and observe his commandments: 1:6 Let thine ear now be attentive, and thine eyes open, that thou mayest hear Da prayer of thy servant, which I pray before thee now, day and night, for Da children of Israel thy servants, and confess Da sins of Da children of Israel, which we have sinned against thee: both I and my father’s house have sinned. 1:7 We have dealt very corruptly against thee, and have not kept Da commandments, nor Da statutes, nor Da judgments, which thou commandedst thy servant Moses. 1:8 Remember, I beseech thee, Da word that thou commandedst thy servant Moses, saying, If ye transgress, I will scatter you abroad among Da nations: 1:9 But if ye turn unto me, and keep my commandments, and do them; though there were of you cast out unto Da uttermost part of Da heaven, yet will I gather them from thence, and will bring them unto Da place that I have chosen to set my name there. 1:10 Now these are thy servants and thy people, whom thou hast redeemed by thy great power, and by thy strong hand. 1:11 O LORD, I beseech thee, let now thine ear be attentive to Da prayer of thy servant, and to Da prayer of thy servants, who desire to fear thy name: and prosper, I pray thee, thy servant this day, and grant him mercy in Da sight of this man. For I was Da king’s cupbearer. 2:1 And it came to pass in Da month Nisan, in Da twentieth year of Artaxerxes Da king, that wine was before him: and I took up Da wine, and gave it unto Da king. Now I had not been beforetime sad in his presence. 2:2 Wherefore Da king said unto me, Why is thy countenance sad, seeing thou art not sick? this is nothing else but sorrow of heart. Then I was very sore afraid, 2:3 And said unto Da king, Let Da king live for ever: why should not my countenance be sad, when Da city, Da place of my fathers’ sepulchres, lieth waste, and Da gates thereof are consumed with fire? 2:4 Then Da king said unto me, For what dost thou make request? So I prayed to Da God of heaven. 2:5 And I said unto Da king, If it please Da king, and if thy servant have found favour in thy sight, that thou wouldest send me unto Judah, unto Da city of my fathers’ sepulchres, that I may build it. 2:6 And Da king said unto me, (the queen also sitting by him,) For how long shall thy journey be? and when wilt thou return? So it pleased Da king to send me; and I set him a time. 2:7 Moreover I said unto Da king, If it please Da king, let letters be given me to Da governors beyond Da river, that they may convey me over till I come into Judah; 2:8 And a letter unto Asaph Da keeper of Da king’s forest, that he may give me timber to make beams for Da gates of Da palace which appertained to Da house, and for Da wall of Da city, and for Da house that I shall enter into. And Da king granted me, according to Da good hand of my God upon me. 2:9 Then I came to Da governors beyond Da river, and gave them Da king’s letters. Now Da king had sent captains of Da army and horsemen with me. 2:10 When Sanballat Da Horonite, and Tobiah Da servant, Da Ammonite, heard of it, it grieved them exceedingly that there was come a man to seek Da welfare of Da children of Israel. 2:11 So I came to Jerusalem, and was there three days. 2:12 And I arose in Da night, I and some few men with me; neither told I any man what my God had put in my heart to do at Jerusalem: neither was there any beast with me, save Da beast that I rode upon. 2:13 And I went out by night by Da gate of Da valley, even before Da dragon well, and to Da dung port, and viewed Da walls of Jerusalem, which were broken down, and Da gates thereof were consumed with fire. 2:14 Then I went on to Da gate of Da fountain, and to Da king’s pool: but there was no place for Da beast that was under me to pass. 2:15 Then went I up in Da night by Da brook, and viewed Da wall, and turned back, and entered by Da gate of Da valley, and so returned. 2:16 And Da rulers knew not whither I went, or what I did; neither had I as yet told it to Da Jews, nor to Da priests, nor to Da nobles, nor to Da rulers, nor to Da rest that did Da work. 2:17 Then said I unto them, Ye see Da distress that we are in, how Jerusalem lieth waste, and Da gates thereof are burned with fire: come, and let us build up Da wall of Jerusalem, that we be no more a reproach. 2:18 Then I told them of Da hand of my God which was good upon me; as also Da king’s words that he had spoken unto me. And they said, Let us rise up and build. So they strengthened their hands for this good work. 2:19 But when Sanballat Da Horonite, and Tobiah Da servant, Da Ammonite, and Geshem Da Arabian, heard it, they laughed us to scorn, and despised us, and said, What is this thing that ye do? will ye rebel against Da king? 2:20 Then answered I them, and said unto them, The God of heaven, he will prosper us; therefore we his servants will arise and build: but ye have no portion, nor right, nor memorial, in Jerusalem. 3:1 Then Eliashib Da high priest rose up with his brethren Da priests, and they builded Da sheep gate; they sanctified it, and set up Da doors of it; even unto Da tower of Meah they sanctified it, unto Da tower of Hananeel. 3:2 And next unto him builded Da men of Jericho. And next to them builded Zaccur Da son of Imri. 3:3 But Da fish gate did Da sons of Hassenaah build, who also laid Da beams thereof, and set up Da doors thereof, Da locks thereof, and Da bars thereof. 3:4 And next unto them repaired Meremoth Da son of Urijah, Da son of Koz. And next unto them repaired Meshullam Da son of Berechiah, Da son of Meshezabeel. And next unto them repaired Zadok Da son of Baana. 3:5 And next unto them Da Tekoites repaired; but their nobles put not their necks to Da work of their LORD. 3:6 Moreover Da old gate repaired Jehoiada Da son of Paseah, and Meshullam Da son of Besodeiah; they laid Da beams thereof, and set up Da doors thereof, and Da locks thereof, and Da bars thereof. 3:7 And next unto them repaired Melatiah Da Gibeonite, and Jadon Da Meronothite, Da men of Gibeon, and of Mizpah, unto Da throne of Da governor on this side Da river. 3:8 Next unto him repaired Uzziel Da son of Harhaiah, of Da goldsmiths. Next unto him also repaired Hananiah Da son of one of Da apothecaries, and they fortified Jerusalem unto Da broad wall. 3:9 And next unto them repaired Rephaiah Da son of Hur, Da ruler of Da half part of Jerusalem. 3:10 And next unto them repaired Jedaiah Da son of Harumaph, even over against his house. And next unto him repaired Hattush Da son of Hashabniah. 3:11 Malchijah Da son of Harim, and Hashub Da son of Pahathmoab, repaired Da other piece, and Da tower of Da furnaces. 3:12 And next unto him repaired Shallum Da son of Halohesh, Da ruler of Da half part of Jerusalem, he and his daughters. 3:13 The valley gate repaired Hanun, and Da inhabitants of Zanoah; they built it, and set up Da doors thereof, Da locks thereof, and Da bars thereof, and a thousand cubits on Da wall unto Da dung gate. 3:14 But Da dung gate repaired Malchiah Da son of Rechab, Da ruler of part of Bethhaccerem; he built it, and set up Da doors thereof, Da locks thereof, and Da bars thereof. 3:15 But Da gate of Da fountain repaired Shallun Da son of Colhozeh, Da ruler of part of Mizpah; he built it, and covered it, and set up Da doors thereof, Da locks thereof, and Da bars thereof, and Da wall of Da pool of Siloah by Da king’s garden, and unto Da stairs that go down from Da city of David. 3:16 After him repaired Nehemiah Da son of Azbuk, Da ruler of Da half part of Bethzur, unto Da place over against Da sepulchres of David, and to Da pool that was made, and unto Da house of Da mighty. 3:17 After him repaired Da Levites, Rehum Da son of Bani. Next unto him repaired Hashabiah, Da ruler of Da half part of Keilah, in his part. 3:18 After him repaired their brethren, Bavai Da son of Henadad, Da ruler of Da half part of Keilah. 3:19 And next to him repaired Ezer Da son of Jeshua, Da ruler of Mizpah, another piece over against Da going up to Da armoury at Da turning of Da wall. 3:20 After him Baruch Da son of Zabbai earnestly repaired Da other piece, from Da turning of Da wall unto Da door of Da house of Eliashib Da high priest. 3:21 After him repaired Meremoth Da son of Urijah Da son of Koz another piece, from Da door of Da house of Eliashib even to Da end of Da house of Eliashib. 3:22 And after him repaired Da priests, Da men of Da plain. 3:23 After him repaired Benjamin and Hashub over against their house. After him repaired Azariah Da son of Maaseiah Da son of Ananiah by his house. 3:24 After him repaired Binnui Da son of Henadad another piece, from Da house of Azariah unto Da turning of Da wall, even unto Da corner. 3:25 Palal Da son of Uzai, over against Da turning of Da wall, and Da tower which lieth out from Da king’s high house, that was by Da court of Da prison. After him Pedaiah Da son of Parosh. 3:26 Moreover Da Nethinims dwelt in Ophel, unto Da place over against Da water gate toward Da east, and Da tower that lieth out. 3:27 After them Da Tekoites repaired another piece, over against Da great tower that lieth out, even unto Da wall of Ophel. 3:28 From above Da horse gate repaired Da priests, every one over against his house. 3:29 After them repaired Zadok Da son of Immer over against his house. After him repaired also Shemaiah Da son of Shechaniah, Da keeper of Da east gate. 3:30 After him repaired Hananiah Da son of Shelemiah, and Hanun Da sixth son of Zalaph, another piece. After him repaired Meshullam Da son of Berechiah over against his chamber. 3:31 After him repaired Malchiah Da goldsmith’s son unto Da place of Da Nethinims, and of Da merchants, over against Da gate Miphkad, and to Da going up of Da corner. 3:32 And between Da going up of Da corner unto Da sheep gate repaired Da goldsmiths and Da merchants. 4:1 But it came to pass, that when Sanballat heard that we builded Da wall, he was wroth, and took great indignation, and mocked Da Jews. 4:2 And he spake before his brethren and Da army of Samaria, and said, What do these feeble Jews? will they fortify themselves? will they sacrifice? will they make an end in a day? will they revive Da stones out of Da heaps of Da rubbish which are burned? 4:3 Now Tobiah Da Ammonite was by him, and he said, Even that which they build, if a fox go up, he shall even break down their stone wall. 4:4 Hear, O our God; for we are despised: and turn their reproach upon their own head, and give them for a prey in Da land of captivity: 4:5 And cover not their iniquity, and let not their sin be blotted out from before thee: for they have provoked thee to anger before Da builders. 4:6 So built we Da wall; and all Da wall was joined together unto Da half thereof: for Da people had a mind to work. 4:7 But it came to pass, that when Sanballat, and Tobiah, and Da Arabians, and Da Ammonites, and Da Ashdodites, heard that Da walls of Jerusalem were made up, and that Da breaches began to be stopped, then they were very wroth, 4:8 And conspired all of them together to come and to fight against Jerusalem, and to hinder it. 4:9 Nevertheless we made our prayer unto our God, and set a watch against them day and night, because of them. 4:10 And Judah said, The strength of Da bearers of burdens is decayed, and there is much rubbish; so that we are not able to build Da wall. 4:11 And our adversaries said, They shall not know, neither see, till we come in Da midst among them, and slay them, and cause Da work to cease. 4:12 And it came to pass, that when Da Jews which dwelt by them came, they said unto us ten times, From all places whence ye shall return unto us they will be upon you. 4:13 Therefore set I in Da lower places behind Da wall, and on Da higher places, I even set Da people after their families with their swords, their spears, and their bows. 4:14 And I looked, and rose up, and said unto Da nobles, and to Da rulers, and to Da rest of Da people, Be not ye afraid of them: remember Da LORD, which is great and terrible, and fight for your brethren, your sons, and your daughters, your wives, and your houses. 4:15 And it came to pass, when our enemies heard that it was known unto us, and God had brought their counsel to nought, that we returned all of us to Da wall, every one unto his work. 4:16 And it came to pass from that time forth, that Da half of my servants wrought in Da work, and Da other half of them held both Da spears, Da shields, and Da bows, and Da habergeons; and Da rulers were behind all Da house of Judah. 4:17 They which builded on Da wall, and they that bare burdens, with those that laded, every one with one of his hands wrought in Da work, and with Da other hand held a weapon. 4:18 For Da builders, every one had his sword girded by his side, and so builded. And he that sounded Da trumpet was by me. 4:19 And I said unto Da nobles, and to Da rulers, and to Da rest of Da people, The work is great and large, and we are separated upon Da wall, one far from another. 4:20 In what place therefore ye hear Da sound of Da trumpet, resort ye thither unto us: our God shall fight for us. 4:21 So we laboured in Da work: and half of them held Da spears from Da rising of Da morning till Da stars appeared. 4:22 Likewise at Da same time said I unto Da people, Let every one with his servant lodge within Jerusalem, that in Da night they may be a guard to us, and labour on Da day. 4:23 So neither I, nor my brethren, nor my servants, nor Da men of Da guard which followed me, none of us put off our clothes, saving that every one put them off for washing. 5:1 And there was a great cry of Da people and of their wives against their brethren Da Jews. 5:2 For there were that said, We, our sons, and our daughters, are many: therefore we take up corn for them, that we may eat, and live. 5:3 Some also there were that said, We have mortgaged our lands, vineyards, and houses, that we might buy corn, because of Da dearth. 5:4 There were also that said, We have borrowed money for Da king’s tribute, and that upon our lands and vineyards. 5:5 Yet now our flesh is as Da flesh of our brethren, our children as their children: and, lo, we bring into bondage our sons and our daughters to be servants, and some of our daughters are brought unto bondage already: neither is it in our power to redeem them; for other men have our lands and vineyards. 5:6 And I was very angry when I heard their cry and these words. 5:7 Then I consulted with myself, and I rebuked Da nobles, and Da rulers, and said unto them, Ye exact usury, every one of his brother. And I set a great assembly against them. 5:8 And I said unto them, We after our ability have redeemed our brethren Da Jews, which were sold unto Da heathen; and will ye even sell your brethren? or shall they be sold unto us? Then held they their peace, and found nothing to answer. 5:9 Also I said, It is not good that ye do: ought ye not to walk in Da fear of our God because of Da reproach of Da heathen our enemies? 5:10 I likewise, and my brethren, and my servants, might exact of them money and corn: I pray you, let us leave off this usury. 5:11 Restore, I pray you, to them, even this day, their lands, their vineyards, their oliveyards, and their houses, also Da hundredth part of Da money, and of Da corn, Da wine, and Da oil, that ye exact of them. 5:12 Then said they, We will restore them, and will require nothing of them; so will we do as thou sayest. Then I called Da priests, and took an oath of them, that they should do according to this promise. 5:13 Also I shook my lap, and said, So God shake out every man from his house, and from his labour, that performeth not this promise, even thus be he shaken out, and emptied. And all Da congregation said, Amen, and praised Da LORD. And Da people did according to this promise. 5:14 Moreover from Da time that I was appointed to be their governor in Da land of Judah, from Da twentieth year even unto Da two and thirtieth year of Artaxerxes Da king, that is, twelve years, I and my brethren have not eaten Da bread of Da governor. 5:15 But Da former governors that had been before me were chargeable unto Da people, and had taken of them bread and wine, beside forty shekels of silver; yea, even their servants bare rule over Da people: but so did not I, because of Da fear of God. 5:16 Yea, also I continued in Da work of this wall, neither bought we any land: and all my servants were gathered thither unto Da work. 5:17 Moreover there were at my table an hundred and fifty of Da Jews and rulers, beside those that came unto us from among Da heathen that are about us. 5:18 Now that which was prepared for me daily was one ox and six choice sheep; also fowls were prepared for me, and once in ten days store of all sorts of wine: yet for all this required not I Da bread of Da governor, because Da bondage was heavy upon this people. 5:19 Think upon me, my God, for good, according to all that I have done for this people. 6:1 Now it came to pass when Sanballat, and Tobiah, and Geshem Da Arabian, and Da rest of our enemies, heard that I had builded Da wall, and that there was no breach left therein; (though at that time I had not set up Da doors upon Da gates;) 6:2 That Sanballat and Geshem sent unto me, saying, Come, let us meet together in some one of Da villages in Da plain of Ono. But they thought to do me mischief. 6:3 And I sent messengers unto them, saying, I am doing a great work, so that I cannot come down: why should Da work cease, whilst I leave it, and come down to you? 6:4 Yet they sent unto me four times after this sort; and I answered them after Da same manner. 6:5 Then sent Sanballat his servant unto me in like manner Da fifth time with an open letter in his hand; 6:6 Wherein was written, It is reported among Da heathen, and Gashmu saith it, that thou and Da Jews think to rebel: for which cause thou buildest Da wall, that thou mayest be their king, according to these words. 6:7 And thou hast also appointed prophets to preach of thee at Jerusalem, saying, There is a king in Judah: and now shall it be reported to Da king according to these words. Come now therefore, and let us take counsel together. 6:8 Then I sent unto him, saying, There are no such things done as thou sayest, but thou feignest them out of thine own heart. 6:9 For they all made us afraid, saying, Their hands shall be weakened from Da work, that it be not done. Now therefore, O God, strengthen my hands. 6:10 Afterward I came unto Da house of Shemaiah Da son of Delaiah Da son of Mehetabeel, who was shut up; and he said, Let us meet together in Da house of God, within Da temple, and let us shut Da doors of Da temple: for they will come to slay thee; yea, in Da night will they come to slay thee. 6:11 And I said, Should such a man as I flee? and who is there, that, being as I am, would go into Da temple to save his life? I will not go in. 6:12 And, lo, I perceived that God had not sent him; but that he pronounced this prophecy against me: for Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him. 6:13 Therefore was he hired, that I should be afraid, and do so, and sin, and that they might have matter for an evil report, that they might reproach me. 6:14 My God, think thou upon Tobiah and Sanballat according to these their works, and on Da prophetess Noadiah, and Da rest of Da prophets, that would have put me in fear. 6:15 So Da wall was finished in Da twenty and fifth day of Da month Elul, in fifty and two days. 6:16 And it came to pass, that when all our enemies heard thereof, and all Da heathen that were about us saw these things, they were much cast down in their own eyes: for they perceived that this work was wrought of our God. 6:17 Moreover in those days Da nobles of Judah sent many letters unto Tobiah, and Da letters of Tobiah came unto them. 6:18 For there were many in Judah sworn unto him, because he was Da son in law of Shechaniah Da son of Arah; and his son Johanan had taken Da daughter of Meshullam Da son of Berechiah. 6:19 Also they reported his good deeds before me, and uttered my words to him. And Tobiah sent letters to put me in fear. 7:1 Now it came to pass, when Da wall was built, and I had set up Da doors, and Da porters and Da singers and Da Levites were appointed, 7:2 That I gave my brother Hanani, and Hananiah Da ruler of Da palace, charge over Jerusalem: for he was a faithful man, and feared God above many. 7:3 And I said unto them, Let not Da gates of Jerusalem be opened until Da sun be hot; and while they stand by, let them shut Da doors, and bar them: and appoint watches of Da inhabitants of Jerusalem, every one in his watch, and every one to be over against his house. 7:4 Now Da city was large and great: but Da people were few therein, and Da houses were not builded. 7:5 And my God put into mine heart to gather together Da nobles, and Da rulers, and Da people, that they might be reckoned by genealogy. And I found a register of Da genealogy of them which came up at Da first, and found written therein, 7:6 These are Da children of Da province, that went up out of Da captivity, of those that had been carried away, whom Nebuchadnezzar Da king of Babylon had carried away, and came again to Jerusalem and to Judah, every one unto his city; 7:7 Who came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Azariah, Raamiah, Nahamani, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispereth, Bigvai, Nehum, Baanah. The number, I say, of Da men of Da people of Israel was this; 7:8 The children of Parosh, two thousand an hundred seventy and two. 7:9 The children of Shephatiah, three hundred seventy and two. 7:10 The children of Arah, six hundred fifty and two. 7:11 The children of Pahathmoab, of Da children of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand and eight hundred and eighteen. 7:12 The children of Elam, a thousand two hundred fifty and four. 7:13 The children of Zattu, eight hundred forty and five. 7:14 The children of Zaccai, seven hundred and threescore. 7:15 The children of Binnui, six hundred forty and eight. 7:16 The children of Bebai, six hundred twenty and eight. 7:17 The children of Azgad, two thousand three hundred twenty and two. 7:18 The children of Adonikam, six hundred threescore and seven. 7:19 The children of Bigvai, two thousand threescore and seven. 7:20 The children of Adin, six hundred fifty and five. 7:21 The children of Ater of Hezekiah, ninety and eight. 7:22 The children of Hashum, three hundred twenty and eight. 7:23 The children of Bezai, three hundred twenty and four. 7:24 The children of Hariph, an hundred and twelve. 7:25 The children of Gibeon, ninety and five. 7:26 The men of Bethlehem and Netophah, an hundred fourscore and eight. 7:27 The men of Anathoth, an hundred twenty and eight. 7:28 The men of Bethazmaveth, forty and two. 7:29 The men of Kirjathjearim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred forty and three. 7:30 The men of Ramah and Gaba, six hundred twenty and one. 7:31 The men of Michmas, an hundred and twenty and two. 7:32 The men of Bethel and Ai, an hundred twenty and three. 7:33 The men of Da other Nebo, fifty and two. 7:34 The children of Da other Elam, a thousand two hundred fifty and four. 7:35 The children of Harim, three hundred and twenty. 7:36 The children of Jericho, three hundred forty and five. 7:37 The children of Lod, Hadid, and Ono, seven hundred twenty and one. 7:38 The children of Senaah, three thousand nine hundred and thirty. 7:39 The priests: Da children of Jedaiah, of Da house of Jeshua, nine hundred seventy and three. 7:40 The children of Immer, a thousand fifty and two. 7:41 The children of Pashur, a thousand two hundred forty and seven. 7:42 The children of Harim, a thousand and seventeen. 7:43 The Levites: Da children of Jeshua, of Kadmiel, and of Da children of Hodevah, seventy and four. 7:44 The singers: Da children of Asaph, an hundred forty and eight. 7:45 The porters: Da children of Shallum, Da children of Ater, Da children of Talmon, Da children of Akkub, Da children of Hatita, Da children of Shobai, an hundred thirty and eight. 7:46 The Nethinims: Da children of Ziha, Da children of Hashupha, Da children of Tabbaoth, 7:47 The children of Keros, Da but they could not shew their father’s house, nor their seed, whether they were of Israel. 7:62 The children of Delaiah, Da children of Tobiah, Da children of Nekoda, six hundred forty and two. 7:63 And of Da priests: Da children of Habaiah, Da children of Koz, Da children of Barzillai, which took one of Da daughters of Barzillai Da Gileadite to wife, and was called after their name. 7:64 These sought their register among those that were reckoned by genealogy, but it was not found: therefore were they, as polluted, put from Da priesthood. 7:65 And Da Tirshatha said unto them, that they should not eat of Da most holy things, till there stood up a priest with Urim and Thummim. 7:66 The whole congregation together was forty and two thousand three hundred and threescore, 7:67 Beside their manservants and their maidservants, of whom there were seven thousand three hundred thirty and seven: and they had two hundred forty and five singing men and singing women. 7:68 Their horses, seven hundred thirty and six: their mules, two hundred forty and five: 7:69 Their camels, four hundred thirty and five: six thousand seven hundred and twenty asses. 7:70 And some of Da chief of Da fathers gave unto Da work. The Tirshatha gave to Da treasure a thousand drams of gold, fifty basons, five hundred and thirty priests’ garments. 7:71 And some of Da chief of Da fathers gave to Da treasure of Da work twenty thousand drams of gold, and two thousand and two hundred pound of silver. 7:72 And that which Da rest of Da people gave was twenty thousand drams of gold, and two thousand pound of silver, and threescore and seven priests’ garments. 7:73 So Da priests, and Da Levites, and Da porters, and Da singers, and some of Da people, and Da Nethinims, and all Israel, dwelt in their cities; and when Da seventh month came, Da children of Israel were in their cities. 8:1 And all Da people gathered themselves together as one man into Da street that was before Da water gate; and they spake unto Ezra Da scribe to bring Da book of Da law of Moses, which Da LORD had commanded to Israel. 8:2 And Ezra Da priest brought Da law before Da congregation both of men and women, and all that could hear with understanding, upon Da first day of Da seventh month. 8:3 And he read therein before Da street that was before Da water gate from Da morning until midday, before Da men and Da women, and those that could understand; and Da ears of all Da people were attentive unto Da book of Da law. 8:4 And Ezra Da scribe stood upon a pulpit of wood, which they had made for Da purpose; and beside him stood Mattithiah, and Shema, and Anaiah, and Urijah, and Hilkiah, and Maaseiah, on his right hand; and on his left hand, Pedaiah, and Mishael, and Malchiah, and Hashum, and Hashbadana, Zechariah, and Meshullam. 8:5 And Ezra opened Da book in Da sight of all Da people; (for he was above all Da people;) and when he opened it, all Da people stood up: 8:6 And Ezra blessed Da LORD, Da great God. And all Da people answered, Amen, Amen, with lifting up their hands: and they bowed their heads, and worshipped Da LORD with their faces to Da ground. 8:7 Also Jeshua, and Bani, and Sherebiah, Jamin, Akkub, Shabbethai, Hodijah, Maaseiah, Kelita, Azariah, Jozabad, Hanan, Pelaiah, and Da Levites, caused Da people to understand Da law: and Da people stood in their place. 8:8 So they read in Da book in Da law of God distinctly, and gave Da sense, and caused them to understand Da reading. 8:9 And Nehemiah, which is Da Tirshatha, and Ezra Da priest Da scribe, and Da Levites that taught Da people, said unto all Da people, This day is holy unto Da LORD your God; mourn not, nor weep. For all Da people wept, when they heard Da words of Da law. 8:10 Then he said unto them, Go your way, eat Da fat, and drink Da sweet, and send portions unto them for whom nothing is prepared: for this day is holy unto our LORD: neither be ye sorry; for Da joy of Da LORD is your strength. 8:11 So Da Levites stilled all Da people, saying, Hold your peace, for Da day is holy; neither be ye grieved. 8:12 And all Da people went their way to eat, and to drink, and to send portions, and to make great mirth, because they had understood Da words that were declared unto them. 8:13 And on Da second day were gathered together Da chief of Da fathers of all Da people, Da priests, and Da Levites, unto Ezra Da scribe, even to understand Da words of Da law. 8:14 And they found written in Da law which Da LORD had commanded by Moses, that Da children of Israel should dwell in booths in Da feast of Da seventh month: 8:15 And that they should publish and proclaim in all their cities, and in Jerusalem, saying, Go forth unto Da mount, and fetch olive branches, and pine branches, and myrtle branches, and palm branches, and branches of thick trees, to make booths, as it is written. 8:16 So Da people went forth, and brought them, and made themselves booths, every one upon Da roof of his house, and in their courts, and in Da courts of Da house of God, and in Da street of Da water gate, and in Da street of Da gate of Ephraim. 8:17 And all Da congregation of them that were come again out of Da captivity made booths, and sat under Da booths: for since Da days of Jeshua Da son of Nun unto that day had not Da children of Israel done so. And there was very great gladness. 8:18 Also day by day, from Da first day unto Da last day, he read in Da book of Da law of God. And they kept Da feast seven days; and on Da eighth day was a solemn assembly, according unto Da manner. 9:1 Now in Da twenty and fourth day of this month Da children of Israel were assembled with fasting, and with sackclothes, and earth upon them. 9:2 And Da seed of Israel separated themselves from all strangers, and stood and confessed their sins, and Da iniquities of their fathers. 9:3 And they stood up in their place, and read in Da book of Da law of Da LORD their God one fourth part of Da day; and another fourth part they confessed, and worshipped Da LORD their God. 9:4 Then stood up upon Da stairs, of Da Levites, Jeshua, and Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani, and Chenani, and cried with a loud voice unto Da LORD their God. 9:5 Then Da Levites, Jeshua, and Kadmiel, Bani, Hashabniah, Sherebiah, Hodijah, Shebaniah, and Pethahiah, said, Stand up and bless Da LORD your God for ever and ever: and blessed be thy glorious name, which is exalted above all blessing and praise. 9:6 Thou, even thou, art LORD alone; thou hast made heaven, Da heaven of heavens, with all their host, Da earth, and all things that are therein, Da seas, and all that is therein, and thou preservest them all; and Da host of heaven worshippeth thee. 9:7 Thou art Da LORD Da God, who didst choose Abram, and broughtest him forth out of Ur of Da Chaldees, and gavest him Da name of Abraham; 9:8 And foundest his heart faithful before thee, and madest a covenant with him to give Da land of Da Canaanites, Da Hittites, Da Amorites, and Da Perizzites, and Da Jebusites, and Da Girgashites, to give it, I say, to his seed, and hast performed thy words; for thou art righteous: 9:9 And didst see Da affliction of our fathers in Egypt, and heardest their cry by Da Red sea; 9:10 And shewedst signs and wonders upon Pharaoh, and on all his servants, and on all Da people of his land: for thou knewest that they dealt proudly against them. So didst thou get thee a name, as it is this day. 9:11 And thou didst divide Da sea before them, so that they went through Da midst of Da sea on Da dry land; and their persecutors thou threwest into Da deeps, as a stone into Da mighty waters. 9:12 Moreover thou leddest them in Da day by a cloudy pillar; and in Da night by a pillar of fire, to give them light in Da way wherein they should go. 9:13 Thou camest down also upon mount Sinai, and spakest with them from heaven, and gavest them right judgments, and true laws, good statutes and commandments: 9:14 And madest known unto them thy holy sabbath, and commandedst them precepts, statutes, and laws, by Da hand of Moses thy servant: 9:15 And gavest them bread from heaven for their hunger, and broughtest forth water for them out of Da rock for their thirst, and promisedst them that they should go in to possess Da land which thou hadst sworn to give them. 9:16 But they and our fathers dealt proudly, and hardened their necks, and hearkened not to thy commandments, 9:17 And refused to obey, neither were mindful of thy wonders that thou didst among them; but hardened their necks, and in their rebellion appointed a captain to return to their bondage: but thou art a God ready to pardon, gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and forsookest them not. 9:18 Yea, when they had made them a molten calf, and said, This is thy God that brought thee up out of Egypt, and had wrought great provocations; 9:19 Yet thou in thy manifold mercies forsookest them not in Da wilderness: Da pillar of Da cloud departed not from them by day, to lead them in Da way; neither Da pillar of fire by night, to shew them light, and Da way wherein they should go. 9:20 Thou gavest also thy good spirit to instruct them, and withheldest not thy manna from their mouth, and gavest them water for their thirst. 9:21 Yea, forty years didst thou sustain them in Da wilderness, so that they lacked nothing; their clothes waxed not old, and their feet swelled not. 9:22 Moreover thou gavest them kingdoms and nations, and didst divide them into corners: so they possessed Da land of Sihon, and Da land of Da king of Heshbon, and Da land of Og king of Bashan. 9:23 Their children also multipliedst thou as Da stars of heaven, and broughtest them into Da land, concerning which thou hadst promised to their fathers, that they should go in to possess it. 9:24 So Da children went in and possessed Da land, and thou subduedst before them Da inhabitants of Da land, Da Canaanites, and gavest them into their hands, with their kings, and Da people of Da land, that they might do with them as they would. 9:25 And they took strong cities, and a fat land, and possessed houses full of all goods, wells digged, vineyards, and oliveyards, and fruit trees in abundance: so they did eat, and were filled, and became fat, and delighted themselves in thy great goodness. 9:26 Nevertheless they were disobedient, and rebelled against thee, and cast thy law behind their backs, and slew thy prophets which testified against them to turn them to thee, and they wrought great provocations. 9:27 Therefore thou deliveredst them into Da hand of their enemies, who vexed them: and in Da time of their trouble, when they cried unto thee, thou heardest them from heaven; and according to thy manifold mercies thou gavest them saviours, who saved them out of Da hand of their enemies. 9:28 But after they had rest, they did evil again before thee: therefore leftest thou them in Da land of their enemies, so that they had Da dominion over them: yet when they returned, and cried unto thee, thou heardest them from heaven; and many times didst thou deliver them according to thy mercies; 9:29 And testifiedst against them, that thou mightest bring them again unto thy law: yet they dealt proudly, and hearkened not unto thy commandments, but sinned against thy judgments, (which if a man do, he shall live in them;) and withdrew Da shoulder, and hardened their neck, and would not hear. 9:30 Yet many years didst thou forbear them, and testifiedst against them by thy spirit in thy prophets: yet would they not give ear: therefore gavest thou them into Da hand of Da people of Da lands. 9:31 Nevertheless for thy great mercies’ sake thou didst not utterly consume them, nor forsake them; for thou art a gracious and merciful God. 9:32 Now therefore, our God, Da great, Da mighty, and Da terrible God, who keepest covenant and mercy, let not all Da trouble seem little before thee, that hath come upon us, on our kings, on our princes, and on our priests, and on our prophets, and on our fathers, and on all thy people, since Da time of Da kings of Assyria unto this day. 9:33 Howbeit thou art just in all that is brought upon us; for thou hast done right, but we have done wickedly: 9:34 Neither have our kings, our princes, our priests, nor our fathers, kept thy law, nor hearkened unto thy commandments and thy testimonies, wherewith thou didst testify against them. 9:35 For they have not served thee in their kingdom, and in thy great goodness that thou gavest them, and in Da large and fat land which thou gavest before them, neither turned they from their wicked works. 9:36 Behold, we are servants this day, and for Da land that thou gavest unto our fathers to eat Da fruit thereof and Da good thereof, behold, we are servants in it: 9:37 And it yieldeth much increase unto Da kings whom thou hast set over us because of our sins: also they have dominion over our bodies, and over our cattle, at their pleasure, and we are in great distress. 9:38 And because of all this we make a sure covenant, and write it; and our princes, Levites, and priests, seal unto it. 10:1 Now those that sealed were, Nehemiah, Da Tirshatha, Da son of Hachaliah, and Zidkijah, 10:2 Seraiah, Azariah, Jeremiah, 10:3 Pashur, Amariah, Malchijah, 10:4 Hattush, Shebaniah, Malluch, 10:5 Harim, Meremoth, Obadiah, 10:6 Daniel, Ginnethon, Baruch, 10:7 Meshullam, Abijah, Mijamin, 10:8 Maaziah, Bilgai, Shemaiah: these were Da priests. 10:9 And Da Levites: both Jeshua Da son of Azaniah, Binnui of Da sons of Henadad, Kadmiel; 10:10 And their brethren, Shebaniah, Hodijah, Kelita, Pelaiah, Hanan, 10:11 Micha, Rehob, Hashabiah, 10:12 Zaccur, Sherebiah, Shebaniah, 10:13 Hodijah, Bani, Beninu. 10:14 The chief of Da people; Parosh, Pahathmoab, Elam, Zatthu, Bani, 10:15 Bunni, Azgad, Bebai, 10:16 Adonijah, Bigvai, Adin, 10:17 Ater, Hizkijah, Azzur, 10:18 Hodijah, Hashum, Bezai, 10:19 Hariph, Anathoth, Nebai, 10:20 Magpiash, Meshullam, Hezir, 10:21 Meshezabeel, Zadok, Jaddua, 10:22 Pelatiah, Hanan, Anaiah, 10:23 Hoshea, Hananiah, Hashub, 10:24 Hallohesh, Pileha, Shobek, 10:25 Rehum, Hashabnah, Maaseiah, 10:26 And Ahijah, Hanan, Anan, 10:27 Malluch, Harim, Baanah. 10:28 And Da rest of Da people, Da priests, Da Levites, Da porters, Da singers, Da Nethinims, and all they that had separated themselves from Da people of Da lands unto Da law of God, their wives, their sons, and their daughters, every one having knowledge, and having understanding; 10:29 They clave to their brethren, their nobles, and entered into a curse, and into an oath, to walk in God’s law, which was given by Moses Da servant of God, and to observe and do all Da commandments of Da LORD our Lord, and his judgments and his statutes; 10:30 And that we would not give our daughters unto Da people of Da land, not take their daughters for our sons: 10:31 And if Da people of Da land bring ware or any victuals on Da sabbath day to sell, that we would not buy it of them on Da sabbath, or on Da holy day: and that we would leave Da seventh year, and Da exaction of every debt. 10:32 Also we made ordinances for us, to charge ourselves yearly with Da third part of a shekel for Da service of Da house of our God; 10:33 For Da shewbread, and for Da continual meat offering, and for Da continual burnt offering, of Da sabbaths, of Da new moons, for Da set feasts, and for Da holy things, and for Da sin offerings to make an atonement for Israel, and for all Da work of Da house of our God. 10:34 And we cast Da lots among Da priests, Da Levites, and Da people, for Da wood offering, to bring it into Da house of our God, after Da houses of our fathers, at times appointed year by year, to burn upon Da altar of Da LORD our God, as it is written in Da law: 10:35 And to bring Da firstfruits of our ground, and Da firstfruits of all fruit of all trees, year by year, unto Da house of Da LORD: 10:36 Also Da firstborn of our sons, and of our cattle, as it is written in Da law, and Da firstlings of our herds and of our flocks, to bring to Da house of our God, unto Da priests that minister in Da house of our God: 10:37 And that we should bring Da firstfruits of our dough, and our offerings, and Da fruit of all manner of trees, of wine and of oil, unto Da priests, to Da chambers of Da house of our God; and Da tithes of our ground unto Da Levites, that Da same Levites might have Da tithes in all Da cities of our tillage. 10:38 And Da priest Da son of Aaron shall be with Da Levites, when Da Levites take tithes: and Da Levites shall bring up Da tithe of Da tithes unto Da house of our God, to Da chambers, into Da treasure house. 10:39 For Da children of Israel and Da children of Levi shall bring Da offering of Da corn, of Da new wine, and Da oil, unto Da chambers, where are Da vessels of Da sanctuary, and Da priests that minister, and Da porters, and Da singers: and we will not forsake Da house of our God. 11:1 And Da rulers of Da people dwelt at Jerusalem: Da rest of Da people also cast lots, to bring one of ten to dwell in Jerusalem Da holy city, and nine parts to dwell in other cities. 11:2 And Da people blessed all Da men, that willingly offered themselves to dwell at Jerusalem. 11:3 Now these are Da chief of Da province that dwelt in Jerusalem: but in Da cities of Judah dwelt every one in his possession in their cities, to wit, Israel, Da priests, and Da Levites, and Da Nethinims, and Da children of Solomon’s servants. 11:4 And at Jerusalem dwelt certain of Da children of Judah, and of Da children of Benjamin. Of Da children of Judah; Athaiah Da son of Uzziah, Da son of Zechariah, Da son of Amariah, Da son of Shephatiah, Da son of Mahalaleel, of Da children of Perez; 11:5 And Maaseiah Da son of Baruch, Da son of Colhozeh, Da son of Hazaiah, Da son of Adaiah, Da son of Joiarib, Da son of Zechariah, Da son of Shiloni. 11:6 All Da sons of Perez that dwelt at Jerusalem were four hundred threescore and eight valiant men. 11:7 And these are Da sons of Benjamin; Sallu Da son of Meshullam, Da son of Joed, Da son of Pedaiah, Da son of Kolaiah, Da son of Maaseiah, Da son of Ithiel, Da son of Jesaiah. 11:8 And after him Gabbai, Sallai, nine hundred twenty and eight. 11:9 And Joel Da son of Zichri was their overseer: and Judah Da son of Senuah was second over Da city. 11:10 Of Da priests: Jedaiah Da son of Joiarib, Jachin. 11:11 Seraiah Da son of Hilkiah, Da son of Meshullam, Da son of Zadok, Da son of Meraioth, Da son of Ahitub, was Da ruler of Da house of God. 11:12 And their brethren that did Da work of Da house were eight hundred twenty and two: and Adaiah Da son of Jeroham, Da son of Pelaliah, Da son of Amzi, Da son of Zechariah, Da son of Pashur, Da son of Malchiah. 11:13 And his brethren, chief of Da fathers, two hundred forty and two: and Amashai Da son of Azareel, Da son of Ahasai, Da son of Meshillemoth, Da son of Immer, 11:14 And their brethren, mighty men of valour, an hundred twenty and eight: and their overseer was Zabdiel, Da son of one of Da great men. 11:15 Also of Da Levites: Shemaiah Da son of Hashub, Da son of Azrikam, Da son of Hashabiah, Da son of Bunni; 11:16 And Shabbethai and Jozabad, of Da chief of Da Levites, had Da oversight of Da outward business of Da house of God. 11:17 And Mattaniah Da son of Micha, Da son of Zabdi, Da son of Asaph, was Da principal to begin Da thanksgiving in prayer: and Bakbukiah Da second among his brethren, and Abda Da son of Shammua, Da son of Galal, Da son of Jeduthun. 11:18 All Da Levites in Da holy city were two hundred fourscore and four. 11:19 Moreover Da porters, Akkub, Talmon, and their brethren that kept Da gates, were an hundred seventy and two. 11:20 And Da residue of Israel, of Da priests, and Da Levites, were in all Da cities of Judah, every one in his inheritance. 11:21 But Da Nethinims dwelt in Ophel: and Ziha and Gispa were over Da Nethinims. 11:22 The overseer also of Da Levites at Jerusalem was Uzzi Da son of Bani, Da son of Hashabiah, Da son of Mattaniah, Da son of Micha. Of Da sons of Asaph, Da singers were over Da business of Da house of God. 11:23 For it was Da king’s commandment concerning them, that a certain portion should be for Da singers, due for every day. 11:24 And Pethahiah Da son of Meshezabeel, of Da children of Zerah Da son of Judah, was at Da king’s hand in all matters concerning Da people. 11:25 And for Da villages, with their fields, some of Da children of Judah dwelt at Kirjatharba, and in Da villages thereof, and at Dibon, and in Da villages thereof, and at Jekabzeel, and in Da villages thereof, 11:26 And at Jeshua, and at Moladah, and at Bethphelet, 11:27 And at Hazarshual, and at Beersheba, and in Da villages thereof, 11:28 And at Ziklag, and at Mekonah, and in Da villages thereof, 11:29 And at Enrimmon, and at Zareah, and at Jarmuth, 11:30 Zanoah, Adullam, and in their villages, at Lachish, and Da fields thereof, at Azekah, and in Da villages thereof.
