The Proverbs 1:1 The proverbs of Solomon Da son of David, king of Israel; 1:2 To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive Da words of understanding; 1:3 To receive Da instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity; 1:4 To give subtilty to Da simple, to Da young man knowledge and discretion. 1:5 A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels: 1:6 To understand a proverb, and Da interpretation; Da words of Da wise, and their dark sayings. 1:7 The fear of Da LORD is Da beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction. 1:8 My son, hear Da instruction of thy father, and forsake not Da law of thy mother: 1:9 For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck. 1:10 My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not. 1:11 If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for Da innocent without cause: 1:12 Let us swallow them up alive as Da grave; and whole, as those that go down into Da pit: 1:13 We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil: 1:14 Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse: 1:15 My son, walk not thou in Da way with them; refrain thy foot from their path: 1:16 For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood. 1:17 Surely in vain Da net is spread in Da sight of any bird. 1:18 And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives. 1:19 So are Da ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away Da life of Da owners thereof. 1:20 Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in Da streets: 1:21 She crieth in Da chief place of concourse, in Da openings of Da gates: in Da city she uttereth her words, saying, 1:22 How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and Da scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge? 1:23 Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you. 1:24 Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded; 1:25 But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof: 1:26 I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh; 1:27 When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you. 1:28 Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me: 1:29 For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose Da fear of Da LORD: 1:30 They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof. 1:31 Therefore shall they eat of Da fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices. 1:32 For Da turning away of Da simple shall slay them, and Da prosperity of fools shall destroy them. 1:33 But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil. 2:1 My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee; 2:2 So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding; 2:3 Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding; 2:4 If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures; 2:5 Then shalt thou understand Da fear of Da LORD, and find Da knowledge of God. 2:6 For Da LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding. 2:7 He layeth up sound wisdom for Da righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly. 2:8 He keepeth Da paths of judgment, and preserveth Da way of his saints. 2:9 Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path. 2:10 When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul; 2:11 Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee: 2:12 To deliver thee from Da way of Da evil man, from Da man that speaketh froward things; 2:13 Who leave Da paths of uprightness, to walk in Da ways of darkness; 2:14 Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in Da frowardness of Da wicked; 2:15 Whose ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths: 2:16 To deliver thee from Da strange woman, even from Da stranger which flattereth with her words; 2:17 Which forsaketh Da guide of her youth, and forgetteth Da covenant of her God. 2:18 For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto Da dead. 2:19 None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of Da paths of life. 2:20 That thou mayest walk in Da way of good men, and keep Da paths of Da righteous. 2:21 For Da upright shall dwell in Da land, and Da perfect shall remain in it. 2:22 But Da wicked shall be cut off from Da earth, and Da transgressors shall be rooted out of it. 3:1 My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments: 3:2 For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee. 3:3 Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon Da table of thine heart: 3:4 So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in Da sight of God and man. 3:5 Trust in Da LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding. 3:6 In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths. 3:7 Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear Da LORD, and depart from evil. 3:8 It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones. 3:9 Honour Da LORD with thy substance, and with Da firstfruits of all thine increase: 3:10 So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine. 3:11 My son, despise not Da chastening of Da LORD; neither be weary of his correction: 3:12 For whom Da LORD loveth he correcteth; even as a father Da son in whom he delighteth. 3:13 Happy is Da man that findeth wisdom, and Da man that getteth understanding. 3:14 For Da merchandise of it is better than Da merchandise of silver, and Da gain thereof than fine gold. 3:15 She is more precious than rubies: and all Da things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her. 3:16 Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour. 3:17 Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace. 3:18 She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her. 3:19 The LORD by wisdom hath founded Da earth; by understanding hath he established Da heavens. 3:20 By his knowledge Da depths are broken up, and Da clouds drop down Da dew. 3:21 My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion: 3:22 So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck. 3:23 Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble. 3:24 When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet. 3:25 Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of Da desolation of Da wicked, when it cometh. 3:26 For Da LORD shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken. 3:27 Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in Da power of thine hand to do it. 3:28 Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee. 3:29 Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee. 3:30 Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm. 3:31 Envy thou not Da oppressor, and choose none of his ways. 3:32 For Da froward is abomination to Da LORD: but his secret is with Da righteous. 3:33 The curse of Da LORD is in Da house of Da wicked: but he blesseth Da habitation of Da just. 3:34 Surely he scorneth Da scorners: but he giveth grace unto Da lowly. 3:35 The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be Da promotion of fools. 4:1 Hear, ye children, Da instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding. 4:2 For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law. 4:3 For I was my father’s son, tender and only beloved in Da sight of my mother. 4:4 He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live. 4:5 Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from Da words of my mouth. 4:6 Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee. 4:7 Wisdom is Da principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding. 4:8 Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her. 4:9 She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee. 4:10 Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and Da years of thy life shall be many. 4:11 I have taught thee in Da way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths. 4:12 When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble. 4:13 Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life. 4:14 Enter not into Da path of Da wicked, and go not in Da way of evil men. 4:15 Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away. 4:16 For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall. 4:17 For they eat Da bread of wickedness, and drink Da wine of violence. 4:18 But Da path of Da just is as Da shining light, that shineth more and more unto Da perfect day. 4:19 The way of Da wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble. 4:20 My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings. 4:21 Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in Da midst of thine heart. 4:22 For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh. 4:23 Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are Da issues of life. 4:24 Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee. 4:25 Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee. 4:26 Ponder Da path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established. 4:27 Turn not to Da right hand nor to Da left: remove thy foot from evil. 5:1 My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding: 5:2 That thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge. 5:3 For Da lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil: 5:4 But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword. 5:5 Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell. 5:6 Lest thou shouldest ponder Da path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them. 5:7 Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from Da words of my mouth. 5:8 Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh Da door of her house: 5:9 Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto Da cruel: 5:10 Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours be in Da house of a stranger; 5:11 And thou mourn at Da last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed, 5:12 And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof; 5:13 And have not obeyed Da voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me! 5:14 I was almost in all evil in Da midst of Da congregation and assembly. 5:15 Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well. 5:16 Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in Da streets. 5:17 Let them be only thine own, and not strangers’ with thee. 5:18 Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with Da wife of thy youth. 5:19 Let her be as Da loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love. 5:20 And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace Da bosom of a stranger? 5:21 For Da ways of man are before Da eyes of Da LORD, and he pondereth all his goings. 5:22 His own iniquities shall take Da wicked himself, and he shall be holden with Da cords of his sins. 5:23 He shall die without instruction; and in Da greatness of his folly he shall go astray. 6:1 My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger, 6:2 Thou art snared with Da words of thy mouth, thou art taken with Da words of thy mouth. 6:3 Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into Da hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend. 6:4 Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids. 6:5 Deliver thyself as a roe from Da hand of Da hunter, and as a bird from Da hand of Da fowler. 6:6 Go to Da ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise: 6:7 Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler, 6:8 Provideth her meat in Da summer, and gathereth her food in Da harvest. 6:9 How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep? 6:10 Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of Da hands to sleep: 6:11 So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man. 6:12 A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth. 6:13 He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers; 6:14 Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord. 6:15 Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy. 6:16 These six things doth Da LORD hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him: 6:17 A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood, 6:18 An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief, 6:19 A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren. 6:20 My son, keep thy father’s commandment, and forsake not Da law of thy mother: 6:21 Bind them continually upon thine heart, and tie them about thy neck. 6:22 When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee. 6:23 For Da commandment is a lamp; and Da law is light; and reproofs of instruction are Da way of life: 6:24 To keep thee from Da evil woman, from Da flattery of Da tongue of a strange woman. 6:25 Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids. 6:26 For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and Da adultress will hunt for Da precious life. 6:27 Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned? 6:28 Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned? 6:29 So he that goeth in to his neighbours wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent. 6:30 Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry; 6:31 But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all Da substance of his house. 6:32 But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul. 6:33 A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away. 6:34 For jealousy is Da rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in Da day of vengeance. 6:35 He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts. 7:1 My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee. 7:2 Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as Da apple of thine eye. 7:3 Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon Da table of thine heart. 7:4 Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman: 7:5 That they may keep thee from Da strange woman, from Da stranger which flattereth with her words. 7:6 For at Da window of my house I looked through my casement, 7:7 And beheld among Da simple ones, I discerned among Da youths, a young man void of understanding, 7:8 Passing through Da street near her corner; and he went Da way to her house, 7:9 In Da twilight, in Da evening, in Da black and dark night: 7:10 And, behold, there met him a woman with Da attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart. 7:11 (She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house: 7:12 Now is she without, now in Da streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.) 7:13 So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him, 7:14 I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows. 7:15 Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee. 7:16 I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt. 7:17 I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon. 7:18 Come, let us take our fill of love until Da morning: let us solace ourselves with loves. 7:19 For Da goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey: 7:20 He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at Da day appointed. 7:21 With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with Da flattering of her lips she forced him. 7:22 He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to Da slaughter, or as a fool to Da correction of Da stocks; 7:23 Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to Da snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life. 7:24 Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to Da words of my mouth. 7:25 Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths. 7:26 For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her. 7:27 Her house is Da way to hell, going down to Da chambers of death. 8:1 Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice? 8:2 She standeth in Da top of high places, by Da way in Da places of Da paths. 8:3 She crieth at Da gates, at Da entry of Da city, at Da coming in at Da doors. 8:4 Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice is to Da sons of man. 8:5 O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart. 8:6 Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and Da opening of my lips shall be right things. 8:7 For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips. 8:8 All Da words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them. 8:9 They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge. 8:10 Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold. 8:11 For wisdom is better than rubies; and all Da things that may be desired are not to be compared to it. 8:12 I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions. 8:13 The fear of Da LORD is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and Da evil way, and Da froward mouth, do I hate. 8:14 Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength. 8:15 By me kings reign, and princes decree justice. 8:16 By me princes rule, and nobles, even all Da judges of Da earth. 8:17 I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me. 8:18 Riches and honour are with me; yea, durable riches and righteousness. 8:19 My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver. 8:20 I lead in Da way of righteousness, in Da midst of Da paths of judgment: 8:21 That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures. 8:22 The LORD possessed me in Da beginning of his way, before his works of old. 8:23 I was set up from everlasting, from Da beginning, or ever Da earth was. 8:24 When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water. 8:25 Before Da mountains were settled, before Da hills was I brought forth: 8:26 While as yet he had not made Da earth, nor Da fields, nor Da highest part of Da dust of Da world. 8:27 When he prepared Da heavens, I was there: when he set a compass upon Da face of Da depth: 8:28 When he established Da clouds above: when he strengthened Da fountains of Da deep: 8:29 When he gave to Da sea his decree, that Da waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed Da foundations of Da earth: 8:30 Then I was by him, as one brought up with him: and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him; 8:31 Rejoicing in Da habitable part of his earth; and my delights were with Da sons of men. 8:32 Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed are they that keep my ways. 8:33 Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not. 8:34 Blessed is Da man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at Da posts of my doors. 8:35 For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of Da LORD. 8:36 But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death. 9:1 Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars: 9:2 She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table. 9:3 She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon Da highest places of Da city, 9:4 Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him, 9:5 Come, eat of my bread, and drink of Da wine which I have mingled. 9:6 Forsake Da foolish, and live; and go in Da way of understanding. 9:7 He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot. 9:8 Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee. 9:9 Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning. 9:10 The fear of Da LORD is Da beginning of wisdom: and Da knowledge of Da holy is understanding. 9:11 For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and Da years of thy life shall be increased. 9:12 If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it. 9:13 A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing. 9:14 For she sitteth at Da door of her house, on a seat in Da high places of Da city, 9:15 To call passengers who go right on their ways: 9:16 Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him, 9:17 Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant. 9:18 But he knoweth not that Da dead are there; and that her guests are in Da depths of hell. 10:1 The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is Da heaviness of his mother. 10:2 Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death. 10:3 The LORD will not suffer Da soul of Da righteous to famish: but he casteth away Da substance of Da wicked. 10:4 He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but Da hand of Da diligent maketh rich. 10:5 He that gathereth in summer is a wise son: but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame. 10:6 Blessings are upon Da head of Da just: but violence covereth Da mouth of Da wicked. 10:7 The memory of Da just is blessed: but Da name of Da wicked shall rot. 10:8 The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall. 10:9 He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known. 10:10 He that winketh with Da eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall. 10:11 The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life: but violence covereth Da mouth of Da wicked. 10:12 Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins. 10:13 In Da lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for Da back of him that is void of understanding. 10:14 Wise men lay up knowledge: but Da mouth of Da foolish is near destruction. 10:15 The rich man’s wealth is his strong city: Da destruction of Da poor is their poverty. 10:16 The labour of Da righteous tendeth to life: Da fruit of Da wicked to sin. 10:17 He is in Da way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth. 10:18 He that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool. 10:19 In Da multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise. 10:20 The tongue of Da just is as choice silver: Da heart of Da wicked is little worth. 10:21 The lips of Da righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom. 10:22 The blessing of Da LORD, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it. 10:23 It is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom. 10:24 The fear of Da wicked, it shall come upon him: but Da desire of Da righteous shall be granted. 10:25 As Da whirlwind passeth, so is Da wicked no more: but Da righteous is an everlasting foundation. 10:26 As vinegar to Da teeth, and as smoke to Da eyes, so is Da sluggard to them that send him. 10:27 The fear of Da LORD prolongeth days: but Da years of Da wicked shall be shortened. 10:28 The hope of Da righteous shall be gladness: but Da expectation of Da wicked shall perish. 10:29 The way of Da LORD is strength to Da upright: but destruction shall be to Da workers of iniquity. 10:30 The righteous shall never be removed: but Da wicked shall not inhabit Da earth. 10:31 The mouth of Da just bringeth forth wisdom: but Da froward tongue shall be cut out. 10:32 The lips of Da righteous know what is acceptable: but Da mouth of Da wicked speaketh frowardness. 11:1 A false balance is abomination to Da LORD: but a just weight is his delight. 11:2 When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with Da lowly is wisdom. 11:3 The integrity of Da upright shall guide them: but Da perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them. 11:4 Riches profit not in Da day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death. 11:5 The righteousness of Da perfect shall direct his way: but Da wicked shall fall by his own wickedness. 11:6 The righteousness of Da upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in their own naughtiness. 11:7 When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish: and Da hope of unjust men perisheth. 11:8 The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and Da wicked cometh in his stead. 11:9 An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall Da just be delivered. 11:10 When it goeth well with Da righteous, Da city rejoiceth: and when Da wicked perish, there is shouting. 11:11 By Da blessing of Da upright Da city is exalted: but it is overthrown by Da mouth of Da wicked. 11:12 He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace. 11:13 A talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth Da matter. 11:14 Where no counsel is, Da people fall: but in Da multitude of counsellors there is safety. 11:15 He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it: and he that hateth suretiship is sure. 11:16 A gracious woman retaineth honour: and strong men retain riches. 11:17 The merciful man doeth good to his own soul: but he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh. 11:18 The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness shall be a sure reward. 11:19 As righteousness tendeth to life: so he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death. 11:20 They that are of a froward heart are abomination to Da LORD: but such as are upright in their way are his delight. 11:21 Though hand join in hand, Da wicked shall not be unpunished: but Da seed of Da righteous shall be delivered. 11:22 As a jewel of gold in a swine’s snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion. 11:23 The desire of Da righteous is only good: but Da expectation of Da wicked is wrath. 11:24 There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty. 11:25 The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself. 11:26 He that withholdeth corn, Da people shall curse him: but blessing shall be upon Da head of him that selleth it. 11:27 He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour: but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him. 11:28 He that trusteth in his riches shall fall; but Da righteous shall flourish as a branch. 11:29 He that troubleth his own house shall inherit Da wind: and Da fool shall be servant to Da wise of heart. 11:30 The fruit of Da righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise. 11:31 Behold, Da righteous shall be rather than a fool in his folly. 17:13 Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house. 17:14 The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: therefore leave off fool to get wisdom, seeing he hath no heart to it? 17:17 A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity. 17:18 A man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in Da presence of his friend. 17:19 He loveth transgression that loveth strife: and he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction. 17:20 He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief. 17:21 He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow: and Da father of a fool hath no joy. 17:22 A merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth Da bones. 17:23 A wicked man taketh a gift out of Da bosom to pervert Da ways of judgment. 17:24 Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but Da eyes of a fool are in Da ends of Da earth. 17:25 A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bare him. 17:26 Also to punish Da just is not good, nor to strike princes for equity. 17:27 He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit. 17:28 Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding. 18:1 Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom. 18:2 A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself. 18:3 When Da wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach. 18:4 The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters, and Da wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook. 18:5 It is not good to accept Da person of Da wicked, to overthrow Da righteous in judgment. 18:6 A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes. 18:7 A fool’s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are Da snare of his soul. 18:8 The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into Da innermost parts of Da belly. 18:9 He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster. 18:10 The name of Da LORD is a strong tower: Da righteous runneth into it, and is safe. 18:11 The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, and as an high wall in his own conceit. 18:12 Before destruction Da heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility. 18:13 He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him. 18:14 The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear? 18:15 The heart of Da prudent getteth knowledge; and Da ear of Da wise seeketh knowledge. 18:16 A man’s gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men. 18:17 He that is first in his own cause seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him. 18:18 The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between Da mighty. 18:19 A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city: and their contentions are like Da bars of a castle. 18:20 A man’s belly shall be satisfied with Da fruit of his mouth; and with Da increase of his lips shall he be filled. 18:21 Death and life are in Da power of Da tongue: and they that love it shall eat Da fruit thereof. 18:22 Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of Da LORD. 18:23 The poor useth intreaties; but Da rich answereth roughly. 18:24 A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother. 19:1 Better is Da poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool. 19:2 Also, that Da soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet sinneth. 19:3 The foolishness of man perverteth his way: and his heart fretteth against Da LORD. 19:4 Wealth maketh many friends; but Da poor is separated from his neighbour. 19:5 A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall not escape. 19:6 Many will intreat Da favour of Da prince: and every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts. 19:7 All Da brethren of Da poor do hate him: how much more do his friends go far from him? he pursueth them with words, yet they are wanting to him. 19:8 He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: he that keepeth understanding shall find good. 19:9 A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall perish. 19:10 Delight is not seemly for a fool; much less for a servant to have rule over princes. 19:11 The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression. 19:12 The king’s wrath is as Da roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon Da grass. 19:13 A foolish son is Da calamity of his father: and Da contentions of a wife are a continual dropping. 19:14 House and riches are Da inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from Da LORD. 19:15 Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger. 19:16 He that keepeth Da commandment keepeth his own soul; but he that despiseth his ways shall die. 19:17 He that hath pity upon Da poor lendeth unto Da LORD; and that which he hath given will he pay him again. 19:18 Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his crying. 19:19 A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment: for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again. 19:20 Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end. 19:21 There are many devices in a man’s heart; nevertheless Da counsel of Da LORD, that shall stand. 19:22 The desire of a man is his kindness: and a poor man is better than a liar. 19:23 The fear of Da LORD tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil. 19:24 A slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again. 19:25 Smite a scorner, and Da simple will beware: and reprove one that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge. 19:26 He that wasteth his father, and chaseth away his mother, is a son that causeth shame, and bringeth reproach. 19:27 Cease, my son, to hear Da instruction that causeth to err from Da words of knowledge. 19:28 An ungodly witness scorneth judgment: and Da mouth of Da wicked devoureth iniquity. 19:29 Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for Da back of fools. 20:1 Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise. 20:2 The fear of a king is as Da roaring of a lion: whoso provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul. 20:3 It is an honour for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling. 20:4 The sluggard will not plow by reason of Da cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing. 20:5 Counsel in Da heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out. 20:6 Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness: but a faithful man who can find? 20:7 The just man walketh in his integrity: his children are blessed after him. 20:8 A king that sitteth in Da throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes. 20:9 Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin? 20:10 Divers weights, and divers measures, both of them are alike abomination to Da LORD. 20:11 Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right. 20:12 The hearing ear, and Da seeing eye, Da LORD hath made even both of them. 20:13 Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread. 20:14 It is naught, it is naught, saith Da buyer: but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth. 20:15 There is gold, and a multitude of rubies: but Da lips of knowledge are a precious jewel. 20:16 Take his garment that is surety for a stranger: and take a pledge of him for a strange woman. 20:17 Bread of deceit is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel. 20:18 Every purpose is established by counsel: and with good advice make war. 20:19 He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets: therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips. 20:20 Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness. 20:21 An inheritance may be gotten hastily at Da beginning; but Da end thereof shall not be blessed. 20:22 Say not thou, I will recompense evil; but wait on Da LORD, and he shall save thee. 20:23 Divers weights are an abomination unto Da LORD; and a false balance is not good. 20:24 Man’s goings are of Da LORD; how can a man then understand his own way? 20:25 It is a snare to Da man who devoureth that which is holy, and after vows to make enquiry. 20:26 A wise king scattereth Da wicked, and bringeth Da wheel over them. 20:27 The spirit of man is Da candle of Da LORD, searching all Da inward parts of Da belly. 20:28 Mercy and truth preserve Da king: and his throne is upholden by mercy. 20:29 The glory of young men is their strength: and Da beauty of old men is Da grey head. 20:30 The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so do stripes Da inward parts of Da belly. 21:1 The king’s heart is in Da hand of Da LORD, as Da rivers of water: he turneth it whithersoever he will. 21:2 Every way of a man is right in his own eyes: but Da LORD pondereth Da hearts. 21:3 To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to Da LORD than sacrifice. 21:4 An high look, and a proud heart, and Da plowing of Da wicked, is sin. 21:5 The thoughts of Da diligent tend only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty only to want. 21:6 The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vanity tossed to and fro of them that seek death. 21:7 The robbery of Da wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to do judgment. 21:8 The way of man is froward and strange: but as for Da pure, his work is right. 21:9 It is better to dwell in a corner of Da housetop, than with a brawling woman in a wide house. 21:10 The soul of Da wicked desireth evil: his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes. 21:11 When Da scorner is punished, Da simple is made wise: and when Da wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge. 21:12 The righteous man wisely considereth Da house of Da wicked: but God overthroweth Da wicked for their wickedness. 21:13 Whoso stoppeth his ears at Da cry of Da poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard. 21:14 A gift in secret pacifieth anger: and a reward in Da bosom strong wrath. 21:15 It is joy to Da just to do judgment: but destruction shall be to Da workers of iniquity. 21:16 The man that wandereth out of Da way of understanding shall remain in Da congregation of Da dead. 21:17 He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man: he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich. 21:18 The wicked shall be a ransom for Da righteous, and Da transgressor for Da upright. 21:19 It is better to dwell in Da wilderness, than with a contentious and an angry woman. 21:20 There is treasure to be desired and oil in Da dwelling of Da wise; but a foolish man spendeth it up. 21:21 He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour. 21:22 A wise man scaleth Da city of Da mighty, and casteth down Da strength of Da confidence thereof. 21:23 Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles. 21:24 Proud and haughty scorner is his name, who dealeth in proud wrath. 21:25 The desire of Da slothful killeth him; for his hands refuse to labour. 21:26 He coveteth greedily all Da day long: but Da righteous giveth and spareth not. 21:27 The sacrifice of Da wicked is abomination: how much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked mind? 21:28 A false witness shall perish: but Da man that heareth speaketh constantly. 21:29 A wicked man hardeneth his face: but as for Da upright, he directeth his way. 21:30 There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against Da LORD. 21:31 The horse is prepared against Da day of battle: but safety is of Da LORD. 22:1 A GOOD name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold. 22:2 The rich and poor meet together: Da LORD is Da maker of them all. 22:3 A prudent man foreseeth Da evil, and hideth himself: but Da simple pass on, and are punished. 22:4 By humility and Da fear of Da LORD are riches, and honour, and life. 22:5 Thorns and snares are in Da way of Da froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them. 22:6 Train up a child in Da way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it. 22:7 The rich ruleth over Da poor, and Da borrower is servant to Da lender. 22:8 He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and Da rod of his anger shall fail. 22:9 He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to Da poor. 22:10 Cast out Da scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease. 22:11 He that loveth pureness of heart, for Da grace of his lips Da king shall be his friend. 22:12 The eyes of Da LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth Da words of Da transgressor. 22:13 The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in Da streets. 22:14 The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of Da LORD shall fall therein. 22:15 Foolishness is bound in Da heart of a child; but Da rod of correction shall drive it far from him. 22:16 He that oppresseth Da poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to Da rich, shall surely come to want. 22:17 Bow down thine ear, and hear Da words of Da wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge. 22:18 For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips. 22:19 That thy trust may be in Da LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee. 22:20 Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge, 22:21 That I might make thee know Da certainty of Da words of truth; that thou mightest answer Da words of truth to them that send unto thee? 22:22 Rob not Da poor, because he is poor: neither oppress Da afflicted in Da gate: 22:23 For Da LORD will plead their cause, and spoil Da soul of those that spoiled them. 22:24 Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go: 22:25 Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul. 22:26 Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts. 22:27 If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee? 22:28 Remove not Da ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set. 22:29 Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men. 23:1 When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee: 23:2 And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite. 23:3 Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat. 23:4 Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom. 23:5 Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven. 23:6 Eat thou not Da bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats: 23:7 For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee. 23:8 The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words. 23:9 Speak not in Da ears of a fool: for he will despise Da wisdom of thy words. 23:10 Remove not Da old landmark; and enter not into Da fields of Da fatherless: 23:11 For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee. 23:12 Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to Da words of knowledge. 23:13 Withhold not correction from Da child: for if thou beatest him with Da rod, he shall not die. 23:14 Thou shalt beat him with Da rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell. 23:15 My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine. 23:16 Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things. 23:17 Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in Da fear of Da LORD all Da day long. 23:18 For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off. 23:19 Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in Da way. 23:20 Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh: 23:21 For Da drunkard and Da glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags. 23:22 Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old. 23:23 Buy Da truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding. 23:24 The father of Da righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him. 23:25 Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice. 23:26 My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways. 23:27 For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit. 23:28 She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth Da transgressors among men. 23:29 Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes? 23:30 They that tarry long at Da wine; they that go to seek mixed wine. 23:31 Look not thou upon Da wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in Da cup, when it moveth itself aright. 23:32 At Da last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder. 23:33 Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things. 23:34 Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in Da midst of Da sea, or as he that lieth upon Da top of a mast. 23:35 They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again. 24:1 Be not thou envious against evil men, neither desire to be with them. 24:2 For their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief. 24:3 Through wisdom is an house builded; and by understanding it is established: 24:4 And by knowledge shall Da chambers be filled with all precious and pleasant riches. 24:5 A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength. 24:6 For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war: and in multitude of counsellors there is safety. 24:7 Wisdom is too high for a fool: he openeth not his mouth in Da gate. 24:8 He that deviseth to do evil shall be called a mischievous person. 24:9 The thought of foolishness is sin: and Da scorner is an abomination to men. 24:10 If thou faint in Da day of adversity, thy strength is small. 24:11 If thou forbear to deliver them that are drawn unto death, and those that are ready to be slain; 24:12 If thou sayest, Behold, we knew it not; doth not he that pondereth Da heart consider it? and he that keepeth thy soul, doth not he know it? and shall not he render to every man according to his works? 24:13 My son, eat thou honey, because it is good; and Da honeycomb, which is sweet to thy taste: 24:14 So shall Da knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul: when thou hast found it, then there shall be a reward, and thy expectation shall not be cut off. 24:15 Lay not wait, O wicked man, against Da dwelling of Da righteous; spoil not his resting place: 24:16 For a just man falleth seven times, and riseth up again: but Da wicked shall fall into mischief. 24:17 Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, and let not thine heart be glad when he stumbleth: 24:18 Lest Da LORD see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him. 24:19 Fret not thyself because of evil men, neither be thou envious at Da wicked: 24:20 For there shall be no reward to Da evil man; Da candle of Da wicked shall be put out. 24:21 My son, fear thou Da LORD and Da king: and meddle not with them that are given to change: 24:22 For their calamity shall rise suddenly; and who knoweth Da ruin of them both? 24:23 These things also belong to Da wise. It is not good to have respect of persons in judgment. 24:24 He that saith unto Da wicked, Thou are righteous; him shall Da people curse, nations shall abhor him: 24:25 But to them that rebuke him shall be delight, and a good blessing shall come upon them. 24:26 Every man shall kiss his lips that giveth a right answer. 24:27 Prepare thy work without, and make it fit for thyself in Da field; and afterwards build thine house. 24:28 Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; and deceive not with thy lips. 24:29 Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to Da man according to his work. 24:30 I went by Da field of Da slothful, and by Da vineyard of Da man void of understanding; 24:31 And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered Da face thereof, and Da stone wall thereof was broken down. 24:32 Then I saw, and considered it well: I looked upon it, and received instruction. 24:33 Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of Da hands to sleep: 24:34 So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth; and thy want as an armed man. 25:1 These are also proverbs of Solomon, which Da men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out. 25:2 It is Da glory of God to conceal a thing: but Da honour of kings is to search out a matter. 25:3 The heaven for height, and Da earth for depth, and Da heart of kings is unsearchable. 25:4 Take away Da dross from Da silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for Da finer. 25:5 Take away Da wicked from before Da king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness. 25:6 Put not forth thyself in Da presence of Da king, and stand not in Da place of great men: 25:7 For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in Da presence of Da prince whom thine eyes have seen. 25:8 Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in Da end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame. 25:9 Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself; and discover not a secret to another: 25:10 Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away. 25:11 A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver. 25:12 As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear. 25:13 As Da cold of snow in Da time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth Da soul of his masters. 25:14 Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain. 25:15 By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh Da bone. 25:16 Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it. 25:17 Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbours house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee. 25:18 A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow. 25:19 Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint. 25:20 As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart. 25:21 If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink: 25:22 For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and Da LORD shall reward thee. 25:23 The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue. 25:24 It is better to dwell in Da corner of Da housetop, than with a brawling woman and in a wide house. 25:25 As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country. 25:26 A righteous man falling down before Da wicked is as a troubled fountain, and a corrupt spring. 25:27 It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own glory is not glory. 25:28 He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls. 26:1 As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool. 26:2 As Da bird by wandering, as Da swallow by flying, so Da curse causeless shall not come. 26:3 A whip for Da horse, a bridle for Da ass, and a rod for Da fool’s back. 26:4 Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him. 26:5 Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit. 26:6 He that sendeth a message by Da hand of a fool cutteth off Da feet, and drinketh damage. 26:7 The legs of Da lame are not equal: so is a parable in Da mouth of fools. 26:8 As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool. 26:9 As a thorn goeth up into Da hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in Da mouths of fools. 26:10 The great God that formed all things both rewardeth Da fool, and rewardeth transgressors. 26:11 As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly. 26:12 Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him. 26:13 The slothful man saith, There is a lion in Da way; a lion is in Da streets. 26:14 As Da door turneth upon his hinges, so doth Da slothful upon his bed. 26:15 The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth. 26:16 The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason. 26:17 He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by Da ears. 26:18 As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death, 26:19 So is Da man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport? 26:20 Where no wood is, there Da fire goeth out: so where there is no talebearer, Da strife ceaseth. 26:21 As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife. 26:22 The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into Da innermost parts of Da belly. 26:23 Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross. 26:24 He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him; 26:25 When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart. 26:26 Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before Da whole congregation. 26:27 Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him. 26:28 A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin. 27:1 Boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth. 27:2 Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips. 27:3 A stone is heavy, and Da sand weighty; but a fool’s wrath is heavier than them both. 27:4 Wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before envy? 27:5 Open rebuke is better than secret love. 27:6 Faithful are Da wounds of a friend; but Da kisses of an enemy are deceitful. 27:7 The full soul loatheth an honeycomb; but to Da hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet. 27:8 As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place. 27:9 Ointment and perfume rejoice Da heart: so doth Da sweetness of a man’s friend by hearty counsel. 27:10 Thine own friend, and thy father’s friend, forsake not; neither go into thy brother’s house in Da day of thy calamity: for better is a neighbour that is near than a brother far off. 27:11 My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that reproacheth me. 27:12 A prudent man foreseeth Da evil, and hideth himself; but Da simple pass on, and are punished. 27:13 Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him for a strange woman. 27:14 He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in Da morning, it shall be counted a curse to him. 27:15 A continual dropping in a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike. 27:16 Whosoever hideth her hideth Da wind, and Da ointment of his right hand, which bewrayeth itself. 27:17 Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth Da countenance of his friend. 27:18 Whoso keepeth Da fig tree shall eat Da fruit thereof: so he that waiteth on his master shall be honoured. 27:19 As in water face answereth to face, so Da heart of man to man. 27:20 Hell and destruction are never full; so Da eyes of man are never satisfied. 27:21 As Da fining pot for silver, and Da furnace for gold; so is a man to his praise. 27:22 Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle, yet will not his foolishness depart from him. 27:23 Be thou diligent to know Da state of thy flocks, and look well to thy herds. 27:24 For riches are not for ever: and doth Da crown endure to every generation? 27:25 The hay appeareth, and Da tender grass sheweth itself, and herbs of Da mountains are gathered. 27:26 The lambs are for thy clothing, and Da goats are Da price of Da field. 27:27 And thou shalt have goats’ milk enough for thy food, for Da food of thy household, and for Da maintenance for thy maidens. 28:1 The wicked flee when no man pursueth: but Da righteous are bold as a lion. 28:2 For Da transgression of a land many are Da princes thereof: but by a man of understanding and knowledge Da state thereof shall be prolonged. 28:3 A poor man that oppresseth Da poor is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food. 28:4 They that forsake Da law praise Da wicked: but such as keep Da law contend with them. 28:5 Evil men understand not judgment: but they that seek Da LORD understand all things. 28:6 Better is Da poor that walketh in his uprightness, than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich. 28:7 Whoso keepeth Da law is a wise son: but he that is a companion of riotous men shameth his father. 28:8 He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance, he shall gather it for him that will pity Da poor. 28:9 He that turneth away his ear from hearing Da law, even his prayer shall be abomination. 28:10 Whoso causeth Da righteous to go astray in an evil way, he shall fall himself into his own pit: but Da upright shall have good things in possession. 28:11 The rich man is wise in his own conceit; but Da poor that hath understanding searcheth him out. 28:12 When righteous men do rejoice, there is great glory: but when Da wicked rise, a man is hidden. 28:13 He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy. 28:14 Happy is Da man that feareth alway: but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief. 28:15 As a roaring lion, and a ranging bear; so is a wicked ruler over Da poor people. 28:16 The prince that wanteth understanding is also a great oppressor: but he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days. 28:17 A man that doeth violence to Da blood of any person shall flee to Da pit; let no man stay him. 28:18 Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved: but he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once. 28:19 He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread: but he that followeth after vain persons shall have poverty enough. 28:20 A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent. 28:21 To have respect of persons is not good: for for a piece of bread that man will transgress. 28:22 He that hasteth to be rich hath an evil eye, and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him. 28:23 He that rebuketh a man afterwards shall find more favour than he that flattereth with Da tongue. 28:24 Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, It is no transgression; Da same is Da companion of a destroyer. 28:25 He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife: but he that putteth his trust in Da LORD shall be made fat. 28:26 He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool: but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered. 28:27 He that giveth unto Da poor shall not lack: but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse. 28:28 When Da wicked rise, men hide themselves: but when they perish, Da righteous increase. 29:1 He, that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy. 29:2 When Da righteous are in authority, Da people rejoice: but when Da wicked beareth rule, Da people mourn. 29:3 Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth his substance. 29:4 The king by judgment establisheth Da land: but he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it. 29:5 A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his feet. 29:6 In Da transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but Da righteous doth sing and rejoice. 29:7 The righteous considereth Da cause of Da poor: but Da wicked regardeth not to know it. 29:8 Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath. 29:9 If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, there is no rest. 29:10 The bloodthirsty hate Da upright: but Da just seek his soul. 29:11 A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards. 29:12 If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked. 29:13 The poor and Da deceitful man meet together: Da LORD lighteneth both their eyes. 29:14 The king that faithfully judgeth Da poor, his throne shall be established for ever. 29:15 The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame. 29:16 When Da wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but Da righteous shall see their fall. 29:17 Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul. 29:18 Where there is no vision, Da people perish: but he that keepeth Da law, happy is he. 29:19 A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer. 29:20 Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him. 29:21 He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become his son at Da length. 29:22 An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression. 29:23 A man’s pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold Da humble in spirit. 29:24 Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and bewrayeth it not. 29:25 The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in Da LORD shall be safe. 29:26 Many seek Da ruler’s favour; but every man’s judgment cometh from Da LORD. 29:27 An unjust man is an abomination to Da just: and he that is upright in Da way is abomination to Da wicked. 30:1 The words of Agur Da son of Jakeh, even Da prophecy: Da man spake unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal, 30:2 Surely I am more brutish than any man, and have not Da understanding of a man. 30:3 I neither learned wisdom, nor have Da knowledge of Da holy. 30:4 Who hath ascended up into heaven, or descended? who hath gathered Da wind in his fists? who hath bound Da waters in a garment? who hath established all Da ends of Da earth? what is his name, and what is his son’s name, if thou canst tell? 30:5 Every word of God is pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him. 30:6 Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar. 30:7 Two things have I required of thee; deny me them not before I die: 30:8 Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with food convenient for me: 30:9 Lest I be full, and deny thee, and say, Who is Da LORD? or lest I be poor, and steal, and take Da name of my God in vain. 30:10 Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty. 30:11 There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother. 30:12 There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness. 30:13 There is a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up. 30:14 There is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives, to devour Da poor from off Da earth, and Da needy from among men. 30:15 The horseleach hath two daughters, crying, Give, give. There are three things that are never satisfied, yea, four things say not, It is enough: 30:16 The grave; and Da barren womb; Da earth that is not filled with water; and Da fire that saith not, It is enough. 30:17 The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, Da ravens of Da valley shall pick it out, and Da young eagles shall eat it. 30:18 There be three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not: 30:19 The way of an eagle in Da air; Da way of a serpent upon a rock; Da way of a ship in Da midst of Da sea; and Da way of a man with a maid. 30:20 Such is Da way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness. 30:21 For three things Da earth is disquieted, and for four which it cannot bear: 30:22 For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with meat; 30:23 For an odious woman when she is married; and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress. 30:24 There be four things which are little upon Da earth, but they are exceeding wise: 30:25 The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in Da summer; 30:26 The conies are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in Da rocks; 30:27 The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands; 30:28 The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings’ palaces. 30:29 There be three things which go well, yea, four are comely in going: 30:30 A lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any; 30:31 A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom there is no rising up. 30:32 If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay thine hand upon thy mouth. 30:33 Surely Da churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and Da wringing of Da nose bringeth forth blood: so Da forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife. 31:1 The words of king Lemuel, Da prophecy that his mother taught him. 31:2 What, my son? and what, Da son of my womb? and what, Da son of my vows? 31:3 Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings. 31:4 It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink: 31:5 Lest they drink, and forget Da law, and pervert Da judgment of any of Da afflicted. 31:6 Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts. 31:7 Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more. 31:8 Open thy mouth for Da dumb in Da cause of all such as are appointed to destruction. 31:9 Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead Da cause of Da poor and needy. 31:10 Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies. 31:11 The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil. 31:12 She will do him good and not evil all Da days of her life. 31:13 She seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands. 31:14 She is like Da merchants’ ships; she bringeth her food from afar. 31:15 She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens. 31:16 She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with Da fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard. 31:17 She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms. 31:18 She perceiveth that her merchandise is good: her candle goeth not out by night. 31:19 She layeth her hands to Da spindle, and her hands hold Da distaff. 31:20 She stretcheth out her hand to Da poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to Da needy. 31:21 She is not afraid of Da snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet. 31:22 She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple. 31:23 Her husband is known in Da gates, when he sitteth among Da elders of Da land. 31:24 She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles unto Da merchant. 31:25 Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come. 31:26 She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is Da law of kindness. 31:27 She looketh well to Da ways of her household, and eateth not Da bread of idleness. 31:28 Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her. 31:29 Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all. 31:30 Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth Da LORD, she shall be praised. 31:31 Give her of Da fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in Da gates. Ecclesiastes or The Preacher 1:1 The words of Da Preacher, Da son of David, king in Jerusalem. 1:2 Vanity of vanities, saith Da Preacher, vanity of vanities; all is vanity. 1:3 What profit hath a man of all his labour which he taketh under Da sun? 1:4 One generation passeth away, and another generation cometh: but Da earth abideth for ever. 1:5 The sun also ariseth, and Da sun goeth down, and hasteth to his place where he arose. 1:6 The wind goeth toward Da south, and turneth about unto Da north; it whirleth about continually, and Da wind returneth again according to his circuits. 1:7 All Da rivers run into Da sea; yet Da sea is not full; unto Da place from whence Da rivers come, thither they return again. 1:8 All things are full of labour; man cannot utter it: Da eye is not satisfied with seeing, nor Da ear filled with hearing. 1:9 The thing that hath been, it is that which shall be; and that which is done is that which shall be done: and there is no new thing under Da sun. 1:10 Is there any thing whereof it may be said, See, this is new? it hath been already of old time, which was before us. 1:11 There is no remembrance of former things; neither shall there be any remembrance of things that are to come with those that shall come after. 1:12 I Da Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem. 1:13 And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail hath God given to Da sons of man to be exercised therewith. 1:14 I have seen all Da works that are done under Da sun; and, behold, all is vanity and vexation of spirit. 1:15 That which is crooked cannot be made straight: and that which is wanting cannot be numbered. 1:16 I communed with mine own heart, saying, Lo, I am come to great estate, and have gotten more wisdom than all they that have been before me in Jerusalem: yea, my heart had great experience of wisdom and knowledge. 1:17 And I gave my heart to know wisdom, and to know madness and folly: I perceived that this also is vexation of spirit. 1:18 For in much wisdom is much grief: and he that increaseth knowledge increaseth sorrow. 2:1 I said in mine heart, Go to now, I will prove thee with mirth, therefore enjoy pleasure: and, behold, this also is vanity. 2:2 I said of laughter, It is mad: and of mirth, What doeth it? 2:3 I sought in mine heart to give myself unto wine, yet acquainting mine heart with wisdom; and to lay hold on folly, till I might see what was that good for Da sons of men, which they should do under Da heaven all Da days of their life. 2:4 I made me great works; I builded me houses; I planted me vineyards: 2:5 I made me gardens and orchards, and I planted trees in them of all kind of fruits: 2:6 I made me pools of water, to water therewith Da wood that bringeth forth trees: 2:7 I got me servants and maidens, and had servants born in my house; also I had great possessions of great and small cattle above all that were in Jerusalem before me: 2:8 I gathered me also silver and gold, and Da peculiar treasure of kings and of Da provinces: I gat me men singers and women singers, and Da delights of Da sons of men, as musical instruments, and that of all sorts. 2:9 So I was great, and increased more than all that were before me in Jerusalem: also my wisdom remained with me. 2:10 And whatsoever mine eyes desired I kept not from them, I withheld not my heart from any joy; for my heart rejoiced in all my labour: and this was my portion of all my labour. 2:11 Then I looked on all Da works that my hands had wrought, and on Da labour that I had laboured to do: and, behold, all was vanity and vexation of spirit, and there was no profit under Da sun. 2:12 And I turned myself to behold wisdom, and madness, and folly: for what can Da man do that cometh after Da king? even that which hath been already done. 2:13 Then I saw that wisdom excelleth folly, as far as light excelleth darkness. 2:14 The wise man’s eyes are in his head; but Da fool walketh in darkness: and I myself perceived also that one event happeneth to them all. 2:15 Then said I in my heart, As it happeneth to Da fool, so it happeneth even to me; and why was I then more wise? Then I said in my heart, that this also is vanity. 2:16 For there is no remembrance of Da wise more than of Da fool for ever; seeing that which now is in Da days to come shall all be forgotten. And how dieth Da wise man? as Da fool. 2:17 Therefore I hated life; because Da work that is wrought under Da sun is grievous unto me: for all is vanity and vexation of spirit. 2:18 Yea, I hated all my labour which I had taken under Da sun: because I should leave it unto Da man that shall be after me. 2:19 And who knoweth whether he shall be a wise man or a fool? yet shall he have rule over all my labour wherein I have laboured, and wherein I have shewed myself wise under Da sun. This is also vanity. 2:20 Therefore I went about to cause my heart to despair of all Da labour which I took under Da sun. 2:21 For there is a man whose labour is in wisdom, and in knowledge, and in equity; yet to a man that hath not laboured therein shall he leave it for his portion. This also is vanity and a great evil. 2:22 For what hath man of all his labour, and of Da vexation of his heart, wherein he hath laboured under Da sun? 2:23 For all his days are sorrows, and his travail grief; yea, his heart taketh not rest in Da night. This is also vanity. 2:24 There is nothing better for a man, than that he should eat and drink, and that he should make his soul enjoy good in his labour. This also I saw, that it was from Da hand of God. 2:25 For who can eat, or who else can hasten hereunto, more than I? 2:26 For God giveth to a man that is good in his sight wisdom, and knowledge, and joy: but to Da sinner he giveth travail, to gather and to heap up, that he may give to him that is good before God. This also is vanity and vexation of spirit. 3:1 To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under Da heaven: 3:2 A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up that which is planted; 3:3 A time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up; 3:4 A time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance; 3:5 A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing; 3:6 A time to get, and a time to lose; a time to keep, and a time to cast away; 3:7 A time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak; 3:8 A time to love, and a time to hate; a time of war, and a time of peace. 3:9 What profit hath he that worketh in that wherein he laboureth? 3:10 I have seen Da travail, which God hath given to Da sons of men to be exercised in it. 3:11 He hath made every thing beautiful in his time: also he hath set Da world in their heart, so that no man can find out Da work that God maketh from Da beginning to Da end. 3:12 I know that there is no good in them, but for a man to rejoice, and to do good in his life. 3:13 And also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy Da good of all his labour, it is Da gift of God. 3:14 I know that, whatsoever God doeth, it shall be for ever: nothing can be put to it, nor any thing taken from it: and God doeth it, that men should fear before him. 3:15 That which hath been is now; and that which is to be hath already been; and God requireth that which is past. 3:16 And moreover I saw under Da sun Da place of judgment, that wickedness was there; and Da place of righteousness, that iniquity was there. 3:17 I said in mine heart, God shall judge Da righteous and Da wicked: for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work. 3:18 I said in mine heart concerning Da estate of Da sons of men, that God might manifest them, and that they might see that they themselves are beasts. 3:19 For that which befalleth Da sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as Da one dieth, so dieth Da other; yea, they have all one breath; so that a man hath no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity. 3:20 All go unto one place; all are of Da dust, and all turn to dust again. 3:21 Who knoweth Da spirit of man that goeth upward, and Da spirit of Da beast that goeth downward to Da earth? 3:22 Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him? 4:1 So I returned, and considered all Da oppressions that are done under Da sun: and behold Da tears of such as were oppressed, and they had no comforter; and on Da side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter. 4:2 Wherefore I praised Da dead which are already dead more than Da living which are yet alive. 4:3 Yea, better is he than both they, which hath not yet been, who hath not seen Da evil work that is done under Da sun. 4:4 Again, I considered all travail, and every right work, that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This is also vanity and vexation of spirit. 4:5 The fool foldeth his hands together, and eateth his own flesh. 4:6 Better is an handful with quietness, than both Da hands full with travail and vexation of spirit. 4:7 Then I returned, and I saw vanity under Da sun. 4:8 There is one alone, and there is not a second; yea, he hath neither child nor brother: yet is there no end of all his labour; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither saith he, For whom do I labour, and bereave my soul of good? This is also vanity, yea, it is a sore travail. 4:9 Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour. 4:10 For if they fall, Da one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him that is alone when he falleth; for he hath not another to help him up. 4:11 Again, if two lie together, then they have heat: but how can one be warm alone? 4:12 And if one prevail against him, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken. 4:13 Better is a poor and a wise child than an old and foolish king, who will no more be admonished. 4:14 For out of prison he cometh to reign; whereas also he that is born in his kingdom becometh poor. 4:15 I considered all Da living which walk under Da sun, with Da second child that shall stand up in his stead. 4:16 There is no end of all Da people, even of all that have been before them: they also that come after shall not rejoice in him. Surely this also is vanity and vexation of spirit. 5:1 Keep thy foot when thou goest to Da house of God, and be more ready to hear, than to give Da sacrifice of fools: for they consider not that they do evil. 5:2 Be not rash with thy mouth, and let not thine heart be hasty to utter any thing before God: for God is in heaven, and thou upon earth: therefore let thy words be few. 5:3 For a dream cometh through Da multitude of business; and a fool’s voice is known by multitude of words. 5:4 When thou vowest a vow unto God, defer not to pay it; for he hath no pleasure in fools: pay that which thou hast vowed. 5:5 Better is it that thou shouldest not vow, than that thou shouldest vow and not pay. 5:6 Suffer not thy mouth to cause thy flesh to sin; neither say thou before Da angel, that it was an error: wherefore should God be angry at thy voice, and destroy Da work of thine hands? 5:7 For in Da multitude of dreams and many words there are also divers vanities: but fear thou God. 5:8 If thou seest Da oppression of Da poor, and violent perverting of judgment and justice in a province, marvel not at Da matter: for he that is higher than Da highest regardeth;
