and there be higher than they. 5:9 Moreover Da profit of Da earth is for all: Da king himself is served by Da field. 5:10 He that loveth silver shall not be satisfied with silver; nor he that loveth abundance with increase: this is also vanity. 5:11 When goods increase, they are increased that eat them: and what good is there to Da owners thereof, saving Da beholding of them with their eyes? 5:12 The sleep of a labouring man is sweet, whether he eat little or much: but Da abundance of Da rich will not suffer him to sleep. 5:13 There is a sore evil which I have seen under Da sun, namely, riches kept for Da owners thereof to their hurt. 5:14 But those riches perish by evil travail: and he begetteth a son, and there is nothing in his hand. 5:15 As he came forth of his mother’s womb, naked shall he return to go as he came, and shall take nothing of his labour, which he may carry away in his hand. 5:16 And this also is a sore evil, that in all points as he came, so shall he go: and what profit hath he that hath laboured for Da wind? 5:17 All his days also he eateth in darkness, and he hath much sorrow and wrath with his sickness. 5:18 Behold that which I have seen: it is good and comely for one to eat and to drink, and to enjoy Da good of all his labour that he taketh under Da sun all Da days of his life, which God giveth him: for it is his portion. 5:19 Every man also to whom God hath given riches and wealth, and hath given him power to eat thereof, and to take his portion, and to rejoice in his labour; this is Da gift of God. 5:20 For he shall not much remember Da days of his life; because God answereth him in Da joy of his heart. 6:1 There is an evil which I have seen under Da sun, and it is common among men: 6:2 A man to whom God hath given riches, wealth, and honour, so that he wanteth nothing for his soul of all that he desireth, yet God giveth him not power to eat thereof, but a stranger eateth it: this is vanity, and it is an evil disease. 6:3 If a man beget an hundred children, and live many years, so that Da days of his years be many, and his soul be not filled with good, and also that he have no burial; I say, that an untimely birth is better than he. 6:4 For he cometh in with vanity, and departeth in darkness, and his name shall be covered with darkness. 6:5 Moreover he hath not seen Da sun, nor known any thing: this hath more rest than Da other. 6:6 Yea, though he live a thousand years twice told, yet hath he seen no good: do not all go to one place? 6:7 All Da labour of man is for his mouth, and yet Da appetite is not filled. 6:8 For what hath Da wise more than Da fool? what hath Da poor, that knoweth to walk before Da living? 6:9 Better is Da sight of Da eyes than Da wandering of Da desire: this is also vanity and vexation of spirit. 6:10 That which hath been is named already, and it is known that it is man: neither may he contend with him that is mightier than he. 6:11 Seeing there be many things that increase vanity, what is man Da better? 6:12 For who knoweth what is good for man in this life, all Da days of his vain life which he spendeth as a shadow? for who can tell a man what shall be after him under Da sun? 7:1 A good name is better than precious ointment; and Da day of death than Da day of one’s birth. 7:2 It is better to go to Da house of mourning, than to go to Da house of feasting: for that is Da end of all men; and Da living will lay it to his heart. 7:3 Sorrow is better than laughter: for by Da sadness of Da countenance Da heart is made better. 7:4 The heart of Da wise is in Da house of mourning; but Da heart of fools is in Da house of mirth. 7:5 It is better to hear Da rebuke of Da wise, than for a man to hear Da song of fools. 7:6 For as Da crackling of thorns under a pot, so is Da laughter of Da fool: this also is vanity. 7:7 Surely oppression maketh a wise man mad; and a gift destroyeth Da heart. 7:8 Better is Da end of a thing than Da beginning thereof: and Da patient in spirit is better than Da proud in spirit. 7:9 Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in Da bosom of fools. 7:10 Say not thou, What is Da cause that Da former days were better than these? for thou dost not enquire wisely concerning this. 7:11 Wisdom is good with an inheritance: and by it there is profit to them that see Da sun. 7:12 For wisdom is a defence, and money is a defence: but Da excellency of knowledge is, that wisdom giveth life to them that have it. 7:13 Consider Da work of God: for who can make that straight, which he hath made crooked? 7:14 In Da day of prosperity be joyful, but in Da day of adversity consider: God also hath set Da one over against Da other, to Da end that man should find nothing after him. 7:15 All things have I seen in Da days of my vanity: there is a just man that perisheth in his righteousness, and there is a wicked man that prolongeth his life in his wickedness. 7:16 Be not righteous over much; neither make thyself over wise: why shouldest thou destroy thyself ? 7:17 Be not over much wicked, neither be thou foolish: why shouldest thou die before thy time? 7:18 It is good that thou shouldest take hold of this; yea, also from this withdraw not thine hand: for he that feareth God shall come forth of them all. 7:19 Wisdom strengtheneth Da wise more than ten mighty men which are in Da city. 7:20 For there is not a just man upon earth, that doeth good, and sinneth not. 7:21 Also take no heed unto all words that are spoken; lest thou hear thy servant curse thee: 7:22 For oftentimes also thine own heart knoweth that thou thyself likewise hast cursed others. 7:23 All this have I proved by wisdom: I said, I will be wise; but it was far from me. 7:24 That which is far off, and exceeding deep, who can find it out? 7:25 I applied mine heart to know, and to search, and to seek out wisdom, and Da reason of things, and to know Da wickedness of folly, even of foolishness and madness: 7:26 And I find more bitter than death Da woman, whose heart is snares and nets, and her hands as bands: whoso pleaseth God shall escape from her; but Da sinner shall be taken by her. 7:27 Behold, this have I found, saith Da preacher, counting one by one, to find out Da account: 7:28 Which yet my soul seeketh, but I find not: one man among a thousand have I found; but a woman among all those have I not found. 7:29 Lo, this only have I found, that God hath made man upright; but they have sought out many inventions. 8:1 Who is as Da wise man? and who knoweth Da interpretation of a thing? a man’s wisdom maketh his face to shine, and Da boldness of his face shall be changed. 8:2 I counsel thee to keep Da king’s commandment, and that in regard of Da oath of God. 8:3 Be not hasty to go out of his sight: stand not in an evil thing; for he doeth whatsoever pleaseth him. 8:4 Where Da word of a king is, there is power: and who may say unto him, What doest thou? 8:5 Whoso keepeth Da commandment shall feel no evil thing: and a wise man’s heart discerneth both time and judgment. 8:6 Because to every purpose there is time and judgment, therefore Da misery of man is great upon him. 8:7 For he knoweth not that which shall be: for who can tell him when it shall be? 8:8 There is no man that hath power over Da spirit to retain Da spirit; neither hath he power in Da day of death: and there is no discharge in that war; neither shall wickedness deliver those that are given to it. 8:9 All this have I seen, and applied my heart unto every work that is done under Da sun: there is a time wherein one man ruleth over another to his own hurt. 8:10 And so I saw Da wicked buried, who had come and gone from Da place of Da holy, and they were forgotten in Da city where they had so done: this is also vanity. 8:11 Because sentence against an evil work is not executed speedily, therefore Da heart of Da sons of men is fully set in them to do evil. 8:12 Though a sinner do evil an hundred times, and his days be prolonged, yet surely I know that it shall be well with them that fear God, which fear before him: 8:13 But it shall not be well with Da wicked, neither shall he prolong his days, which are as a shadow; because he feareth not before God. 8:14 There is a vanity which is done upon Da earth; that there be just men, unto whom it happeneth according to Da work of Da wicked; again, there be wicked men, to whom it happeneth according to Da work of Da righteous: I said that this also is vanity. 8:15 Then I commended mirth, because a man hath no better thing under Da sun, than to eat, and to drink, and to be merry: for that shall abide with him of his labour Da days of his life, which God giveth him under Da sun. 8:16 When I applied mine heart to know wisdom, and to see Da business that is done upon Da earth: (for also there is that neither day nor night seeth sleep with his eyes:) 8:17 Then I beheld all Da work of God, that a man cannot find out Da work that is done under Da sun: because though a man labour to seek it out, yet he shall not find it; yea farther; though a wise man think to know it, yet shall he not be able to find it. 9:1 For all this I considered in my heart even to declare all this, that Da righteous, and Da wise, and their works, are in Da hand of God: no man knoweth either love or hatred by all that is before them. 9:2 All things come alike to all: there is one event to Da righteous, and to Da wicked; to Da good and to Da clean, and to Da unclean; to him that sacrificeth, and to him that sacrificeth not: as is Da good, so is Da sinner; and he that sweareth, as he that feareth an oath. 9:3 This is an evil among all things that are done under Da sun, that there is one event unto all: yea, also Da heart of Da sons of men is full of evil, and madness is in their heart while they live, and after that they go to Da dead. 9:4 For to him that is joined to all Da living there is hope: for a living dog is better than a dead lion. 9:5 For Da living know that they shall die: but Da dead know not any thing, neither have they any more a reward; for Da memory of them is forgotten. 9:6 Also their love, and their hatred, and their envy, is now perished; neither have they any more a portion for ever in any thing that is done under Da sun. 9:7 Go thy way, eat thy bread with joy, and drink thy wine with a merry heart; for God now accepteth thy works. 9:8 Let thy garments be always white; and let thy head lack no ointment. 9:9 Live joyfully with Da wife whom thou lovest all Da days of Da life of thy vanity, which he hath given thee under Da sun, all Da days of thy vanity: for that is thy portion in this life, and in thy labour which thou takest under Da sun. 9:10 Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with thy might; for there is no work, nor device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom, in Da grave, whither thou goest. 9:11 I returned, and saw under Da sun, that Da race is not to Da swift, nor Da battle to Da strong, neither yet bread to Da wise, nor yet riches to men of understanding, nor yet favour to men of skill; but time and chance happeneth to them all. 9:12 For man also knoweth not his time: as Da fishes that are taken in an evil net, and as Da birds that are caught in Da snare; so are Da sons of men snared in an evil time, when it falleth suddenly upon them. 9:13 This wisdom have I seen also under Da sun, and it seemed great unto me: 9:14 There was a little city, and few men within it; and there came a great king against it, and besieged it, and built great bulwarks against it: 9:15 Now there was found in it a poor wise man, and he by his wisdom delivered Da city; yet no man remembered that same poor man. 9:16 Then said I, Wisdom is better than strength: nevertheless Da poor man’s wisdom is despised, and his words are not heard. 9:17 The words of wise men are heard in quiet more than Da cry of him that ruleth among fools. 9:18 Wisdom is better than weapons of war: but one sinner destroyeth much good. 10:1 Dead flies cause Da ointment of Da apothecary to send forth a stinking savour: so doth a little folly him that is in reputation for wisdom and honour. 10:2 A wise man’s heart is at his right hand; but a fool’s heart at his left. 10:3 Yea also, when he that is a fool walketh by Da way, his wisdom faileth him, and he saith to every one that he is a fool. 10:4 If Da spirit of Da ruler rise up against thee, leave not thy place; for yielding pacifieth great offences. 10:5 There is an evil which I have seen under Da sun, as an error which proceedeth from Da ruler: 10:6 Folly is set in great dignity, and Da rich sit in low place. 10:7 I have seen servants upon horses, and princes walking as servants upon Da earth. 10:8 He that diggeth a pit shall fall into it; and whoso breaketh an hedge, a serpent shall bite him. 10:9 Whoso removeth stones shall be hurt therewith; and he that cleaveth wood shall be endangered thereby. 10:10 If Da iron be blunt, and he do not whet Da edge, then must he put to more strength: but wisdom is profitable to direct. 10:11 Surely Da serpent will bite without enchantment; and a babbler is no better. 10:12 The words of a wise man’s mouth are gracious; but Da lips of a fool will swallow up himself. 10:13 The beginning of Da words of his mouth is foolishness: and Da end of his talk is mischievous madness. 10:14 A fool also is full of words: a man cannot tell what shall be; and what shall be after him, who can tell him? 10:15 The labour of Da foolish wearieth every one of them, because he knoweth not how to go to Da city. 10:16 Woe to thee, O land, when thy king is a child, and thy princes eat in Da morning! 10:17 Blessed art thou, O land, when thy king is Da son of nobles, and thy princes eat in due season, for strength, and not for drunkenness! 10:18 By much slothfulness Da building decayeth; and through idleness of Da hands Da house droppeth through. 10:19 A feast is made for laughter, and wine maketh merry: but money answereth all things. 10:20 Curse not Da king, no not in thy thought; and curse not Da rich in thy bedchamber: for a bird of Da air shall carry Da voice, and that which hath wings shall tell Da matter. 11:1 Cast thy bread upon Da waters: for thou shalt find it after many days. 11:2 Give a portion to seven, and also to eight; for thou knowest not what evil shall be upon Da earth. 11:3 If Da clouds be full of rain, they empty themselves upon Da earth: and if Da tree fall toward Da south, or toward Da north, in Da place where Da tree falleth, there it shall be. 11:4 He that observeth Da wind shall not sow; and he that regardeth Da clouds shall not reap. 11:5 As thou knowest not what is Da way of Da spirit, nor how Da bones do grow in Da womb of her that is with child: even so thou knowest not Da works of God who maketh all. 11:6 In Da morning sow thy seed, and in Da evening withhold not thine hand: for thou knowest not whether shall prosper, either this or that, or whether they both shall be alike good. 11:7 Truly Da light is sweet, and a pleasant thing it is for Da eyes to behold Da sun: 11:8 But if a man live many years, and rejoice in them all; yet let him remember Da days of darkness; for they shall be many. All that cometh is vanity. 11:9 Rejoice, O young man, in thy youth; and let thy heart cheer thee in Da days of thy youth, and walk in Da ways of thine heart, and in Da sight of thine eyes: but know thou, that for all these things God will bring thee into judgment. 11:10 Therefore remove sorrow from thy heart, and put away evil from thy flesh: for childhood and youth are vanity. 12:1 Remember now thy Creator in Da days of thy youth, while Da evil days come not, nor Da years draw nigh, when thou shalt say, I have no pleasure in them; 12:2 While Da sun, or Da light, or Da moon, or Da stars, be not darkened, nor Da clouds return after Da rain: 12:3 In Da day when Da keepers of Da house shall tremble, and Da strong men shall bow themselves, and Da grinders cease because they are few, and those that look out of Da windows be darkened, 12:4 And Da doors shall be shut in Da streets, when Da sound of Da grinding is low, and he shall rise up at Da voice of Da bird, and all Da daughters of musick shall be brought low; 12:5 Also when they shall be afraid of that which is high, and fears shall be in Da way, and Da almond tree shall flourish, and Da grasshopper shall be a burden, and desire shall fail: because man goeth to his long home, and Da mourners go about Da streets: 12:6 Or ever Da silver cord be loosed, or Da golden bowl be broken, or Da pitcher be broken at Da fountain, or Da wheel broken at Da cistern. 12:7 Then shall Da dust return to Da earth as it was: and Da spirit shall return unto God who gave it. 12:8 Vanity of vanities, saith Da preacher; all is vanity. 12:9 And moreover, because Da preacher was wise, he still taught Da people knowledge; yea, he gave good heed, and sought out, and set in order many proverbs. 12:10 The preacher sought to find out acceptable words: and that which was written was upright, even words of truth. 12:11 The words of Da wise are as goads, and as nails fastened by Da masters of assemblies, which are given from one shepherd. 12:12 And further, by these, my son, be admonished: of making many books there is no end; and much study is a weariness of Da flesh. 12:13 Let us hear Da conclusion of Da whole matter: Fear God, and keep his commandments: for this is Da whole duty of man. 12:14 For God shall bring every work into judgment, with every secret thing, whether it be good, or whether it be evil. The Song of Solomon 1:1 The song of songs, which is Solomon’s. 1:2 Let him kiss me with Da kisses of his mouth: for thy love is better than wine. 1:3 Because of Da savour of thy good ointments thy name is as ointment poured forth, therefore do Da virgins love thee. 1:4 Draw me, we will run after thee: Da king hath brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: Da upright love thee. 1:5 I am black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as Da tents of Kedar, as Da curtains of Solomon. 1:6 Look not upon me, because I am black, because Da sun hath looked upon me: my mother’s children were angry with me; they made me Da keeper of Da vineyards; but mine own vineyard have I not kept. 1:7 Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turneth aside by Da flocks of thy companions? 1:8 If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, go thy way forth by Da footsteps of Da flock, and feed thy kids beside Da shepherds’ tents. 1:9 I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh’s chariots. 1:10 Thy cheeks are comely with rows of jewels, thy neck with chains of gold. 1:11 We will make thee borders of gold with studs of silver. 1:12 While Da king sitteth at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth Da smell thereof. 1:13 A bundle of myrrh is my well-beloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts. 1:14 My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire in Da vineyards of Engedi. 1:15 Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves’ eyes. 1:16 Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: also our bed is green. 1:17 The beams of our house are cedar, and our rafters of fir. 2:1 I am Da rose of Sharon, and Da lily of Da valleys. 2:2 As Da lily among thorns, so is my love among Da daughters. 2:3 As Da apple tree among Da trees of Da wood, so is my beloved among Da sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste. 2:4 He brought me to Da banqueting house, and his banner over me was love. 2:5 Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I am sick of love. 2:6 His left hand is under my head, and his right hand doth embrace me. 2:7 I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by Da roes, and by Da hinds of Da field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please. 2:8 The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh leaping upon Da mountains, skipping upon Da hills. 2:9 My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: behold, he standeth behind our wall, he looketh forth at Da windows, shewing himself through Da lattice. 2:10 My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away. 2:11 For, lo, Da winter is past, Da rain is over and gone; 2:12 The flowers appear on Da earth; Da time of Da singing of birds is come, and Da voice of Da turtle is heard in our land; 2:13 The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, and Da vines with Da tender grape give a good smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away. 2:14 O my dove, that art in Da clefts of Da rock, in Da secret places of Da stairs, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely. 2:15 Take us Da foxes, Da little foxes, that spoil Da vines: for our vines have tender grapes. 2:16 My beloved is mine, and I am his: he feedeth among Da lilies. 2:17 Until Da day break, and Da shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon Da mountains of Bether. 3:1 By night on my bed I sought him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not. 3:2 I will rise now, and go about Da city in Da streets, and in Da broad ways I will seek him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not. 3:3 The watchmen that go about Da city found me: to whom I said, Saw ye him whom my soul loveth? 3:4 It was but a little that I passed from them, but I found him whom my soul loveth: I held him, and would not let him go, until I had brought him into my mother’s house, and into Da chamber of her that conceived me. 3:5 I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by Da roes, and by Da hinds of Da field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please. 3:6 Who is this that cometh out of Da wilderness like pillars of smoke, perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, with all powders of Da merchant? 3:7 Behold his bed, which is Solomon’s; threescore valiant men are about it, of Da valiant of Israel. 3:8 They all hold swords, being expert in war: every man hath his sword upon his thigh because of fear in Da night. 3:9 King Solomon made himself a chariot of Da wood of Lebanon. 3:10 He made Da pillars thereof of silver, Da bottom thereof of gold, Da covering of it of purple, Da midst thereof being paved with love, for Da daughters of Jerusalem. 3:11 Go forth, O ye daughters of Zion, and behold king Solomon with Da crown wherewith his mother crowned him in Da day of his espousals, and in Da day of Da gladness of his heart. 4:1 Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves’ eyes within thy locks: thy hair is as a flock of goats, that appear from mount Gilead. 4:2 Thy teeth are like a flock of sheep that are even shorn, which came up from Da washing; whereof every one bear twins, and none is barren among them. 4:3 Thy lips are like a thread of scarlet, and thy speech is comely: thy temples are like a piece of a pomegranate within thy locks. 4:4 Thy neck is like Da tower of David builded for an armoury, whereon there hang a thousand bucklers, all shields of mighty men. 4:5 Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins, which feed among Da lilies. 4:6 Until Da day break, and Da shadows flee away, I will get me to Da mountain of myrrh, and to Da hill of frankincense. 4:7 Thou art all fair, my love; there is no spot in thee. 4:8 Come with me from Lebanon, my spouse, with me from Lebanon: look from Da top of Amana, from Da top of Shenir and Hermon, from Da lions’ dens, from Da mountains of Da leopards. 4:9 Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister, my spouse; thou hast ravished my heart with one of thine eyes, with one chain of thy neck. 4:10 How fair is thy love, my sister, my spouse! how much better is thy love than wine! and Da smell of thine ointments than all spices! 4:11 Thy lips, O my spouse, drop as Da honeycomb: honey and milk are under thy tongue; and Da smell of thy garments is like Da smell of Lebanon. 4:12 A garden inclosed is my sister, my spouse; a spring shut up, a fountain sealed. 4:13 Thy plants are an orchard of pomegranates, with pleasant fruits; camphire, with spikenard, 4:14 Spikenard and saffron; calamus and cinnamon, with all trees of frankincense; myrrh and aloes, with all Da chief spices: 4:15 A fountain of gardens, a well of living waters, and streams from Lebanon. 4:16 Awake, O north wind; and come, thou south; blow upon my garden, that Da spices thereof may flow out. Let my beloved come into his garden, and eat his pleasant fruits. 5:1 I am come into my garden, my sister, my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat, O friends; drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved. 5:2 I sleep, but my heart waketh: it is Da voice of my beloved that knocketh, saying, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled: for my head is filled with dew, and my locks with Da drops of Da night. 5:3 I have put off my coat; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them? 5:4 My beloved put in his hand by Da hole of Da door, and my bowels were moved for him. 5:5 I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped with myrrh, and my fingers with sweet smelling myrrh, upon Da handles of Da lock. 5:6 I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself, and was gone: my soul failed when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer. 5:7 The watchmen that went about Da city found me, they smote me, they wounded me; Da keepers of Da walls took away my veil from me. 5:8 I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, if ye find my beloved, that ye tell him, that I am sick of love. 5:9 What is thy beloved more than another beloved, O thou fairest among women? what is thy beloved more than another beloved, that thou dost so charge us? 5:10 My beloved is white and ruddy, Da chiefest among ten thousand. 5:11 His head is as Da most fine gold, his locks are bushy, and black as a raven. 5:12 His eyes are as Da eyes of doves by Da rivers of waters, washed with milk, and fitly set. 5:13 His cheeks are as a bed of spices, as sweet flowers: his lips like lilies, dropping sweet smelling myrrh. 5:14 His hands are as gold rings set with Da beryl: his belly is as bright ivory overlaid with sapphires. 5:15 His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: his countenance is as Lebanon, excellent as Da cedars. 5:16 His mouth is most sweet: yea, he is altogether lovely. This is my beloved, and this is my friend, O daughters of Jerusalem. 6:1 Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee. 6:2 My beloved is gone down into his garden, to Da beds of spices, to feed in Da gardens, and to gather lilies. 6:3 I am my beloved’s, and my beloved is mine: he feedeth among Da lilies. 6:4 Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as an army with banners. 6:5 Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: thy hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead. 6:6 Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from Da washing, whereof every one beareth twins, and there is not one barren among them. 6:7 As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples within thy locks. 6:8 There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number. 6:9 My dove, my undefiled is but one; she is Da only one of her mother, she is Da choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her; yea, Da queens and Da concubines, and they praised her. 6:10 Who is she that looketh forth as Da morning, fair as Da moon, clear as Da sun, and terrible as an army with banners? 6:11 I went down into Da garden of nuts to see Da fruits of Da valley, and to see whether Da vine flourished and Da pomegranates budded. 6:12 Or ever I was aware, my soul made me like Da chariots of Amminadib. 6:13 Return, return, O Shulamite; return, return, that we may look upon thee. What will ye see in Da Shulamite? As it were Da company of two armies. 7:1 How beautiful are thy feet with shoes, O prince’s daughter! Da joints of thy thighs are like jewels, Da work of Da hands of a cunning workman. 7:2 Thy navel is like a round goblet, which wanteth not liquor: thy belly is like an heap of wheat set about with lilies. 7:3 Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins. 7:4 Thy neck is as a tower of ivory; thine eyes like Da fishpools in Heshbon, by Da gate of Bathrabbim: thy nose is as Da tower of Lebanon which looketh toward Damascus. 7:5 Thine head upon thee is like Carmel, and Da hair of thine head like purple; Da king is held in Da galleries. 7:6 How fair and how pleasant art thou, O love, for delights! 7:7 This thy stature is like to a palm tree, and thy breasts to clusters of grapes. 7:8 I said, I will go up to Da palm tree, I will take hold of Da boughs thereof: now also thy breasts shall be as clusters of Da vine, and Da smell of thy nose like apples; 7:9 And Da roof of thy mouth like Da best wine for my beloved, that goeth down sweetly, causing Da lips of those that are asleep to speak. 7:10 I am my beloved’s, and his desire is toward me. 7:11 Come, my beloved, let us go forth into Da field; let us lodge in Da villages. 7:12 Let us get up early to Da vineyards; let us see if Da vine flourish, whether Da tender grape appear, and Da pomegranates bud forth: there will I give thee my loves. 7:13 The mandrakes give a smell, and at our gates are all manner of pleasant fruits, new and old, which I have laid up for thee, O my beloved. 8:1 O that thou wert as my brother, that sucked Da breasts of my mother! when I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; yea, I should not be despised. 8:2 I would lead thee, and bring thee into my mother’s house, who would instruct me: I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine of Da juice of my pomegranate. 8:3 His left hand should be under my head, and his right hand should embrace me. 8:4 I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, until he please. 8:5 Who is this that cometh up from Da wilderness, leaning upon her beloved? I raised thee up under Da apple tree: there thy mother brought thee forth: there she brought thee forth that bare thee. 8:6 Set me as a seal upon thine heart, as a seal upon thine arm: for love is strong as death; jealousy is cruel as Da grave: Da coals thereof are coals of fire, which hath a most vehement flame. 8:7 Many waters cannot quench love, neither can Da floods drown it: if a man would give all Da substance of his house for love, it would utterly be contemned. 8:8 We have a little sister, and she hath no breasts: what shall we do for our sister in Da day when she shall be spoken for? 8:9 If she be a wall, we will build upon her a palace of silver: and if she be a door, we will inclose her with boards of cedar. 8:10 I am a wall, and my breasts like towers: then was I in his eyes as one that found favour. 8:11 Solomon had a vineyard at Baalhamon; he let out Da vineyard unto keepers; every one for Da fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of silver. 8:12 My vineyard, which is mine, is before me: thou, O Solomon, must have a thousand, and those that keep Da fruit thereof two hundred. 8:13 Thou that dwellest in Da gardens, Da companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to hear it. 8:14 Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a roe or to a young hart upon Da mountains of spices. The Book of Da Prophet Isaiah 1:1 The vision of Isaiah Da son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in Da days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah. 1:2 Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth: for Da LORD hath spoken, I have nourished and brought up children, and they have rebelled against me. 1:3 The ox knoweth his owner, and Da ass his master’s crib: but Israel doth not know, my people doth not consider. 1:4 Ah sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity, a seed of evildoers, children that are corrupters: they have forsaken Da LORD, they have provoked Da Holy One of Israel unto anger, they are gone away backward. 1:5 Why should ye be stricken any more? ye will revolt more and more: Da whole head is sick, and Da whole heart faint. 1:6 From Da sole of Da foot even unto Da head there is no soundness in it; but wounds, and bruises, and putrifying sores: they have not been closed, neither bound up, neither mollified with ointment. 1:7 Your country is desolate, your cities are burned with fire: your land, strangers devour it in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers. 1:8 And Da daughter of Zion is left as a cottage in a vineyard, as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, as a besieged city. 1:9 Except Da LORD of hosts had left unto us a very small remnant, we should have been as Sodom, and we should have been like unto Gomorrah. 1:10 Hear Da word of Da LORD, ye rulers of Sodom; give ear unto Da law of our God, ye people of Gomorrah. 1:11 To what purpose is Da multitude of your sacrifices unto me? saith Da LORD: I am full of Da burnt offerings of rams, and Da fat of fed beasts; and I delight not in Da blood of bullocks, or of lambs, or of he goats. 1:12 When ye come to appear before me, who hath required this at your hand, to tread my courts? 1:13 Bring no more vain oblations; incense is an abomination unto me; Da new moons and sabbaths, Da calling of assemblies, I cannot away with; it is iniquity, even Da solemn meeting. 1:14 Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hateth: they are a trouble unto me; I am weary to bear them. 1:15 And when ye spread forth your hands, I will hide mine eyes from you: yea, when ye make many prayers, I will not hear: your hands are full of blood. 1:16 Wash you, make you clean; put away Da evil of your doings from before mine eyes; cease to do evil; 1:17 Learn to do well; seek judgment, relieve Da oppressed, judge Da fatherless, plead for Da widow. 1:18 Come now, and let us reason together, saith Da LORD: though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool. 1:19 If ye be willing and obedient, ye shall eat Da good of Da land: 1:20 But if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured with Da sword: for Da mouth of Da LORD hath spoken it. 1:21 How is Da faithful city become an harlot! it was full of judgment; righteousness lodged in it; but now murderers. 1:22 Thy silver is become dross, thy wine mixed with water: 1:23 Thy princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves: every one loveth gifts, and followeth after rewards: they judge not Da fatherless, neither doth Da cause of Da widow come unto them. 1:24 Therefore saith Da LORD, Da LORD of hosts, Da mighty One of Israel, Ah, I will ease me of mine adversaries, and avenge me of mine enemies: 1:25 And I will turn my hand upon thee, and purely purge away thy dross, and take away all thy tin: 1:26 And I will restore thy judges as at Da first, and thy counsellors as at Da beginning: afterward thou shalt be called, The city of righteousness, Da faithful city. 1:27 Zion shall be redeemed with judgment, and her converts with righteousness. 1:28 And Da destruction of Da transgressors and of Da sinners shall be together, and they that forsake Da LORD shall be consumed. 1:29 For they shall be ashamed of Da oaks which ye have desired, and ye shall be confounded for Da gardens that ye have chosen. 1:30 For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth, and as a garden that hath no water. 1:31 And Da strong shall be as tow, and Da maker of it as a spark, and they shall both burn together, and none shall quench them. 2:1 The word that Isaiah Da son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem. 2:2 And it shall come to pass in Da last days, that Da mountain of Da LORD’s house shall be established in Da top of Da mountains, and shall be exalted above Da hills; and she being desolate shall sit upon Da ground. 4:1 And in that day seven women shall take hold of one man, saying, We will eat our own bread, and wear our own apparel: only let us be called by thy name, to take away our reproach. 4:2 In that day shall Da branch of Da LORD be beautiful and glorious, and Da fruit of Da earth shall be excellent and comely for them that are escaped of Israel. 4:3 And it shall come to pass, that he that is left in Zion, and he that remaineth in Jerusalem, shall be called holy, even every one that is written among Da living in Jerusalem: 4:4 When Da Lord shall have washed away Da filth of Da daughters of Zion, and shall have purged Da blood of Jerusalem from Da midst thereof by Da spirit of judgment, and by Da spirit of burning. 4:5 And Da LORD will create upon every dwelling place of mount Zion, and upon her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day, and Da shining of a flaming fire by night: for upon all Da glory shall be a defence. 4:6 And there shall be a tabernacle for a shadow in Da day time from Da heat, and for a place of refuge, and for a covert from storm and from rain. 5:1 Now will I sing to my wellbeloved a song of my beloved touching his vineyard. My wellbeloved hath a vineyard in a very fruitful hill: 5:2 And he fenced it, and gathered out Da stones thereof, and planted it with Da choicest vine, and built a tower in Da midst of it, and also made a winepress therein: and he looked that it should bring forth grapes, and it brought forth wild grapes. 5:3 And now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem, and men of Judah, judge, I pray you, betwixt me and my vineyard. 5:4 What could have been done more to my vineyard, that I have not done in it? wherefore, when I looked that it should bring forth grapes, brought it forth wild grapes? 5:5 And now go to; I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard: I will take away Da hedge thereof, and it shall be eaten up; and break down Da wall thereof, and it shall be trodden down: 5:6 And I will lay it waste: it shall not be pruned, nor digged; but there shall come up briers and thorns: I will also command Da clouds that they rain no rain upon it. 5:7 For Da vineyard of Da LORD of hosts is Da house of Israel, and Da men of Judah his pleasant plant: and he looked for judgment, but behold oppression; for righteousness, but behold a cry. 5:8 Woe unto them that join house to house, that lay field to field, till there be no place, that they may be placed alone in Da midst of Da earth! 5:9 In mine ears said Da LORD of hosts, Of a truth many houses shall be desolate, even great and fair, without inhabitant. 5:10 Yea, ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, and Da seed of an homer shall yield an ephah. 5:11 Woe unto them that rise up early in Da morning, that they may follow strong drink; that continue until night, till wine inflame them! 5:12 And Da harp, and Da viol, Da tabret, and pipe, and wine, are in their feasts: but they regard not Da work of Da LORD, neither consider Da operation of his hands. 5:13 Therefore my people are gone into captivity, because they have no knowledge: and their honourable men are famished, and their multitude dried up with thirst. 5:14 Therefore hell hath enlarged herself, and opened her mouth without measure: and their glory, and their multitude, and their pomp, and he that rejoiceth, shall descend into it. 5:15 And Da mean man shall be brought down, and Da mighty man shall be humbled, and Da eyes of Da lofty shall be humbled: 5:16 But Da LORD of hosts shall be exalted in judgment, and God that is holy shall be sanctified in righteousness. 5:17 Then shall Da lambs feed after their manner, and Da waste places of Da fat ones shall strangers eat. 5:18 Woe unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as it were with a cart rope: 5:19 That say, Let him make speed, and hasten his work, that we may see it: and let Da counsel of Da Holy One of Israel draw nigh and come, that we may know it! 5:20 Woe unto them that call evil good, and good evil; that put darkness for light, and light for darkness; that put bitter for sweet, and sweet for bitter! 5:21 Woe unto them that are wise in their own eyes, and prudent in their own sight! 5:22 Woe unto them that are mighty to drink wine, and men of strength to mingle strong drink: 5:23 Which justify Da wicked for reward, and take away Da righteousness of Da righteous from him! 5:24 Therefore as Da fire devoureth Da stubble, and Da flame consumeth Da chaff, so their root shall be as rottenness, and their blossom shall go up as dust: because they have cast away Da law of Da LORD of hosts, and despised Da word of Da Holy One of Israel. 5:25 Therefore is Da anger of Da LORD kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them: and Da hills did tremble, and their carcases were torn in Da midst of Da streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still. 5:26 And he will lift up an ensign to Da nations from far, and will hiss unto them from Da end of Da earth: and, behold, they shall come with speed swiftly: 5:27 None shall be weary nor stumble among them; none shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall Da girdle of their loins be loosed, nor Da latchet of their shoes be broken: 5:28 Whose arrows are sharp, and all their bows bent, their horses’ hoofs shall be counted like flint, and their wheels like a whirlwind: 5:29 Their roaring shall be like a lion, they shall roar like young lions: yea, they shall roar, and lay hold of Da prey, and shall carry it away safe, and none shall deliver it. 5:30 And in that day they shall roar against them like Da roaring of Da sea: and if one look unto Da land, behold darkness and sorrow, and Da light is darkened in Da heavens thereof. 6:1 In Da year that king Uzziah died I saw also Da LORD sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up, and his train filled Da temple. 6:2 Above it stood Da seraphims: each one had six wings; with twain he covered his face, and with twain he covered his feet, and with twain he did fly. 6:3 And one cried unto another, and said, Holy, holy, holy, is Da LORD of hosts: Da whole earth is full of his glory. 6:4 And Da posts of Da door moved at Da voice of him that cried, and Da house was filled with smoke. 6:5 Then said I, Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in Da midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen Da King, Da LORD of hosts. 6:6 Then flew one of Da seraphims unto me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with Da tongs from off Da altar: 6:7 And he laid it upon my mouth, and said, Lo, this hath touched thy lips; and thine iniquity is taken away, and thy sin purged. 6:8 Also I heard Da voice of Da Lord, saying, Whom shall I send, and who will go for us? 7:22 And it shall come to pass, for Da abundance of milk that they shall give he shall eat butter: for butter and honey shall every one eat that is left in Da land. 7:23 And it shall come to pass in that day, that every place shall be, where there were a thousand vines at a thousand silverlings, it shall even be for briers and thorns. 7:24 With arrows and with bows shall men come thither; because all Da land shall become briers and thorns. 7:25 And on all hills that shall be digged with Da mattock, there shall not come thither Da fear of briers and thorns: but it shall be for Da sending forth of oxen, and for Da treading of lesser cattle. 8:1 Moreover Da LORD said unto me, Take thee a great roll, and write in it with a man’s pen concerning Mahershalalhashbaz. 8:2 And I took unto me faithful witnesses to record, Uriah Da priest, and Zechariah Da son of Jeberechiah. 8:3 And I went unto Da prophetess; For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still. 10:1 Woe unto them that decree unrighteous decrees, and that write grievousness which they have prescribed; 10:2 To turn aside Da needy from judgment, and to take away Da right from Da poor of my people, that widows may be their prey, and that they may rob Da fatherless! 10:3 And what will ye do in Da day of visitation, and in Da desolation which shall come from far? to whom will ye flee for help? and where will ye leave your glory? 10:4 Without me they shall bow down under Da prisoners, and they shall fall under Da slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still. 10:5 O Assyrian, Da rod of mine anger, and Da staff in their hand is mine indignation. 10:6 I will send him against an hypocritical nation, and against Da people of my wrath will I give him a charge, to take Da spoil, and to take Da prey, and to tread them down like Da mire of Da streets. 10:7 Howbeit he meaneth not so, neither doth his heart think so; but it is in his heart to destroy and cut off nations not a few. 10:8 For he saith, Are not my princes altogether kings? 10:9 Is not Calno as Carchemish? is not Hamath as Arpad? is not Samaria as Damascus? 10:10 As my hand hath found Da kingdoms of Da idols, and whose graven images did excel them of Jerusalem and of Samaria; and there was none that moved Da wing, or opened Da mouth, or peeped. 10:15 Shall Da axe boast itself against him that heweth therewith? or shall Da saw magnify itself against him that shaketh it? as if Da rod should shake itself against them that lift it up, or as if Da staff should lift up itself, as if it were no wood. 10:16 Therefore shall Da Lord, Da Lord of hosts, send among his fat ones leanness; and under his glory he shall kindle a burning like Da burning of a fire. 10:17 And Da light of Israel shall be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame: and it shall burn and devour his thorns and his briers in one day; 10:18 And shall consume Da glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body: and they shall be as when a standard-bearer fainteth. 10:19 And Da rest of Da trees of his forest shall be few, that a child may write them. 10:20 And it shall come to pass in that day, that Da remnant of Israel, and such as are escaped of Da house of Jacob, shall no more again stay upon him that smote them; at Michmash he hath laid up his carriages: 10:29 They are gone over Da passage: they have taken up their lodging at Geba; Ramah is afraid; Gibeah of Saul is fled. 10:30 Lift up thy voice, O daughter of Gallim: cause it to be heard unto Laish, O poor Anathoth. 10:31 Madmenah is removed; Da inhabitants of Gebim gather themselves to flee. 10:32 As yet shall he remain at Nob that day: he shall shake his hand against Da mount of Da daughter of Zion, Da hill of Jerusalem. 10:33 Behold, Da Lord, Da LORD of hosts, shall lop Da bough with terror: and Da high ones of stature shall be hewn down, and Da haughty shall be humbled. 10:34 And he shall cut down Da thickets of Da forest with iron, and Lebanon shall fall by a mighty one. 11:1 And there shall come forth a rod out of Da stem of Jesse, and a Branch shall grow out of his roots: 11:2 And Da spirit of Da LORD shall rest upon him, Da spirit of wisdom and understanding, Da spirit of counsel and might, Da spirit of knowledge and of Da fear of Da LORD; for her merchandise shall be for them that dwell before Da LORD, to eat sufficiently, and for durable clothing. 24:1 Behold, Da LORD maketh Da earth empty, and maketh it waste, and turneth it upside down, and scattereth abroad Da inhabitants thereof. 24:2 And it shall be, as with Da people, so with Da priest; we have waited for thee: be thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in Da time of trouble. 33:3 At Da noise of Da tumult Da people fled; at Da lifting up of thyself Da nations were scattered. 33:4 And your spoil shall be gathered like Da gathering of Da caterpiller: as Da running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them. 33:5 The LORD is exalted; and Bashan and Carmel shake off their fruits. 33:10 Now will I rise, saith Da LORD; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself. 33:11 Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath, as fire, shall devour you. 33:12 And Da people shall be as Da burnings of lime: as thorns cut up shall they be burned in Da fire. 33:13 Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; and, ye that are near, acknowledge my might. 33:14 The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness hath surprised Da hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell with Da devouring fire? who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings? 33:15 He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth Da gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil; 33:16 He shall dwell on high: his place of defence shall be Da munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him; his waters shall be sure. 33:17 Thine eyes shall see Da king in his beauty: they shall behold Da land that is very far off. 33:18 Thine heart shall meditate terror. Where is Da scribe? where is Da receiver? where is he that counted Da towers? 33:19 Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of a deeper speech than thou canst perceive; of a stammering tongue, that thou canst not understand. 33:20 Look upon Zion, Da city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle that shall not be taken down; not one of Da stakes thereof shall ever be removed, neither shall any of Da cords thereof be broken. 33:21 But there Da glorious LORD will be unto us a place of broad rivers and streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby. 33:22 For Da LORD is our judge, Da LORD is our lawgiver, Da LORD is our king; he will save us. 33:23 Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread Da sail: then is Da prey of a great spoil divided; Da lame take Da prey. 33:24 And Da inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: Da people that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity. 34:1 Come near, ye nations, to hear; and hearken, ye people: let Da earth hear, and all that is therein; Da world, and all things that come forth of it. 34:2 For Da indignation of Da LORD is upon all nations, and his fury upon all their armies: he hath utterly destroyed them, he hath delivered them to Da slaughter. 34:3 Their slain also shall be cast out, and their stink shall come up out of their carcases, and Da mountains shall be melted with their blood. 34:4 And all Da host of heaven shall be dissolved, and Da heavens shall be rolled together as a scroll: and all their host shall fall down, as Da leaf falleth off from Da vine, and as a falling fig from Da fig tree. 34:5 For my sword shall be bathed in heaven: behold, it shall come down upon Idumea, and upon Da people of my curse, to judgment. 34:6 The sword of Da LORD is filled with blood, it is made fat with fatness, and with Da blood of lambs and goats, with Da fat of Da kidneys of rams: for Da LORD hath a sacrifice in Bozrah, and a great slaughter in Da land of Idumea. 34:7 And Da unicorns shall come down with them, and Da bullocks with Da bulls; and their land shall be soaked with blood, and their dust made fat with fatness. 34:8 For it is Da day of Da LORD’s vengeance, and Da year of recompences for Da controversy of Zion. 34:9 And Da streams thereof shall be turned into pitch, and Da dust thereof into brimstone, and Da land thereof shall become burning pitch. 34:10 It shall not be quenched night nor day; Da smoke thereof shall go up for ever: from generation to generation it shall lie waste; none shall pass through it for ever and ever. 34:11 But Da cormorant and Da bittern shall possess it; Da owl also and Da raven shall dwell in it: and he shall stretch out upon it Da line of confusion, and Da stones of emptiness. 34:12 They shall call Da nobles thereof to Da kingdom, but none shall be there, and all her princes shall be nothing. 34:13 And thorns shall come up in her palaces, nettles and brambles in Da fortresses thereof: and it shall be an habitation of dragons, and a court for owls. 34:14 The wild beasts of Da desert shall also meet with Da wild beasts of Da island, and Da satyr shall cry to his fellow; Da screech owl also shall rest there, and find for herself a place of rest. 34:15 There shall Da great owl make her nest, and lay, and hatch, and gather under her shadow: there shall Da vultures also be gathered, every one with her mate. 34:16 Seek ye out of Da book of Da LORD, and read: no one of these shall fail, none shall want her mate: for my mouth it hath commanded, and his spirit it hath gathered them. 34:17 And he hath cast Da lot for them, and his hand hath divided it unto them by line: they shall possess it for ever, from generation to generation shall they dwell therein. 35:1 The wilderness and Da solitary place shall be glad for them; and Da desert shall rejoice, and blossom as Da rose. 35:2 It shall blossom abundantly, and rejoice even with joy and singing: Da glory of Lebanon shall be given unto it, Da excellency of Carmel and Sharon, they shall see Da glory of Da LORD, and Da excellency of our God. 35:3 Strengthen ye Da weak hands, and confirm Da feeble knees. 35:4 Say to them that are of a fearful heart, Be strong, fear not: behold, your God will come with vengeance, even God with a recompence; he will come and save you. 35:5 Then Da eyes of Da blind shall be opened, and Da ears of Da deaf shall be unstopped. 35:6 Then shall Da lame man leap as an hart, and Da tongue of Da dumb sing: for in Da wilderness shall waters break out, and streams in Da desert. 35:7 And Da parched ground shall become a pool, and Da thirsty land springs of water: in Da habitation of dragons, where each lay, shall be grass with reeds and rushes. 35:8 And an highway shall be there, and a way, and it shall be called The way of holiness; Da unclean shall not pass over it; but it shall be for those: Da wayfaring men, though fools, shall not err therein. 35:9 No lion shall be there, nor any ravenous beast shall go up thereon, it shall not be found there; but Da redeemed shall walk there: 35:10 And Da ransomed of Da LORD shall return, and come to Zion with songs and everlasting joy upon their heads: they shall obtain joy and gladness, and sorrow and sighing shall flee away. 36:1 Now it came to pass in Da fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, that Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all Da defenced cities of Judah, and took them. 36:2 And Da king of Assyria sent Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem unto king Hezekiah with a great army. And he stood by Da conduit of Da upper pool in Da highway of Da fuller’s field. 36:3 Then came forth unto him Eliakim, Hilkiah’s son, which was over Da house, and Shebna Da scribe, and Joah, Asaph’s son, Da recorder. 36:4 And Rabshakeh said unto them, Say ye now to Hezekiah, Thus saith Da great king, Da king of Assyria, What confidence is this wherein thou trustest? 36:5 I say, sayest thou, (but they are but vain words) I have counsel and strength for war: now on whom dost thou trust, that thou rebellest against me? 36:6 Lo, thou trustest in Da staff of this broken reed, on Egypt; whereon if a man lean, it will go into his hand, and pierce it: so is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all that trust in him. 36:7 But if thou say to me, We trust in Da LORD our God: is it not he, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath taken away, and said to Judah and to Jerusalem, Ye shall worship before this altar? 36:8 Now therefore give pledges, I pray thee, to my master Da king of Assyria, and I will give thee two thousand horses, if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them. 36:9 How then wilt thou turn away Da face of one captain of Da least of my master’s servants, and put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen? 36:10 And am I now come up without Da LORD against this land to destroy it? Da LORD said unto me, Go up against this land, and destroy it. 36:11 Then said Eliakim and Shebna and Joah unto Rabshakeh, Speak, I pray thee, unto thy servants in Da Syrian language; for we understand it: and speak not to us in Da Jews’ language, in Da ears of Da people that are on Da wall. 36:12 But Rabshakeh said, Hath my master sent me to thy master and to thee to speak these words? hath he not sent me to Da men that sit upon Da wall, that they may eat their own dung, and drink their own piss with you? 36:13 Then Rabshakeh stood, and cried with a loud voice in Da Jews’ language, and said, Hear ye Da words of Da great king, Da king of Assyria. 36:14 Thus saith Da king, Let not Hezekiah deceive you: for he shall not be able to deliver you. 36:15 Neither let Hezekiah make you trust in Da LORD, saying, The LORD will surely deliver us: this city shall not be delivered into Da hand of Da king of Assyria. 36:16 Hearken not to Hezekiah: for thus saith Da king of Assyria, Make an agreement with me by a present, and come out to me: and eat ye every one of his vine, and every one of his fig tree, and drink ye every one Da waters of his own cistern; 36:17 Until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a land of bread and vineyards. 36:18 Beware lest Hezekiah persuade you, saying, Da LORD will deliver us. Hath any of Da gods of Da nations delivered his land out of Da hand of Da king of Assyria? 36:19 Where are Da gods of Hamath and Arphad? where are Da gods of Sepharvaim? and have they delivered Samaria out of my hand? 36:20 Who are they among all Da gods of these lands, that have delivered their land out of my hand, that Da LORD should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand? 36:21 But they held their peace, and answered him not a word: for Da king’s commandment was, saying, Answer him not. 36:22 Then came Eliakim, Da son of Hilkiah, that was over Da household, and Shebna Da scribe, and Joah, Da son of Asaph, Da recorder, to Hezekiah with their clothes rent, and told him Da words of Rabshakeh. 37:1 And it came to pass, when king Hezekiah heard it, that he rent his clothes, and covered himself with sackcloth, and went into Da house of Da LORD. 37:2 And he sent Eliakim, who was over Da household, and Shebna Da scribe, and Da elders of Da priests covered with sackcloth, unto Isaiah Da prophet Da son of Amoz. 37:3 And they said unto him, Thus saith Hezekiah, This day is a day of trouble, and of rebuke, and of blasphemy: for Da children are come to Da birth, and there is not strength to bring forth. 37:4 It may be Da LORD thy God will hear Da words of Rabshakeh, whom Da king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach Da living God, and will reprove Da words which Da LORD thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up thy prayer for Da remnant that is left. 37:5 So Da servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah. 37:6 And Isaiah said unto them, Thus shall ye say unto your master, Thus saith Da LORD, Be not afraid of Da words that thou hast heard, wherewith Da servants of Da king of Assyria have blasphemed me. 37:7 Behold, I will send a blast upon him, and he shall hear a rumour, and return to his own land; and I will cause him to fall by Da sword in his own land. 37:8 So Rabshakeh returned, and found Da king of Assyria warring against Libnah: for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish. 37:9 And he heard say concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, He is come forth to make war with thee. And when he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying, 37:10 Thus shall ye speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, Let not thy God, in whom thou trustest, deceive thee, saying, Jerusalem shall not be given into Da hand of Da king of Assyria. 37:11 Behold, thou hast heard what Da kings of Assyria have done to all lands by destroying them utterly; and shalt thou be delivered? 37:12 Have Da gods of Da nations delivered them which my fathers have destroyed, as Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and Da children of Eden which were in Telassar? 37:13 Where is Da king of Hamath, and Da king of Arphad, and Da king of Da city of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah? 37:14 And Hezekiah received Da letter from Da hand of Da messengers, and read it: and Hezekiah went up unto Da house of Da LORD, and spread it before Da LORD. 37:15 And Hezekiah prayed unto Da LORD, saying, 37:16 O LORD of hosts, God of Israel, that dwellest between Da cherubims, thou art Da God, even thou alone, of all Da kingdoms of Da earth: thou hast made heaven and earth. 37:17 Incline thine ear, O LORD, and hear; open thine eyes, O LORD, and see: and hear all Da words of Sennacherib, which hath sent to reproach Da living God. 37:18 Of a truth, LORD, Da kings of Assyria have laid waste all Da nations, and their countries, 37:19 And have cast their gods into Da fire: for they were no gods, but Da work of men’s hands, wood and stone: therefore they have destroyed them. 37:20 Now therefore, O LORD our God, save us from his hand, that all Da kingdoms of Da earth may know that thou art Da LORD, even thou only. 37:21 Then Isaiah Da son of Amoz sent unto Hezekiah, saying, Thus saith Da LORD God of Israel, Whereas thou hast prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria: 37:22 This is Da word which Da LORD hath spoken concerning him; The virgin, Da daughter of Zion, hath despised thee, and laughed thee to scorn; Da daughter of Jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee. 37:23 Whom hast thou reproached and blasphemed? and against whom hast thou exalted thy voice, and lifted up thine eyes on high? even against Da Holy One of Israel. 37:24 By thy servants hast thou reproached Da Lord, and hast said, By Da multitude of my chariots am I come up to Da height of Da mountains, to Da sides of Lebanon; and I will cut down Da tall cedars thereof, and Da choice fir trees thereof: and I will enter into Da height of his border, and Da forest of his Carmel. 37:25 I have digged, and drunk water; and with Da sole of my feet have I dried up all Da rivers of Da besieged places. 37:26 Hast thou not heard long ago, how I have done it; and of ancient times, that I have formed it? now have I brought it to pass, that thou shouldest be to lay waste defenced cities into ruinous heaps. 37:27 Therefore their inhabitants were of small power, they were dismayed and confounded: they were as Da grass of Da field, and as Da green herb, as Da grass on Da housetops, and as corn blasted before it be grown up. 37:28 But I know thy abode, and thy going out, and thy coming in, and thy rage against me. 37:29 Because thy rage against me, and thy tumult, is come up into mine ears, therefore will I put my hook in thy nose, and my bridle in thy lips, and I will turn thee back by Da way by which thou camest. 37:30 And this shall be a sign unto thee, Ye shall eat this year such as groweth of itself; and Da second year that which springeth of Da same: and in Da third year sow ye, and reap, and plant vineyards, and eat Da fruit thereof. 37:31 And Da remnant that is escaped of Da house of Judah shall again take root downward, and bear fruit upward: 37:32 For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, and they that escape out of mount Zion: Da zeal of Da LORD of hosts shall do this. 37:33 Therefore thus saith Da LORD concerning Da king of Assyria, He shall not come into this city, nor shoot an arrow there, nor come before it with shields, nor cast a bank against it. 37:34 By Da way that he came, by Da same shall he return, and shall not come into this city, saith Da LORD. 37:35 For I will defend this city to save it for mine own sake, and for my servant David’s sake. 37:36 Then Da angel of Da LORD went forth, and smote in Da camp of Da Assyrians a hundred and fourscore and five thousand: and when they arose early in Da morning, behold, they were all dead corpses. 37:37 So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, and went and returned, and dwelt at Nineveh. 37:38 And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in Da house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with Da sword; and they escaped into Da land of Armenia: and Esarhaddon his son reigned in his stead. 38:1 In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And Isaiah Da prophet Da son of Amoz came unto him, and said unto him, Thus saith Da LORD, Set thine house in order: for thou shalt die, and not live. 38:2 Then Hezekiah turned his face toward Da wall, and prayed unto Da LORD, 38:3 And said, Remember now, O LORD, I beseech thee, how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore. 38:4 Then came Da word of Da LORD to Isaiah, saying, 38:5 Go, and say to Hezekiah, Thus saith Da LORD, Da God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will add unto thy days fifteen years. 38:6 And I will deliver thee and this city out of Da hand of Da king of Assyria: and I will defend this city. 38:7 And this shall be a sign unto thee from Da LORD, that Da LORD will do this thing that he hath spoken; 38:8 Behold, I will bring again Da shadow of Da degrees, which is gone down in Da sun dial of Ahaz, ten degrees backward. So Da sun returned ten degrees, by which degrees it was gone down. 38:9 The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick, and was recovered of his sickness: 38:10 I said in Da cutting off of my days, I shall go to Da gates of Da grave: I am deprived of Da residue of my years. 38:11 I said, I shall not see Da LORD, even Da LORD, in Da land of Da living: I shall behold man no more with Da inhabitants of Da world. 38:12 Mine age is departed, and is removed from me as a shepherd’s tent: I have cut off like a weaver my life: he will cut me off with pining sickness: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me. 38:13 I reckoned till morning, that, as a lion, so will he break all my bones: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me. 38:14 Like a crane or a swallow, so did I chatter: I did mourn as a dove: mine eyes fail with looking upward: O LORD, I am oppressed; undertake for me. 38:15 What shall I say? he hath both spoken unto me, and himself hath done it: I shall go softly all my years in Da bitterness of my soul. 38:16 O LORD, by these things men live, and in all these things is Da life of my spirit: so wilt thou recover me, and make me to live. 38:17 Behold, for peace I had great bitterness: but thou hast in love to my soul delivered it from Da pit of corruption: for thou hast cast all my sins behind thy back. 38:18 For Da grave cannot praise thee, death can not celebrate thee: they that go down into Da pit cannot hope for thy truth. 38:19 The living, Da living, he shall praise thee, as I do this day: Da father to Da children shall make known thy truth. 38:20 The LORD was ready to save me: therefore we will sing my songs to Da stringed instruments all Da days of our life in Da house of Da LORD. 38:21 For Isaiah had said, Let them take a lump of figs, and lay it for a plaister upon Da boil, and he shall recover. 38:22 Hezekiah also had said, What is Da sign that I shall go up to Da house of Da LORD? 39:1 At that time Merodachbaladan, Da son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah: for he had heard that he had been sick, and was recovered. 39:2 And Hezekiah was glad of them, and shewed them Da house of his precious things, Da silver, and Da gold, and Da spices, and Da precious ointment, and all Da house of his armour, and all that was found in his treasures: there was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah shewed them not. 39:3 Then came Isaiah Da prophet unto king Hezekiah, and said unto him, What said these men? and from whence came they unto thee? And Hezekiah said, They are come from a far country unto me, even from Babylon. 39:4 Then said he, What have they seen in thine house? And Hezekiah answered, All that is in mine house have they seen: there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shewed them. 39:5 Then said Isaiah to Hezekiah, Hear Da word of Da LORD of hosts: 39:6 Behold, Da days come, that all that is in thine house, and that which thy fathers have laid up in store until this day, shall be carried to Babylon: nothing shall be left, saith Da LORD. 39:7 And of thy sons that shall issue from thee, which thou shalt beget, shall they take away; and they shall be eunuchs in Da palace of Da king of Babylon. 39:8 Then said Hezekiah to Isaiah, Good is Da word of Da LORD which thou hast spoken. He said moreover, For there shall be peace and truth in my days. 40:1 Comfort ye, comfort ye my people, saith your God. 40:2 Speak ye comfortably to Jerusalem, and cry unto her, that her warfare is accomplished, that her iniquity is pardoned: for she hath received of Da LORD’s hand double for all her sins. 40:3 The voice of him that crieth in Da wilderness, Prepare ye Da way of Da LORD, make straight in Da desert a highway for our God. 40:4 Every valley shall be exalted, and every mountain and hill shall be made low: and Da crooked shall be made straight, and Da rough places plain: 40:5 And Da glory of Da LORD shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see it together: for Da mouth of Da LORD hath spoken it. 40:6 The voice said, Cry. And he said, What shall I cry? All flesh is grass, and all Da goodliness thereof is as Da flower of Da field: 40:7 The grass withereth, Da flower fadeth: because Da spirit of Da LORD bloweth upon it: surely Da people is grass. 40:8 The grass withereth, Da flower fadeth: but Da word of our God shall stand for ever. 40:9 O Zion, that bringest good tidings, get thee up into Da high mountain; O Jerusalem, that bringest good tidings, lift up thy voice with strength; lift it up, be not afraid; say unto Da cities of Judah, Behold your God! 40:10 Behold, Da Lord GOD will come with strong hand, and his arm shall rule for him: behold, his reward is with him, and his work before him. 40:11 He shall feed his flock like a shepherd: he shall gather Da lambs with his arm, and carry them in his bosom, and shall gently lead those that are with young. 40:12 Who hath measured Da waters in Da hollow of his hand, and meted out heaven with Da span, and comprehended Da dust of Da earth in a measure, and weighed Da mountains in scales, and Da hills in a balance? 40:13 Who hath directed Da Spirit of Da LORD, or being his counsellor hath taught him? 40:14 With whom took he counsel, and who instructed him, and taught him in Da path of judgment, and taught him knowledge, and shewed to him Da way of understanding? 40:15 Behold, Da nations are as a drop of a bucket, and are counted as Da small dust of Da balance: behold, he taketh up Da isles as a very little thing. 40:16 And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, nor Da beasts thereof sufficient for a burnt offering. 40:17 All nations before him are as nothing; and they are counted to him less than nothing, and vanity. 40:18 To whom then will ye liken God? or what likeness will ye compare unto him? 40:19 The workman melteth a graven image, and Da goldsmith spreadeth it over with gold, and casteth silver chains. 40:20 He that is so impoverished that he hath no oblation chooseth a tree that will not rot; he seeketh unto him a cunning workman to prepare a graven image, that shall not be moved. 40:21 Have ye not known? have ye not heard? hath it not been told you from Da beginning? have ye not understood from Da foundations of Da earth? 40:22 It is he that sitteth upon Da circle of Da earth, and Da inhabitants thereof are as grasshoppers; that stretcheth out Da heavens as a curtain, and spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in: 40:23 That bringeth Da princes to nothing; he maketh Da judges of Da earth as vanity. 40:24 Yea, they shall not be planted; yea, they shall not be sown: yea, their stock shall not take root in Da earth: and he shall also blow upon them, and they shall wither, and Da whirlwind shall take them away as stubble. 40:25 To whom then will ye liken me, or shall I be equal? saith Da Holy One. 40:26 Lift up your eyes on high, and behold who hath created these things, that bringeth out their host by number: he calleth them all by names by Da greatness of his might, for that he is strong in power; not one faileth. 40:27 Why sayest thou, O Jacob, and speakest, O Israel, My way is hid from Da LORD, and my judgment is passed over from my God? 40:28 Hast thou not known? hast thou not heard, that Da everlasting God, Da LORD, Da Creator of Da ends of Da earth, fainteth not, neither is weary? there is no searching of his understanding. 40:29 He giveth power to Da faint; and to them that have no might he increaseth strength. 40:30 Even Da youths shall faint and be weary, and Da young men shall utterly fall: 40:31 But they that wait upon Da LORD shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint. 41:1 Keep silence before me, O islands; and let Da people renew their strength: let them come near; then let them speak: let us come near together to judgment. 41:2 Who raised up Da righteous man from Da east, called him to his foot, gave Da nations before him, and made him rule over kings? he gave them as Da dust to his sword, and as driven stubble to his bow. 41:3 He pursued them, and passed safely; even by Da way that he had not gone with his feet. 41:4 Who hath wrought and done it, calling Da generations from Da beginning? I Da LORD, Da first, and with Da last; I am he. 41:5 The isles saw it, and feared; Da ends of Da earth were afraid, drew near, and came. 41:6 They helped every one his neighbour; and every one said to his brother, Be of good courage. 41:7 So Da carpenter encouraged Da goldsmith, and he that smootheth with Da hammer him that smote Da anvil, saying, It is ready for Da sodering: and he fastened it with nails, that it should not be moved. 41:8 But thou, Israel, art my servant, Jacob whom I have chosen, Da seed of Abraham my friend. 41:9 Thou whom I have taken from Da ends of Da earth, and called thee from Da chief men thereof, and said unto thee, Thou art my servant; I have chosen thee, and not cast thee away. 41:10 Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with Da right hand of my righteousness. 41:11 Behold, all they that were incensed against thee shall be ashamed and confounded: they shall be as nothing; and they that strive with thee shall perish. 41:12 Thou shalt seek them, and shalt not find them, even them that contended with thee: they that war against thee shall be as nothing, and as a thing of nought. 41:13 For I Da LORD thy God will hold thy right hand, saying unto thee, Fear not; I will help thee. 41:14 Fear not, thou worm Jacob, and ye men of Israel; I will help thee, saith Da LORD, and thy redeemer, Da Holy One of Israel. 41:15 Behold, I will make thee a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth: thou shalt thresh Da mountains, and beat them small, and shalt make Da hills as chaff. 41:16 Thou shalt fan them, and Da wind shall carry them away, and Da whirlwind shall scatter them: and thou shalt rejoice in Da LORD, and shalt glory in Da Holy One of Israel. 41:17 When Da poor and needy seek water, and there is none, and their tongue faileth for thirst, I Da LORD will hear them, I Da God of Israel will not forsake them. 41:18 I will open rivers in high places, and fountains in Da midst of Da valleys: I will make Da wilderness a pool of water, and Da dry land springs of water. 41:19 I will plant in Da wilderness Da cedar, Da shittah tree, and Da myrtle, and Da oil tree; I will set in Da desert Da fir tree, and Da pine, and Da box tree together: 41:20 That they may see, and know, and consider, and understand together, that Da hand of Da LORD hath done this, and Da Holy One of Israel hath created it. 41:21 Produce your cause, saith Da LORD; bring forth your strong reasons, saith Da King of Jacob. 41:22 Let them bring them forth, and shew us what shall happen: let them shew Da former things, what they be, that we may consider them, and know Da latter end of them; or declare us things for to come. 41:23 Shew Da things that are to come hereafter, that we may know that ye are gods: yea, do good, or do evil, that we may be dismayed, and behold it together. 41:24 Behold, ye are of nothing, and your work of nought: an abomination is he that chooseth you. 41:25 I have raised up one from Da north, and he shall come: from Da rising of Da sun shall he call upon my name: and he shall come upon princes as upon morter, and as Da potter treadeth clay. 41:26 Who hath declared from Da beginning, that we may know? and beforetime, that we may say, He is righteous? yea, there is none that sheweth, yea, there is none that declareth, yea, there is none that heareth your words. 41:27 The first shall say to Zion, Behold, behold them: and I will give to Jerusalem one that bringeth good tidings. 41:28 For I beheld, and there was no man; even among them, and there was no counsellor, that, when I asked of them, could answer a word. 41:29 Behold, they are all vanity; their works are nothing: their molten images are wind and confusion. 42:1 Behold my servant, whom I uphold; mine elect, in whom my soul delighteth; I have put my spirit upon him: he shall bring forth judgment to Da Gentiles. 42:2 He shall not cry, nor lift up, nor cause his voice to be heard in Da street. 42:3 A bruised reed shall he not break, and Da smoking flax shall he not quench: he shall bring forth judgment unto truth. 42:4 He shall not fail nor be discouraged, till he have set judgment in Da earth: and Da isles shall wait for his law. 42:5 Thus saith God Da LORD, he that created Da heavens, and stretched them out; 42:7 To open Da blind eyes, to bring out Da prisoners from Da prison, and them that sit in darkness out of Da prison house. 42:8 I am Da LORD: that is my name: and my glory will I not give to another, neither my praise to graven images. 42:9 Behold, Da former things are come to pass, and new things do I declare: before they spring forth I tell you of them. 42:10 Sing unto Da LORD a new song, and his praise from Da end of Da earth, ye that go down to Da sea, and all that is therein;
