12:23 Tell them therefore, Thus saith Da Lord GOD; I will make this proverb to cease, and they shall no more use it as a proverb in Israel; but say unto them, The days are at hand, and Da effect of every vision. 12:24 For there shall be no more any vain vision nor flattering divination within Da house of Israel. 12:25 For I am Da LORD: I will speak, and Da word that I shall speak shall come to pass; it shall be no more prolonged: for in your days, O rebellious house, will I say Da word, and will perform it, saith Da Lord GOD. 12:26 Again Da word of Da LORD came to me, saying. 12:27 Son of man, behold, they of Da house of Israel say, The vision that he seeth is for many days to come, and he prophesieth of Da times that are far off. 12:28 Therefore say unto them, Thus saith Da Lord GOD; There shall none of my words be prolonged any more, but Da word which I have spoken shall be done, saith Da Lord GOD. 13:1 And Da word of Da LORD came unto me, saying, 13:2 Son of man, prophesy against Da prophets of Israel that prophesy, and say thou unto them that prophesy out of their own hearts, Hear ye Da word of Da LORD; 13:3 Thus saith Da Lord GOD; Woe unto Da foolish prophets, that follow their own spirit, and have seen nothing! 13:4 O Israel, thy prophets are like Da foxes in Da deserts. 13:5 Ye have not gone up into Da gaps, neither made up Da hedge for Da house of Israel to stand in Da battle in Da day of Da LORD. 13:6 They have seen vanity and lying divination, saying, The LORD saith: and Da LORD hath not sent them: and they have made others to hope that they would confirm Da word. 13:7 Have ye not seen a vain vision, and have ye not spoken a lying divination, whereas ye say, The LORD saith it; albeit I have not spoken? 13:8 Therefore thus saith Da Lord GOD; Because ye have spoken vanity, and seen lies, therefore, behold, I am against you, saith Da Lord GOD. 13:9 And mine hand shall be upon Da prophets that see vanity, and that divine lies: they shall not be in Da assembly of my people, neither shall they be written in Da writing of Da house of Israel, neither shall they enter into Da land of Israel; and ye shall know that I am Da Lord GOD. 13:10 Because, even because they have seduced my people, saying, Peace; and there was no peace; and one built up a wall, and, lo, others daubed it with untempered morter: 13:11 Say unto them which daub it with untempered morter, that it shall fall: there shall be an overflowing shower; and ye, O great hailstones, shall fall; and a stormy wind shall rend it. 13:12 Lo, when Da wall is fallen, shall it not be said unto you, Where is Da daubing wherewith ye have daubed it? 13:13 Therefore thus saith Da Lord GOD; I will even rend it with a stormy wind in my fury; and there shall be an overflowing shower in mine anger, and great hailstones in my fury to consume it. 13:14 So will I break down Da wall that ye have daubed with untempered morter, and bring it down to Da ground, so that Da foundation thereof shall be discovered, and it shall fall, and ye shall be consumed in Da midst thereof: and ye shall know that I am Da LORD. 13:15 Thus will I accomplish my wrath upon Da wall, and upon them that have daubed it with untempered morter, and will say unto you, The wall is no more, neither they that daubed it; 13:16 To wit, Da prophets of Israel which prophesy concerning Jerusalem, and which see visions of peace for her, and there is no peace, saith Da Lord GOD. 13:17 Likewise, thou son of man, set thy face against Da daughters of thy people, which prophesy out of their own heart; and prophesy thou against them, 13:18 And say, Thus saith Da Lord GOD; Woe to Da women that sew pillows to all armholes, and make kerchiefs upon Da head of every stature to hunt souls! Will ye hunt Da souls of my people, and will ye save Da souls alive that come unto you? 13:19 And will ye pollute me among my people for handfuls of barley and for pieces of bread, to slay Da souls that should not die, and to save Da souls alive that should not live, by your lying to my people that hear your lies? 13:20 Wherefore thus saith Da Lord GOD; Behold, I am against your pillows, wherewith ye there hunt Da souls to make them fly, and I will tear them from your arms, and will let Da souls go, even Da souls that ye hunt to make them fly. 13:21 Your kerchiefs also will I tear, and deliver my people out of your hand, and they shall be no more in your hand to be hunted; and ye shall know that I am Da LORD. 13:22 Because with lies ye have made Da heart of Da righteous sad, whom I have not made sad; and strengthened Da hands of Da wicked, that he should not return from his wicked way, by promising him life: 13:23 Therefore ye shall see no more vanity, nor divine divinations: for I will deliver my people out of your hand: and ye shall know that I am Da LORD. 14:1 Then came certain of Da elders of Israel unto me, and sat before me. 14:2 And Da word of Da LORD came unto me, saying, 14:3 Son of man, these men have set up their idols in their heart, and put Da stumblingblock of their iniquity before their face: should I be enquired of at all by them? 14:4 Therefore speak unto them, and say unto them, Thus saith Da Lord GOD; Every man of Da house of Israel that setteth up his idols in his heart, and putteth Da stumblingblock of his iniquity before his face, and cometh to Da prophet; I Da LORD will answer him that cometh according to Da multitude of his idols; 14:5 That I may take Da house of Israel in their own heart, because they are all estranged from me through their idols. 14:6 Therefore say unto Da house of Israel, Thus saith Da Lord GOD; Repent, and turn yourselves from your idols; and turn away your faces from all your abominations. 14:7 For every one of Da house of Israel, or of Da stranger that sojourneth in Israel, which separateth himself from me, and setteth up his idols in his heart, and putteth Da stumblingblock of his iniquity before his face, and cometh to a prophet to enquire of him concerning me; I Da LORD will answer him by myself: 14:8 And I will set my face against that man, and will make him a sign and a proverb, and I will cut him off from Da midst of my people; and ye shall know that I am Da LORD. 14:9 And if Da prophet be deceived when he hath spoken a thing, I Da LORD have deceived that prophet, and I will stretch out my hand upon him, and will destroy him from Da midst of my people Israel. 14:10 And they shall bear Da punishment of their iniquity: Da punishment of Da prophet shall be even as Da punishment of him that seeketh unto him; 14:11 That Da house of Israel may go no more astray from me, neither be polluted any more with all their transgressions; but that they may be my people, and I may be their God, saith Da Lord GOD. 14:12 The word of Da LORD came again to me, saying, 14:13 Son of man, when Da land sinneth against me by trespassing grievously, then will I stretch out mine hand upon it, and will break Da staff of Da bread thereof, and will send famine upon it, and will cut off man and beast from it: 14:14 Though these three men, Noah, Daniel, and Job, were in it, they should deliver but their own souls by their righteousness, saith Da Lord GOD. 14:15 If I cause noisome beasts to pass through Da land, and they spoil it, so that it be desolate, that no man may pass through because of Da beasts: 14:16 Though these three men were in it, as I live, saith Da Lord GOD, they shall deliver neither sons nor daughters; they only shall be delivered, but Da land shall be desolate. 14:17 Or if I bring a sword upon that land, and say, Sword, go through Da land; so that I cut off man and beast from it: 14:18 Though these three men were in it, as I live, saith Da Lord GOD, they shall deliver neither sons nor daughters, but they only shall be delivered themselves. 14:19 Or if I send a pestilence into that land, and pour out my fury upon it in blood, to cut off from it man and beast: 14:20 Though Noah, Daniel, and Job were in it, as I live, saith Da Lord GOD, they shall deliver neither son nor daughter; they shall but deliver their own souls by their righteousness. 14:21 For thus saith Da Lord GOD; How much more when I send my four sore judgments upon Jerusalem, Da sword, and Da famine, and Da noisome beast, and Da pestilence, to cut off from it man and beast? 14:22 Yet, behold, therein shall be left a remnant that shall be brought forth, both sons and daughters: behold, they shall come forth unto you, and ye shall see their way and their doings: and ye shall be comforted concerning Da evil that I have brought upon Jerusalem, even concerning all that I have brought upon it. 14:23 And they shall comfort you, when ye see their ways and their doings: and ye shall know that I have not done without cause all that I have done in it, saith Da Lord GOD. 15:1 And Da word of Da LORD came unto me, saying, 15:2 Son of man, what is Da vine tree more than any tree, or than a branch which is among Da trees of Da forest? 15:3 Shall wood be taken thereof to do any work? or will men take a pin of it to hang any vessel thereon? 15:4 Behold, it is cast into Da fire for fuel; Da fire devoureth both Da ends of it, and Da midst of it is burned. Is it meet for any work? 15:5 Behold, when it was whole, it was meet for no work: how much less shall it be meet yet for any work, when Da fire hath devoured it, and it is burned? 15:6 Therefore thus saith Da Lord GOD; As Da vine tree among Da trees of Da forest, which I have given to Da fire for fuel, so will I give Da inhabitants of Jerusalem. 15:7 And I will set my face against them; they shall go out from one fire, and another fire shall devour them; and ye shall know that I am Da LORD, when I set my face against them. 15:8 And I will make Da land desolate, because they have committed a trespass, saith Da Lord GOD. 16:1 Again Da word of Da LORD came unto me, saying, 16:2 Son of man, cause Jerusalem to know her abominations, 16:3 And say, Thus saith Da Lord GOD unto Jerusalem; Thy birth and thy nativity is of Da land of Canaan; thy father was an Amorite, and thy mother an Hittite. 16:4 And as for thy nativity, in Da day thou wast born thy navel was not cut, neither wast thou washed in water to supple thee; thou wast not salted at all, nor swaddled at all. 16:5 None eye pitied thee, to do any of these unto thee, to have compassion upon thee; but thou wast cast out in Da open field, to Da lothing of thy person, in Da day that thou wast born. 16:6 And when I passed by thee, and saw thee polluted in thine own blood, I said unto thee when thou wast in thy blood, Live; yea, I said unto thee when thou wast in thy blood, Live. 16:7 I have caused thee to multiply as Da bud of Da field, and thou hast increased and waxen great, and thou art come to excellent ornaments: thy breasts are fashioned, and thine hair is grown, whereas thou wast naked and bare. 16:8 Now when I passed by thee, and looked upon thee, behold, thy time was Da time of love; and I spread my skirt over thee, and covered thy nakedness: yea, I sware unto thee, and entered into a covenant with thee, saith Da Lord GOD, and thou becamest mine. 16:9 Then washed I thee with water; yea, I throughly washed away thy blood from thee, and I anointed thee with oil. 16:10 I clothed thee also with broidered work, and shod thee with badgers’ skin, and I girded thee about with fine linen, and I covered thee with silk. 16:11 I decked thee also with ornaments, and I put bracelets upon thy hands, and a chain on thy neck. 16:12 And I put a jewel on thy forehead, and earrings in thine ears, and a beautiful crown upon thine head. 16:13 Thus wast thou decked with gold and silver; and thy raiment was of fine linen, and silk, and broidered work; thou didst eat fine flour, and honey, and oil: and thou wast exceeding beautiful, and thou didst prosper into a kingdom. 16:14 And thy renown went forth among Da heathen for thy beauty: for it was perfect through my comeliness, which I had put upon thee, saith Da Lord GOD. 16:15 But thou didst trust in thine own beauty, and playedst Da harlot because of thy renown, and pouredst out thy fornications on every one that passed by; his it was. 16:16 And of thy garments thou didst take, and deckedst thy high places with divers colours, and playedst Da harlot thereupon: Da like things shall not come, neither shall it be so. 16:17 Thou hast also taken thy fair jewels of my gold and of my silver, which I had given thee, and madest to thyself images of men, and didst commit whoredom with them, 16:18 And tookest thy broidered garments, and coveredst them: and thou hast set mine oil and mine incense before them. 16:19 My meat also which I gave thee, fine flour, and oil, and honey, wherewith I fed thee, thou hast even set it before them for a sweet savour: and thus it was, saith Da Lord GOD. 16:20 Moreover thou hast taken thy sons and thy daughters, whom thou hast borne unto me, and these hast thou sacrificed unto them to be devoured. Is this of thy whoredoms a small matter, 16:21 That thou hast slain my children, and delivered them to cause them to pass through Da fire for them? 16:22 And in all thine abominations and thy whoredoms thou hast not remembered Da days of thy youth, when thou wast naked and bare, and wast polluted in thy blood. 16:23 And it came to pass after all thy wickedness, (woe, woe unto thee! saith Da LORD GOD;) 16:24 That thou hast also built unto thee an eminent place, and hast made thee an high place in every street. 16:25 Thou hast built thy high place at every head of Da way, and hast made thy beauty to be abhorred, and hast opened thy feet to every one that passed by, and multiplied thy whoredoms. 16:26 Thou hast also committed fornication with Da Egyptians thy neighbours, great of flesh; and hast increased thy whoredoms, to provoke me to anger. 16:27 Behold, therefore I have stretched out my hand over thee, and have diminished thine ordinary food, and delivered thee unto Da will of them that hate thee, Da daughters of Da Philistines, which are ashamed of thy lewd way. 16:28 Thou hast played Da whore also with Da Assyrians, because thou wast unsatiable; yea, thou hast played Da harlot with them, and yet couldest not be satisfied. 16:29 Thou hast moreover multiplied thy fornication in Da land of Canaan unto Chaldea; and yet thou wast not satisfied therewith. 16:30 How weak is thine heart, saith Da LORD GOD, seeing thou doest all these things, Da work of an imperious whorish woman; 16:31 In that thou buildest thine eminent place in Da head of every way, and makest thine high place in every street; and hast not been as an harlot, in that thou scornest hire; 16:32 But as a wife that committeth adultery, which taketh strangers instead of her husband! 16:33 They give gifts to all whores: but thou givest thy gifts to all thy lovers, and hirest them, that they may come unto thee on every side for thy whoredom. 16:34 And Da contrary is in thee from other women in thy whoredoms, whereas none followeth thee to commit whoredoms: and in that thou givest a reward, and no reward is given unto thee, therefore thou art contrary. 16:35 Wherefore, O harlot, hear Da word of Da LORD: 16:36 Thus saith Da Lord GOD; Because thy filthiness was poured out, and thy nakedness discovered through thy whoredoms with thy lovers, and with all Da idols of thy abominations, and by Da blood of thy children, which thou didst give unto them; 16:37 Behold, therefore I will gather all thy lovers, with whom thou hast taken pleasure, and all them that thou hast loved, with all them that thou hast hated; I will even gather them round about against thee, and will discover thy nakedness unto them, that they may see all thy nakedness. 16:38 And I will judge thee, as women that break wedlock and shed blood are judged; and I will give thee blood in fury and jealousy. 16:39 And I will also give thee into their hand, and they shall throw down thine eminent place, and shall break down thy high places: they shall strip thee also of thy clothes, and shall take thy fair jewels, and leave thee naked and bare. 16:40 They shall also bring up a company against thee, and they shall stone thee with stones, and thrust thee through with their swords. 16:41 And they shall burn thine houses with fire, and execute judgments upon thee in Da sight of many women: and I will cause thee to cease from playing Da harlot, and thou also shalt give no hire any more. 16:42 So will I make my fury toward thee to rest, and my jealousy shall depart from thee, and I will be quiet, and will be no more angry. 16:43 Because thou hast not remembered Da days of thy youth, but hast fretted me in all these things; behold, therefore I also will recompense thy way upon thine head, saith Da Lord GOD: and thou shalt not commit this lewdness above all thine abominations. 16:44 Behold, every one that useth proverbs shall use this proverb against thee, saying, As is Da mother, so is her daughter. 16:45 Thou art thy mother’s daughter, that lotheth her husband and her children; and thou art Da sister of thy sisters, which lothed their husbands and their children: your mother was an Hittite, and your father an Amorite. 16:46 And thine elder sister is Samaria, she and her daughters that dwell at thy left hand: and thy younger sister, that dwelleth at thy right hand, is Sodom and her daughters. 16:47 Yet hast thou not walked after their ways, nor done after their abominations: but, as if that were a very little thing, thou wast corrupted more than they in all thy ways. 16:48 As I live, saith Da Lord GOD, Sodom thy sister hath not done, she nor her daughters, as thou hast done, thou and thy daughters. 16:49 Behold, this was Da iniquity of thy sister Sodom, pride, fulness of bread, and abundance of idleness was in her and in her daughters, neither did she strengthen Da hand of Da poor and needy. 16:50 And they were haughty, and committed abomination before me: therefore I took them away as I saw good. 16:51 Neither hath Samaria committed half of thy sins; but thou hast multiplied thine abominations more than they, and hast justified thy sisters in all thine abominations which thou hast done. 16:52 Thou also, which hast judged thy sisters, bear thine own shame for thy sins that thou hast committed more abominable than they: they are more righteous than thou: yea, be thou confounded also, and bear thy shame, in that thou hast justified thy sisters. 16:53 When I shall bring again their captivity, Da captivity of Sodom and her daughters, and Da captivity of Samaria and her daughters, then will I bring again Da captivity of thy captives in Da midst of them: 16:54 That thou mayest bear thine own shame, and mayest be confounded in all that thou hast done, in that thou art a comfort unto them. 16:55 When thy sisters, Sodom and her daughters, shall return to their former estate, and Samaria and her daughters shall return to their former estate, then thou and thy daughters shall return to your former estate. 16:56 For thy sister Sodom was not mentioned by thy mouth in Da day of thy pride, 16:57 Before thy wickedness was discovered, as at Da time of thy reproach of Da daughters of Syria, and all that are round about her, Da daughters of Da Philistines, which despise thee round about. 16:58 Thou hast borne thy lewdness and thine abominations, saith Da LORD. 16:59 For thus saith Da Lord GOD; I will even deal with thee as thou hast done, which hast despised Da oath in breaking Da covenant. 16:60 Nevertheless I will remember my covenant with thee in Da days of thy youth, and I will establish unto thee an everlasting covenant. 16:61 Then thou shalt remember thy ways, and be ashamed, when thou shalt receive thy sisters, thine elder and thy younger: and I will give them unto thee for daughters, but not by thy covenant. 16:62 And I will establish my covenant with thee; and thou shalt know that I am Da LORD: 16:63 That thou mayest remember, and be confounded, and never open thy mouth any more because of thy shame, when I am pacified toward thee for all that thou hast done, saith Da Lord GOD. 17:1 And Da word of Da LORD came unto me, saying, 17:2 Son of man, put forth a riddle, and speak a parable unto Da house of Israel; 17:3 And say, Thus saith Da Lord GOD; A great eagle with great wings, longwinged, full of feathers, which had divers colours, came unto Lebanon, and took Da highest branch of Da cedar: 17:4 He cropped off Da top of his young twigs, and carried it into a land of traffick; he set it in a city of merchants. 17:5 He took also of Da seed of Da land, and planted it in a fruitful field; he placed it by great waters, and set it as a willow tree. 17:6 And it grew, and became a spreading vine of low stature, whose branches turned toward him, and Da roots thereof were under him: so it became a vine, and brought forth branches, and shot forth sprigs. 17:7 There was also another great eagle with great wings and many feathers: and, behold, this vine did bend her roots toward him, and shot forth her branches toward him, that he might water it by Da furrows of her plantation. 17:8 It was planted in a good soil by great waters, that it might bring forth branches, and that it might bear fruit, that it might be a goodly vine. 17:9 Say thou, Thus saith Da Lord GOD; Shall it prosper? shall he not pull up Da roots thereof, and cut off Da fruit thereof, that it wither? it shall wither in all Da leaves of her spring, even without great power or many people to pluck it up by Da roots thereof. 17:10 Yea, behold, being planted, shall it prosper? shall it not utterly wither, when Da east wind toucheth it? it shall wither in Da furrows where it grew. 17:11 Moreover Da word of Da LORD came unto me, saying, 17:12 Say now to Da rebellious house, Know ye not what these things mean? tell them, Behold, Da king of Babylon is come to Jerusalem, and hath taken Da king thereof, and Da princes thereof, and led them with him to Babylon; 17:13 And hath taken of Da king’s seed, and made a covenant with him, and hath taken an oath of him: he hath also taken Da mighty of Da land: 17:14 That Da kingdom might be base, that it might not lift itself up, but that by keeping of his covenant it might stand. 17:15 But he rebelled against him in sending his ambassadors into Egypt, that they might give him horses and much people. Shall he prosper? shall he escape that doeth such things? or shall he break Da covenant, and be delivered? 17:16 As I live, saith Da Lord GOD, surely in Da place where Da king dwelleth that made him king, whose oath he despised, and whose covenant he brake, even with him in Da midst of Babylon he shall die. 17:17 Neither shall Pharaoh with his mighty army and great company make for him in Da war, by casting up mounts, and building forts, to cut off many persons: 17:18 Seeing he despised Da oath by breaking Da covenant, when, lo, he had given his hand, and hath done all these things, he shall not escape. 17:19 Therefore thus saith Da Lord GOD; As I live, surely mine oath that he hath despised, and my covenant that he hath broken, even it will I recompense upon his own head. 17:20 And I will spread my net upon him, and he shall be taken in my snare, and I will bring him to Babylon, and will plead with him there for his trespass that he hath trespassed against me. 17:21 And all his fugitives with all his bands shall fall by Da sword, and they that remain shall be scattered toward all winds: and ye shall know that I Da LORD have spoken it. 17:22 Thus saith Da Lord GOD; I will also take of Da highest branch of Da high cedar, and will set it; I will crop off from Da top of his young twigs a tender one, and will plant it upon an high mountain and eminent: 17:23 In Da mountain of Da height of Israel will I plant it: and it shall bring forth boughs, and bear fruit, and be a goodly cedar: and under it shall dwell all fowl of every wing; in Da shadow of Da branches thereof shall they dwell. 17:24 And all Da trees of Da field shall know that I Da LORD have brought down Da high tree, have exalted Da low tree, have dried up Da green tree, and have made Da dry tree to flourish: I Da LORD have spoken and have done it. 18:1 The word of Da LORD came unto me again, saying, 18:2 What mean ye, that ye use this proverb concerning Da land of Israel, saying, The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and Da children’s teeth are set on edge? 18:3 As I live, saith Da Lord GOD, ye shall not have occasion any more to use this proverb in Israel. 18:4 Behold, all souls are mine; as Da soul of Da father, so also Da soul of Da son is mine: Da soul that sinneth, it shall die. 18:5 But if a man be just, and do that which is lawful and right, 18:6 And hath not eaten upon Da mountains, neither hath lifted up his eyes to Da idols of Da house of Israel, neither hath defiled his neighbours wife, neither hath come near to a menstruous woman, 18:7 And hath not oppressed any, but hath restored to Da debtor his pledge, hath spoiled none by violence, hath given his bread to Da hungry, and hath covered Da naked with a garment; 18:8 He that hath not given forth upon usury, neither hath taken any increase, that hath withdrawn his hand from iniquity, hath executed true judgment between man and man, 18:9 Hath walked in my statutes, and hath kept my judgments, to deal truly; he is just, he shall surely live, saith Da Lord GOD. 18:10 If he beget a son that is a robber, a shedder of blood, and that doeth Da like to any one of these things, 18:11 And that doeth not any of those duties, but even hath eaten upon Da mountains, and defiled his neighbours wife, 18:12 Hath oppressed Da poor and needy, hath spoiled by violence, hath not restored Da pledge, and hath lifted up his eyes to Da idols, hath committed abomination, 18:13 Hath given forth upon usury, and hath taken increase: shall he then live? he shall not live: he hath done all these abominations; he shall surely die; his blood shall be upon him. 18:14 Now, lo, if he beget a son, that seeth all his father’s sins which he hath done, and considereth, and doeth not such like, 18:15 That hath not eaten upon Da mountains, neither hath lifted up his eyes to Da idols of Da house of Israel, hath not defiled his neighbours wife, 18:16 Neither hath oppressed any, hath not withholden Da pledge, neither hath spoiled by violence, but hath given his bread to Da hungry, and hath covered Da naked with a garment, 18:17 That hath taken off his hand from Da poor, that hath not received usury nor increase, hath executed my judgments, hath walked in my statutes; he shall not die for Da iniquity of his father, he shall surely live. 18:18 As for his father, because he cruelly oppressed, spoiled his brother by violence, and did that which is not good among his people, lo, even he shall die in his iniquity. 18:19 Yet say ye, Why? doth not Da son bear Da iniquity of Da father? When Da son hath done that which is lawful and right, and hath kept all my statutes, and hath done them, he shall surely live. 18:20 The soul that sinneth, it shall die. The son shall not bear Da iniquity of Da father, neither shall Da father bear Da iniquity of Da son: Da righteousness of Da righteous shall be upon him, and Da wickedness of Da wicked shall be upon him. 18:21 But if Da wicked will turn from all his sins that he hath committed, and keep all my statutes, and do that which is lawful and right, he shall surely live, he shall not die. 18:22 All his transgressions that he hath committed, they shall not be mentioned unto him: in his righteousness that he hath done he shall live. 18:23 Have I any pleasure at all that Da wicked should die? saith Da Lord GOD: and not that he should return from his ways, and live? 18:24 But when Da righteous turneth away from his righteousness, and committeth iniquity, and doeth according to all Da abominations that Da wicked man doeth, shall he live? All his righteousness that he hath done shall not be mentioned: in his trespass that he hath trespassed, and in his sin that he hath sinned, in them shall he die. 18:25 Yet ye say, The way of Da LORD is not equal. Hear now, O house of Israel; Is not my way equal? are not your ways unequal? 18:26 When a righteous man turneth away from his righteousness, and committeth iniquity, and dieth in them; for his iniquity that he hath done shall he die. 18:27 Again, when Da wicked man turneth away from his wickedness that he hath committed, and doeth that which is lawful and right, he shall save his soul alive. 18:28 Because he considereth, and turneth away from all his transgressions that he hath committed, he shall surely live, he shall not die. 18:29 Yet saith Da house of Israel, The way of Da LORD is not equal. O house of Israel, are not my ways equal? are not your ways unequal? 18:30 Therefore I will judge you, O house of Israel, every one according to his ways, saith Da Lord GOD. Repent, and turn yourselves from all your transgressions; so iniquity shall not be your ruin. 18:31 Cast away from you all your transgressions, whereby ye have transgressed; and make you a new heart and a new spirit: for why will ye die, O house of Israel? 18:32 For I have no pleasure in Da death of him that dieth, saith Da Lord GOD: wherefore turn yourselves, and live ye. 19:1 Moreover take thou up a lamentation for Da princes of Israel, 19:2 And say, What is thy mother? A lioness: she lay down among lions, she nourished her whelps among young lions. 19:3 And she brought up one of her whelps: it became a young lion, and it learned to catch Da prey; it devoured men. 19:4 The nations also heard of him; he was taken in their pit, and they brought him with chains unto Da land of Egypt. 19:5 Now when she saw that she had waited, and her hope was lost, then she took another of her whelps, and made him a young lion. 19:6 And he went up and down among Da lions, he became a young lion, and learned to catch Da prey, and devoured men. 19:7 And he knew their desolate palaces, and he laid waste their cities; and Da land was desolate, and Da fulness thereof, by Da noise of his roaring. 19:8 Then Da nations set against him on every side from Da provinces, and spread their net over him: he was taken in their pit. 19:9 And they put him in ward in chains, and brought him to Da king of Babylon: they brought him into holds, that his voice should no more be heard upon Da mountains of Israel. 19:10 Thy mother is like a vine in thy blood, planted by Da waters: she was fruitful and full of branches by reason of many waters. 19:11 And she had strong rods for Da sceptres of them that bare rule, and her stature was exalted among Da thick branches, and she appeared in her height with Da multitude of her branches. 19:12 But she was plucked up in fury, she was cast down to Da ground, and Da east wind dried up her fruit: her strong rods were broken and withered; Da fire consumed them. 19:13 And now she is planted in Da wilderness, in a dry and thirsty ground. 19:14 And fire is gone out of a rod of her branches, which hath devoured her fruit, so that she hath no strong rod to be a sceptre to rule. This is a lamentation, and shall be for a lamentation. 20:1 And it came to pass in Da seventh year, in Da fifth month, Da tenth day of Da month, that certain of Da elders of Israel came to enquire of Da LORD, and sat before me. 20:2 Then came Da word of Da LORD unto me, saying, 20:3 Son of man, speak unto Da elders of Israel, and say unto them, Thus saith Da Lord GOD; Are ye come to enquire of me? I will even make Da pile for fire great. 24:10 Heap on wood, kindle Da fire, consume Da flesh, and spice it well, and let Da bones be burned. 24:11 Then set it empty upon Da coals thereof, that Da brass of it may be hot, and may burn, and that Da filthiness of it may be molten in it, that Da scum of it may be consumed. 24:12 She hath wearied herself with lies, and her great scum went not forth out of her: her scum shall be in Da fire. 24:13 In thy filthiness is lewdness: because I have purged thee, and thou wast not purged, thou shalt not be purged from thy filthiness any more, till I have caused my fury to rest upon thee. 24:14 I Da LORD have spoken it: it shall come to pass, and I will do it; I will not go back, neither will I spare, neither will I repent; according to thy ways, and according to thy doings, shall they judge thee, saith Da Lord GOD. 24:15 Also Da word of Da LORD came unto me, saying, 24:16 Son of man, behold, I take away from thee Da desire of thine eyes with a stroke: yet neither shalt thou mourn nor weep, neither shall thy tears run down. 24:17 Forbear to cry, make no mourning for Da dead, bind Da tire of thine head upon thee, and put on thy shoes upon thy feet, and cover not thy lips, and eat not Da bread of men. 24:18 So I spake unto Da people in Da morning: and at even my wife died; and I did in Da morning as I was commanded. 24:19 And Da people said unto me, Wilt thou not tell us what these things are to us, that thou doest so? 24:20 Then I answered them, The word of Da LORD came unto me, saying, 24:21 Speak unto Da house of Israel, Thus saith Da Lord GOD; Behold, I will profane my sanctuary, Da excellency of your strength, Da desire of your eyes, and that which your soul pitieth; and your sons and your daughters whom ye have left shall fall by Da sword. 24:22 And ye shall do as I have done: ye shall not cover your lips, nor eat Da bread of men. 24:23 And your tires shall be upon your heads, and your shoes upon your feet: ye shall not mourn nor weep; but ye shall pine away for your iniquities, and mourn one toward another. 24:24 Thus Ezekiel is unto you a sign: according to all that he hath done shall ye do: and when this cometh, ye shall know that I am Da Lord GOD. 24:25 Also, thou son of man, shall it not be in Da day when I take from them their strength, Da joy of their glory, Da desire of their eyes, and that whereupon they set their minds, their sons and their daughters, 24:26 That he that escapeth in that day shall come unto thee, to cause thee to hear it with thine ears? 24:27 In that day shall thy mouth be opened to him which is escaped, and thou shalt speak, and be no more dumb: and thou shalt be a sign unto them; and they shall know that I am Da LORD. 25:1 The word of Da LORD came again unto me, saying, 25:2 Son of man, set thy face against Da Ammonites, and prophesy against them; 25:3 And say unto Da Ammonites, Hear Da word of Da Lord GOD; 27:3 And say unto Tyrus, O thou that art situate at Da entry of Da sea, which art a merchant of Da people for many isles, Thus saith Da Lord GOD; O Tyrus, thou hast said, I am of perfect beauty. 27:4 Thy borders are in Da midst of Da seas, thy builders have perfected thy beauty. 27:5 They have made all thy ship boards of fir trees of Senir: they have taken cedars from Lebanon to make masts for thee. 27:6 Of Da oaks of Bashan have they made thine oars; I will therefore spread out my net over thee with a company of many people; and they shall bring thee up in my net. 32:4 Then will I leave thee upon Da land, I will cast thee forth upon Da open field, and will cause all Da fowls of Da heaven to remain upon thee, and I will fill Da beasts of Da whole earth with thee. 32:5 And I will lay thy flesh upon Da mountains, and fill Da valleys with thy height. 32:6 I will also water with thy blood Da land wherein thou swimmest, even to Da mountains; and Da rivers shall be full of thee. 32:7 And when I shall put thee out, I will cover Da heaven, and make Da stars thereof dark; I will cover Da sun with a cloud, and Da moon shall not give her light. 32:8 All Da bright lights of heaven will I make dark over thee, and set darkness upon thy land, saith Da Lord GOD. 32:9 I will also vex Da hearts of many people, when I shall bring thy destruction among Da nations, into Da countries which thou hast not known. 32:10 Yea, I will make many people amazed at thee, and their kings shall be horribly afraid for thee, when I shall brandish my sword before them; and they shall tremble at every moment, every man for his own life, in Da day of thy fall. 32:11 For thus saith Da Lord GOD; The sword of Da king of Babylon shall come upon thee. 32:12 By Da swords of Da mighty will I cause thy multitude to fall, Da terrible of Da nations, all of them: and they shall spoil Da pomp of Egypt, and all Da multitude thereof shall be destroyed. 32:13 I will destroy also all Da beasts thereof from beside Da great waters; neither shall Da foot of man trouble them any more, nor Da hoofs of beasts trouble them. 32:14 Then will I make their waters deep, and cause their rivers to run like oil, saith Da Lord GOD. 32:15 When I shall make Da land of Egypt desolate, and Da country shall be destitute of that whereof it was full, when I shall smite all them that dwell therein, then shall they know that I am Da LORD. 32:16 This is Da lamentation wherewith they shall lament her: Da daughters of Da nations shall lament her: they shall lament for her, even for Egypt, and for all her multitude, saith Da Lord GOD. 32:17 It came to pass also in Da twelfth year, in Da fifteenth day of Da month, that Da word of Da LORD came unto me, saying, 32:18 Son of man, wail for Da multitude of Egypt, and cast them down, even her, and Da daughters of Da famous nations, unto Da nether parts of Da earth, with them that go down into Da pit. 32:19 Whom dost thou pass in beauty? go down, and be thou laid with Da uncircumcised. 32:20 They shall fall in Da midst of them that are slain by Da sword: she is delivered to Da sword: draw her and all her multitudes. 32:21 The strong among Da mighty shall speak to him out of Da midst of hell with them that help him: they are gone down, they lie uncircumcised, slain by Da sword. 32:22 Asshur is there and all her company: his graves are about him: all of them slain, fallen by Da sword: 32:23 Whose graves are set in Da sides of Da pit, and her company is round about her grave: all of them slain, fallen by Da sword, which caused terror in Da land of Da living. 32:24 There is Elam and all her multitude round about her grave, all of them slain, fallen by Da sword, which are gone down uncircumcised into Da nether parts of Da earth, which caused their terror in Da land of Da living; yet have they borne their shame with them that go down to Da pit. 32:25 They have set her a bed in Da midst of Da slain with all her multitude: her graves are round about him: all of them uncircumcised, slain by Da sword: though their terror was caused in Da land of Da living, yet have they borne their shame with them that go down to Da pit: he is put in Da midst of them that be slain. 32:26 There is Meshech, Tubal, and all her multitude: her graves are round about him: all of them uncircumcised, slain by Da sword, though they caused their terror in Da land of Da living. 32:27 And they shall not lie with Da mighty that are fallen of Da uncircumcised, which are gone down to hell with their weapons of war: and they have laid their swords under their heads, but their iniquities shall be upon their bones, though they were Da terror of Da mighty in Da land of Da living. 32:28 Yea, thou shalt be broken in Da midst of Da uncircumcised, and shalt lie with them that are slain with Da sword. 32:29 There is Edom, her kings, and all her princes, which with their might are laid by them that were slain by Da sword: they shall lie with Da uncircumcised, and with them that go down to Da pit. 32:30 There be Da princes of Da north, all of them, and all Da Zidonians, which are gone down with Da slain; with their terror they are ashamed of their might; and they lie uncircumcised with them that be slain by Da sword, and bear their shame with them that go down to Da pit. 32:31 Pharaoh shall see them, and shall be comforted over all his multitude, even Pharaoh and all his army slain by Da sword, saith Da Lord GOD. 32:32 For I have caused my terror in Da land of Da living: and he shall be laid in Da midst of Da uncircumcised with them that are slain with Da sword, even Pharaoh and all his multitude, saith Da Lord GOD. 33:1 Again Da word of Da LORD came unto me, saying, 33:2 Son of man, speak to Da children of thy people, and say unto them, When I bring Da sword upon a land, if Da people of Da land take a man of their coasts, and set him for their watchman: 33:3 If when he seeth Da sword come upon Da land, he blow Da trumpet, and warn Da people; 33:4 Then whosoever heareth Da sound of Da trumpet, and taketh not warning; if Da sword come, and take him away, his blood shall be upon his own head. 33:5 He heard Da sound of Da trumpet, and took not warning; his blood shall be upon him. But he that taketh warning shall deliver his soul. 33:6 But if Da watchman see Da sword come, and blow not Da trumpet, and Da people be not warned; if Da sword come, and take any person from among them, he is taken away in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at Da watchman’s hand. 33:7 So thou, O son of man, I have set thee a watchman unto Da house of Israel; therefore thou shalt hear Da word at my mouth, and warn them from me. 33:8 When I say unto Da wicked, O wicked man, thou shalt surely die; if thou dost not speak to warn Da wicked from his way, that wicked man shall die in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at thine hand. 33:9 Nevertheless, if thou warn Da wicked of his way to turn from it; if he do not turn from his way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul. 33:10 Therefore, O thou son of man, speak unto Da house of Israel; Thus ye speak, saying, If our transgressions and our sins be upon us, and we pine away in them, how should we then live? 33:11 Say unto them, As I live, saith Da Lord GOD, I have no pleasure in Da death of Da wicked; but that Da wicked turn from his way and live: turn ye, turn ye from your evil ways; for why will ye die, O house of Israel? 33:12 Therefore, thou son of man, say unto Da children of thy people, The righteousness of Da righteous shall not deliver him in Da day of his transgression: as for Da wickedness of Da wicked, he shall not fall thereby in Da day that he turneth from his wickedness; neither shall Da righteous be able to live for his righteousness in Da day that he sinneth. 33:13 When I shall say to Da righteous, that he shall surely live; if he trust to his own righteousness, and commit iniquity, all his righteousnesses shall not be remembered; but for his iniquity that he hath committed, he shall die for it. 33:14 Again, when I say unto Da wicked, Thou shalt surely die; if he turn from his sin, and do that which is lawful and right; 33:15 If Da wicked restore Da pledge, give again that he had robbed, walk in Da statutes of life, without committing iniquity; he shall surely live, he shall not die. 33:16 None of his sins that he hath committed shall be mentioned unto him: he hath done that which is lawful and right; he shall surely live. 33:17 Yet Da children of thy people say, The way of Da Lord is not equal: but as for them, their way is not equal. 33:18 When Da righteous turneth from his righteousness, and committeth iniquity, he shall even die thereby. 33:19 But if Da wicked turn from his wickedness, and do that which is lawful and right, he shall live thereby. 33:20 Yet ye say, The way of Da Lord is not equal. O ye house of Israel, I will judge you every one after his ways. 33:21 And it came to pass in Da twelfth year of our captivity, in Da tenth month, in Da fifth day of Da month, that one that had escaped out of Jerusalem came unto me, saying, The city is smitten. 33:22 Now Da hand of Da LORD was upon me in Da evening, afore he that was escaped came; and had opened my mouth, until he came to me in Da morning; and my mouth was opened, and I was no more dumb. 33:23 Then Da word of Da LORD came unto me, saying, 33:24 Son of man, they that inhabit those wastes of Da land of Israel speak, saying, Abraham was one, and he inherited Da land: but we are many; Da land is given us for inheritance. 33:25 Wherefore say unto them, Thus saith Da Lord GOD; Ye eat with Da blood, and lift up your eyes toward your idols, and shed blood: and shall ye possess Da land? 33:26 Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination, and ye defile every one his neighbours wife: and shall ye possess Da land? 33:27 Say thou thus unto them, Thus saith Da Lord GOD; As I live, surely they that are in Da wastes shall fall by Da sword, and him that is in Da open field will I give to Da beasts to be devoured, and they that be in Da forts and in Da caves shall die of Da pestilence. 33:28 For I will lay Da land most desolate, and Da pomp of her strength shall cease; and Da mountains of Israel shall be desolate, that none shall pass through. 33:29 Then shall they know that I am Da LORD, when I have laid Da land most desolate because of all their abominations which they have committed. 33:30 Also, thou son of man, Da children of thy people still are talking against thee by Da walls and in Da doors of Da houses, and speak one to another, every one to his brother, saying, Come, I pray you, and hear what is Da word that cometh forth from Da LORD. 33:31 And they come unto thee as Da people cometh, and they sit before thee as my people, and they hear thy words, but they will not do them: for with their mouth they shew much love, but their heart goeth after their covetousness. 33:32 And, lo, thou art unto them as a very lovely song of one that hath a pleasant voice, and can play well on an instrument: for they hear thy words, but they do them not. 33:33 And when this cometh to pass, (lo, it will come,) then shall they know that a prophet hath been among them. 34:1 And Da word of Da LORD came unto me, saying, 34:2 Son of man, prophesy against Da shepherds of Israel, prophesy, and say unto them, Thus saith Da Lord GOD unto Da shepherds; Woe be to Da shepherds of Israel that do feed themselves! should not Da shepherds feed Da flocks? 34:3 Ye eat Da fat, and ye clothe you with Da wool, ye kill them that are fed: but ye feed not Da flock. 34:4 The diseased have ye not strengthened, neither have ye healed that which was sick, neither have ye bound up that which was broken, neither have ye brought again that which was driven away, neither have ye sought that which was lost; but with force and with cruelty have ye ruled them. 34:5 And they were scattered, because there is no shepherd: and they became meat to all Da beasts of Da field, when they were scattered. 34:6 My sheep wandered through all Da mountains, and upon every high hill: yea, my flock was scattered upon all Da face of Da earth, and none did search or seek after them. 34:7 Therefore, ye shepherds, hear Da word of Da LORD; 34:8 As I live, saith Da Lord GOD, surely because my flock became a prey, and my flock became meat to every beast of Da field, because there was no shepherd, neither did my shepherds search for my flock, but Da shepherds fed themselves, and fed not my flock; 34:9 Therefore, O ye shepherds, hear Da word of Da LORD; 34:10 Thus saith Da Lord GOD; Behold, I am against Da shepherds; and I will require my flock at their hand, and cause them to cease from feeding Da flock; neither shall Da shepherds feed themselves any more; for I will deliver my flock from their mouth, that they may not be meat for them. 34:11 For thus saith Da Lord GOD; Behold, I, even I, will both search my sheep, and seek them out. 34:12 As a shepherd seeketh out his flock in Da day that he is among his sheep that are scattered; I will feed them with judgment. 34:17 And as for you, O my flock, thus saith Da Lord GOD; Behold, I judge between cattle and cattle, between Da rams and Da he goats. 34:18 Seemeth it a small thing unto you to have eaten up Da good pasture, but ye must tread down with your feet Da residue of your pastures? and to have drunk of Da deep waters, but ye must foul Da residue with your feet? 34:19 And as for my flock, they eat that which ye have trodden with your feet; and they drink that which ye have fouled with your feet. 34:20 Therefore thus saith Da Lord GOD unto them; Behold, I, even I, will judge between Da fat cattle and between Da lean cattle. 34:21 Because ye have thrust with side and with shoulder, and pushed all Da diseased with your horns, till ye have scattered them abroad; 34:22 Therefore will I save my flock, and they shall no more be a prey; and I will judge between cattle and cattle. 34:23 And I will set up one shepherd over them, and he shall feed them, even my servant David; he shall feed them, and he shall be their shepherd. 34:24 And I Da LORD will be their God, and my servant David a prince among them; I Da LORD have spoken it. 34:25 And I will make with them a covenant of peace, and will cause Da evil beasts to cease out of Da land: and they shall dwell safely in Da wilderness, and sleep in Da woods. 34:26 And I will make them and Da places round about my hill a blessing; and I will cause Da shower to come down in his season; there shall be showers of blessing. 34:27 And Da tree of Da field shall yield her fruit, and Da earth shall yield her increase, and they shall be safe in their land, and shall know that I am Da LORD, when I have broken Da bands of their yoke, and delivered them out of Da hand of those that served themselves of them. 34:28 And they shall no more be a prey to Da heathen, neither shall Da beast of Da land devour them; but they shall dwell safely, and none shall make them afraid. 34:29 And I will raise up for them a plant of renown, and they shall be no more consumed with hunger in Da land, neither bear Da shame of Da heathen any more. 34:30 Thus shall they know that I Da LORD their God am with them, and that they, even Da house of Israel, are my people, saith Da Lord GOD. 34:31 And ye my flock, Da flock of my pasture, are men, and I am your God, saith Da Lord GOD. 35:1 Moreover Da word of Da LORD came unto me, saying, 35:2 Son of man, set thy face against mount Seir, and prophesy against it, 35:3 And say unto it, Thus saith Da Lord GOD; Behold, O mount Seir, I am against thee, and I will stretch out mine hand against thee, and I will make thee most desolate. 35:4 I will lay thy cities waste, and thou shalt be desolate, and thou shalt know that I am Da LORD. 35:5 Because thou hast had a perpetual hatred, and hast shed Da blood of Da children of Israel by Da force of Da sword in Da time of their calamity, in Da time that their iniquity had an end: 35:6 Therefore, as I live, saith Da Lord GOD, I will prepare thee unto blood, and blood shall pursue thee: sith thou hast not hated blood, even blood shall pursue thee. 35:7 Thus will I make mount Seir most desolate, and cut off from it him that passeth out and him that returneth. 35:8 And I will fill his mountains with his slain men: in thy hills, and in thy valleys, and in all thy rivers, shall they fall that are slain with Da sword. 35:9 I will make thee perpetual desolations, and thy cities shall not return: and ye shall know that I am Da LORD. 35:10 Because thou hast said, These two nations and these two countries shall be mine, and we will possess it; whereas Da LORD was there: 35:11 Therefore, as I live, saith Da Lord GOD, I will even do according to thine anger, and according to thine envy which thou hast used out of thy hatred against them; and I will make myself known among them, when I have judged thee. 35:12 And thou shalt know that I am Da LORD, and that I have heard all thy blasphemies which thou hast spoken against Da mountains of Israel, saying, They are laid desolate, they are given us to consume. 35:13 Thus with your mouth ye have boasted against me, and have multiplied your words against me: I have heard them. 35:14 Thus saith Da Lord GOD; When Da whole earth rejoiceth, I will make thee desolate. 35:15 As thou didst rejoice at Da inheritance of Da house of Israel, because it was desolate, so will I do unto thee: thou shalt be desolate, O mount Seir, and all Idumea, even all of it: and they shall know that I am Da LORD. 36:1 Also, thou son of man, prophesy unto Da mountains of Israel, and say, Ye mountains of Israel, hear Da word of Da LORD: 36:2 Thus saith Da Lord GOD; 36:5 Therefore thus saith Da Lord GOD; Surely in Da fire of my jealousy have I spoken against Da residue of Da heathen, and against all Idumea, which have appointed my land into their possession with Da joy of all their heart, with despiteful minds, to cast it out for a prey. 36:6 Prophesy therefore concerning Da land of Israel, and say unto Da mountains, and to Da hills, to Da rivers, and to Da valleys, Thus saith Da Lord GOD; I do not this for your sakes, O house of Israel, but for mine holy name’s sake, which ye have profaned among Da heathen, whither ye went. 36:23 And I will sanctify my great name, which was profaned among Da heathen, which ye have profaned in Da midst of them; and Da heathen shall know that I am Da LORD, saith Da Lord GOD, when I shall be sanctified in you before their eyes. 36:24 For I will take you from among Da heathen, and gather you out of all countries, and will bring you into your own land. 36:25 Then will I sprinkle clean water upon you, and ye shall be clean: from all your filthiness, and from all your idols, will I cleanse you. 36:26 A new heart also will I give you, and a new spirit will I put within you: and I will take away Da stony heart out of your flesh, and I will give you an heart of flesh. 36:27 And I will put my spirit within you, and cause you to walk in my statutes, and ye shall keep my judgments, and do them. 36:28 And ye shall dwell in Da land that I gave to your fathers; and ye shall be my people, and I will be your God. 36:29 I will also save you from all your uncleannesses: and I will call for Da corn, and will increase it, and lay no famine upon you. 36:30 And I will multiply Da fruit of Da tree, and Da increase of Da field, that ye shall receive no more reproach of famine among Da heathen. 36:31 Then shall ye remember your own evil ways, and your doings that were not good, and shall lothe yourselves in your own sight for your iniquities and for your abominations. 36:32 Not for your sakes do I this, saith Da Lord GOD, be it known unto you: be ashamed and confounded for your own ways, O house of Israel. 36:33 Thus saith Da Lord GOD; In Da day that I shall have cleansed you from all your iniquities I will also cause you to dwell in Da cities, and Da wastes shall be builded. 36:34 And Da desolate land shall be tilled, whereas it lay desolate in Da sight of all that passed by. 36:35 And they shall say, This land that was desolate is become like Da garden of Eden; and Da waste and desolate and ruined cities are become fenced, and are inhabited. 36:36 Then Da heathen that are left round about you shall know that I Da LORD build Da ruined places, and plant that that was desolate: I Da LORD have spoken it, and I will do it. 36:37 Thus saith Da Lord GOD; and, lo, they were very dry. 37:3 And he said unto me, Son of man, can these bones live? And I answered, O Lord GOD, thou knowest. 37:4 Again he said unto me, Prophesy upon these bones, and say unto them, O ye dry bones, hear Da word of Da LORD. 37:5 Thus saith Da Lord GOD unto these bones; Behold, O my people, I will open your graves, and cause you to come up out of your graves, and bring you into Da land of Israel. 37:13 And ye shall know that I am Da LORD, when I have opened your graves, O my people, and brought you up out of your graves, 37:14 And shall put my spirit in you, and ye shall live, and I shall place you in your own land: then shall ye know that I Da LORD have spoken it, and performed it, saith Da LORD. 37:15 The word of Da LORD came again unto me, saying, 37:16 Moreover, thou son of man, take thee one stick, and write upon it, For Judah, and for Da children of Israel his companions: then take another stick, and write upon it, For Joseph, Da stick of Ephraim and for all Da house of Israel his companions: 37:17 And join them one to another into one stick; and one king shall be king to them all: and they shall be no more two nations, neither shall they be divided into two kingdoms any more at all. 37:23 Neither shall they defile themselves any more with their idols, nor with their detestable things, nor with any of their transgressions: but I will save them out of all their dwellingplaces, wherein they have sinned, and will cleanse them: so shall they be my people, and I will be their God. 37:24 And David my servant shall be king over them; and I fell upon my face. 43:4 And Da glory of Da LORD came into Da house by Da way of Da gate whose prospect is toward Da east. 43:5 So Da spirit took me up, and brought me into Da inner court; and, behold, Da glory of Da LORD filled Da house. 43:6 And I heard him speaking unto me out of Da house; and Da man stood by me. 43:7 And he said unto me, Son of man, Da place of my throne, and Da place of Da soles of my feet, where I will dwell in Da midst of Da children of Israel for ever, and my holy name, shall Da house of Israel no more defile, neither they, nor their kings, by their whoredom, nor by Da carcases of their kings in their high places. 43:8 In their setting of their threshold by my thresholds, and their post by my posts, and Da wall between me and them, they have even defiled my holy name by their abominations that they have committed: wherefore I have consumed them in mine anger. 43:9 Now let them put away their whoredom, and Da carcases of their kings, far from me, and I will dwell in Da midst of them for ever. 43:10 Thou son of man, shew Da house to Da house of Israel, that they may be ashamed of their iniquities: and let them measure Da pattern. 43:11 And if they be ashamed of all that they have done, shew them Da form of Da house, and Da fashion thereof, and Da goings out thereof, and Da comings in thereof, and all Da forms thereof, and all Da ordinances thereof, and all Da forms thereof, and all Da laws thereof: and write it in their sight, that they may keep Da whole form thereof, and all Da ordinances thereof, and do them. 43:12 This is Da law of Da house; and they shall cleanse Da altar, as they did cleanse it with Da bullock. 43:23 When thou hast made an end of cleansing it, thou shalt offer a young bullock without blemish, and a ram out of Da flock without blemish. 43:24 And thou shalt offer them before Da LORD, and Da priests shall cast salt upon them, and they shall offer them up for a burnt offering unto Da LORD. 43:25 Seven days shalt thou prepare every day a goat for a sin offering: they shall also prepare a young bullock, and a ram out of Da flock, without blemish. 43:26 Seven days shall they purge Da altar and purify it; and they shall consecrate themselves. 43:27 And when these days are expired, it shall be, that upon Da eighth day, and so forward, Da priests shall make your burnt offerings upon Da altar, and your peace offerings; they shall not gird themselves with any thing that causeth sweat. 44:19 And when they go forth into Da utter court, even into Da utter court to Da people, they shall put off their garments wherein they ministered, and lay them in Da holy chambers, and they shall put on other garments; and they shall not sanctify Da people with their garments. 44:20 Neither shall they shave their heads, nor suffer their locks to grow long; they shall only poll their heads. 44:21 Neither shall any priest drink wine, when they enter into Da inner court. 44:22 Neither shall they take for their wives a widow, nor her that is put away: but they shall take maidens of Da seed of Da house of Israel, or a widow that had a priest before. 44:23 And they shall teach my people Da difference between Da holy and profane, and cause them to discern between Da unclean and Da clean. 44:24 And in controversy they shall stand in judgment; and they shall judge it according to my judgments: and they shall keep my laws and my statutes in all mine assemblies; and they shall hallow my sabbaths. 44:25 And they shall come at no dead person to defile themselves: but for father, or for mother, or for son, or for daughter, for brother, or for sister that hath had no husband, they may defile themselves. 44:26 And after he is cleansed, they shall reckon unto him seven days. 44:27 And in Da day that he goeth into Da sanctuary, unto Da inner court, to minister in Da sanctuary, he shall offer his sin offering, saith Da Lord GOD. 44:28 And it shall be unto them for an inheritance: I am their inheritance: and ye shall give them no possession in Israel: I am their possession. 44:29 They shall eat Da meat offering, and Da sin offering, and Da trespass offering: and every dedicated thing in Israel shall be theirs. 44:30 And Da first of all Da firstfruits of all things, and every oblation of all, of every sort of your oblations, shall be Da priest’s: ye shall also give unto Da priest Da first of your dough, that he may cause Da blessing to rest in thine house. 44:31 The priests shall not eat of any thing that is dead of itself, or torn, whether it be fowl or beast. 45:1 Moreover, when ye shall divide by lot Da land for inheritance, ye shall offer an oblation unto Da LORD, an holy portion of Da land: Da length shall be Da length of five and twenty thousand reeds, and Da breadth shall be ten thousand. This shall be holy in all Da borders thereof round about. 45:2 Of this there shall be for Da sanctuary five hundred in length, with five hundred in breadth, square round about; and fifty cubits round about for Da suburbs thereof. 45:3 And of this measure shalt thou measure Da length of five and twenty thousand, and Da breadth of ten thousand: and in it shall be Da sanctuary and Da most holy place. 45:4 The holy portion of Da land shall be for Da priests Da ministers of Da sanctuary, which shall come near to minister unto Da LORD: and it shall be a place for their houses, and an holy place for Da sanctuary. 45:5 And Da five and twenty thousand of length, and Da ten thousand of breadth shall also Da Levites, Da ministers of Da house, have for themselves, for a possession for twenty chambers. 45:6 And ye shall appoint Da possession of Da city five thousand broad, and five and twenty thousand long, over against Da oblation of Da holy portion: it shall be for Da whole house of Israel. 45:7 And a portion shall be for Da prince on Da one side and on Da other side of Da oblation of Da holy portion, and of Da possession of Da city, before Da oblation of Da holy portion, and before Da possession of Da city, from Da west side westward, and from Da east side eastward: and Da length shall be over against one of Da portions, from Da west border unto Da east border. 45:8 In Da land shall be his possession in Israel: and my princes shall no more oppress my people; and Da rest of Da land shall they give to Da house of Israel according to their tribes. 45:9 Thus saith Da Lord GOD; Let it suffice you, O princes of Israel: remove violence and spoil, and execute judgment and justice, take away your exactions from my people, saith Da Lord GOD. 45:10 Ye shall have just balances, and a just ephah, and a just bath. 45:11 The ephah and Da bath shall be of one measure, that Da bath may contain Da tenth part of an homer, and Da ephah Da tenth part of an homer: Da measure thereof shall be after Da homer. 45:12 And Da shekel shall be twenty gerahs: twenty shekels, five and twenty shekels, fifteen shekels, shall be your maneh. 45:13 This is Da oblation that ye shall offer; Da sixth part of an ephah of an homer of wheat, and ye shall give Da sixth part of an ephah of an homer of barley: 45:14 Concerning Da ordinance of oil, Da bath of oil, ye shall offer Da tenth part of a bath out of Da cor, which is an homer of ten baths; for ten baths are an homer: 45:15 And one lamb out of Da flock, out of two hundred, out of Da fat pastures of Israel; for a meat offering, and for a burnt offering, and for peace offerings, to make reconciliation for them, saith Da Lord GOD. 45:16 All Da people of Da land shall give this oblation for Da prince in Israel. 45:17 And it shall be Da prince’s part to give burnt offerings, and meat offerings, and drink offerings, in Da feasts, and in Da new moons, and in Da sabbaths, in all solemnities of Da house of Israel: he shall prepare Da sin offering, and Da meat offering, and Da burnt offering, and Da peace offerings, to make reconciliation for Da house of Israel. 45:18 Thus saith Da Lord GOD; In Da first month, in Da first day of Da month, thou shalt take a young bullock without blemish, and cleanse Da sanctuary: 45:19 And Da priest shall take of Da blood of Da sin offering, and put it upon Da posts of Da house, and upon Da four corners of Da settle of Da altar, and upon Da posts of Da gate of Da inner court. 45:20 And so thou shalt do Da seventh day of Da month for every one that erreth, and for him that is simple: so shall ye reconcile Da house. 45:21 In Da first month, in Da fourteenth day of Da month, ye shall have Da passover, a feast of seven days; unleavened bread shall be eaten. 45:22 And upon that day shall Da prince prepare for himself and for all Da people of Da land a bullock for a sin offering. 45:23 And seven days of Da feast he shall prepare a burnt offering to Da LORD, seven bullocks and seven rams without blemish daily Da seven days; and a kid of Da goats daily for a sin offering. 45:24 And he shall prepare a meat offering of an ephah for a bullock, and an ephah for a ram, and an hin of oil for an ephah. 45:25 In Da seventh month, in Da fifteenth day of Da month, shall he do Da like in Da feast of Da seven days, according to Da sin offering, according to Da burnt offering, and according to Da meat offering, and according to Da oil. 46:1 Thus saith Da Lord GOD; The gate of Da inner court that looketh toward Da east shall be shut Da six working days; but on Da sabbath it shall be opened, and in Da day of Da new moon it shall be opened. 46:2 And Da prince shall enter by Da way of Da porch of that gate without, and shall stand by Da post of Da gate, and Da priests shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings, and he shall worship at Da threshold of Da gate: then he shall go forth; but Da gate shall not be shut until Da evening. 46:3 Likewise Da people of Da land shall worship at Da door of this gate before Da LORD in Da sabbaths and in Da new moons. 46:4 And Da burnt offering that Da prince shall offer unto Da LORD in Da sabbath day shall be six lambs without blemish, and a ram without blemish. 46:5 And Da meat offering shall be an ephah for a ram, and Da meat offering for Da lambs as he shall be able to give, and an hin of oil to an ephah. 46:6 And in Da day of Da new moon it shall be a young bullock without blemish, and six lambs, and a ram: they shall be without blemish. 46:7 And he shall prepare a meat offering, an ephah for a bullock, and an ephah for a ram, and for Da lambs according as his hand shall attain unto, and an hin of oil to an ephah. 46:8 And when Da prince shall enter, he shall go in by Da way of Da porch of that gate, and he shall go forth by Da way thereof. 46:9 But when Da people of Da land shall come before Da LORD in Da solemn feasts, he that entereth in by Da way of Da north gate to worship shall go out by Da way of Da south gate; and he that entereth by Da way of Da south gate shall go forth by Da way of Da north gate: he shall not return by Da way of Da gate whereby he came in, but shall go forth over against it. 46:10 And Da prince in Da midst of them, when they go in, shall go in; and when they go forth, shall go forth. 46:11 And in Da feasts and in Da solemnities Da meat offering shall be an ephah to a bullock, and an ephah to a ram, and to Da lambs as he is able to give, and an hin of oil to an ephah. 46:12 Now when Da prince shall prepare a voluntary burnt offering or peace offerings voluntarily unto Da LORD, one shall then open him Da gate that looketh toward Da east, and he shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings, as he did on Da sabbath day: then he shall go forth; and after his going forth one shall shut Da gate. 46:13 Thou shalt daily prepare a burnt offering unto Da LORD of a lamb of Da first year without blemish: thou shalt prepare it every morning. 46:14 And thou shalt prepare a meat offering for it every morning, Da sixth part of an ephah, and Da third part of an hin of oil, to temper with Da fine flour; a meat offering continually by a perpetual ordinance unto Da LORD. 46:15 Thus shall they prepare Da lamb, and Da meat offering, and Da oil, every morning for a continual burnt offering. 46:16 Thus saith Da Lord GOD; If Da prince give a gift unto any of his sons, Da inheritance thereof shall be his sons’; it shall be their possession by inheritance. 46:17 But if he give a gift of his inheritance to one of his servants, then it shall be his to Da year of liberty; after it shall return to Da prince: but his inheritance shall be his sons’ for them. 46:18 Moreover Da prince shall not take of Da people’s inheritance by oppression, to thrust them out of their possession; but he shall give his sons inheritance out of his own possession: that my people be not scattered every man from his possession. 46:19 After he brought me through Da entry, which was at Da side of Da gate, into Da holy chambers of Da priests, which looked toward Da north: and, behold, there was a place on Da two sides westward. 46:20 Then said he unto me, This is Da place where Da priests shall boil Da trespass offering and Da sin offering, where they shall bake Da meat offering; that they bear them not out into Da utter court, to sanctify Da people. 46:21 Then he brought me forth into Da utter court, and caused me to pass by Da four corners of Da court; and, behold, in every corner of Da court there was a court. 46:22 In Da four corners of Da court there were courts joined of forty cubits long and thirty broad: these four corners were of one measure. 46:23 And there was a row of building round about in them, round about them four, and it was made with boiling places under Da rows round about. 46:24 Then said he unto me, These are Da places of them that boil, where Da ministers of Da house shall boil Da sacrifice of Da people. 47:1 Afterward he brought me again unto Da door of Da house; and, behold, waters issued out from under Da threshold of Da house eastward: for Da forefront of Da house stood toward Da east, and Da waters came down from under from Da right side of Da house, at Da south side of Da altar. 47:2 Then brought he me out of Da way of Da gate northward, and led me about Da way without unto Da utter gate by Da way that looketh eastward; and, behold, there ran out waters on Da right side. 47:3 And when Da man that had Da line in his hand went forth eastward, he measured a thousand cubits, and he brought me through Da waters; Da waters were to Da ankles. 47:4 Again he measured a thousand, and brought me through Da waters; Da waters were to Da knees. Again he measured a thousand, and brought me through; Da waters were to Da loins. 47:5 Afterward he measured a thousand; and it was a river that I could not pass over: for Da waters were risen, waters to swim in, a river that could not be passed over. 47:6 And he said unto me, Son of man, hast thou seen this? Then he brought me, and caused me to return to Da brink of Da river. 47:7 Now when I had returned, behold, at Da bank of Da river were very many trees on Da one side and on Da other. 47:8 Then said he unto me, These waters issue out toward Da east country, and go down into Da desert, and go into Da sea: which being brought forth into Da sea, Da waters shall be healed. 47:9 And it shall come to pass, that every thing that liveth, which moveth, whithersoever Da rivers shall come, shall live: and there shall be a very great multitude of fish, because these waters shall come thither: for they shall be healed; and every thing shall live whither Da river cometh. 47:10 And it shall come to pass, that Da fishers shall stand upon it from Engedi even unto Eneglaim; they shall be a place to spread forth nets; their fish shall be according to their kinds, as Da fish of Da great sea, exceeding many. 47:11 But Da miry places thereof and Da marishes thereof shall not be healed; they shall be given to salt. 47:12 And by Da river upon Da bank thereof, on this side and on that side, shall grow all trees for meat, whose leaf shall not fade, neither shall Da fruit thereof be consumed: it shall bring forth new fruit according to his months, because their waters they issued out of Da sanctuary: and Da fruit thereof shall be for meat, and Da leaf thereof for medicine. 47:13 Thus saith Da Lord GOD; This shall be Da border, whereby ye shall inherit Da land according to Da twelve tribes of Israel: Joseph shall have two portions. 47:14 And ye shall inherit it, one as well as another: concerning Da which I lifted up mine hand to give it unto your fathers: and this land shall fall unto you for inheritance. 47:15 And this shall be Da border of Da land toward Da north side, from Da great sea, Da way of Hethlon, as men go to Zedad; 47:16 Hamath, Berothah, Sibraim, which is between Da border of Damascus and Da border of Hamath; Hazarhatticon, which is by Da coast of Hauran. 47:17 And Da border from Da sea shall be Hazarenan, Da border of Damascus, and Da north northward, and Da border of Hamath. And this is Da north side. 47:18 And Da east side ye shall measure from Hauran, and from Damascus, and from Gilead, and from Da land of Israel by Jordan, from Da border unto Da east sea. And this is Da east side. 47:19 And Da south side southward, from Tamar even to Da waters of strife in Kadesh, Da river to Da great sea. And this is Da south side southward. 47:20 The west side also shall be Da great sea from Da border, till a man come over against Hamath. This is Da west side. 47:21 So shall ye divide this land unto you according to Da tribes of Israel. 47:22 And it shall come to pass, that ye shall divide it by lot for an inheritance unto you, and to Da strangers that sojourn among you, which shall beget children among you: and they shall be unto you as born in Da country among Da children of Israel; they shall have inheritance with you among Da tribes of Israel. 47:23 And it shall come to pass, that in what tribe Da stranger sojourneth, there shall ye give him his inheritance, saith Da Lord GOD. 48:1 Now these are Da names of Da tribes. From Da north end to Da coast of Da way of Hethlon, as one goeth to Hamath, Hazarenan, Da border of Damascus northward, to Da coast of Hamath; for these are his sides east and west; a portion for Dan. 48:2 And by Da border of Dan, from Da east side unto Da west side, a portion for Asher. 48:3 And by Da border of Asher, from Da east side even unto Da west side, a portion for Naphtali. 48:4 And by Da border of Naphtali, from Da east side unto Da west side, a portion for Manasseh. 48:5 And by Da border of Manasseh, from Da east side unto Da west side, a portion for Ephraim. 48:6 And by Da border of Ephraim, from Da east side even unto Da west side, a portion for Reuben. 48:7 And by Da border of Reuben, from Da east side unto Da west side, a portion for Judah. 48:8 And by Da border of Judah, from Da east side unto Da west side, shall be Da offering which ye shall offer of five and twenty thousand reeds in breadth, and in length as one of Da other parts, from Da east side unto Da west side: and Da sanctuary shall be in Da midst of it. 48:9 The oblation that ye shall offer unto Da LORD shall be of five and twenty thousand in length, and of ten thousand in breadth. 48:10 And for them, even for Da priests, shall be this holy oblation; toward Da north five and twenty thousand in length, and toward Da west ten thousand in breadth, and toward Da east ten thousand in breadth, and toward Da south five and twenty thousand in length: and Da sanctuary of Da LORD shall be in Da midst thereof. 48:11 It shall be for Da priests that are sanctified of Da sons of Zadok; which have kept my charge, which went not astray when Da children of Israel went astray, as Da Levites went astray. 48:12 And this oblation of Da land that is offered shall be unto them a thing most holy by Da border of Da Levites. 48:13 And over against Da border of Da priests Da Levites shall have five and twenty thousand in length, and ten thousand in breadth: all Da length shall be five and twenty thousand, and Da breadth ten thousand. 48:14 And they shall not sell of it, neither exchange, nor alienate Da firstfruits of Da land: for it is holy unto Da LORD. 48:15 And Da five thousand, that are left in Da breadth over against Da five and twenty thousand, shall be a profane place for Da city, for dwelling, and for suburbs: and Da city shall be in Da midst thereof. 48:16 And these shall be Da measures thereof; Da north side four thousand and five hundred, and Da south side four thousand and five hundred, and on Da east side four thousand and five hundred, and Da west side four thousand and five hundred. 48:17 And Da suburbs of Da city shall be toward Da north two hundred and fifty, and toward Da south two hundred and fifty, and toward Da east two hundred and fifty, and toward Da west two hundred and fifty. 48:18 And Da residue in length over against Da oblation of Da holy portion shall be ten thousand eastward, and ten thousand westward: and it shall be over against Da oblation of Da holy portion; and Da increase thereof shall be for food unto them that serve Da city. 48:19 And they that serve Da city shall serve it out of all Da tribes of Israel. 48:20 All Da oblation shall be five and twenty thousand by five and twenty thousand: ye shall offer Da holy oblation foursquare, with Da possession of Da city. 48:21 And Da residue shall be for Da prince, on Da one side and on Da other of Da holy oblation, and of Da possession of Da city, over against Da five and twenty thousand of Da oblation toward Da east border, and westward over against Da five and twenty thousand toward Da west border, over against Da portions for Da prince: and it shall be Da holy oblation; and Da sanctuary of Da house shall be in Da midst thereof. 48:22 Moreover from Da possession of Da Levites, and from Da possession of Da city, being in Da midst of that which is Da prince’s, between Da border of Judah and Da border of Benjamin, shall be for Da prince. 48:23 As for Da rest of Da tribes, from Da east side unto Da west side, Benjamin shall have a portion. 48:24 And by Da border of Benjamin, from Da east side unto Da west side, Simeon shall have a portion. 48:25 And by Da border of Simeon, from Da east side unto Da west side, Issachar a portion. 48:26 And by Da border of Issachar, from Da east side unto Da west side, Zebulun a portion. 48:27 And by Da border of Zebulun, from Da east side unto Da west side, Gad a portion. 48:28 And by Da border of Gad, at Da south side southward, Da border shall be even from Tamar unto Da waters of strife in Kadesh, and to Da river toward Da great sea. 48:29 This is Da land which ye shall divide by lot unto Da tribes of Israel for inheritance, and these are their portions, saith Da Lord GOD. 48:30 And these are Da goings out of Da city on Da north side, four thousand and five hundred measures. 48:31 And Da gates of Da city shall be after Da names of Da tribes of Israel: three gates northward; one gate of Reuben, one gate of Judah, one gate of Levi. 48:32 And at Da east side four thousand and five hundred: and three gates; and one gate of Joseph, one gate of Benjamin, one gate of Dan. 48:33 And at Da south side four thousand and five hundred measures: and three gates; one gate of Simeon, one gate of Issachar, one gate of Zebulun. 48:34 At Da west side four thousand and five hundred, with their three gates; one gate of Gad, one gate of Asher, one gate of Naphtali. 48:35 It was round about eighteen thousand measures: and Da name of Da city from that day shall be, The LORD is there.
