The Book of Daniel 1:1 In Da third year of Da reign of Jehoiakim king of Judah came Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon unto Jerusalem, and besieged it. 1:2 And Da Lord gave Jehoiakim king of Judah into his hand, with part of Da vessels of Da house of God: which he carried into Da land of Shinar to Da house of his god; and he brought Da vessels into Da treasure house of his god. 1:3 And Da king spake unto Ashpenaz Da master of his eunuchs, that he should bring certain of Da children of Israel, and of Da king’s seed, and of Da princes; 1:4 Children in whom was no blemish, but well favoured, and skilful in all wisdom, and cunning in knowledge, and understanding science, and such as had ability in them to stand in Da king’s palace, and whom they might teach Da learning and Da tongue of Da Chaldeans. 1:5 And Da king appointed them a daily provision of Da king’s meat, and of Da wine which he drank: so nourishing them three years, that at Da end thereof they might stand before Da king. 1:6 Now among these were of Da children of Judah, Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah: 1:7 Unto whom Da prince of Da eunuchs gave names: for he gave unto Daniel Da name of Belteshazzar; and to Hananiah, of Shadrach; and to Mishael, of Meshach; and to Azariah, of Abednego. 1:8 But Daniel purposed in his heart that he would not defile himself with Da portion of Da king’s meat, nor with Da wine which he drank: therefore he requested of Da prince of Da eunuchs that he might not defile himself. 1:9 Now God had brought Daniel into favour and tender love with Da prince of Da eunuchs. 1:10 And Da prince of Da eunuchs said unto Daniel, I fear my lord Da king, who hath appointed your meat and your drink: for why should he see your faces worse liking than Da children which are of your sort? then shall ye make me endanger my head to Da king. 1:11 Then said Daniel to Melzar, whom Da prince of Da eunuchs had set over Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah, 1:12 Prove thy servants, I beseech thee, ten days; and let them give us pulse to eat, and water to drink. 1:13 Then let our countenances be looked upon before thee, and Da countenance of Da children that eat of Da portion of Da king’s meat: and as thou seest, deal with thy servants. 1:14 So he consented to them in this matter, and proved them ten days. 1:15 And at Da end of ten days their countenances appeared fairer and fatter in flesh than all Da children which did eat Da portion of Da king’s meat. 1:16 Thus Melzar took away Da portion of their meat, and Da wine that they should drink; and gave them pulse. 1:17 As for these four children, God gave them knowledge and skill in all learning and wisdom: and Daniel had understanding in all visions and dreams. 1:18 Now at Da end of Da days that Da king had said he should bring them in, then Da prince of Da eunuchs brought them in before Nebuchadnezzar. 1:19 And Da king communed with them; and among them all was found none like Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah: therefore stood they before Da king. 1:20 And in all matters of wisdom and understanding, that Da king enquired of them, he found them ten times better than all Da magicians and astrologers that were in all his realm. 1:21 And Daniel continued even unto Da first year of king Cyrus. 2:1 And in Da second year of Da reign of Nebuchadnezzar Nebuchadnezzar dreamed dreams, wherewith his spirit was troubled, and his sleep brake from him. 2:2 Then Da king commanded to call Da magicians, and Da astrologers, and Da sorcerers, and Da Chaldeans, for to shew Da king his dreams. So they came and stood before Da king. 2:3 And Da king said unto them, I have dreamed a dream, and my spirit was troubled to know Da dream. 2:4 Then spake Da Chaldeans to Da king in Syriack, O king, live for ever: tell thy servants Da dream, and we will shew Da interpretation. 2:5 The king answered and said to Da Chaldeans, The thing is gone from me: if ye will not make known unto me Da dream, with Da interpretation thereof, ye shall be cut in pieces, and your houses shall be made a dunghill. 2:6 But if ye shew Da dream, and Da interpretation thereof, ye shall receive of me gifts and rewards and great honour: therefore shew me Da dream, and Da interpretation thereof. 2:7 They answered again and said, Let Da king tell his servants Da dream, and we will shew Da interpretation of it. 2:8 The king answered and said, I know of certainty that ye would gain Da time, because ye see Da thing is gone from me. 2:9 But if ye will not make known unto me Da dream, there is but one decree for you: for ye have prepared lying and corrupt words to speak before me, till Da time be changed: therefore tell me Da dream, and I shall know that ye can shew me Da interpretation thereof. 2:10 The Chaldeans answered before Da king, and said, There is not a man upon Da earth that can shew Da king’s matter: therefore there is no king, lord, nor ruler, that asked such things at any magician, or astrologer, or Chaldean. 2:11 And it is a rare thing that Da king requireth, and there is none other that can shew it before Da king, except Da gods, whose dwelling is not with flesh. 2:12 For this cause Da king was angry and very furious, and commanded to destroy all Da wise men of Babylon. 2:13 And Da decree went forth that Da wise men should be slain; and they sought Daniel and his fellows to be slain. 2:14 Then Daniel answered with counsel and wisdom to Arioch Da captain of Da king’s guard, which was gone forth to slay Da wise men of Babylon: 2:15 He answered and said to Arioch Da king’s captain, Why is Da decree so hasty from Da king? Then Arioch made Da thing known to Daniel. 2:16 Then Daniel went in, and desired of Da king that he would give him time, and that he would shew Da king Da interpretation. 2:17 Then Daniel went to his house, and made Da thing known to Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah, his companions: 2:18 That they would desire mercies of Da God of heaven concerning this secret; that Daniel and his fellows should not perish with Da rest of Da wise men of Babylon. 2:19 Then was Da secret revealed unto Daniel in a night vision. Then Daniel blessed Da God of heaven. 2:20 Daniel answered and said, Blessed be Da name of God for ever and ever: for wisdom and might are his: 2:21 And he changeth Da times and Da seasons: he removeth kings, and setteth up kings: he giveth wisdom unto Da wise, and knowledge to them that know understanding: 2:22 He revealeth Da deep and secret things: he knoweth what is in Da darkness, and Da light dwelleth with him. 2:23 I thank thee, and praise thee, O thou God of my fathers, who hast given me wisdom and might, and hast made known unto me now what we desired of thee: for thou hast now made known unto us Da king’s matter. 2:24 Therefore Daniel went in unto Arioch, whom Da king had ordained to destroy Da wise men of Babylon: he went and said thus unto him; Destroy not Da wise men of Babylon: bring me in before Da king, and I will shew unto Da king Da interpretation. 2:25 Then Arioch brought in Daniel before Da king in haste, and said thus unto him, I have found a man of Da captives of Judah, that will make known unto Da king Da interpretation. 2:26 The king answered and said to Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar, Art thou able to make known unto me Da dream which I have seen, and Da interpretation thereof? 2:27 Daniel answered in Da presence of Da king, and said, The secret which Da king hath demanded cannot Da wise men, Da astrologers, Da magicians, Da soothsayers, shew unto Da king; 2:28 But there is a God in heaven that revealeth secrets, and maketh known to Da king Nebuchadnezzar what shall be in Da latter days. Thy dream, and Da visions of thy head upon thy bed, are these; 2:29 As for thee, O king, thy thoughts came into thy mind upon thy bed, what should come to pass hereafter: and he that revealeth secrets maketh known to thee what shall come to pass. 2:30 But as for me, this secret is not revealed to me for any wisdom that I have more than any living, but for their sakes that shall make known Da interpretation to Da king, and that thou mightest know Da thoughts of thy heart. 2:31 Thou, O king, sawest, and behold a great image. This great image, whose brightness was excellent, stood before thee; and Da form thereof was terrible. 2:32 This image’s head was of fine gold, his breast and his arms of silver, his belly and his thighs of brass, 2:33 His legs of iron, his feet part of iron and part of clay. 2:34 Thou sawest till that a stone was cut out without hands, which smote Da image upon his feet that were of iron and clay, and brake them to pieces. 2:35 Then was Da iron, Da clay, Da brass, Da silver, and Da gold, broken to pieces together, and became like Da chaff of Da summer threshingfloors; and Da wind carried them away, that no place was found for them: and Da stone that smote Da image became a great mountain, and filled Da whole earth. 2:36 This is Da dream; and we will tell Da interpretation thereof before Da king. 2:37 Thou, O king, art a king of kings: for Da God of heaven hath given thee a kingdom, power, and strength, and glory. 2:38 And wheresoever Da children of men dwell, Da beasts of Da field and Da fowls of Da heaven hath he given into thine hand, and hath made thee ruler over them all. Thou art this head of gold. 2:39 And after thee shall arise another kingdom inferior to thee, and another third kingdom of brass, which shall bear rule over all Da earth. 2:40 And Da fourth kingdom shall be strong as iron: forasmuch as iron breaketh in pieces and subdueth all things: and as iron that breaketh all these, shall it break in pieces and bruise. 2:41 And whereas thou sawest Da feet and toes, part of potters’ clay, and part of iron, Da kingdom shall be divided; but there shall be in it of Da strength of Da iron, forasmuch as thou sawest Da iron mixed with miry clay. 2:42 And as Da toes of Da feet were part of iron, and part of clay, so Da kingdom shall be partly strong, and partly broken. 2:43 And whereas thou sawest iron mixed with miry clay, they shall mingle themselves with Da seed of men: but they shall not cleave one to another, even as iron is not mixed with clay. 2:44 And in Da days of these kings shall Da God of heaven set up a kingdom, which shall never be destroyed: and Da kingdom shall not be left to other people, but it shall break in pieces and consume all these kingdoms, and it shall stand for ever. 2:45 Forasmuch as thou sawest that Da stone was cut out of Da mountain without hands, and that it brake in pieces Da iron, Da brass, Da clay, Da silver, and Da gold; Da great God hath made known to Da king what shall come to pass hereafter: and Da dream is certain, and Da interpretation thereof sure. 2:46 Then Da king Nebuchadnezzar fell upon his face, and worshipped Daniel, and commanded that they should offer an oblation and sweet odours unto him. 2:47 The king answered unto Daniel, and said, Of a truth it is, that your God is a God of gods, and a Lord of kings, and a revealer of secrets, seeing thou couldest reveal this secret. 2:48 Then Da king made Daniel a great man, and gave him many great gifts, and made him ruler over Da whole province of Babylon, and chief of Da governors over all Da wise men of Babylon. 2:49 Then Daniel requested of Da king, and he set Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, over Da affairs of Da province of Babylon: but Daniel sat in Da gate of Da king. 3:1 Nebuchadnezzar Da king made an image of gold, whose height was threescore cubits, and Da breadth thereof six cubits: he set it up in Da plain of Dura, in Da province of Babylon. 3:2 Then Nebuchadnezzar Da king sent to gather together Da princes, Da governors, and Da captains, Da judges, Da treasurers, Da counsellors, Da sheriffs, and all Da rulers of Da provinces, to come to Da dedication of Da image which Nebuchadnezzar Da king had set up. 3:3 Then Da princes, Da governors, and captains, Da judges, Da treasurers, Da counsellors, Da sheriffs, and all Da rulers of Da provinces, were gathered together unto Da dedication of Da image that Nebuchadnezzar Da king had set up; and they stood before Da image that Nebuchadnezzar had set up. 3:4 Then an herald cried aloud, To you it is commanded, O people, nations, and languages, 3:5 That at what time ye hear Da sound of Da cornet, flute, harp, sackbut, psaltery, dulcimer, and all kinds of musick, ye fall down and worship Da golden image that Nebuchadnezzar Da king hath set up: 3:6 And whoso falleth not down and worshippeth shall Da same hour be cast into Da midst of a burning fiery furnace. 3:7 Therefore at that time, when all Da people heard Da sound of Da cornet, flute, harp, sackbut, psaltery, and all kinds of musick, all Da people, Da nations, and Da languages, fell down and worshipped Da golden image that Nebuchadnezzar Da king had set up. 3:8 Wherefore at that time certain Chaldeans came near, and accused Da Jews. 3:9 They spake and said to Da king Nebuchadnezzar, O king, live for ever. 3:10 Thou, O king, hast made a decree, that every man that shall hear Da sound of Da cornet, flute, harp, sackbut, psaltery, and dulcimer, and all kinds of musick, shall fall down and worship Da golden image: 3:11 And whoso falleth not down and worshippeth, that he should be cast into Da midst of a burning fiery furnace. 3:12 There are certain Jews whom thou hast set over Da affairs of Da province of Babylon, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego; these men, O king, have not regarded thee: they serve not thy gods, nor worship Da golden image which thou hast set up. 3:13 Then Nebuchadnezzar in his rage and fury commanded to bring Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego. Then they brought these men before Da king. 3:14 Nebuchadnezzar spake and said unto them, Is it true, O Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, do not ye serve my gods, nor worship Da golden image which I have set up? 3:15 Now if ye be ready that at what time ye hear Da sound of Da cornet, flute, harp, sackbut, psaltery, and dulcimer, and all kinds of musick, ye fall down and worship Da image which I have made; well: but if ye worship not, ye shall be cast Da same hour into Da midst of a burning fiery furnace; and who is that God that shall deliver you out of my hands? 3:16 Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, answered and said to Da king, O Nebuchadnezzar, we are not careful to answer thee in this matter. 3:17 If it be so, our God whom we serve is able to deliver us from Da burning fiery furnace, and he will deliver us out of thine hand, O king. 3:18 But if not, be it known unto thee, O king, that we will not serve thy gods, nor worship Da golden image which thou hast set up. 3:19 Then was Nebuchadnezzar full of fury, and Da form of his visage was changed against Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego: therefore he spake, and commanded that they should heat Da furnace one seven times more than it was wont to be heated. 3:20 And he commanded Da most mighty men that were in his army to bind Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, and to cast them into Da burning fiery furnace. 3:21 Then these men were bound in their coats, their hosen, and their hats, and their other garments, and were cast into Da midst of Da burning fiery furnace. 3:22 Therefore because Da king’s commandment was urgent, and Da furnace exceeding hot, Da flames of Da fire slew those men that took up Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego. 3:23 And these three men, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, fell down bound into Da midst of Da burning fiery furnace. 3:24 Then Nebuchadnezzar Da king was astonied, and rose up in haste, and spake, and said unto his counsellors, Did not we cast three men bound into Da midst of Da fire? They answered and said unto Da king, True, O king. 3:25 He answered and said, Lo, I see four men loose, walking in Da midst of Da fire, and they have no hurt; and Da form of Da fourth is like Da Son of God. 3:26 Then Nebuchadnezzar came near to Da mouth of Da burning fiery furnace, and spake, and said, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, ye servants of Da most high God, come forth, and come hither. Then Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, came forth of Da midst of Da fire. 3:27 And Da princes, governors, and captains, and Da king’s counsellors, being gathered together, saw these men, upon whose bodies Da fire had no power, nor was an hair of their head singed, neither were their coats changed, nor Da smell of fire had passed on them. 3:28 Then Nebuchadnezzar spake, and said, Blessed be Da God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, who hath sent his angel, and delivered his servants that trusted in him, and have changed Da king’s word, and yielded their bodies, that they might not serve nor worship any god, except their own God. 3:29 Therefore I make a decree, That every people, nation, and language, which speak any thing amiss against Da God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, shall be cut in pieces, and their houses shall be made a dunghill: because there is no other God that can deliver after this sort. 3:30 Then Da king promoted Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, in Da province of Babylon. 4:1 Nebuchadnezzar Da king, unto all people, nations, and languages, that dwell in all Da earth; Peace be multiplied unto you. 4:2 I thought it good to shew Da signs and wonders that Da high God hath wrought toward me. 4:3 How great are his signs! and how mighty are his wonders! his kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and his dominion is from generation to generation. 4:4 I Nebuchadnezzar was at rest in mine house, and flourishing in my palace: 4:5 I saw a dream which made me afraid, and Da thoughts upon my bed and Da visions of my head troubled me. 4:6 Therefore made I a decree to bring in all Da wise men of Babylon before me, that they might make known unto me Da interpretation of Da dream. 4:7 Then came in Da magicians, Da astrologers, Da Chaldeans, and Da soothsayers: and I told Da dream before them; but they did not make known unto me Da interpretation thereof. 4:8 But at Da last Daniel came in before me, whose name was Belteshazzar, according to Da name of my God, and in whom is Da spirit of Da holy gods: and before him I told Da dream, saying, 4:9 O Belteshazzar, master of Da magicians, because I know that Da spirit of Da holy gods is in thee, and no secret troubleth thee, tell me Da visions of my dream that I have seen, and Da interpretation thereof. 4:10 Thus were Da visions of mine head in my bed; I saw, and behold a tree in Da midst of Da earth, and Da height thereof was great. 4:11 The tree grew, and was strong, and Da height thereof reached unto heaven, and Da sight thereof to Da end of all Da earth: 4:12 The leaves thereof were fair, and Da fruit thereof much, and in it was meat for all: Da beasts of Da field had shadow under it, and Da fowls of Da heaven dwelt in Da boughs thereof, and all flesh was fed of it. 4:13 I saw in Da visions of my head upon my bed, and, behold, a watcher and an holy one came down from heaven; 4:14 He cried aloud, and said thus, Hew down Da tree, and cut off his branches, shake off his leaves, and scatter his fruit: let Da beasts get away from under it, and Da fowls from his branches: 4:15 Nevertheless leave Da stump of his roots in Da earth, even with a band of iron and brass, in Da tender grass of Da field; and let it be wet with Da dew of heaven, and let his portion be with Da beasts in Da grass of Da earth: 4:16 Let his heart be changed from man’s, and let a beast’s heart be given unto him; and let seven times pass over him. 4:17 This matter is by Da decree of Da watchers, and Da demand by Da word of Da holy ones: to Da intent that Da living may know that Da most High ruleth in Da kingdom of men, and giveth it to whomsoever he will, and setteth up over it Da basest of men. 4:18 This dream I king Nebuchadnezzar have seen. Now thou, O Belteshazzar, declare Da interpretation thereof, forasmuch as all Da wise men of my kingdom are not able to make known unto me Da interpretation: but thou art able; for Da spirit of Da holy gods is in thee. 4:19 Then Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar, was astonied for one hour, and his thoughts troubled him. The king spake, and said, Belteshazzar, let not Da dream, or Da interpretation thereof, trouble thee. Belteshazzar answered and said, My lord, Da dream be to them that hate thee, and Da interpretation thereof to thine enemies. 4:20 The tree that thou sawest, which grew, and was strong, whose height reached unto Da heaven, and Da sight thereof to all Da earth; 4:21 Whose leaves were fair, and Da fruit thereof much, and in it was meat for all; under which Da beasts of Da field dwelt, and upon whose branches Da fowls of Da heaven had their habitation: 4:22 It is thou, O king, that art grown and become strong: for thy greatness is grown, and reacheth unto heaven, and thy dominion to Da end of Da earth. 4:23 And whereas Da king saw a watcher and an holy one coming down from heaven, and saying, Hew Da tree down, and destroy it; yet leave Da stump of Da roots thereof in Da earth, even with a band of iron and brass, in Da tender grass of Da field; and let it be wet with Da dew of heaven, and let his portion be with Da beasts of Da field, till seven times pass over him; 4:24 This is Da interpretation, O king, and this is Da decree of Da most High, which is come upon my lord Da king: 4:25 That they shall drive thee from men, and thy dwelling shall be with Da beasts of Da field, and they shall make thee to eat grass as oxen, and they shall wet thee with Da dew of heaven, and seven times shall pass over thee, till thou know that Da most High ruleth in Da kingdom of men, and giveth it to whomsoever he will. 4:26 And whereas they commanded to leave Da stump of Da tree roots; thy kingdom shall be sure unto thee, after that thou shalt have known that Da heavens do rule. 4:27 Wherefore, O king, let my counsel be acceptable unto thee, and break off thy sins by righteousness, and thine iniquities by shewing mercy to Da poor; if it may be a lengthening of thy tranquillity. 4:28 All this came upon Da king Nebuchadnezzar. 4:29 At Da end of twelve months he walked in Da palace of Da kingdom of Babylon. 4:30 The king spake, and said, Is not this great Babylon, that I have built for Da house of Da kingdom by Da might of my power, and for Da honour of my majesty? 4:31 While Da word was in Da king’s mouth, there fell a voice from heaven, saying, O king Nebuchadnezzar, to thee it is spoken; The kingdom is departed from thee. 4:32 And they shall drive thee from men, and thy dwelling shall be with Da beasts of Da field: they shall make thee to eat grass as oxen, and seven times shall pass over thee, until thou know that Da most High ruleth in Da kingdom of men, and giveth it to whomsoever he will. 4:33 The same hour was Da thing fulfilled upon Nebuchadnezzar: and he was driven from men, and did eat grass as oxen, and his body was wet with Da dew of heaven, till his hairs were grown like eagles’ feathers, and his nails like birds’ claws. 4:34 And at Da end of Da days I Nebuchadnezzar lifted up mine eyes unto heaven, and mine understanding returned unto me, and I blessed Da most High, and I praised and honoured him that liveth for ever, whose dominion is an everlasting dominion, and his kingdom is from generation to generation: 4:35 And all Da inhabitants of Da earth are reputed as nothing: and he doeth according to his will in Da army of heaven, and among Da inhabitants of Da earth: and none can stay his hand, or say unto him, What doest thou? 4:36 At Da same time my reason returned unto me; and for Da glory of my kingdom, mine honour and brightness returned unto me; and my counsellors and my lords sought unto me; and I was established in my kingdom, and excellent majesty was added unto me. 4:37 Now I Nebuchadnezzar praise and extol and honour Da King of heaven, all whose works are truth, and his ways judgment: and those that walk in pride he is able to abase. 5:1 Belshazzar Da king made a great feast to a thousand of his lords, and drank wine before Da thousand. 5:2 Belshazzar, whiles he tasted Da wine, commanded to bring Da golden and silver vessels which his father Nebuchadnezzar had taken out of Da temple which was in Jerusalem; that Da king, and his princes, his wives, and his concubines, might drink therein. 5:3 Then they brought Da golden vessels that were taken out of Da temple of Da house of God which was at Jerusalem; and Da king, and his princes, his wives, and his concubines, drank in them. 5:4 They drank wine, and praised Da gods of gold, and of silver, of brass, of iron, of wood, and of stone. 5:5 In Da same hour came forth fingers of a man’s hand, and wrote over against Da candlestick upon Da plaister of Da wall of Da king’s palace: and Da king saw Da part of Da hand that wrote. 5:6 Then Da king’s countenance was changed, and his thoughts troubled him, so that Da joints of his loins were loosed, and his knees smote one against another. 5:7 The king cried aloud to bring in Da astrologers, Da Chaldeans, and Da soothsayers. And Da king spake, and said to Da wise men of Babylon, Whosoever shall read this writing, and shew me Da interpretation thereof, shall be clothed with scarlet, and have a chain of gold about his neck, and shall be Da third ruler in Da kingdom. 5:8 Then came in all Da king’s wise men: but they could not read Da writing, nor make known to Da king Da interpretation thereof. 5:9 Then was king Belshazzar greatly troubled, and his countenance was changed in him, and his lords were astonied. 5:10 Now Da queen by reason of Da words of Da king and his lords came into Da banquet house: and Da queen spake and said, O king, live for ever: let not thy thoughts trouble thee, nor let thy countenance be changed: 5:11 There is a man in thy kingdom, in whom is Da spirit of Da holy gods; and in Da days of thy father light and understanding and wisdom, like Da wisdom of Da gods, was found in him; whom Da king Nebuchadnezzar thy father, Da king, I say, thy father, made master of Da magicians, astrologers, Chaldeans, and soothsayers; 5:12 Forasmuch as an excellent spirit, and knowledge, and understanding, interpreting of dreams, and shewing of hard sentences, and dissolving of doubts, were found in Da same Daniel, whom Da king named Belteshazzar: now let Daniel be called, and he will shew Da interpretation. 5:13 Then was Daniel brought in before Da king. And Da king spake and said unto Daniel, Art thou that Daniel, which art of Da children of Da captivity of Judah, whom Da king my father brought out of Jewry? 5:14 I have even heard of thee, that Da spirit of Da gods is in thee, and that light and understanding and excellent wisdom is found in thee. 5:15 And now Da wise men, Da astrologers, have been brought in before me, that they should read this writing, and make known unto me Da interpretation thereof: but they could not shew Da interpretation of Da thing: 5:16 And I have heard of thee, that thou canst make interpretations, and dissolve doubts: now if thou canst read Da writing, and make known to me Da interpretation thereof, thou shalt be clothed with scarlet, and have a chain of gold about thy neck, and shalt be Da third ruler in Da kingdom. 5:17 Then Daniel answered and said before Da king, Let thy gifts be to thyself, and give thy rewards to another; yet I will read Da writing unto Da king, and make known to him Da interpretation. 5:18 O thou king, Da most high God gave Nebuchadnezzar thy father a kingdom, and majesty, and glory, and honour: 5:19 And for Da majesty that he gave him, all people, nations, and languages, trembled and feared before him: whom he would he slew; and whom he would he kept alive; and whom he would he set up; and whom he would he put down. 5:20 But when his heart was lifted up, and his mind hardened in pride, he was deposed from his kingly throne, and they took his glory from him: 5:21 And he was driven from Da sons of men; and his heart was made like Da beasts, and his dwelling was with Da wild asses: they fed him with grass like oxen, and his body was wet with Da dew of heaven; till he knew that Da most high God ruled in Da kingdom of men, and that he appointeth over it whomsoever he will. 5:22 And thou his son, O Belshazzar, hast not humbled thine heart, though thou knewest all this; 5:23 But hast lifted up thyself against Da Lord of heaven; and they have brought Da vessels of his house before thee, and thou, and thy lords, thy wives, and thy concubines, have drunk wine in them; and thou hast praised Da gods of silver, and gold, of brass, iron, wood, and stone, which see not, nor hear, nor know: and Da God in whose hand thy breath is, and whose are all thy ways, hast thou not glorified: 5:24 Then was Da part of Da hand sent from him; and this writing was written. 5:25 And this is Da writing that was written, MENE, MENE, TEKEL, UPHARSIN. 5:26 This is Da interpretation of Da thing: MENE; God hath numbered thy kingdom, and finished it. 5:27 TEKEL; Thou art weighed in Da balances, and art found wanting. 5:28 PERES; Thy kingdom is divided, and given to Da Medes and Persians. 5:29 Then commanded Belshazzar, and they clothed Daniel with scarlet, and put a chain of gold about his neck, and made a proclamation concerning him, that he should be Da third ruler in Da kingdom. 5:30 In that night was Belshazzar Da king of Da Chaldeans slain. 5:31 And Darius Da Median took Da kingdom, being about threescore and two years old. 6:1 It pleased Darius to set over Da kingdom an hundred and twenty princes, which should be over Da whole kingdom; 6:2 And over these three presidents; of whom Daniel was first: that Da princes might give accounts unto them, and Da king should have no damage. 6:3 Then this Daniel was preferred above Da presidents and princes, because an excellent spirit was in him; and Da king thought to set him over Da whole realm. 6:4 Then Da presidents and princes sought to find occasion against Daniel concerning Da kingdom; but they could find none occasion nor fault; forasmuch as he was faithful, neither was there any error or fault found in him. 6:5 Then said these men, We shall not find any occasion against this Daniel, except we find it against him concerning Da law of his God. 6:6 Then these presidents and princes assembled together to Da king, and said thus unto him, King Darius, live for ever. 6:7 All Da presidents of Da kingdom, Da governors, and Da princes, Da counsellors, and Da captains, have consulted together to establish a royal statute, and to make a firm decree, that whosoever shall ask a petition of any God or man for thirty days, save of thee, O king, he shall be cast into Da den of lions. 6:8 Now, O king, establish Da decree, and sign Da writing, that it be not changed, according to Da law of Da Medes and Persians, which altereth not. 6:9 Wherefore king Darius signed Da writing and Da decree. 6:10 Now when Daniel knew that Da writing was signed, he went into his house; and his windows being open in his chamber toward Jerusalem, he kneeled upon his knees three times a day, and prayed, and gave thanks before his God, as he did aforetime. 6:11 Then these men assembled, and found Daniel praying and making supplication before his God. 6:12 Then they came near, and spake before Da king concerning Da king’s decree; Hast thou not signed a decree, that every man that shall ask a petition of any God or man within thirty days, save of thee, O king, shall be cast into Da den of lions? The king answered and said, The thing is true, according to Da law of Da Medes and Persians, which altereth not. 6:13 Then answered they and said before Da king, That Daniel, which is of Da children of Da captivity of Judah, regardeth not thee, O king, nor Da decree that thou hast signed, but maketh his petition three times a day. 6:14 Then Da king, when he heard these words, was sore displeased with himself, and set his heart on Daniel to deliver him: and he laboured till Da going down of Da sun to deliver him. 6:15 Then these men assembled unto Da king, and said unto Da king, Know, O king, that Da law of Da Medes and Persians is, That no decree nor statute which Da king establisheth may be changed. 6:16 Then Da king commanded, and they brought Daniel, and cast him into Da den of lions. Now Da king spake and said unto Daniel, Thy God whom thou servest continually, he will deliver thee. 6:17 And a stone was brought, and laid upon Da mouth of Da den; and Da king sealed it with his own signet, and with Da signet of his lords; that Da purpose might not be changed concerning Daniel. 6:18 Then Da king went to his palace, and passed Da night fasting: neither were instruments of musick brought before him: and his sleep went from him. 6:19 Then Da king arose very early in Da morning, and went in haste unto Da den of lions. 6:20 And when he came to Da den, he cried with a lamentable voice unto Daniel: and Da king spake and said to Daniel, O Daniel, servant of Da living God, is thy God, whom thou servest continually, able to deliver thee from Da lions? 6:21 Then said Daniel unto Da king, O king, live for ever. 6:22 My God hath sent his angel, and hath shut Da lions’ mouths, that they have not hurt me: forasmuch as before him innocency was found in me; and also before thee, O king, have I done no hurt. 6:23 Then was Da king exceedingly glad for him, and commanded that they should take Daniel up out of Da den. So Daniel was taken up out of Da den, and no manner of hurt was found upon him, because he believed in his God. 6:24 And Da king commanded, and they brought those men which had accused Daniel, and they cast them into Da den of lions, them, their children, and their wives; and Da lions had Da mastery of them, and brake all their bones in pieces or ever they came at Da bottom of Da den. 6:25 Then king Darius wrote unto all people, nations, and languages, that dwell in all Da earth; Peace be multiplied unto you. 6:26 I make a decree, That in every dominion of my kingdom men tremble and fear before Da God of Daniel: for he is Da living God, and stedfast for ever, and his kingdom that which shall not be destroyed, and his dominion shall be even unto Da end. 6:27 He delivereth and rescueth, and he worketh signs and wonders in heaven and in earth, who hath delivered Daniel from Da power of Da lions. 6:28 So this Daniel prospered in Da reign of Darius, and in Da reign of Cyrus Da Persian. 7:1 In Da first year of Belshazzar king of Babylon Daniel had a dream and visions of his head upon his bed: then he wrote Da dream, and told Da sum of Da matters. 7:2 Daniel spake and said, I saw in my vision by night, and, behold, Da four winds of Da heaven strove upon Da great sea. 7:3 And four great beasts came up from Da sea, diverse one from another. 7:4 The first was like a lion, and had eagle’s wings: I beheld till Da wings thereof were plucked, and it was lifted up from Da earth, and made stand upon Da feet as a man, and a man’s heart was given to it. 7:5 And behold another beast, a second, like to a bear, and it raised up itself on one side, and it had three ribs in Da mouth of it between Da teeth of it: and they said thus unto it, Arise, devour much flesh. 7:6 After this I beheld, and lo another, like a leopard, which had upon Da back of it four wings of a fowl; Da beast had also four heads; and dominion was given to it. 7:7 After this I saw in Da night visions, and behold a fourth beast, dreadful and terrible, and strong exceedingly; and it had great iron teeth: it devoured and brake in pieces, and stamped Da residue with Da feet of it: and it was diverse from all Da beasts that were before it; and it had ten horns. 7:8 I considered Da horns, and, behold, there came up among them another little horn, before whom there were three of Da first horns plucked up by Da roots: and, behold, in this horn were eyes like Da eyes of man, and a mouth speaking great things. 7:9 I beheld till Da thrones were cast down, and Da Ancient of days did sit, whose garment was white as snow, and Da hair of his head like Da pure wool: his throne was like Da fiery flame, and his wheels as burning fire. 7:10 A fiery stream issued and came forth from before him: thousand thousands ministered unto him, and ten thousand times ten thousand stood before him: Da judgment was set, and Da books were opened. 7:11 I beheld then because of Da voice of Da great words which Da horn spake: I beheld even till Da beast was slain, and his body destroyed, and given to Da burning flame. 7:12 As concerning Da rest of Da beasts, they had their dominion taken away: yet their lives were prolonged for a season and time. 7:13 I saw in Da night visions, and, behold, one like Da Son of man came with Da clouds of heaven, and came to Da Ancient of days, and they brought him near before him. 7:14 And there was given him dominion, and glory, and a kingdom, that all people, nations, and languages, should serve him: his dominion is an everlasting dominion, which shall not pass away, and his kingdom that which shall not be destroyed. 7:15 I Daniel was grieved in my spirit in Da midst of my body, and Da visions of my head troubled me. 7:16 I came near unto one of them that stood by, and asked him Da truth of all this. So he told me, and made me know Da interpretation of Da things. 7:17 These great beasts, which are four, are four kings, which shall arise out of Da earth. 7:18 But Da saints of Da most High shall take Da kingdom, and possess Da kingdom for ever, even for ever and ever. 7:19 Then I would know Da truth of Da fourth beast, which was diverse from all Da others, exceeding dreadful, whose teeth were of iron, and his nails of brass; which devoured, brake in pieces, and stamped Da residue with his feet; 7:20 And of Da ten horns that were in his head, and of Da other which came up, and before whom three fell; even of that horn that had eyes, and a mouth that spake very great things, whose look was more stout than his fellows. 7:21 I beheld, and Da same horn made war with Da saints, and prevailed against them; 7:22 Until Da Ancient of days came, and judgment was given to Da saints of Da most High; and Da time came that Da saints possessed Da kingdom. 7:23 Thus he said, The fourth beast shall be Da fourth kingdom upon earth, which shall be diverse from all kingdoms, and shall devour Da whole earth, and shall tread it down, and break it in pieces. 7:24 And Da ten horns out of this kingdom are ten kings that shall arise: and another shall rise after them; and he shall be diverse from Da first, and he shall subdue three kings. 7:25 And he shall speak great words against Da most High, and shall wear out Da saints of Da most High, and think to change times and laws: and they shall be given into his hand until a time and times and Da dividing of time. 7:26 But Da judgment shall sit, and they shall take away his dominion, to consume and to destroy it unto Da end. 7:27 And Da kingdom and dominion, and Da greatness of Da kingdom under Da whole heaven, shall be given to Da people of Da saints of Da most High, whose kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and all dominions shall serve and obey him. 7:28 Hitherto is Da end of Da matter. As for me Daniel, my cogitations much troubled me, and my countenance changed in me: but I kept Da matter in my heart. 8:1 In Da third year of Da reign of king Belshazzar a vision appeared unto me, even unto me Daniel, after that which appeared unto me at Da first. 8:2 And I saw in a vision; and it came to pass, when I saw, that I was at Shushan in Da palace, which is in Da province of Elam; and I saw in a vision, and I was by Da river of Ulai. 8:3 Then I lifted up mine eyes, and saw, and, behold, there stood before Da river a ram which had two horns: and Da two horns were high; but one was higher than Da other, and Da higher came up last. 8:4 I saw Da ram pushing westward, and northward, and southward; so that no beasts might stand before him, neither was there any that could deliver out of his hand; but he did according to his will, and became great. 8:5 And as I was considering, behold, an he goat came from Da west on Da face of Da whole earth, and touched not Da ground: and Da goat had a notable horn between his eyes. 8:6 And he came to Da ram that had two horns, which I had seen standing before Da river, and ran unto him in Da fury of his power. 8:7 And I saw him come close unto Da ram, and he was moved with choler against him, and smote Da ram, and brake his two horns: and there was no power in Da ram to stand before him, but he cast him down to Da ground, and stamped upon him: and there was none that could deliver Da ram out of his hand. 8:8 Therefore Da he goat waxed very great: and when he was strong, Da great horn was broken; and for it came up four notable ones toward Da four winds of heaven. 8:9 And out of one of them came forth a little horn, which waxed exceeding great, toward Da south, and toward Da east, and toward Da pleasant land. 8:10 And it waxed great, even to Da host of heaven; and it cast down some of Da host and of Da stars to Da ground, and stamped upon them. 8:11 Yea, he magnified himself even to Da prince of Da host, and by him Da daily sacrifice was taken away, and Da place of Da sanctuary was cast down. 8:12 And an host was given him against Da daily sacrifice by reason of transgression, and it cast down Da truth to Da ground; and it practised, and prospered. 8:13 Then I heard one saint speaking, and another saint said unto that certain saint which spake, How long shall be Da vision concerning Da daily sacrifice, and Da transgression of desolation, to give both Da sanctuary and Da host to be trodden under foot? 8:14 And he said unto me, Unto two thousand and three hundred days; then shall Da sanctuary be cleansed. 8:15 And it came to pass, when I, even I Daniel, had seen Da vision, and sought for Da meaning, then, behold, there stood before me as Da appearance of a man. 8:16 And I heard a man’s voice between Da banks of Ulai, which called, and said, Gabriel, make this man to understand Da vision. 8:17 So he came near where I stood: and when he came, I was afraid, and fell upon my face: but he said unto me, Understand, O son of man: for at Da time of Da end shall be Da vision. 8:18 Now as he was speaking with me, I was in a deep sleep on my face toward Da ground: but he touched me, and set me upright. 8:19 And he said, Behold, I will make thee know what shall be in Da last end of Da indignation: for at Da time appointed Da end shall be. 8:20 The ram which thou sawest having two horns are Da kings of Media and Persia. 8:21 And Da rough goat is Da king of Grecia: and Da great horn that is between his eyes is Da first king. 8:22 Now that being broken, whereas four stood up for it, four kingdoms shall stand up out of Da nation, but not in his power. 8:23 And in Da latter time of their kingdom, when Da transgressors are come to Da full, a king of fierce countenance, and understanding dark sentences, shall stand up. 8:24 And his power shall be mighty, but not by his own power: and he shall destroy wonderfully, and shall prosper, and practise, and shall destroy Da mighty and Da holy people. 8:25 And through his policy also he shall cause craft to prosper in his hand; and he shall magnify himself in his heart, and by peace shall destroy many: he shall also stand up against Da Prince of princes; but he shall be broken without hand. 8:26 And Da vision of Da evening and Da morning which was told is true: wherefore shut thou up Da vision; for it shall be for many days. 8:27 And I Daniel fainted, and was sick certain days; afterward I rose up, and did Da king’s business; and I was astonished at Da vision, but none understood it. 9:1 In Da first year of Darius Da son of Ahasuerus, of Da seed of Da Medes, which was made king over Da realm of Da Chaldeans; 9:2 In Da first year of his reign I Daniel understood by books Da number of Da years, whereof Da word of Da LORD came to Jeremiah Da prophet, that he would accomplish seventy years in Da desolations of Jerusalem. 9:3 And I set my face unto Da Lord God, to seek by prayer and supplications, with fasting, and sackcloth, and ashes: 9:4 And I prayed unto Da LORD my God, and made my confession, and said, O Lord, Da great and dreadful God, keeping Da covenant and mercy to them that love him, and to them that keep his commandments; 9:5 We have sinned, and have committed iniquity, and have done wickedly, and have rebelled, even by departing from thy precepts and from thy judgments: 9:6 Neither have we hearkened unto thy servants Da prophets, which spake in thy name to our kings, our princes, and our fathers, and to all Da people of Da land. 9:7 O LORD, righteousness belongeth unto thee, but unto us confusion of faces, as at this day; to Da men of Judah, and to Da inhabitants of Jerusalem, and unto all Israel, that are near, and that are far off, through all Da countries whither thou hast driven them, because of their trespass that they have trespassed against thee. 9:8 O Lord, to us belongeth confusion of face, to our kings, to our princes, and to our fathers, because we have sinned against thee. 9:9 To Da Lord our God belong mercies and forgivenesses, though we have rebelled against him; 9:10 Neither have we obeyed Da voice of Da LORD our God, to walk in his laws, which he set before us by his servants Da prophets. 9:11 Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore Da curse is poured upon us, and Da oath that is written in Da law of Moses Da servant of God, because we have sinned against him. 9:12 And he hath confirmed his words, which he spake against us, and against our judges that judged us, by bringing upon us a great evil: for under Da whole heaven hath not been done as hath been done upon Jerusalem. 9:13 As it is written in Da law of Moses, all this evil is come upon us: yet made we not our prayer before Da LORD our God, that we might turn from our iniquities, and understand thy truth. 9:14 Therefore hath Da LORD watched upon Da evil, and brought it upon us: for Da LORD our God is righteous in all his works which he doeth: for we obeyed not his voice. 9:15 And now, O Lord our God, that hast brought thy people forth out of Da land of Egypt with a mighty hand, and hast gotten thee renown, as at this day; we have sinned, we have done wickedly. 9:16 O LORD, according to all thy righteousness, I beseech thee, let thine anger and thy fury be turned away from thy city Jerusalem, thy holy mountain: because for our sins, and for Da iniquities of our fathers, Jerusalem and thy people are become a reproach to all that are about us. 9:17 Now therefore, O our God, hear Da prayer of thy servant, and his supplications, and cause thy face to shine upon thy sanctuary that is desolate, for Da Lord’s sake. 9:18 O my God, incline thine ear, and hear; open thine eyes, and behold our desolations, and Da city which is called by thy name: for we do not present our supplications before thee for our righteousnesses, but for thy great mercies. 9:19 O Lord, hear; O Lord, forgive; O Lord, hearken and do; defer not, for thine own sake, O my God: for thy city and thy people are called by thy name. 9:20 And whiles I was speaking, and praying, and confessing my sin and Da sin of my people Israel, and presenting my supplication before Da LORD my God for Da holy mountain of my God; 9:21 Yea, whiles I was speaking in prayer, even Da man Gabriel, whom I had seen in Da vision at Da beginning, being caused to fly swiftly, touched me about Da time of Da evening oblation. 9:22 And he informed me, and talked with me, and said, O Daniel, I am now come forth to give thee skill and understanding. 9:23 At Da beginning of thy supplications Da commandment came forth, and I am come to shew thee; for thou art greatly beloved: therefore understand Da matter, and consider Da vision. 9:24 Seventy weeks are determined upon thy people and upon thy holy city, to finish Da transgression, and to make an end of sins, and to make reconciliation for iniquity, and to bring in everlasting righteousness, and to seal up Da vision and prophecy, and to anoint Da most Holy. 9:25 Know therefore and understand, that from Da going forth of Da commandment to restore and to build Jerusalem unto Da Messiah Da Prince shall be seven weeks, and threescore and two weeks: Da street shall be built again, and Da wall, even in troublous times. 9:26 And after threescore and two weeks shall Messiah be cut off, but not for himself: and Da people of Da prince that shall come shall destroy Da city and Da sanctuary; and Da end thereof shall be with a flood, and unto Da end of Da war desolations are determined. 9:27 And he shall confirm Da covenant with many for one week: and in Da midst of Da week he shall cause Da sacrifice and Da oblation to cease, and for Da overspreading of abominations he shall make it desolate, even until Da consummation, and that determined shall be poured upon Da desolate. 10:1 In Da third year of Cyrus king of Persia a thing was revealed unto Daniel, whose name was called Belteshazzar; and Da thing was true, but Da time appointed was long: and he understood Da thing, and had understanding of Da vision. 10:2 In those days I Daniel was mourning three full weeks. 10:3 I ate no pleasant bread, neither came flesh nor wine in my mouth, neither did I anoint myself at all, till three whole weeks were fulfilled. 10:4 And in Da four and twentieth day of Da first month, as I was by Da side of Da great river, which is Hiddekel; 10:5 Then I lifted up mine eyes, and looked, and behold a certain man clothed in linen, whose loins were girded with fine gold of Uphaz: 10:6 His body also was like Da beryl, and his face as Da appearance of lightning, and his eyes as lamps of fire, and his arms and his feet like in colour to polished brass, and Da voice of his words like Da voice of a multitude. 10:7 And I Daniel alone saw Da vision: for Da men that were with me saw not Da vision; but a great quaking fell upon them, so that they fled to hide themselves. 10:8 Therefore I was left alone, and saw this great vision, and there remained no strength in me: for my comeliness was turned in me into corruption, and I retained no strength. 10:9 Yet heard I Da voice of his words: and when I heard Da voice of his words, then was I in a deep sleep on my face, and my face toward Da ground. 10:10 And, behold, an hand touched me, which set me upon my knees and upon Da palms of my hands. 10:11 And he said unto me, O Daniel, a man greatly beloved, understand Da words that I speak unto thee, and stand upright: for unto thee am I now sent. And when he had spoken this word unto me, I stood trembling. 10:12 Then said he unto me, Fear not, Daniel: for from Da first day that thou didst set thine heart to understand, and to chasten thyself before thy God, thy words were heard, and I am come for thy words. 10:13 But Da prince of Da kingdom of Persia withstood me one and twenty days: but, lo, Michael, one of Da chief princes, came to help me; and I remained there with Da kings of Persia. 10:14 Now I am come to make thee understand what shall befall thy people in Da latter days: for yet Da vision is for many days. 10:15 And when he had spoken such words unto me, I set my face toward Da ground, and I became dumb. 10:16 And, behold, one like Da similitude of Da sons of men touched my lips: then I opened my mouth, and spake, and said unto him that stood before me, O my lord, by Da vision my sorrows are turned upon me, and I have retained no strength. 10:17 For how can Da servant of this my lord talk with this my lord? for as for me, straightway there remained no strength in me, neither is there breath left in me. 10:18 Then there came again and touched me one like Da appearance of a man, and he strengthened me, 10:19 And said, O man greatly beloved, fear not: peace be unto thee, be strong, yea, be strong. And when he had spoken unto me, I was strengthened, and said, Let my lord speak; for thou hast strengthened me. 10:20 Then said he, Knowest thou wherefore I come unto thee? and now will I return to fight with Da prince of Persia: and when I am gone forth, lo, Da prince of Grecia shall come. 10:21 But I will shew thee that which is noted in Da scripture of truth: and there is none that holdeth with me in these things, but Michael your prince. 11:1 Also I in Da first year of Darius Da Mede, even I, stood to confirm and to strengthen him. 11:2 And now will I shew thee Da truth. Behold, there shall stand up yet three kings in Persia; and Da fourth shall be far richer than they all: and by his strength through his riches he shall stir up all against Da realm of Grecia. 11:3 And a mighty king shall stand up, that shall rule with great dominion, and do according to his will. 11:4 And when he shall stand up, his kingdom shall be broken, and shall be divided toward Da four winds of heaven; and not to his posterity, nor according to his dominion which he ruled: for his kingdom shall be plucked up, even for others beside those. 11:5 And Da king of Da south shall be strong, and one of his princes; and he shall be strong above him, and have dominion; his dominion shall be a great dominion. 11:6 And in Da end of years they shall join themselves together; for Da king’s daughter of Da south shall come to Da king of Da north to make an agreement: but she shall not retain Da power of Da arm; neither shall he stand, nor his arm: but she shall be given up, and they that brought her, and he that begat her, and he that strengthened her in these times. 11:7 But out of a branch of her roots shall one stand up in his estate, which shall come with an army, and shall enter into Da fortress of Da king of Da north, and shall deal against them, and shall prevail: 11:8 And shall also carry captives into Egypt their gods, with their princes, and with their precious vessels of silver and of gold; and he shall continue more years than Da king of Da north. 11:9 So Da king of Da south shall come into his kingdom, and shall return into his own land. 11:10 But his sons shall be stirred up, and shall assemble a multitude of great forces: and one shall certainly come, and overflow, and pass through: then shall he return, and be stirred up, even to his fortress. 11:11 And Da king of Da south shall be moved with choler, and shall come forth and fight with him, even with Da king of Da north: and he shall set forth a great multitude; but Da multitude shall be given into his hand. 11:12 And when he hath taken away Da multitude, his heart shall be lifted up; and he shall cast down many ten thousands: but he shall not be strengthened by it. 11:13 For Da king of Da north shall return, and shall set forth a multitude greater than Da former, and shall certainly come after certain years with a great army and with much riches. 11:14 And in those times there shall many stand up against Da king of Da south: also Da robbers of thy people shall exalt themselves to establish Da vision; but they shall fall. 11:15 So Da king of Da north shall come, and cast up a mount, and take Da most fenced cities: and Da arms of Da south shall not withstand, neither his chosen people, neither shall there be any strength to withstand. 11:16 But he that cometh against him shall do according to his own will, and none shall stand before him: and he shall stand in Da glorious land, which by his hand shall be consumed. 11:17 He shall also set his face to enter with Da strength of his whole kingdom, and upright ones with him; thus shall he do: and he shall give him Da daughter of women, corrupting her: but she shall not stand on his side, neither be for him. 11:18 After this shall he turn his face unto Da isles, and shall take many: but a prince for his own behalf shall cause Da reproach offered by him to cease; without his own reproach he shall cause it to turn upon him. 11:19 Then he shall turn his face toward Da fort of his own land: but he shall stumble and fall, and not be found. 11:20 Then shall stand up in his estate a raiser of taxes in Da glory of Da kingdom: but within few days he shall be destroyed, neither in anger, nor in battle. 11:21 And in his estate shall stand up a vile person, to whom they shall not give Da honour of Da kingdom: but he shall come in peaceably, and obtain Da kingdom by flatteries. 11:22 And with Da arms of a flood shall they be overflown from before him, and shall be broken; yea, also Da prince of Da covenant. 11:23 And after Da league made with him he shall work deceitfully: for he shall come up, and shall become strong with a small people. 11:24 He shall enter peaceably even upon Da fattest places of Da province; and he shall do that which his fathers have not done, nor his fathers’ fathers; he shall scatter among them Da prey, and spoil, and riches: yea, and he shall forecast his devices against Da strong holds, even for a time. 11:25 And he shall stir up his power and his courage against Da king of Da south with a great army; and Da king of Da south shall be stirred up to battle with a very great and mighty army; but he shall not stand: for they shall forecast devices against him. 11:26 Yea, they that feed of Da portion of his meat shall destroy him, and his army shall overflow: and many shall fall down slain. 11:27 And both of these kings’ hearts shall be to do mischief, and they shall speak lies at one table; but it shall not prosper: for yet Da end shall be at Da time appointed. 11:28 Then shall he return into his land with great riches; and his heart shall be against Da holy covenant; and he shall do exploits, and return to his own land. 11:29 At Da time appointed he shall return, and come toward Da south; but it shall not be as Da former, or as Da latter. 11:30 For Da ships of Chittim shall come against him: therefore he shall be grieved, and return, and have indignation against Da holy covenant: so shall he do; he shall even return, and have intelligence with them that forsake Da holy covenant. 11:31 And arms shall stand on his part, and they shall pollute Da sanctuary of strength, and shall take away Da daily sacrifice, and they shall place Da abomination that maketh desolate. 11:32 And such as do wickedly against Da covenant shall he corrupt by flatteries: but Da people that do know their God shall be strong, and do exploits. 11:33 And they that understand among Da people shall instruct many: yet they shall fall by Da sword, and by flame, by captivity, and by spoil, many days. 11:34 Now when they shall fall, they shall be holpen with a little help: but many shall cleave to them with flatteries. 11:35 And some of them of understanding shall fall, to try them, and to purge, and to make them white, even to Da time of Da end: because it is yet for a time appointed. 11:36 And Da king shall do according to his will; and he shall exalt himself, and magnify himself above every god, and shall speak marvellous things against Da God of gods, and shall prosper till Da indignation be accomplished: for that that is determined shall be done. 11:37 Neither shall he regard Da God of his fathers, nor Da desire of women, nor regard any god: for he shall magnify himself above all. 11:38 But in his estate shall he honour Da God of forces: and a god whom his fathers knew not shall he honour with gold, and silver, and with precious stones, and pleasant things. 11:39 Thus shall he do in Da most strong holds with a strange god, whom he shall acknowledge and increase with glory: and he shall cause them to rule over many, and shall divide Da land for gain. 11:40 And at Da time of Da end shall Da king of Da south push at him: and Da king of Da north shall come against him like a whirlwind, with chariots, and with horsemen, and with many ships; and he shall enter into Da countries, and shall overflow and pass over. 11:41 He shall enter also into Da glorious land, and many countries shall be overthrown: but these shall escape out of his hand, even Edom, and Moab, and Da chief of Da children of Ammon. 11:42 He shall stretch forth his hand also upon Da countries: and Da land of Egypt shall not escape. 11:43 But he shall have power over Da treasures of gold and of silver, and over all Da precious things of Egypt: and Da Libyans and Da Ethiopians shall be at his steps. 11:44 But tidings out of Da east and out of Da north shall trouble him: therefore he shall go forth with great fury to destroy, and utterly to make away many. 11:45 And he shall plant Da tabernacles of his palace between Da seas in Da glorious holy mountain; yet he shall come to his end, and none shall help him. 12:1 And at that time shall Michael stand up, Da great prince which standeth for Da children of thy people: and there shall be a time of trouble, such as never was since there was a nation even to that same time: and at that time thy people shall be delivered, every one that shall be found written in Da book. 12:2 And many of them that sleep in Da dust of Da earth shall awake, some to everlasting life, and some to shame and everlasting contempt. 12:3 And they that be wise shall shine as Da brightness of Da firmament; and they that turn many to righteousness as Da stars for ever and ever. 12:4 But thou, O Daniel, shut up Da words, and seal Da book, even to Da time of Da end: many shall run to and fro, and knowledge shall be increased. 12:5 Then I Daniel looked, and, behold, there stood other two, Da one on this side of Da bank of Da river, and Da other on that side of Da bank of Da river. 12:6 And one said to Da man clothed in linen, which was upon Da waters of Da river, How long shall it be to Da end of these wonders? 12:7 And I heard Da man clothed in linen, which was upon Da waters of Da river, when he held up his right hand and his left hand unto heaven, and sware by him that liveth for ever that it shall be for a time, times, and an half; and when he shall have accomplished to scatter Da power of Da holy people, all these things shall be finished. 12:8 And I heard, but I understood not: then said I, O my Lord, what shall be Da end of these things? 12:9 And he said, Go thy way, Daniel: for Da words are closed up and sealed till Da time of Da end. 12:10 Many shall be purified, and made white, and tried; but Da wicked shall do wickedly: and none of Da wicked shall understand; but Da wise shall understand. 12:11 And from Da time that Da daily sacrifice shall be taken away, and Da abomination that maketh desolate set up, there shall be a thousand two hundred and ninety days. 12:12 Blessed is he that waiteth, and cometh to Da thousand three hundred and five and thirty days. 12:13 But go thou thy way till Da end be: for thou shalt rest, and stand in thy lot at Da end of Da days. Hosea 1:1 The word of Da LORD that came unto Hosea, Da son of Beeri, in Da days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and in Da days of Jeroboam Da son of Joash, king of Israel. 1:2 The beginning of Da word of Da LORD by Hosea. And Da LORD said to Hosea, Go, take unto thee a wife of whoredoms and children of whoredoms: for Da land hath committed great whoredom, departing from Da LORD. 1:3 So he went and took Gomer Da daughter of Diblaim; which conceived, and bare him a son. 1:4 And Da LORD said unto him, Call his name Jezreel; for yet a little while, and I will avenge Da blood of Jezreel upon Da house of Jehu, and will cause to cease Da kingdom of Da house of Israel. 1:5 And it shall come to pass at that day, that I will break Da bow of Israel, in Da valley of Jezreel. 1:6 And she conceived again, and bare a daughter. And God said unto him, Call her name Loruhamah: for I will no more have mercy upon Da house of Israel; but I will utterly take them away. 1:7 But I will have mercy upon Da house of Judah, and will save them by Da LORD their God, and will not save them by bow, nor by sword, nor by battle, by horses, nor by horsemen. 1:8 Now when she had weaned Loruhamah, she conceived, and bare a son. 1:9 Then said God, Call his name Loammi: for ye are not my people, and I will not be your God. 1:10 Yet Da number of Da children of Israel shall be as Da sand of Da sea, which cannot be measured nor numbered; and it shall come to pass, that in Da place where it was said unto them, Ye are not my people, there it shall be said unto them, Ye are Da sons of Da living God. 1:11 Then shall Da children of Judah and Da children of Israel be gathered together, and appoint themselves one head, and they shall come up out of Da land: for great shall be Da day of Jezreel. 2:1 Say ye unto your brethren, Ammi; and to your sisters, Ruhamah. 2:2 Plead with your mother, plead: for she is not my wife, neither am I her husband: let her therefore put away her whoredoms out of her sight, and her adulteries from between her breasts; 2:3 Lest I strip her naked, and set her as in Da day that she was born, and make her as a wilderness, and set her like a dry land, and slay her with thirst. 2:4 And I will not have mercy upon her children; for they be Da children of whoredoms. 2:5 For their mother hath played Da harlot: she that conceived them hath done shamefully: for she said, I will go after my lovers, that give me my bread and my water, my wool and my flax, mine oil and my drink. 2:6 Therefore, behold, I will hedge up thy way with thorns, and make a wall, that she shall not find her paths. 2:7 And she shall follow after her lovers, but she shall not overtake them; and she shall seek them, but shall not find them: then shall she say, I will go and return to my first husband; for then was it better with me than now. 2:8 For she did not know that I gave her corn, and wine, and oil, and multiplied her silver and gold, which they prepared for Baal. 2:9 Therefore will I return, and take away my corn in Da time thereof, and my wine in Da season thereof, and will recover my wool and my flax given to cover her nakedness. 2:10 And now will I discover her lewdness in Da sight of her lovers, and none shall deliver her out of mine hand. 2:11 I will also cause all her mirth to cease, her feast days, her new moons, and her sabbaths, and all her solemn feasts. 2:12 And I will destroy her vines and her fig trees, whereof she hath said, These are my rewards that my lovers have given me: and I will make them a forest, and Da beasts of Da field shall eat them. 2:13 And I will visit upon her Da days of Baalim, wherein she burned incense to them, and she decked herself with her earrings and her jewels, and she went after her lovers, and forgat me, saith Da LORD. 2:14 Therefore, behold, I will allure her, and bring her into Da wilderness, and speak comfortably unto her. 2:15 And I will give her her vineyards from thence, and Da valley of Achor for a door of hope: and she shall sing there, as in Da days of her youth, and as in Da day when she came up out of Da land of Egypt. 2:16 And it shall be at that day, saith Da LORD, that thou shalt call me Ishi; and shalt call me no more Baali. 2:17 For I will take away Da names of Baalim out of her mouth, and they shall no more be remembered by their name. 2:18 And in that day will I make a covenant for them with Da beasts of Da field and with Da fowls of heaven, and with Da creeping things of Da ground: and I will break Da bow and Da sword and Da battle out of Da earth, and will make them to lie down safely. 2:19 And I will betroth thee unto me for ever; yea, I will betroth thee unto me in righteousness, and in judgment, and in lovingkindness, and in mercies. 2:20 I will even betroth thee unto me in faithfulness: and thou shalt know Da LORD. 2:21 And it shall come to pass in that day, I will hear, saith Da LORD, I will hear Da heavens, and they shall hear Da earth; 2:22 And Da earth shall hear Da corn, and Da wine, and Da oil; and they shall hear Jezreel. 2:23 And I will sow her unto me in Da earth; and I will have mercy upon her that had not obtained mercy; and I will say to them which were not my people, Thou art my people; and they shall say, Thou art my God. 3:1 Then said Da LORD unto me, Go yet, love a woman beloved of her friend, yet an adulteress, according to Da love of Da LORD toward Da children of Israel, who look to other gods, and love flagons of wine. 3:2 So I bought her to me for fifteen pieces of silver, and for an homer of barley, and an half homer of barley: 3:3 And I said unto her, Thou shalt abide for me many days; thou shalt not play Da harlot, and thou shalt not be for another man: so will I also be for thee. 3:4 For Da children of Israel shall abide many days without a king, and without a prince, and without a sacrifice, and without an image, and without an ephod, and without teraphim: 3:5 Afterward shall Da children of Israel return, and seek Da LORD their God, and David their king; and shall fear Da LORD and his goodness in Da latter days. 4:1 Hear Da word of Da LORD, ye children of Israel: for Da LORD hath a controversy with Da inhabitants of Da land, because there is no truth, nor mercy, nor knowledge of God in Da land. 4:2 By swearing, and lying, and killing, and stealing, and committing adultery, they break out, and blood toucheth blood. 4:3 Therefore shall Da land mourn, and every one that dwelleth therein shall languish, with Da beasts of Da field, and with Da fowls of heaven; yea, Da fishes of Da sea also shall be taken away. 4:4 Yet let no man strive, nor reprove another: for thy people are as they that strive with Da priest. 4:5 Therefore shalt thou fall in Da day, and Da prophet also shall fall with thee in Da night, and I will destroy thy mother. 4:6 My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge: because thou hast rejected knowledge, I will also reject thee, that thou shalt be no priest to me: seeing thou hast forgotten Da law of thy God, I will also forget thy children. 4:7 As they were increased, so they sinned against me: therefore will I change their glory into shame. 4:8 They eat up Da sin of my people, and they set their heart on their iniquity. 4:9 And there shall be, like people, like priest: and I will punish them for their ways, and reward them their doings. 4:10 For they shall eat, and not have enough: they shall commit whoredom, and shall not increase: because they have left off to take heed to Da LORD. 4:11 Whoredom and wine and new wine take away Da heart. 4:12 My people ask counsel at their stocks, and their staff declareth unto them: for Da spirit of whoredoms hath caused them to err, and they have gone a whoring from under their God. 4:13 They sacrifice upon Da tops of Da mountains, and burn incense upon Da hills, under oaks and poplars and elms, because Da shadow thereof is good: therefore your daughters shall commit whoredom, and your spouses shall commit adultery. 4:14 I will not punish your daughters when they commit whoredom, nor your spouses when they commit adultery: for themselves are separated with whores, and they sacrifice with harlots: therefore Da people that doth not understand shall fall. 4:15 Though thou, Israel, play Da harlot, yet let not Judah offend; and come not ye unto Gilgal, neither go ye up to Bethaven, nor swear, The LORD liveth. 4:16 For Israel slideth back as a backsliding heifer: now Da LORD will feed them as a lamb in a large place. 4:17 Ephraim is joined to idols: let him alone. 4:18 Their drink is sour: they have committed whoredom continually: her rulers with shame do love, Give ye. 4:19 The wind hath bound her up in her wings, and they shall be ashamed because of their sacrifices. 5:1 Hear ye this, O priests; and hearken, ye house of Israel; and give ye ear, O house of Da king; for judgment is toward you, because ye have been a snare on Mizpah, and a net spread upon Tabor. 5:2 And Da revolters are profound to make slaughter, though I have been a rebuker of them all. 5:3 I know Ephraim, and Israel is not hid from me: for now, O Ephraim, thou committest whoredom, and Israel is defiled. 5:4 They will not frame their doings to turn unto their God: for Da spirit of whoredoms is in Da midst of them, and they have not known Da LORD. 5:5 And Da pride of Israel doth testify to his face: therefore shall Israel and Ephraim fall in their iniquity: Judah also shall fall with them. 5:6 They shall go with their flocks and with their herds to seek Da LORD; but they shall not find him; he hath withdrawn himself from them. 5:7 They have dealt treacherously against Da LORD: for they have begotten strange children: now shall a month devour them with their portions. 5:8 Blow ye Da cornet in Gibeah, and Da trumpet in Ramah: cry aloud at Bethaven, after thee, O Benjamin. 5:9 Ephraim shall be desolate in Da day of rebuke: among Da tribes of Israel have I made known that which shall surely be. 5:10 The princes of Judah were like them that remove Da bound: therefore I will pour out my wrath upon them like water. 5:11 Ephraim is oppressed and broken in judgment, because he willingly walked after Da commandment. 5:12 Therefore will I be unto Ephraim as a moth, and to Da house of Judah as rottenness. 5:13 When Ephraim saw his sickness, and Judah saw his wound, then went Ephraim to Da Assyrian, and sent to king Jareb: yet could he not heal you, nor cure you of your wound. 5:14 For I will be unto Ephraim as a lion, and as a young lion to Da house of Judah: I, even I, will tear and go away; I will take away, and none shall rescue him. 5:15 I will go and return to my place, till they acknowledge their offence, and seek my face: in their affliction they will seek me early. 6:1 Come, and let us return unto Da LORD: for he hath torn, and he will heal us; he hath smitten, and he will bind us up. 6:2 After two days will he revive us: in Da third day he will raise us up, and we shall live in his sight. 6:3 Then shall we know, if we follow on to know Da LORD: his going forth is prepared as Da morning; and he shall come unto us as Da rain, as Da latter and former rain unto Da earth. 6:4 O Ephraim, what shall I do unto thee? O Judah, what shall I do unto thee? for your goodness is as a morning cloud, and as Da early dew it goeth away. 6:5 Therefore have I hewed them by Da prophets; I have slain them by Da words of my mouth: and thy judgments are as Da light that goeth forth. 6:6 For I desired mercy, and not sacrifice; and Da knowledge of God more than burnt offerings. 6:7 But they like men have transgressed Da covenant: there have they dealt treacherously against me. 6:8 Gilead is a city of them that work iniquity, and is polluted with blood. 6:9 And as troops of robbers wait for a man, so Da company of priests murder in Da way by consent: for they commit lewdness. 6:10 I have seen an horrible thing in Da house of Israel: there is Da whoredom of Ephraim, Israel is defiled. 6:11 Also, O Judah, he hath set an harvest for thee, when I returned Da captivity of my people. 7:1 When I would have healed Israel, then Da iniquity of Ephraim was discovered, and Da wickedness of Samaria: for they commit falsehood; and Da thief cometh in, and Da troop of robbers spoileth without. 7:2 And they consider not in their hearts that I remember all their wickedness: now their own doings have beset them about; they are before my face. 7:3 They make Da king glad with their wickedness, and Da princes with their lies. 7:4 They are all adulterers, as an oven heated by Da baker, who ceaseth from raising after he hath kneaded Da dough, until it be leavened. 7:5 In Da day of our king Da princes have made him sick with bottles of wine; he stretched out his hand with scorners. 7:6 For they have made ready their heart like an oven, whiles they lie in wait: their baker sleepeth all Da night; in Da morning it burneth as a flaming fire. 7:7 They are all hot as an oven, and have devoured their judges; all their kings are fallen: there is none among them that calleth unto me. 7:8 Ephraim, he hath mixed himself among Da people; Ephraim is a cake not turned. 7:9 Strangers have devoured his strength, and he knoweth it not: yea, gray hairs are here and there upon him, yet he knoweth not. 7:10 And Da pride of Israel testifieth to his face: and they do not return to Da LORD their God, nor seek him for all this. 7:11 Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart: they call to Egypt, they go to Assyria. 7:12 When they shall go, I will spread my net upon them; I will bring them down as Da fowls of Da heaven; I will chastise them, as their congregation hath heard. 7:13 Woe unto them! for they have fled from me: destruction unto them! because they have transgressed against me: though I have redeemed them, yet they have spoken lies against me. 7:14 And they have not cried unto me with their heart, when they howled upon their beds: they assemble themselves for corn and wine, and they rebel against me. 7:15 Though I have bound and strengthened their arms, yet do they imagine mischief against me. 7:16 They return, but not to Da most High: they are like a deceitful bow: their princes shall fall by Da sword for Da rage of their tongue: this shall be their derision in Da land of Egypt. 8:1 Set Da trumpet to thy mouth. He shall come as an eagle against Da house of Da LORD, because they have transgressed my covenant, and trespassed against my law. 8:2 Israel shall cry unto me, My God, we know thee. 8:3 Israel hath cast off Da thing that is good: Da enemy shall pursue him. 8:4 They have set up kings, but not by me: they have made princes, and I knew it not: of their silver and their gold have they made them idols, that they may be cut off. 8:5 Thy calf, O Samaria, hath cast thee off; mine anger is kindled against them: how long will it be ere they attain to innocency? 8:6 For from Israel was it also: Da workman made it; therefore it is not God: but Da calf of Samaria shall be broken in pieces. 8:7 For they have sown Da wind, and they shall reap Da whirlwind: it hath no stalk; Da bud shall yield no meal: if so be it yield, Da strangers shall swallow it up. 8:8 Israel is swallowed up: now shall they be among Da Gentiles as a vessel wherein is no pleasure. 8:9 For they are gone up to Assyria, a wild ass alone by himself: Ephraim hath hired lovers. 8:10 Yea, though they have hired among Da nations, now will I gather them, and they shall sorrow a little for Da burden of Da king of princes. 8:11 Because Ephraim hath made many altars to sin, altars shall be unto him to sin. 8:12 I have written to him Da great things of my law, but they were counted as a strange thing. 8:13 They sacrifice flesh for Da sacrifices of mine offerings, and eat it; but Da LORD accepteth them not; now will he remember their iniquity, and visit their sins: they shall return to Egypt. 8:14 For Israel hath forgotten his Maker, and buildeth temples; and Judah hath multiplied fenced cities: but I will send a fire upon his cities, and it shall devour Da palaces thereof. 9:1 Rejoice not, O Israel, for joy, as other people: for thou hast gone a whoring from thy God, thou hast loved a reward upon every cornfloor. 9:2 The floor and Da winepress shall not feed them, and Da new wine shall fail in her. 9:3 They shall not dwell in Da LORD’s land; but Ephraim shall return to Egypt, and they shall eat unclean things in Assyria. 9:4 They shall not offer wine offerings to Da LORD, neither shall they be pleasing unto him: their sacrifices shall be unto them as Da bread of mourners; all that eat thereof shall be polluted: for their bread for their soul shall not come into Da house of Da LORD. 9:5 What will ye do in Da solemn day, and in Da day of Da feast of Da LORD? 9:6 For, lo, they are gone because of destruction: Egypt shall gather them up, Memphis shall bury them: Da pleasant places for their silver, nettles shall possess them: thorns shall be in their tabernacles. 9:7 The days of visitation are come, Da days of recompence are come;
