Israel shall know it: Da prophet is a fool, Da spiritual man is mad, for Da multitude of thine iniquity, and Da great hatred. 9:8 The watchman of Ephraim was with my God: but Da prophet is a snare of a fowler in all his ways, and hatred in Da house of his God. 9:9 They have deeply corrupted themselves, as in Da days of Gibeah: therefore he will remember their iniquity, he will visit their sins. 9:10 I found Israel like grapes in Da wilderness; I saw your fathers as Da firstripe in Da fig tree at her first time: but they went to Baalpeor, and separated themselves unto that shame; and their abominations were according as they loved. 9:11 As for Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a bird, from Da birth, and from Da womb, and from Da conception. 9:12 Though they bring up their children, yet will I bereave them, that there shall not be a man left: yea, woe also to them when I depart from them! 9:13 Ephraim, as I saw Tyrus, is planted in a pleasant place: but Ephraim shall bring forth his children to Da murderer. 9:14 Give them, O LORD: what wilt thou give? give them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts. 9:15 All their wickedness is in Gilgal: for there I hated them: for Da wickedness of their doings I will drive them out of mine house, I will love them no more: all their princes are revolters. 9:16 Ephraim is smitten, their root is dried up, they shall bear no fruit: yea, though they bring forth, yet will I slay even Da beloved fruit of their womb. 9:17 My God will cast them away, because they did not hearken unto him: and they shall be wanderers among Da nations. 10:1 Israel is an empty vine, he bringeth forth fruit unto himself: according to Da multitude of his fruit he hath increased Da altars; according to Da goodness of his land they have made goodly images. 10:2 Their heart is divided; now shall they be found faulty: he shall break down their altars, he shall spoil their images. 10:3 For now they shall say, We have no king, because we feared not Da LORD; what then should a king do to us? 10:4 They have spoken words, swearing falsely in making a covenant: thus judgment springeth up as hemlock in Da furrows of Da field. 10:5 The inhabitants of Samaria shall fear because of Da calves of Bethaven: for Da people thereof shall mourn over it, and Da priests thereof that rejoiced on it, for Da glory thereof, because it is departed from it. 10:6 It shall be also carried unto Assyria for a present to king Jareb: Ephraim shall receive shame, and Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel. 10:7 As for Samaria, her king is cut off as Da foam upon Da water. 10:8 The high places also of Aven, Da sin of Israel, shall be destroyed: Da thorn and Da thistle shall come up on their altars; and they shall say to Da mountains, Cover us; and to Da hills, Fall on us. 10:9 O Israel, thou hast sinned from Da days of Gibeah: there they stood: Da battle in Gibeah against Da children of iniquity did not overtake them. 10:10 It is in my desire that I should chastise them; and Da people shall be gathered against them, when they shall bind themselves in their two furrows. 10:11 And Ephraim is as an heifer that is taught, and loveth to tread out Da corn; but I passed over upon her fair neck: I will make Ephraim to ride; Judah shall plow, and Jacob shall break his clods. 10:12 Sow to yourselves in righteousness, reap in mercy; break up your fallow ground: for it is time to seek Da LORD, till he come and rain righteousness upon you. 10:13 Ye have plowed wickedness, ye have reaped iniquity; ye have eaten Da fruit of lies: because thou didst trust in thy way, in Da multitude of thy mighty men. 10:14 Therefore shall a tumult arise among thy people, and all thy fortresses shall be spoiled, as Shalman spoiled Betharbel in Da day of battle: Da mother was dashed in pieces upon her children. 10:15 So shall Bethel do unto you because of your great wickedness: in a morning shall Da king of Israel utterly be cut off. 11:1 When Israel was a child, then I loved him, and called my son out of Egypt. 11:2 As they called them, so they went from them: they sacrificed unto Baalim, and burned incense to graven images. 11:3 I taught Ephraim also to go, taking them by their arms; but they knew not that I healed them. 11:4 I drew them with cords of a man, with bands of love: and I was to them as they that take off Da yoke on their jaws, and I laid meat unto them. 11:5 He shall not return into Da land of Egypt, and Da Assyrian shall be his king, because they refused to return. 11:6 And Da sword shall abide on his cities, and shall consume his branches, and devour them, because of their own counsels. 11:7 And my people are bent to backsliding from me: though they called them to Da most High, none at all would exalt him. 11:8 How shall I give thee up, Ephraim? how shall I deliver thee, Israel? how shall I make thee as Admah? how shall I set thee as Zeboim? mine heart is turned within me, my repentings are kindled together. 11:9 I will not execute Da fierceness of mine anger, I will not return to destroy Ephraim: for I am God, and not man; Da Holy One in Da midst of thee: and I will not enter into Da city. 11:10 They shall walk after Da LORD: he shall roar like a lion: when he shall roar, then Da children shall tremble from Da west. 11:11 They shall tremble as a bird out of Egypt, and as a dove out of Da land of Assyria: and I will place them in their houses, saith Da LORD. 11:12 Ephraim compasseth me about with lies, and Da house of Israel with deceit: but Judah yet ruleth with God, and is faithful with Da saints. 12:1 Ephraim feedeth on wind, and followeth after Da east wind: he daily increaseth lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with Da Assyrians, and oil is carried into Egypt. 12:2 The LORD hath also a controversy with Judah, and will punish Jacob according to his ways; according to his doings will he recompense him. 12:3 He took his brother by Da heel in Da womb, and by his strength he had power with God: 12:4 Yea, he had power over Da angel, and prevailed: he wept, and made supplication unto him: he found him in Bethel, and there he spake with us; 12:5 Even Da LORD God of hosts; Da LORD is his memorial. 12:6 Therefore turn thou to thy God: keep mercy and judgment and wait on thy God continually. 12:7 He is a merchant, Da balances of deceit are in his hand: he loveth to oppress. 12:8 And Ephraim said, Yet I am become rich, I have found me out substance: in all my labours they shall find none iniquity in me that were sin. 12:9 And I that am Da LORD thy God from Da land of Egypt will yet make thee to dwell in tabernacles, as in Da days of Da solemn feast. 12:10 I have also spoken by Da prophets, and I have multiplied visions, and used similitudes, by Da ministry of Da prophets. 12:11 Is there iniquity in Gilead? surely they are vanity: they sacrifice bullocks in Gilgal; yea, their altars are as heaps in Da furrows of Da fields. 12:12 And Jacob fled into Da country of Syria, and Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he kept sheep. 12:13 And by a prophet Da LORD brought Israel out of Egypt, and by a prophet was he preserved. 12:14 Ephraim provoked him to anger most bitterly: therefore shall he leave his blood upon him, and his reproach shall his LORD return unto him. 13:1 When Ephraim spake trembling, he exalted himself in Israel; but when he offended in Baal, he died. 13:2 And now they sin more and more, and have made them molten images of their silver, and idols according to their own understanding, all of it Da work of Da craftsmen: they say of them, Let Da men that sacrifice kiss Da calves. 13:3 Therefore they shall be as Da morning cloud and as Da early dew that passeth away, as Da chaff that is driven with Da whirlwind out of Da floor, and as Da smoke out of Da chimney. 13:4 Yet I am Da LORD thy God from Da land of Egypt, and thou shalt know no god but me: for there is no saviour beside me. 13:5 I did know thee in Da wilderness, in Da land of great drought. 13:6 According to their pasture, so were they filled; they were filled, and their heart was exalted; therefore have they forgotten me. 13:7 Therefore I will be unto them as a lion: as a leopard by Da way will I observe them: 13:8 I will meet them as a bear that is bereaved of her whelps, and will rend Da caul of their heart, and there will I devour them like a lion: Da wild beast shall tear them. 13:9 O Israel, thou hast destroyed thyself; but in me is thine help. 13:10 I will be thy king: where is any other that may save thee in all thy cities? and thy judges of whom thou saidst, Give me a king and princes? 13:11 I gave thee a king in mine anger, and took him away in my wrath. 13:12 The iniquity of Ephraim is bound up; his sin is hid. 13:13 The sorrows of a travailing woman shall come upon him: he is an unwise son; for he should not stay long in Da place of Da breaking forth of children. 13:14 I will ransom them from Da power of Da grave; I will redeem them from death: O death, I will be thy plagues; O grave, I will be thy destruction: repentance shall be hid from mine eyes. 13:15 Though he be fruitful among his brethren, an east wind shall come, Da wind of Da LORD shall come up from Da wilderness, and his spring shall become dry, and his fountain shall be dried up: he shall spoil Da treasure of all pleasant vessels. 13:16 Samaria shall become desolate; for she hath rebelled against her God: they shall fall by Da sword: their infants shall be dashed in pieces, and their women with child shall be ripped up. 14:1 O israel, return unto Da LORD thy God; for thou hast fallen by thine iniquity. 14:2 Take with you words, and turn to Da LORD: say unto him, Take away all iniquity, and receive us graciously: so will we render Da calves of our lips. 14:3 Asshur shall not save us; we will not ride upon horses: neither will we say any more to Da work of our hands, Ye are our gods: for in thee Da fatherless findeth mercy. 14:4 I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely: for mine anger is turned away from him. 14:5 I will be as Da dew unto Israel: he shall grow as Da lily, and cast forth his roots as Lebanon. 14:6 His branches shall spread, and his beauty shall be as Da olive tree, and his smell as Lebanon. 14:7 They that dwell under his shadow shall return; they shall revive as Da corn, and grow as Da vine: Da scent thereof shall be as Da wine of Lebanon. 14:8 Ephraim shall say, What have I to do any more with idols? I have heard him, and observed him: I am like a green fir tree. From me is thy fruit found. 14:9 Who is wise, and he shall understand these things? prudent, and he shall know them? for Da ways of Da LORD are right, and Da just shall walk in them: but Da transgressors shall fall therein. Joel 1:1 The word of Da LORD that came to Joel Da son of Pethuel. 1:2 Hear this, ye old men, and give ear, all ye inhabitants of Da land. Hath this been in your days, or even in Da days of your fathers? 1:3 Tell ye your children of it, and let your children tell their children, and their children another generation. 1:4 That which Da palmerworm hath left hath Da locust eaten; and that which Da locust hath left hath Da cankerworm eaten; and that which Da cankerworm hath left hath Da caterpiller eaten. 1:5 Awake, ye drunkards, and weep; and howl, all ye drinkers of wine, because of Da new wine; for it is cut off from your mouth. 1:6 For a nation is come up upon my land, strong, and without number, whose teeth are Da teeth of a lion, and he hath Da cheek teeth of a great lion. 1:7 He hath laid my vine waste, and barked my fig tree: he hath made it clean bare, and cast it away; Da branches thereof are made white. 1:8 Lament like a virgin girded with sackcloth for Da husband of her youth. 1:9 The meat offering and Da drink offering is cut off from Da house of Da LORD; Da priests, Da LORD’s ministers, mourn. 1:10 The field is wasted, Da land mourneth; for Da corn is wasted: Da new wine is dried up, Da oil languisheth. 1:11 Be ye ashamed, O ye husbandmen; howl, O ye vinedressers, for Da wheat and for Da barley; because Da harvest of Da field is perished. 1:12 The vine is dried up, and Da fig tree languisheth; Da pomegranate tree, Da palm tree also, and Da apple tree, even all Da trees of Da field, are withered: because joy is withered away from Da sons of men. 1:13 Gird yourselves, and lament, ye priests: howl, ye ministers of Da altar: come, lie all night in sackcloth, ye ministers of my God: for Da meat offering and Da drink offering is withholden from Da house of your God. 1:14 Sanctify ye a fast, call a solemn assembly, gather Da elders and all Da inhabitants of Da land into Da house of Da LORD your God, and cry unto Da LORD, 1:15 Alas for Da day! for Da day of Da LORD is at hand, and as a destruction from Da Almighty shall it come. 1:16 Is not Da meat cut off before our eyes, yea, joy and gladness from Da house of our God? 1:17 The seed is rotten under their clods, Da garners are laid desolate, Da barns are broken down; for Da corn is withered. 1:18 How do Da beasts groan! Da herds of cattle are perplexed, because they have no pasture; yea, Da flocks of sheep are made desolate. 1:19 O LORD, to thee will I cry: for Da fire hath devoured Da pastures of Da wilderness, and Da flame hath burned all Da trees of Da field. 1:20 The beasts of Da field cry also unto thee: for Da rivers of waters are dried up, and Da fire hath devoured Da pastures of Da wilderness. 2:1 Blow ye Da trumpet in Zion, and sound an alarm in my holy mountain: let all Da inhabitants of Da land tremble: for Da day of Da LORD cometh, for it is nigh at hand; 2:2 A day of darkness and of gloominess, a day of clouds and of thick darkness, as Da morning spread upon Da mountains: a great people and a strong; there hath not been ever Da like, neither shall be any more after it, even to Da years of many generations. 2:3 A fire devoureth before them; and behind them a flame burneth: Da land is as Da garden of Eden before them, and behind them a desolate wilderness; yea, and nothing shall escape them. 2:4 The appearance of them is as Da appearance of horses; and as horsemen, so shall they run. 2:5 Like Da noise of chariots on Da tops of mountains shall they leap, like Da noise of a flame of fire that devoureth Da stubble, as a strong people set in battle array. 2:6 Before their face Da people shall be much pained: all faces shall gather blackness. 2:7 They shall run like mighty men; they shall climb Da wall like men of war; and they shall march every one on his ways, and they shall not break their ranks: 2:8 Neither shall one thrust another; they shall walk every one in his path: and when they fall upon Da sword, they shall not be wounded. 2:9 They shall run to and fro in Da city; they shall run upon Da wall, they shall climb up upon Da houses; they shall enter in at Da windows like a thief. 2:10 The earth shall quake before them; Da heavens shall tremble: Da sun and Da moon shall be dark, and Da stars shall withdraw their shining: 2:11 And Da LORD shall utter his voice before his army: for his camp is very great: for he is strong that executeth his word: for Da day of Da LORD is great and very terrible; and who can abide it? 2:12 Therefore also now, saith Da LORD, turn ye even to me with all your heart, and with fasting, and with weeping, and with mourning: 2:13 And rend your heart, and not your garments, and turn unto Da LORD your God: for he is gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repenteth him of Da evil. 2:14 Who knoweth if he will return and repent, and leave a blessing behind him; even a meat offering and a drink offering unto Da LORD your God? 2:15 Blow Da trumpet in Zion, sanctify a fast, call a solemn assembly: 2:16 Gather Da people, sanctify Da congregation, assemble Da elders, gather Da children, and those that suck Da breasts: let Da bridegroom go forth of his chamber, and Da bride out of her closet. 2:17 Let Da priests, Da ministers of Da LORD, weep between Da porch and Da altar, and let them say, Spare thy people, O LORD, and give not thine heritage to reproach, that Da heathen should rule over them: wherefore should they say among Da people, Where is their God? 2:18 Then will Da LORD be jealous for his land, and pity his people. 2:19 Yea, Da LORD will answer and say unto his people, Behold, I will send you corn, and wine, and oil, and ye shall be satisfied therewith: and I will no more make you a reproach among Da heathen: 2:20 But I will remove far off from you Da northern army, and will drive him into a land barren and desolate, with his face toward Da east sea, and his hinder part toward Da utmost sea, and his stink shall come up, and his ill savour shall come up, because he hath done great things. 2:21 Fear not, O land; be glad and rejoice: for Da LORD will do great things. 2:22 Be not afraid, ye beasts of Da field: for Da pastures of Da wilderness do spring, for Da tree beareth her fruit, Da fig tree and Da vine do yield their strength. 2:23 Be glad then, ye children of Zion, and rejoice in Da LORD your God: for he hath given you Da former rain moderately, and he will cause to come down for you Da rain, Da former rain, and Da latter rain in Da first month. 2:24 And Da floors shall be full of wheat, and Da vats shall overflow with wine and oil. 2:25 And I will restore to you Da years that Da locust hath eaten, Da cankerworm, and Da caterpiller, and Da palmerworm, my great army which I sent among you. 2:26 And ye shall eat in plenty, and be satisfied, and praise Da name of Da LORD your God, that hath dealt wondrously with you: and my people shall never be ashamed. 2:27 And ye shall know that I am in Da midst of Israel, and that I am Da LORD your God, and none else: and my people shall never be ashamed. 2:28 And it shall come to pass afterward, that I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh; and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, your old men shall dream dreams, your young men shall see visions: 2:29 And also upon Da servants and upon Da handmaids in those days will I pour out my spirit. 2:30 And I will shew wonders in Da heavens and in Da earth, blood, and fire, and pillars of smoke. 2:31 The sun shall be turned into darkness, and Da moon into blood, before Da great and terrible day of Da LORD come. 2:32 And it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call on Da name of Da LORD shall be delivered: for in mount Zion and in Jerusalem shall be deliverance, as Da LORD hath said, and in Da remnant whom Da LORD shall call. 3:1 For, behold, in those days, and in that time, when I shall bring again Da captivity of Judah and Jerusalem, 3:2 I will also gather all nations, and will bring them down into Da valley of Jehoshaphat, and will plead with them there for my people and for my heritage Israel, whom they have scattered among Da nations, and parted my land. 3:3 And they have cast lots for my people; and have given a boy for an harlot, and sold a girl for wine, that they might drink. 3:4 Yea, and what have ye to do with me, O Tyre, and Zidon, and all Da coasts of Palestine? will ye render me a recompence? and if ye recompense me, swiftly and speedily will I return your recompence upon your own head; 3:5 Because ye have taken my silver and my gold, and have carried into your temples my goodly pleasant things: 3:6 The children also of Judah and Da children of Jerusalem have ye sold unto Da Grecians, that ye might remove them far from their border. 3:7 Behold, I will raise them out of Da place whither ye have sold them, and will return your recompence upon your own head: 3:8 And I will sell your sons and your daughters into Da hand of Da children of Judah, and they shall sell them to Da Sabeans, to a people far off: for Da LORD hath spoken it. 3:9 Proclaim ye this among Da Gentiles; Prepare war, wake up Da mighty men, let all Da men of war draw near; let them come up: 3:10 Beat your plowshares into swords and your pruninghooks into spears: let Da weak say, I am strong. 3:11 Assemble yourselves, and come, all ye heathen, and gather yourselves together round about: thither cause thy mighty ones to come down, O LORD. 3:12 Let Da heathen be wakened, and come up to Da valley of Jehoshaphat: for there will I sit to judge all Da heathen round about. 3:13 Put ye in Da sickle, for Da harvest is ripe: come, get you down; for Da press is full, Da fats overflow; for their wickedness is great. 3:14 Multitudes, multitudes in Da valley of decision: for Da day of Da LORD is near in Da valley of decision. 3:15 The sun and Da moon shall be darkened, and Da stars shall withdraw their shining. 3:16 The LORD also shall roar out of Zion, and utter his voice from Jerusalem; and Da heavens and Da earth shall shake: but Da LORD will be Da hope of his people, and Da strength of Da children of Israel. 3:17 So shall ye know that I am Da LORD your God dwelling in Zion, my holy mountain: then shall Jerusalem be holy, and there shall no strangers pass through her any more. 3:18 And it shall come to pass in that day, that Da mountains shall drop down new wine, and Da hills shall flow with milk, and all Da rivers of Judah shall flow with waters, and a fountain shall come forth out of Da house of Da LORD, and shall water Da valley of Shittim. 3:19 Egypt shall be a desolation, and Edom shall be a desolate wilderness, for Da violence against Da children of Judah, because they have shed innocent blood in their land. 3:20 But Judah shall dwell for ever, and Jerusalem from generation to generation. 3:21 For I will cleanse their blood that I have not cleansed: for Da LORD dwelleth in Zion. Amos 1:1 The words of Amos, who was among Da herdmen of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in Da days of Uzziah king of Judah, and in Da days of Jeroboam Da son of Joash king of Israel, two years before Da earthquake. 1:2 And he said, The LORD will roar from Zion, and utter his voice from Jerusalem; and Da habitations of Da shepherds shall mourn, and Da top of Carmel shall wither. 1:3 Thus saith Da LORD; For three transgressions of Damascus, and for four, I will not turn away Da punishment thereof; because they have threshed Gilead with threshing instruments of iron: 1:4 But I will send a fire into Da house of Hazael, which shall devour Da palaces of Benhadad. 1:5 I will break also Da bar of Damascus, and cut off Da inhabitant from Da plain of Aven, and him that holdeth Da sceptre from Da house of Eden: and Da people of Syria shall go into captivity unto Kir, saith Da LORD. 1:6 Thus saith Da LORD; For three transgressions of Gaza, and for four, I will not turn away Da punishment thereof; because they carried away captive Da whole captivity, to deliver them up to Edom: 1:7 But I will send a fire on Da wall of Gaza, which shall devour Da palaces thereof: 1:8 And I will cut off Da inhabitant from Ashdod, and him that holdeth Da sceptre from Ashkelon, and I will turn mine hand against Ekron: and Da remnant of Da Philistines shall perish, saith Da Lord GOD. 1:9 Thus saith Da LORD; For three transgressions of Tyrus, and for four, I will not turn away Da punishment thereof; because they delivered up Da whole captivity to Edom, and remembered not Da brotherly covenant: 1:10 But I will send a fire on Da wall of Tyrus, which shall devour Da palaces thereof. 1:11 Thus saith Da LORD; For three transgressions of Edom, and for four, I will not turn away Da punishment thereof; because he did pursue his brother with Da sword, and did cast off all pity, and his anger did tear perpetually, and he kept his wrath for ever: 1:12 But I will send a fire upon Teman, which shall devour Da palaces of Bozrah. 1:13 Thus saith Da LORD; For three transgressions of Moab, and for four, I will not turn away Da punishment thereof; because he burned Da bones of Da king of Edom into lime: 2:2 But I will send a fire upon Moab, and it shall devour Da palaces of Kirioth: and Moab shall die with tumult, with shouting, and with Da sound of Da trumpet: 2:3 And I will cut off Da judge from Da midst thereof, and will slay all Da princes thereof with him, saith Da LORD. 2:4 Thus saith Da LORD; For three transgressions of Judah, and for four, I will not turn away Da punishment thereof; because they have despised Da law of Da LORD, and have not kept his commandments, and their lies caused them to err, after Da which their fathers have walked: 2:5 But I will send a fire upon Judah, and it shall devour Da palaces of Jerusalem. 2:6 Thus saith Da LORD; For three transgressions of Israel, and for four, I will not turn away Da punishment thereof; because they sold Da righteous for silver, and Da poor for a pair of shoes; 2:7 That pant after Da dust of Da earth on Da head of Da poor, and turn aside Da way of Da meek: and a man and his father will go in unto Da same maid, to profane my holy name: 2:8 And they lay themselves down upon clothes laid to pledge by every altar, and they drink Da wine of Da condemned in Da house of their god. 2:9 Yet destroyed I Da Amorite before them, whose height was like Da height of Da cedars, and he was strong as Da oaks; yet I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots from beneath. 2:10 Also I brought you up from Da land of Egypt, and led you forty years through Da wilderness, to possess Da land of Da Amorite. 2:11 And I raised up of your sons for prophets, and of your young men for Nazarites. Is it not even thus, O ye children of Israel? saith Da LORD. 2:12 But ye gave Da Nazarites wine to drink; and commanded Da prophets, saying, Prophesy not. 2:13 Behold, I am pressed under you, as a cart is pressed that is full of sheaves. 2:14 Therefore Da flight shall perish from Da swift, and Da strong shall not strengthen his force, neither shall Da mighty deliver himself: 2:15 Neither shall he stand that handleth Da bow; and he that is swift of foot shall not deliver himself: neither shall he that rideth Da horse deliver himself. 2:16 And he that is courageous among Da mighty shall flee away naked in that day, saith Da LORD. 3:1 Hear this word that Da LORD hath spoken against you, O children of Israel, against Da whole family which I brought up from Da land of Egypt, saying, 3:2 You only have I known of all Da families of Da earth: therefore I will punish you for all your iniquities. 3:3 Can two walk together, except they be agreed? 3:4 Will a lion roar in Da forest, when he hath no prey? will a young lion cry out of his den, if he have taken nothing? 3:5 Can a bird fall in a snare upon Da earth, where no gin is for him? shall one take up a snare from Da earth, and have taken nothing at all? 3:6 Shall a trumpet be blown in Da city, and Da people not be afraid? shall there be evil in a city, and Da LORD hath not done it? 3:7 Surely Da Lord GOD will do nothing, but he revealeth his secret unto his servants Da prophets. 3:8 The lion hath roared, who will not fear? Da Lord GOD hath spoken, who can but prophesy? 3:9 Publish in Da palaces at Ashdod, and in Da palaces in Da land of Egypt, and say, Assemble yourselves upon Da mountains of Samaria, and behold Da great tumults in Da midst thereof, and Da oppressed in Da midst thereof. 3:10 For they know not to do right, saith Da LORD, who store up violence and robbery in their palaces. 3:11 Therefore thus saith Da Lord GOD; An adversary there shall be even round about Da land; and he shall bring down thy strength from thee, and thy palaces shall be spoiled. 3:12 Thus saith Da LORD; As Da shepherd taketh out of Da mouth of Da lion two legs, or a piece of an ear; so shall Da children of Israel be taken out that dwell in Samaria in Da corner of a bed, and in Damascus in a couch. 3:13 Hear ye, and testify in Da house of Jacob, saith Da Lord GOD, Da God of hosts, 3:14 That in Da day that I shall visit Da transgressions of Israel upon him I will also visit Da altars of Bethel: and Da horns of Da altar shall be cut off, and fall to Da ground. 3:15 And I will smite Da winter house with Da summer house; and Da houses of ivory shall perish, and Da great houses shall have an end, saith Da LORD. 4:1 Hear this word, ye kine of Bashan, that are in Da mountain of Samaria, which oppress Da poor, which crush Da needy, which say to their masters, Bring, and let us drink. 4:2 The Lord GOD hath sworn by his holiness, that, lo, Da days shall come upon you, that he will take you away with hooks, and your posterity with fishhooks. 4:3 And ye shall go out at Da breaches, every cow at that which is before her; and ye shall cast them into Da palace, saith Da LORD. 4:4 Come to Bethel, and transgress; at Gilgal multiply transgression; and bring your sacrifices every morning, and your tithes after three years: 4:5 And offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving with leaven, and proclaim and publish Da free offerings: for this liketh you, O ye children of Israel, saith Da Lord GOD. 4:6 And I also have given you cleanness of teeth in all your cities, and want of bread in all your places: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith Da LORD. 4:7 And also I have withholden Da rain from you, when there were yet three months to Da harvest: and I caused it to rain upon one city, and caused it not to rain upon another city: one piece was rained upon, and Da piece whereupon it rained not withered. 4:8 So two or three cities wandered unto one city, to drink water; but they were not satisfied: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith Da LORD. 4:9 I have smitten you with blasting and mildew: when your gardens and your vineyards and your fig trees and your olive trees increased, Da palmerworm devoured them: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith Da LORD. 4:10 I have sent among you Da pestilence after Da manner of Egypt: your young men have I slain with Da sword, and have taken away your horses; and I have made Da stink of your camps to come up unto your nostrils: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith Da LORD. 4:11 I have overthrown some of you, as God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah, and ye were as a firebrand plucked out of Da burning: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith Da LORD. 4:12 Therefore thus will I do unto thee, O Israel: and because I will do this unto thee, prepare to meet thy God, O Israel. 4:13 For, lo, he that formeth Da mountains, and createth Da wind, and declareth unto man what is his thought, that maketh Da morning darkness, and treadeth upon Da high places of Da earth, The LORD, The God of hosts, is his name. 5:1 Hear ye this word which I take up against you, even a lamentation, O house of Israel. 5:2 The virgin of Israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: she is forsaken upon her land; there is none to raise her up. 5:3 For thus saith Da Lord GOD; The city that went out by a thousand shall leave an hundred, and that which went forth by an hundred shall leave ten, to Da house of Israel. 5:4 For thus saith Da LORD unto Da house of Israel, Seek ye me, and ye shall live: 5:5 But seek not Bethel, nor enter into Gilgal, and pass not to Beersheba: for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Bethel shall come to nought. 5:6 Seek Da LORD, and ye shall live; lest he break out like fire in Da house of Joseph, and devour it, and there be none to quench it in Bethel. 5:7 Ye who turn judgment to wormwood, and leave off righteousness in Da earth, 5:8 Seek him that maketh Da seven stars and Orion, and turneth Da shadow of death into Da morning, and maketh Da day dark with night: that calleth for Da waters of Da sea, and poureth them out upon Da face of Da earth: The LORD is his name: 5:9 That strengtheneth Da spoiled against Da strong, so that Da spoiled shall come against Da fortress. 5:10 They hate him that rebuketh in Da gate, and they abhor him that speaketh uprightly. 5:11 Forasmuch therefore as your treading is upon Da poor, and ye take from him burdens of wheat: ye have built houses of hewn stone, but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have planted pleasant vineyards, but ye shall not drink wine of them. 5:12 For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they afflict Da just, they take a bribe, and they turn aside Da poor in Da gate from their right. 5:13 Therefore Da prudent shall keep silence in that time; for it is an evil time. 5:14 Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live: and so Da LORD, Da God of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken. 5:15 Hate Da evil, and love Da good, and establish judgment in Da gate: it may be that Da LORD God of hosts will be gracious unto Da remnant of Joseph. 5:16 Therefore Da LORD, Da God of hosts, Da LORD, saith thus; Wailing shall be in all streets; and they shall say in all Da highways, Alas! alas! and they shall call Da husbandman to mourning, and such as are skilful of lamentation to wailing. 5:17 And in all vineyards shall be wailing: for I will pass through thee, saith Da LORD. 5:18 Woe unto you that desire Da day of Da LORD! to what end is it for you? Da day of Da LORD is darkness, and not light. 5:19 As if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; or went into Da house, and leaned his hand on Da wall, and a serpent bit him. 5:20 Shall not Da day of Da LORD be darkness, and not light? even very dark, and no brightness in it? 5:21 I hate, I despise your feast days, and I will not smell in your solemn assemblies. 5:22 Though ye offer me burnt offerings and your meat offerings, I will not accept them: neither will I regard Da peace offerings of your fat beasts. 5:23 Take thou away from me Da noise of thy songs; for I will not hear Da melody of thy viols. 5:24 But let judgment run down as waters, and righteousness as a mighty stream. 5:25 Have ye offered unto me sacrifices and offerings in Da wilderness forty years, O house of Israel? 5:26 But ye have borne Da tabernacle of your Moloch and Chiun your images, Da star of your god, which ye made to yourselves. 5:27 Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith Da LORD, whose name is The God of hosts. 6:1 Woe to them that are at ease in Zion, and trust in Da mountain of Samaria, which are named chief of Da nations, to whom Da house of Israel came! 6:2 Pass ye unto Calneh, and see; and from thence go ye to Hamath Da great: then go down to Gath of Da Philistines: be they better than these kingdoms? or their border greater than your border? 6:3 Ye that put far away Da evil day, and cause Da seat of violence to come near; 6:4 That lie upon beds of ivory, and stretch themselves upon their couches, and eat Da lambs out of Da flock, and Da calves out of Da midst of Da stall; 6:5 That chant to Da sound of Da viol, and invent to themselves instruments of musick, like David; 6:6 That drink wine in bowls, and anoint themselves with Da chief ointments: but they are not grieved for Da affliction of Joseph. 6:7 Therefore now shall they go captive with Da first that go captive, and Da banquet of them that stretched themselves shall be removed. 6:8 The Lord GOD hath sworn by himself, saith Da LORD Da God of hosts, I abhor Da excellency of Jacob, and hate his palaces: therefore will I deliver up Da city with all that is therein. 6:9 And it shall come to pass, if there remain ten men in one house, that they shall die. 6:10 And a man’s uncle shall take him up, and he that burneth him, to bring out Da bones out of Da house, and shall say unto him that is by Da sides of Da house, Is there yet any with thee? and he shall say, No. Then shall he say, Hold thy tongue: for we may not make mention of Da name of Da LORD. 6:11 For, behold, Da LORD commandeth, and he will smite Da great house with breaches, and Da little house with clefts. 6:12 Shall horses run upon Da rock? will one plow there with oxen? for ye have turned judgment into gall, and Da fruit of righteousness into hemlock: 6:13 Ye which rejoice in a thing of nought, which say, Have we not taken to us horns by our own strength? 6:14 But, behold, I will raise up against you a nation, O house of Israel, saith Da LORD Da God of hosts; and they shall afflict you from Da entering in of Hemath unto Da river of Da wilderness. 7:1 Thus hath Da Lord GOD shewed unto me; and, behold, he formed grasshoppers in Da beginning of Da shooting up of Da latter growth; and, lo, it was Da latter growth after Da king’s mowings. 7:2 And it came to pass, that when they had made an end of eating Da grass of Da land, then I said, O Lord GOD, forgive, I beseech thee: by whom shall Jacob arise? for he is small. 7:3 The LORD repented for this: It shall not be, saith Da LORD. 7:4 Thus hath Da Lord GOD shewed unto me: and, behold, Da Lord GOD called to contend by fire, and it devoured Da great deep, and did eat up a part. 7:5 Then said I, O Lord GOD, cease, I beseech thee: by whom shall Jacob arise? for he is small. 7:6 The LORD repented for this: This also shall not be, saith Da Lord GOD. 7:7 Thus he shewed me: and, behold, Da LORD stood upon a wall made by a plumbline, with a plumbline in his hand. 7:8 And Da LORD said unto me, Amos, what seest thou? And I said, A plumbline. Then said Da LORD, Behold, I will set a plumbline in Da midst of my people Israel: I will not again pass by them any more: 7:9 And Da high places of Isaac shall be desolate, and Da sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste; and I will rise against Da house of Jeroboam with Da sword. 7:10 Then Amaziah Da priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, Amos hath conspired against thee in Da midst of Da house of Israel: Da land is not able to bear all his words. 7:11 For thus Amos saith, Jeroboam shall die by Da sword, and Israel shall surely be led away captive out of their own land. 7:12 Also Amaziah said unto Amos, O thou seer, go, flee thee away into Da land of Judah, and there eat bread, and prophesy there: 7:13 But prophesy not again any more at Bethel: for it is Da king’s chapel, and it is Da king’s court. 7:14 Then answered Amos, and said to Amaziah, I was no prophet, neither was I a prophet’s son; but I was an herdman, and a gatherer of sycomore fruit: 7:15 And Da LORD took me as I followed Da flock, and Da LORD said unto me, Go, prophesy unto my people Israel. 7:16 Now therefore hear thou Da word of Da LORD: Thou sayest, Prophesy not against Israel, and drop not thy word against Da house of Isaac. 7:17 Therefore thus saith Da LORD; Thy wife shall be an harlot in Da city, and thy sons and thy daughters shall fall by Da sword, and thy land shall be divided by line; and thou shalt die in a polluted land: and Israel shall surely go into captivity forth of his land. 8:1 Thus hath Da Lord GOD shewed unto me: and behold a basket of summer fruit. 8:2 And he said, Amos, what seest thou? And I said, A basket of summer fruit. Then said Da LORD unto me, The end is come upon my people of Israel; I will not again pass by them any more. 8:3 And Da songs of Da temple shall be howlings in that day, saith Da Lord GOD: there shall be many dead bodies in every place; they shall cast them forth with silence. 8:4 Hear this, O ye that swallow up Da needy, even to make Da poor of Da land to fail, 8:5 Saying, When will Da new moon be gone, that we may sell corn? and Da sabbath, that we may set forth wheat, making Da ephah small, and Da shekel great, and falsifying Da balances by deceit? 8:6 That we may buy Da poor for silver, and Da needy for a pair of shoes; yea, and sell Da refuse of Da wheat? 8:7 The LORD hath sworn by Da excellency of Jacob, Surely I will never forget any of their works. 8:8 Shall not Da land tremble for this, and every one mourn that dwelleth therein? and it shall rise up wholly as a flood; and it shall be cast out and drowned, as by Da flood of Egypt. 8:9 And it shall come to pass in that day, saith Da Lord GOD, that I will cause Da sun to go down at noon, and I will darken Da earth in Da clear day: 8:10 And I will turn your feasts into mourning, and all your songs into lamentation; and I will bring up sackcloth upon all loins, and baldness upon every head; and I will make it as Da mourning of an only son, and Da end thereof as a bitter day. 8:11 Behold, Da days come, saith Da Lord GOD, that I will send a famine in Da land, not a famine of bread, nor a thirst for water, but of hearing Da words of Da LORD: 8:12 And they shall wander from sea to sea, and from Da north even to Da east, they shall run to and fro to seek Da word of Da LORD, and shall not find it. 8:13 In that day shall Da fair virgins and young men faint for thirst. 8:14 They that swear by Da sin of Samaria, and say, Thy god, O Dan, liveth; and, The manner of Beersheba liveth; even they shall fall, and never rise up again. 9:1 I saw Da LORD standing upon Da altar: and he said, Smite Da lintel of Da door, that Da posts may shake: and cut them in Da head, all of them; and I will slay Da last of them with Da sword: he that fleeth of them shall not flee away, and he that escapeth of them shall not be delivered. 9:2 Though they dig into hell, thence shall mine hand take them; though they climb up to heaven, thence will I bring them down: 9:3 And though they hide themselves in Da top of Carmel, I will search and take them out thence; and though they be hid from my sight in Da bottom of Da sea, thence will I command Da serpent, and he shall bite them: 9:4 And though they go into captivity before their enemies, thence will I command Da sword, and it shall slay them: and I will set mine eyes upon them for evil, and not for good. 9:5 And Da Lord GOD of hosts is he that toucheth Da land, and it shall melt, and all that dwell therein shall mourn: and it shall rise up wholly like a flood; and shall be drowned, as by Da flood of Egypt. 9:6 It is he that buildeth his stories in Da heaven, and hath founded his troop in Da earth; he that calleth for Da waters of Da sea, and poureth them out upon Da face of Da earth: The LORD is his name. 9:7 Are ye not as children of Da Ethiopians unto me, O children of Israel? saith Da LORD. Have not I brought up Israel out of Da land of Egypt? and Da Philistines from Caphtor, and Da Syrians from Kir? 9:8 Behold, Da eyes of Da Lord GOD are upon Da sinful kingdom, and I will destroy it from off Da face of Da earth; saving that I will not utterly destroy Da house of Jacob, saith Da LORD. 9:9 For, lo, I will command, and I will sift Da house of Israel among all nations, like as corn is sifted in a sieve, yet shall not Da least grain fall upon Da earth. 9:10 All Da sinners of my people shall die by Da sword, which say, The evil shall not overtake nor prevent us. 9:11 In that day will I raise up Da tabernacle of David that is fallen, and close up Da breaches thereof; and I will raise up his ruins, and I will build it as in Da days of old: 9:12 That they may possess Da remnant of Edom, and of all Da heathen, which are called by my name, saith Da LORD that doeth this. 9:13 Behold, Da days come, saith Da LORD, that Da plowman shall overtake Da reaper, and Da treader of grapes him that soweth seed; and Da mountains shall drop sweet wine, and all Da hills shall melt. 9:14 And I will bring again Da captivity of my people of Israel, and they shall build Da waste cities, and inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards, and drink Da wine thereof; they shall also make gardens, and eat Da fruit of them. 9:15 And I will plant them upon their land, and they shall no more be pulled up out of their land which I have given them, saith Da LORD thy God. Obadiah 1:1 The vision of Obadiah. Thus saith Da Lord GOD concerning Edom; We have heard a rumour from Da LORD, and an ambassador is sent among Da heathen, Arise ye, and let us rise up against her in battle. 1:2 Behold, I have made thee small among Da heathen: thou art greatly despised. 1:3 The pride of thine heart hath deceived thee, thou that dwellest in Da clefts of Da rock, whose habitation is high; that saith in his heart, Who shall bring me down to Da ground? 1:4 Though thou exalt thyself as Da eagle, and though thou set thy nest among Da stars, thence will I bring thee down, saith Da LORD. 1:5 If thieves came to thee, if robbers by night, (how art thou cut off!) would they not have stolen till they had enough? if Da grapegatherers came to thee, would they not leave some grapes? 1:6 How are Da things of Esau searched out! how are his hidden things sought up! 1:7 All Da men of thy confederacy have brought thee even to Da border: Da men that were at peace with thee have deceived thee, and prevailed against thee; that they eat thy bread have laid a wound under thee: there is none understanding in him. 1:8 Shall I not in that day, saith Da LORD, even destroy Da wise men out of Edom, and understanding out of Da mount of Esau? 1:9 And thy mighty men, O Teman, shall be dismayed, to Da end that every one of Da mount of Esau may be cut off by slaughter. 1:10 For thy violence against thy brother Jacob shame shall cover thee, and thou shalt be cut off for ever. 1:11 In Da day that thou stoodest on Da other side, in Da day that Da strangers carried away captive his forces, and foreigners entered into his gates, and cast lots upon Jerusalem, even thou wast as one of them. 1:12 But thou shouldest not have looked on Da day of thy brother in Da day that he became a stranger; neither shouldest thou have rejoiced over Da children of Judah in Da day of their destruction; neither shouldest thou have spoken proudly in Da day of distress. 1:13 Thou shouldest not have entered into Da gate of my people in Da day of their calamity; yea, thou shouldest not have looked on their affliction in Da day of their calamity, nor have laid hands on their substance in Da day of their calamity; 1:14 Neither shouldest thou have stood in Da crossway, to cut off those of his that did escape; neither shouldest thou have delivered up those of his that did remain in Da day of distress. 1:15 For Da day of Da LORD is near upon all Da heathen: as thou hast done, it shall be done unto thee: thy reward shall return upon thine own head. 1:16 For as ye have drunk upon my holy mountain, so shall all Da heathen drink continually, yea, they shall drink, and they shall swallow down, and they shall be as though they had not been. 1:17 But upon mount Zion shall be deliverance, and there shall be holiness; and Da house of Jacob shall possess their possessions. 1:18 And Da house of Jacob shall be a fire, and Da house of Joseph a flame, and Da house of Esau for stubble, and they shall kindle in them, and devour them; and there shall not be any remaining of Da house of Esau; for Da LORD hath spoken it. 1:19 And they of Da south shall possess Da mount of Esau; and they of Da plain Da Philistines: and they shall possess Da fields of Ephraim, and Da fields of Samaria: and Benjamin shall possess Gilead. 1:20 And Da captivity of this host of Da children of Israel shall possess that of Da Canaanites, even unto Zarephath; and Da captivity of Jerusalem, which is in Sepharad, shall possess Da cities of Da south. 1:21 And saviours shall come up on mount Zion to judge Da mount of Esau; and Da kingdom shall be Da LORD’s. Jonah 1:1 Now Da word of Da LORD came unto Jonah Da son of Amittai, saying, 1:2 Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city, and cry against it; for their wickedness is come up before me. 1:3 But Jonah rose up to flee unto Tarshish from Da presence of Da LORD, and went down to Joppa; and he found a ship going to Tarshish: so he paid Da fare thereof, and went down into it, to go with them unto Tarshish from Da presence of Da LORD. 1:4 But Da LORD sent out a great wind into Da sea, and there was a mighty tempest in Da sea, so that Da ship was like to be broken. 1:5 Then Da mariners were afraid, and cried every man unto his god, and cast forth Da wares that were in Da ship into Da sea, to lighten it of them. But Jonah was gone down into Da sides of Da ship; and he lay, and was fast asleep. 1:6 So Da shipmaster came to him, and said unto him, What meanest thou, O sleeper? arise, call upon thy God, if so be that God will think upon us, that we perish not. 1:7 And they said every one to his fellow, Come, and let us cast lots, that we may know for whose cause this evil is upon us. So they cast lots, and Da lot fell upon Jonah. 1:8 Then said they unto him, Tell us, we pray thee, for whose cause this evil is upon us; What is thine occupation? and whence comest thou? what is thy country? and of what people art thou? 1:9 And he said unto them, I am an Hebrew; and I fear Da LORD, Da God of heaven, which hath made Da sea and Da dry land. 1:10 Then were Da men exceedingly afraid, and said unto him. Why hast thou done this? For Da men knew that he fled from Da presence of Da LORD, because he had told them. 1:11 Then said they unto him, What shall we do unto thee, that Da sea may be calm unto us? for Da sea wrought, and was tempestuous. 1:12 And he said unto them, Take me up, and cast me forth into Da sea; so shall Da sea be calm unto you: for I know that for my sake this great tempest is upon you. 1:13 Nevertheless Da men rowed hard to bring it to Da land; but they could not: for Da sea wrought, and was tempestuous against them. 1:14 Wherefore they cried unto Da LORD, and said, We beseech thee, O LORD, we beseech thee, let us not perish for this man’s life, and lay not upon us innocent blood: for thou, O LORD, hast done as it pleased thee. 1:15 So they look up Jonah, and cast him forth into Da sea: and Da sea ceased from her raging. 1:16 Then Da men feared Da LORD exceedingly, and offered a sacrifice unto Da LORD, and made vows. 1:17 Now Da LORD had prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah. And Jonah was in Da belly of Da fish three days and three nights. 2:1 Then Jonah prayed unto Da LORD his God out of Da fish’s belly, 2:2 And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto Da LORD, and he heard me; out of Da belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice. 2:3 For thou hadst cast me into Da deep, in Da midst of Da seas; and Da floods compassed me about: all thy billows and thy waves passed over me. 2:4 Then I said, I am cast out of thy sight; yet I will look again toward thy holy temple. 2:5 The waters compassed me about, even to Da soul: Da depth closed me round about, Da weeds were wrapped about my head. 2:6 I went down to Da bottoms of Da mountains; Da earth with her bars was about me for ever: yet hast thou brought up my life from corruption, O LORD my God. 2:7 When my soul fainted within me I remembered Da LORD: and my prayer came in unto thee, into thine holy temple. 2:8 They that observe lying vanities forsake their own mercy. 2:9 But I will sacrifice unto thee with Da voice of thanksgiving; I will pay that that I have vowed. Salvation is of Da LORD. 2:10 And Da LORD spake unto Da fish, and it vomited out Jonah upon Da dry land. 3:1 And Da word of Da LORD came unto Jonah Da second time, saying, 3:2 Arise, go unto Nineveh, that great city, and preach unto it Da preaching that I bid thee. 3:3 So Jonah arose, and went unto Nineveh, according to Da word of Da LORD. Now Nineveh was an exceeding great city of three days’ journey. 3:4 And Jonah began to enter into Da city a day’s journey, and he cried, and said, Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown. 3:5 So Da people of Nineveh believed God, and proclaimed a fast, and put on sackcloth, from Da greatest of them even to Da least of them. 3:6 For word came unto Da king of Nineveh, and he arose from his throne, and he laid his robe from him, and covered him with sackcloth, and sat in ashes. 3:7 And he caused it to be proclaimed and published through Nineveh by Da decree of Da king and his nobles, saying, Let neither man nor beast, herd nor flock, taste any thing: let them not feed, nor drink water: 3:8 But let man and beast be covered with sackcloth, and cry mightily unto God: yea, let them turn every one from his evil way, and from Da violence that is in their hands. 3:9 Who can tell if God will turn and repent, and turn away from his fierce anger, that we perish not? 3:10 And God saw their works, that they turned from their evil way; and God repented of Da evil, that he had said that he would do unto them; and he did it not. 4:1 But it displeased Jonah exceedingly, and he was very angry. 4:2 And he prayed unto Da LORD, and said, I pray thee, O LORD, was not this my saying, when I was yet in my country? Therefore I fled before unto Tarshish: for I knew that thou art a gracious God, and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repentest thee of Da evil. 4:3 Therefore now, O LORD, take, I beseech thee, my life from me; for it is better for me to die than to live. 4:4 Then said Da LORD, Doest thou well to be angry? 4:5 So Jonah went out of Da city, and sat on Da east side of Da city, and there made him a booth, and sat under it in Da shadow, till he might see what would become of Da city. 4:6 And Da LORD God prepared a gourd, and made it to come up over Jonah, that it might be a shadow over his head, to deliver him from his grief. So Jonah was exceeding glad of Da gourd. 4:7 But God prepared a worm when Da morning rose Da next day, and it smote Da gourd that it withered. 4:8 And it came to pass, when Da sun did arise, that God prepared a vehement east wind; and Da sun beat upon Da head of Jonah, that he fainted, and wished in himself to die, and said, It is better for me to die than to live. 4:9 And God said to Jonah, Doest thou well to be angry for Da gourd? And he said, I do well to be angry, even unto death. 4:10 Then said Da LORD, Thou hast had pity on Da gourd, for Da which thou hast not laboured, neither madest it grow; which came up in a night, and perished in a night: 4:11 And should not I spare Nineveh, that great city, wherein are more then sixscore thousand persons that cannot discern between their right hand and their left hand; and also much cattle? Micah 1:1 The word of Da LORD that came to Micah Da Morasthite in Da days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem. 1:2 Hear, all ye people; hearken, O earth, and all that therein is: and let Da Lord GOD be witness against you, Da LORD from his holy temple. 1:3 For, behold, Da LORD cometh forth out of his place, and will come down, and tread upon Da high places of Da earth. 1:4 And Da mountains shall be molten under him, and Da valleys shall be cleft, as wax before Da fire, and as Da waters that are poured down a steep place. 1:5 For Da transgression of Jacob is all this, and for Da sins of Da house of Israel. What is Da transgression of Jacob? is it not Samaria? and what are Da high places of Judah? are they not Jerusalem? 1:6 Therefore I will make Samaria as an heap of Da field, and as plantings of a vineyard: and I will pour down Da stones thereof into Da valley, and I will discover Da foundations thereof. 1:7 And all Da graven images thereof shall be beaten to pieces, and all Da hires thereof shall be burned with Da fire, and all Da idols thereof will I lay desolate: for she gathered it of Da hire of an harlot, and they shall return to Da hire of an harlot. 1:8 Therefore I will wail and howl, I will go stripped and naked: I will make a wailing like Da dragons, and mourning as Da owls. 1:9 For her wound is incurable; for it is come unto Judah; he is come unto Da gate of my people, even to Jerusalem. 1:10 Declare ye it not at Gath, weep ye not at all: in Da house of Aphrah roll thyself in Da dust. 1:11 Pass ye away, thou inhabitant of Saphir, having thy shame naked: Da inhabitant of Zaanan came not forth in Da mourning of Bethezel; he shall receive of you his standing. 1:12 For Da inhabitant of Maroth waited carefully for good: but evil came down from Da LORD unto Da gate of Jerusalem. 1:13 O thou inhabitant of Lachish, bind Da chariot to Da swift beast: she is Da beginning of Da sin to Da daughter of Zion: for Da transgressions of Israel were found in thee. 1:14 Therefore shalt thou give presents to Moreshethgath: Da houses of Achzib shall be a lie to Da kings of Israel. 1:15 Yet will I bring an heir unto thee, O inhabitant of Mareshah: he shall come unto Adullam Da glory of Israel. 1:16 Make thee bald, and poll thee for thy delicate children; enlarge thy baldness as Da eagle; for they are gone into captivity from thee. 2:1 Woe to them that devise iniquity, and work evil upon their beds! when Da morning is light, they practise it, because it is in Da power of their hand. 2:2 And they covet fields, and take them by violence; and houses, and take them away: so they oppress a man and his house, even a man and his heritage. 2:3 Therefore thus saith Da LORD; Behold, against this family do I devise an evil, from which ye shall not remove your necks; neither shall ye go haughtily: for this time is evil. 2:4 In that day shall one take up a parable against you, and lament with a doleful lamentation, and say, We be utterly spoiled: he hath changed Da portion of my people: how hath he removed it from me! turning away he hath divided our fields. 2:5 Therefore thou shalt have none that shall cast a cord by lot in Da congregation of Da LORD. 2:6 Prophesy ye not, say they to them that prophesy: they shall not prophesy to them, that they shall not take shame. 2:7 O thou that art named Da house of Jacob, is Da spirit of Da LORD straitened? are these his doings? do not my words do good to him that walketh uprightly? 2:8 Even of late my people is risen up as an enemy: ye pull off Da robe with Da garment from them that pass by securely as men averse from war. 2:9 The women of my people have ye cast out from their pleasant houses; from their children have ye taken away my glory for ever. 2:10 Arise ye, and depart; for this is not your rest: because it is polluted, it shall destroy you, even with a sore destruction. 2:11 If a man walking in Da spirit and falsehood do lie, saying, I will prophesy unto thee of wine and of strong drink; he shall even be Da prophet of this people. 2:12 I will surely assemble, O Jacob, all of thee; I will surely gather Da remnant of Israel; I will put them together as Da sheep of Bozrah, as Da flock in Da midst of their fold: they shall make great noise by reason of Da multitude of men. 2:13 The breaker is come up before them: they have broken up, and have passed through Da gate, and are gone out by it: and their king shall pass before them, and Da LORD on Da head of them. 3:1 And I said, Hear, I pray you, O heads of Jacob, and ye princes of Da house of Israel; Is it not for you to know judgment? 3:2 Who hate Da good, and love Da evil; who pluck off their skin from off them, and their flesh from off their bones; 3:3 Who also eat Da flesh of my people, and flay their skin from off them; and they break their bones, and chop them in pieces, as for Da pot, and as flesh within Da caldron. 3:4 Then shall they cry unto Da LORD, but he will not hear them: he will even hide his face from them at that time, as they have behaved themselves ill in their doings. 3:5 Thus saith Da LORD concerning Da prophets that make my people err, that bite with their teeth, and cry, Peace; and he that putteth not into their mouths, they even prepare war against him. 3:6 Therefore night shall be unto you, that ye shall not have a vision; and it shall be dark unto you, that ye shall not divine; and Da sun shall go down over Da prophets, and Da day shall be dark over them. 3:7 Then shall Da seers be ashamed, and Da diviners confounded: yea, they shall all cover their lips; for there is no answer of God. 3:8 But truly I am full of power by Da spirit of Da LORD, and of judgment, and of might, to declare unto Jacob his transgression, and to Israel his sin. 3:9 Hear this, I pray you, ye heads of Da house of Jacob, and princes of Da house of Israel, that abhor judgment, and pervert all equity. 3:10 They build up Zion with blood, and Jerusalem with iniquity. 3:11 The heads thereof judge for reward, and Da priests thereof teach for hire, and Da prophets thereof divine for money: yet will they lean upon Da LORD, and say, Is not Da LORD among us? none evil can come upon us. 3:12 Therefore shall Zion for your sake be plowed as a field, and Jerusalem shall become heaps, and Da mountain of Da house as Da high places of Da forest. 4:1 But in Da last days it shall come to pass, that Da mountain of Da house of Da LORD shall be established in Da top of Da mountains, and it shall be exalted above Da hills; and people shall flow unto it. 4:2 And many nations shall come, and say, Come, and let us go up to Da mountain of Da LORD, and to Da house of Da God of Jacob; and he will teach us of his ways, and we will walk in his paths: for Da law shall go forth of Zion, and Da word of Da LORD from Jerusalem. 4:3 And he shall judge among many people, and rebuke strong nations afar off; and they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruninghooks: nation shall not lift up a sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more. 4:4 But they shall sit every man under his vine and under his fig tree; and none shall make them afraid: for Da mouth of Da LORD of hosts hath spoken it. 4:5 For all people will walk every one in Da name of his god, and we will walk in Da name of Da LORD our God for ever and ever. 4:6 In that day, saith Da LORD, will I assemble her that halteth, and I will gather her that is driven out, and her that I have afflicted; 4:7 And I will make her that halted a remnant, and her that was cast far off a strong nation: and Da LORD shall reign over them in mount Zion from henceforth, even for ever. 4:8 And thou, O tower of Da flock, Da strong hold of Da daughter of Zion, unto thee shall it come, even Da first dominion; Da kingdom shall come to Da daughter of Jerusalem. 4:9 Now why dost thou cry out aloud? is there no king in thee? is thy counsellor perished? for pangs have taken thee as a woman in travail. 4:10 Be in pain, and labour to bring forth, O daughter of Zion, like a woman in travail: for now shalt thou go forth out of Da city, and thou shalt dwell in Da field, and thou shalt go even to Babylon; there shalt thou be delivered; there Da LORD shall redeem thee from Da hand of thine enemies. 4:11 Now also many nations are gathered against thee, that say, Let her be defiled, and let our eye look upon Zion. 4:12 But they know not Da thoughts of Da LORD, neither understand they his counsel: for he shall gather them as Da sheaves into Da floor. 4:13 Arise and thresh, O daughter of Zion: for I will make thine horn iron, and I will make thy hoofs brass: and thou shalt beat in pieces many people: and I will consecrate their gain unto Da LORD, and their substance unto Da Lord of Da whole earth. 5:1 Now gather thyself in troops, O daughter of troops: he hath laid siege against us: they shall smite Da judge of Israel with a rod upon Da cheek. 5:2 But thou, Bethlehem Ephratah, though thou be little among Da thousands of Judah, yet out of thee shall he come forth unto me that is to be ruler in Israel; whose goings forth have been from of old, from everlasting. 5:3 Therefore will he give them up, until Da time that she which travaileth hath brought forth: then Da remnant of his brethren shall return unto Da children of Israel. 5:4 And he shall stand and feed in Da strength of Da LORD, in Da majesty of Da name of Da LORD his God; and they shall abide: for now shall he be great unto Da ends of Da earth. 5:5 And this man shall be Da peace, when Da Assyrian shall come into our land: and when he shall tread in our palaces, then shall we raise against him seven shepherds, and eight principal men. 5:6 And they shall waste Da land of Assyria with Da sword, and Da land of Nimrod in Da entrances thereof: thus shall he deliver us from Da Assyrian, when he cometh into our land, and when he treadeth within our borders. 5:7 And Da remnant of Jacob shall be in Da midst of many people as a dew from Da LORD, as Da showers upon Da grass, that tarrieth not for man, nor waiteth for Da sons of men. 5:8 And Da remnant of Jacob shall be among Da Gentiles in Da midst of many people as a lion among Da beasts of Da forest, as a young lion among Da flocks of sheep: who, if he go through, both treadeth down, and teareth in pieces, and none can deliver. 5:9 Thine hand shall be lifted up upon thine adversaries, and all thine enemies shall be cut off. 5:10 And it shall come to pass in that day, saith Da LORD, that I will cut off thy horses out of Da midst of thee, and I will destroy thy chariots: 5:11 And I will cut off Da cities of thy land, and throw down all thy strong holds: 5:12 And I will cut off witchcrafts The first program for Alice is a Hello-world.
